original: @181b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @181b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: he tu bindu bi ba ran /
analyzed: he tu bindu bi ba ran /
translated: Hetubinduvivaraṇa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: gtan tshigs thigs pa'i 'grel pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs thigs pa'i 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on the Drop of Reasons

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Vajradhara.

original: skye bo'i tshogs kyi nyon mongs skyob pa'i phyir na thugs rje chen po yang dag bskyed ba can //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs kyi nyon mongs skyob pa'i phyir na thugs rje chen po yang dag bskyed ba can //
translated: Possessing the perfect generation of great compassion in order to protect the afflictions of the assembly of beings,

original: bsod nams ye shes bdag nyid rab tu bsags pa rgya che ba yi rgyu dag ngal ba rnam par bsal //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes bdag nyid rab tu bsags pa rgya che ba yi rgyu dag ngal ba rnam par bsal //
translated: Having dispelled the fatigue of the cause of the vast accumulation of merit and wisdom,

original: shes bya ma lus rab 'byams dri ma med pa'i shes rab 'char ba'i ri bo la brten nas //
analyzed: shes bya ma lus rab 'byams dri ma med pa'i shes rab 'char ba'i ri bo la brten nas //
translated: Relying on the mountain of stainless wisdom that arises from all the infinite objects of knowledge,

original: 'jig rten snying gi mun pa 'joms mdzad rgyal ba nyi ma gang yin de la spyi bos phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten snying gi mun pa 'joms mdzad rgyal ba nyi ma gang yin de la spyi bos phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I bow my head to the Victorious Sun, who conquers the darkness of the world's heart.

original: chos kyi grags pa'i rnams la ni//
analyzed: chos kyi grags pa'i rnams la ni//
translated: For those who are famous for their Dharma,

original: dpyad zin kyang ni dpyad pa mdzes //
analyzed: dpyad zin kyang ni dpyad pa mdzes //
translated: Even though analyzed, analysis is pleasing.

original: rgun ni btsir ba gyur kyang ni //
analyzed: rgun ni btsir ba gyur kyang ni //
translated: Even if grapes are pressed,

original: mngar ba cis na 'dor 'gyur ram //
analyzed: mngar ba cis na 'dor 'gyur ram //
translated: How could their sweetness be lost?

original: 'gro rnams phyogs gcig gang gi blo //
analyzed: 'gro rnams phyogs gcig gang gi blo //
translated: The mind of beings in one direction

original: rigs lam gnas nas gzhal gyur na //
analyzed: rigs lam gnas nas gzhal gyur na //
translated: If one were to judge from the path of reasoning,

original: rgyal gyur de gsung zab mo gang //
analyzed: rgyal gyur de gsung zab mo gang //
translated: how could the profound words of the Victor

original: bdag blo blun pos ga la yin //
analyzed: bdag blo blun pos ga la yin //
translated: be understood by a foolish mind like mine?

original: de lta na yang bdag las kyang//
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag las kyang//
translated: Even so, I will explain

original: gang dag kha cig blo dman pa //
analyzed: gang dag kha cig blo dman pa //
translated: to those of lesser intellect

original: yod pa rnams la bdag gis ni //
analyzed: yod pa rnams la bdag gis ni //
translated: the existence of the Treatise on Valid Knowledge

original: gtan tshigs thigs par rnam par dbye //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thigs par rnam par dbye //
translated: in the Treatise on Valid Knowledge.

original: kha cig ni don lkog tu gyur pa la sogs pa rab tu byed ba rtsom pa'i dgos pa gsungs pa ba de yang nyan pa'i skye bo 'jug pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba de la //
analyzed: kha cig ni don lkog tu gyur pa la sogs pa rab tu byed ba rtsom pa'i dgos pa gsungs pa ba de yang nyan pa'i skye bo 'jug pa'i don yin no zhes bya ba de la //
translated: Some say that the purpose of composing the treatise on hidden objects and so on is to engage the audience of listeners.

original: bstan bcos thams cad nyid dam ni //
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad nyid dam ni //
translated: But is it the purpose of all treatises

original: yang na bya ba 'ga' zhig la //
analyzed: yang na bya ba 'ga' zhig la //
translated: or of some action🔽to engage the audience of listeners?

original: ji srid dgos pa ma brjod par //
analyzed: ji srid dgos pa ma brjod par //
translated: Until the purpose is stated,

original: de srid gang gis gzung bar bya //
analyzed: de srid gang gis gzung bar bya //
translated: by what means is it to be grasped?

original: zhe na / de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhe na / de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is unreasonable,

original: gang gis rab tu byed pa 'di'i dgos pa 'di yin no zhes brjod pas dgos pa'i khyad par dag gi rab tu byed pa ni thabs su nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis rab tu byed pa 'di'i dgos pa 'di yin no zhes brjod pas dgos pa'i khyad par dag gi rab tu byed pa ni thabs su nges pa yin te /
translated: because by stating this is the purpose of this treatise, the specific purpose is ascertained as the means of the treatise.

original: thabs ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir de don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pas rab tu byed pa mnyam pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes rjod par byed pa don dang ldan par smra ba de skad ston pa de ni mi rigs
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir de don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pas rab tu byed pa mnyam pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes rjod par byed pa don dang ldan par smra ba de skad ston pa de ni mi rigs
translated: Because they do not engage in what is not a means, those who seek the goal will engage in the means, such as the equality of composition and so on.

original: te / gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis dgos pa don du gnyer ba rnams ni de'i thabs nges pa de yod pa las yin te /
analyzed: te / gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis dgos pa don du gnyer ba rnams ni de'i thabs nges pa de yod pa las yin te /
translated: That statement is not correct because those who seek a goal through a means are certain that the means exists.

original: dper na zhing rmo ba la sogs pa rnams lo thog la sogs pa'i thabs sa bon la sogs pa sa bon ma yin pa las dben pa'i sa bon la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ba bzhin no //🔽gzhan du na thabs ma nges pa'i thabs las byung ba don du gnyer ba ni rtog @182a * //
analyzed: dper na zhing rmo ba la sogs pa rnams lo thog la sogs pa'i thabs sa bon la sogs pa sa bon ma yin pa las dben pa'i sa bon la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ba bzhin no // gzhan du na thabs ma nges pa'i thabs las byung ba don du gnyer ba ni rtog @182a * //
translated: For example, those who plow fields and so on are certain that the means of a harvest, such as seeds, is not divorced from nonseeds.

original: pa dang ldan pa rnams spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa rnams spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, those who seek the goal that arises from the means would abandon the means if the means were uncertain.🔽Those who seek the goal would not engage in the means if the means were uncertain.

original: thabs las byung ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba la tshad ma'i bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs las byung ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba la tshad ma'i bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for a means of valid cognition to operate on what has arisen from a method or what will arise from a method.

original: ma nges su zin kyang 'brel pa ma tshang ba med ba'i thabs nges bar rung ba 'di dag brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par 'gyur ba srid pas rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par 'gyur bas des na yongs su mi spong ngo //
analyzed: ma nges su zin kyang 'brel pa ma tshang ba med ba'i thabs nges bar rung ba 'di dag brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par 'gyur ba srid pas rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par 'gyur bas des na yongs su mi spong ngo //
translated: Even if it is uncertain, it is suitable to state these methods that are not incomplete in their relation, because it is possible that the desired result will be accomplished. Therefore, the one who has imagination will engage. Thus, it is not completely rejected.

original: nges pa yang tshad ma kho nas yin na dgos pa'i ngag la tshad ma med de /
analyzed: nges pa yang tshad ma kho nas yin na dgos pa'i ngag la tshad ma med de /
translated: If certainty is only by means of a valid cognition, then there is no valid cognition in the statement of the purpose.

original: sgra rnams dang phyi rol gyi don la 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams dang phyi rol gyi don la 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no relation between words and external objects.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i tshad ma de la yang ji lta ba'i dngos po la 'jug pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir des na rab tu byed pa'i dgos pa khyad par gyi thabs la nges pa med do //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i tshad ma de la yang ji lta ba'i dngos po la 'jug pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir des na rab tu byed pa'i dgos pa khyad par gyi thabs la nges pa med do //
translated: Also, in that desired valid cognition, there is no certainty that engages with things as they are. Therefore, there is no certainty in the method of the special purpose of the treatise.

original: gang gis ji ltar don gang brjod par 'dod pa de ji lta bar des rjes su mi sgrub po //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar don gang brjod par 'dod pa de ji lta bar des rjes su mi sgrub po //
translated: By whatever means and in whatever way a certain meaning is desired to be expressed, it is not accomplished in that way.

original: gzhan bsams nas gzhan du brjod pas 'jug pa na slu ba mthong ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa thams cad la yid brtan du med pas so //
analyzed: gzhan bsams nas gzhan du brjod pas 'jug pa na slu ba mthong ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa thams cad la yid brtan du med pas so //
translated: When one engages in something after thinking about it and then says something else, one is seen to deceive. Therefore, since one cannot trust anyone in the world,

original: gal te dgos pa'i khyad par nye bar dgod ba de'i thabs su gyur pa'i rab tu byed pa'i yul la the tshom skye ba de'i phyir de ni zhing rmo ba la sogs pa nyid las sa bon dang sa bon ma yin par nges pas 'jug par brjod do
analyzed: gal te dgos pa'i khyad par nye bar dgod ba de'i thabs su gyur pa'i rab tu byed pa'i yul la the tshom skye ba de'i phyir de ni zhing rmo ba la sogs pa nyid las sa bon dang sa bon ma yin par nges pas 'jug par brjod do
translated: one should engage in farming and so on after ascertaining the seed and the field.

original: zhe na / ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: dgos pa'i khyad par gyi thabs la the tshom skye ba ni de brjod pa las sngar yong pas sgrub par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa de ni rigs pa'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa'i khyad par gyi thabs la the tshom skye ba ni de brjod pa las sngar yong pas sgrub par byed pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa de ni rigs pa'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising of doubt about the means of achieving a specific purpose is prior to the statement of that purpose. Therefore, one engages in farming and so on after ascertaining the seed and the field because of the power of reasoning.

original: rjes su dpag pa de'i dgos pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa rnams mthong bas ci 'di rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i dgos pa'am /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de'i dgos pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa rnams mthong bas ci 'di rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i dgos pa'am /
translated: Since one sees the treatises that teach inference and so on in order to teach the purpose and so on of that inference, what is the purpose of teaching inference?

original: gzhan cung zad cig yin zhes de lta bu'i dngos po'i the tshom sngar 'jug pa na gang gis bsal bar nus /🔽gzhan yang ci 'di dgos pa med pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan cung zad cig yin zhes de lta bu'i dngos po'i the tshom sngar 'jug pa na gang gis bsal bar nus / gzhan yang ci 'di dgos pa med pa 'am /
translated: If one has previously engaged in doubt about the nature of something, how can one be certain?

original: yang na kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa'i dgos pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes shes par 'dod pa 'jug pa srid pas dgos pa'i ngag nye bar dgod pa don med do //
analyzed: yang na kho bo cag mngon par 'dod pa'i dgos pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes shes par 'dod pa 'jug pa srid pas dgos pa'i ngag nye bar dgod pa don med do //
translated: Moreover, it is possible that one might think, “Is this purpose nonexistent, or does it have the purpose that I desire?” Therefore, it is pointless to state the purpose.

original: de'i phyir gang dgos pa spangs pa'i ngag gam de'i don la rtog pa dang ldan pa rtsom pa byed pa'am ston par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dgos pa spangs pa'i ngag gam de'i don la rtog pa dang ldan pa rtsom pa byed pa'am ston par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one who has abandoned the purpose or who is doubtful about it or its meaning will not compose or teach a treatise.

original: dper na se'u bcu pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag dang / bya rog gi so rtog pa bzhin no //🔽'di 'am 'di'i don kyang dgos pa med pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi @182b dmigs pas rgol ba na /
analyzed: dper na se'u bcu pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag dang / bya rog gi so rtog pa bzhin no // 'di 'am 'di'i don kyang dgos pa med pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi @182b dmigs pas rgol ba na /
translated: For example, there are statements such as “The ten pomegranates” and “The crow’s teeth.”🔽When one objects on the ground that the purpose or its meaning is not perceived,

original: de ma grub par brjod pa'i phyir thog mar dgos pa'i ngag nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: de ma grub par brjod pa'i phyir thog mar dgos pa'i ngag nye bar bkod do //
translated: in order to show that it is not nonexistent, the purpose is stated at the outset.

original: de la de bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi bdag nyid 'dis ni rab tu byed pa'i dgos pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la de bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi bdag nyid 'dis ni rab tu byed pa'i dgos pa gsungs te /
translated: The phrase “in order to teach that” indicates the purpose of the treatise.

original: ji ltar ngag gis brjod par bya ba rtogs pa ni ngag gi dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar ngag gis brjod par bya ba rtogs pa ni ngag gi dgos pa yin te /
translated: The purpose of speech is to understand what is expressed by speech.

original: de yang 'di la yod de tshig gi nang tshan rnams dang dag phan tshun du 'brel pa las bsdus pa'i don rtogs so //
analyzed: de yang 'di la yod de tshig gi nang tshan rnams dang dag phan tshun du 'brel pa las bsdus pa'i don rtogs so //
translated: That purpose is present here, because one understands the summarized meaning from the mutual connection of the parts of the sentence.

original: de lta na rab tu byed pa 'dir rjes su dpag pa bstan to zhes bya ba de ni brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na rab tu byed pa 'dir rjes su dpag pa bstan to zhes bya ba de ni brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it is proper to say that inference is taught in this treatise,

original: de'i sgra ni de nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgra ni de nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word “that” is connected to the word “inference.”

original: gal te lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa'i zhar la rjes su dpag pa byung ba de lta na yang smra ba po'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i sgra 'jug pas de'i sgra rab tu sbyar gyi /
analyzed: gal te lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa'i zhar la rjes su dpag pa byung ba de lta na yang smra ba po'i bsam pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i sgra 'jug pas de'i sgra rab tu sbyar gyi /
translated: Even if inference occurs incidentally in the process of understanding a hidden object, the word “inference” is used because it is connected to the intention of the speaker.

original: gzhan du na gtso bo la sbyar bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na gtso bo la sbyar bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be applied to the primary topic?

original: sgra rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo ni don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo ni don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang phyogs kyi chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality of words is not related to the object, and because the following passage, “The property of one of a pair of correlatives,” etc., teaches inference.

original: rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa de bstan pa ni rab tu byed pa'i dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa de bstan pa ni rab tu byed pa'i dgos pa yin te /
translated: The purpose of the treatise is to teach the unerring realization of intrinsic reality,

original: de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished for that purpose.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i yul ni rab tu byed pa'i bya ba yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i yul ni rab tu byed pa'i bya ba yin pa bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the treatise is the object of the activity of the treatise, because it is taught.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tsa'i rkyen gyis bstan te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tsa'i rkyen gyis bstan te /
translated: The word “taught” is a gerundive,

original: des kyang rab tu byed pa dag gi dgos pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid 'brel par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des kyang rab tu byed pa dag gi dgos pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid 'brel par bstan pa yin no //
translated: which also teaches that the purpose of the treatise is to establish the connection between the probandum and the probans.

original: gal te sgra 'jug pa'i yul bstan pas rab tu byed pa'i bya ba gtso bo yin par bstan pa de lta na yang dngos po'i 'jug pa kho na gtso bo yin par bstan te /
analyzed: gal te sgra 'jug pa'i yul bstan pas rab tu byed pa'i bya ba gtso bo yin par bstan pa de lta na yang dngos po'i 'jug pa kho na gtso bo yin par bstan te /
translated: If the function of the chapter is to teach the principal subject matter by showing the domain of application of the word, still, the principal subject matter is the domain of application of the thing itself.

original: de ni de'i bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that is what is to be established.

original: cig shos kyi thabs de ni dor bar bya ba yin te gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos kyi thabs de ni dor bar bya ba yin te gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other, the means of application, is to be rejected, because it is not the principal subject matter.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bstan pa kho na dgos par rtogs pas rab tu byed pa'i bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bstan pa kho na dgos par rtogs pas rab tu byed pa'i bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the function of the chapter is not to teach the means of application, because the need is understood to be the teaching of inference alone.

original: don lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni rab tu byed pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa gsungs so //
analyzed: don lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni rab tu byed pa'i don rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa gsungs so //
translated: The need of the chapter is stated by this passage beginning with “The understanding of a hidden object depends on inference.”

original: dag rang gi don rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa nyid la rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag rang gi don rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa nyid la rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The intelligent person would not engage in the chapter if the need were only the understanding of one’s own purpose.

original: 'on kyang de'i brjod par bya ba'i don skyes bu la nye bar mkho ba @183a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i brjod par bya ba'i don skyes bu la nye bar mkho ba @183a * //
translated: But the meaning that is to be expressed by that is useful for a person,

original: yin te / de yang de la yod de /
analyzed: yin te / de yang de la yod de /
translated: and that also exists for him.

original: gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur ba'i don rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni nges ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur ba'i don rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni nges ba'o //
translated: Because that which is the understanding of a hidden object is ascertainment.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags de rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i phyir thabs gzhan ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba de bstan pas gzhan gyi 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags de rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i phyir thabs gzhan ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba de bstan pas gzhan gyi 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason of the triply characterized inferential cognition is because of the designation of the effect in the cause, and because of the establishment of the means that is not different from that, by the teaching of the probandum, in order to eliminate the assertion of others.

original: rten ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: rten ni rgyu'o //
translated: The basis is the cause.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rten gang yin pa zhes bya ba thun mong du rnam par sbyor ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rten gang yin pa zhes bya ba thun mong du rnam par sbyor ro //
translated: The basis of the inferential cognition is applied in common.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa rten yin pas zhes bya ba bye brag gang gi yin zhes bya ba rtogs pa na gal te yang don lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni sgra'i 'brel pa mo rtags su go ba de lta na yang de tshig gi sbyor ba'i
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa rten yin pas zhes bya ba bye brag gang gi yin zhes bya ba rtogs pa na gal te yang don lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni sgra'i 'brel pa mo rtags su go ba de lta na yang de tshig gi sbyor ba'i
translated: Therefore, when it is understood that the basis of the inferential cognition is the cause, if it is asked whose it is, since the inferential cognition is the basis, then even though the understanding of a hidden object is the understanding of the sign of the connection of a word, in that case, the basis of the inferential cognition is the cause of the ascertainment of the object that is to be understood, because the ascertainment of the object that is to be understood is the ascertainment of the object that is to be understood.

original: dus su nye ba ma yin pas phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir mo rtags kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: dus su nye ba ma yin pas phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir mo rtags kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: It is not a sign of a woman because it is not timely, since it is external.

original: dper na 'di bram ze mor bden no zhes pa dang / snod 'di 'bru bzhag pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'di bram ze mor bden no zhes pa dang / snod 'di 'bru bzhag pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying, “This is truly a Brahmin woman,” and “This vessel is filled with grain.”

original: 'dis kyang don lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa thams cad tshad mar gyur pa las yin gyi gzhan gyis de rtogs so //
analyzed: 'dis kyang don lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa thams cad tshad mar gyur pa las yin gyi gzhan gyis de rtogs so //
translated: This also explains that all understanding of a hidden object is from valid knowledge, and that it is not understood by anything else.

original: mi rigs pa'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags la brten pa kho na bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags la brten pa kho na bshad pa yin te /
translated: Because it is illogical, it is explained that it is only based on a sign having the three modes.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid la brten pa'i phyir zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid la brten pa'i phyir zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that it is based on inference itself.

original: des kyang sgra la sogs pa rnams yin na ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: des kyang sgra la sogs pa rnams yin na ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Also, if it is sound and so on, it is not a valid inference.

original: gzhan du na de rnams kyang bstan par thal bar 'gyur te rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de rnams kyang bstan par thal bar 'gyur te rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that those are also taught, because the reason is the same.

original: de lta na lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad rtogs pa ni tshad ma'i bdag nyid las yin gyi rang dags ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad rtogs pa ni tshad ma'i bdag nyid las yin gyi rang dags ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the understanding of all hidden objects is from the nature of valid cognition, not from mere desire.

original: de rang gi don dang 'brel pa med pas nges pa na de mi slu bar rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma ni mi slu ba mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rang gi don dang 'brel pa med pas nges pa na de mi slu bar rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad ma ni mi slu ba mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is not related to one’s own purpose, it is not reasonable to be nondeceptive when ascertaining it, because the definition of valid cognition is nondeceptive.

original: gzhan yang 'brel pa med pa las ma yin pa'i phyir de thams cad las thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'brel pa med pa las ma yin pa'i phyir de thams cad las thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it follows that everything would be understood from everything, because it would not be from what is related.

original: chos can dang ma 'brel du zin kyang thams cad la rtogs pa skye ste nye ba la bskal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can dang ma 'brel du zin kyang thams cad la rtogs pa skye ste nye ba la bskal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is not related to the subject, understanding arises from everything, because there is no restriction to what is near.

original: de ltar gyur pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags kho na las yin pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad rtogs pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa nyid rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags kho na las yin pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad rtogs pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa nyid rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that is the case, it is only from the evidence of the trimodal evidence that all hidden objects are understood. Therefore, it is said that inference is not different from what is born from the trimodal evidence.

original: don 'di yang phyogs chos de chas khyab pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di yang phyogs chos de chas khyab pa ni /
translated: The property of the subject and pervasion by that part

original: gtan tshigs su'i zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su'i zhe na /
translated: are the reason.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yin no zhes rang @183b bzhin 'brel ba bshad do //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yin no zhes rang @183b bzhin 'brel ba bshad do //
translated: The explanation of the intrinsic relation is that it is the realization of a hidden object.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid dang de'i chas khyab pa nyid lkog tu gyur ba'i don rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid dang de'i chas khyab pa nyid lkog tu gyur ba'i don rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that the property of the subject and pervasion by that part are the reason for the realization of a hidden object.

original: don smos pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs so zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi tshad mar bstan te ;
analyzed: don smos pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs so zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi tshad mar bstan te ;
translated: The statement of the object is that it is the realization of a hidden object. Inference is shown to be a valid cognition that has its own characteristic as its object.

original: don byed par nus pa ni don yin te /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa ni don yin te /
translated: An object is that which is able to perform a function.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is only the nature of its own characteristic.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po la brten nas tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa ni yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po la brten nas tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa ni yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, it will be explained that valid cognition is established in dependence on things.

original: gzhan du na don byed pa don du gnyer ba rjes su dpag pa las 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na don byed pa don du gnyer ba rjes su dpag pa las 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one seeking to perform a function would not engage in inference.

original: spyi'i dngos po yang shes pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi'i dngos po yang shes pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a universal is also characterized by being mere awareness,

original: de'i don byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don byed pa yin te /
translated: it is the object of that awareness.

original: de yang de las skye ba kho nar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de las skye ba kho nar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is established as arising from that alone.

original: rigs ni btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa la nye bar mkho ba med de //
analyzed: rigs ni btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa la nye bar mkho ba med de //
translated: A universal is not useful in such things as cooking and burning,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de la nye bar mkho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de la nye bar mkho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its own characteristic alone is useful in that.

original: gal te de dang 'brel bar de la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'brel bar de la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it engages that because it is related to that,

original: ma yin te rtag pa la phan gdags par bya ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rtag pa la phan gdags par bya ba 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because a permanent thing is not related to anything that is to be benefited.

original: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang /
translated: Even if there were a relationship,

original: ji ltar gzhan rtogs pa na gzhan la 'jug pa yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan rtogs pa na gzhan la 'jug pa yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: how could it engage one thing when it understands another? That would be absurd.

original: gal te 'du ba na phye ba nyid kyis tha dad par mi nges pas de nges pa la 'khrul pas de la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'du ba na phye ba nyid kyis tha dad par mi nges pas de nges pa la 'khrul pas de la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it engages that because it is confused about that, since it is not ascertained as different when it is related to that,

original: de lta na 'on te 'khrul pa kho na yin pa bla'i bar du lhag pa'i spyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de lta na 'on te 'khrul pa kho na yin pa bla'i bar du lhag pa'i spyis ci zhig bya /
translated: In that case, it is better to say that it is just an error. What is the use of an intervening universal?

original: gal te 'khrul pa las sa bon med pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa las sa bon med pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not logical for a seed to be absent from an error,

original: de kho na gsal bas 'bras bu gcig pa de cis na sa bon ma yin /
analyzed: de kho na gsal bas 'bras bu gcig pa de cis na sa bon ma yin /
translated: then why is that single effect, which is the manifestation of reality, not a seed?

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa mtshungs pa las spyir shes pa yin no //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa mtshungs pa las spyir shes pa yin no //
translated: It is a cognition of a universal because of the similarity of the aspect of color and shape.

original: spyi yang de'i ngo bo ma yin te //
analyzed: spyi yang de'i ngo bo ma yin te //
translated: But a universal is not its nature.

original: de ji ltar 'khrul pa'i sa bon yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'khrul pa'i sa bon yin /
translated: How can it be the seed of an error?

original: gzhan dag ni 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan las 'khrul par 'dod pa de spyi shes pa ni gsal ba kho na rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnam pa 'dra ba de dang / de kho na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan las 'khrul par 'dod pa de spyi shes pa ni gsal ba kho na rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnam pa 'dra ba de dang / de kho na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: Others assert that an error is due to a similar cause. The cognition of a universal is just that which is similar in aspect to the exclusion of what is dissimilar. That is the cause of an error.

original: de ma yin pa las ldog pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir spyi dngos por gyur pa dang 'brel pa med pas de rnams la yod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa las ldog pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir spyi dngos por gyur pa dang 'brel pa med pas de rnams la yod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the exclusion of what is not that, it is not tenable that universals exist in them because they are not related to real universals.

original: gang yang gsal ba'i bdag nyid kho na la spyir btags te //
analyzed: gang yang gsal ba'i bdag nyid kho na la spyir btags te //
translated: But if it is a universal, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽And if it is a generality, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a particular, then it is a particular in the sense of a specific property, and it is not a universal.🔽But if it is a universal, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a generality, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.

original: de rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi rjes su dpag par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //🔽rang gi @184a * //🔽mtshan nyid kyi spyi yin na rjes su dpag pa la ji ltar so sor snang ba yin zhes bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi rjes su dpag par khas blangs par 'gyur ro // rang gi @184a * // mtshan nyid kyi spyi yin na rjes su dpag pa la ji ltar so sor snang ba yin zhes bsam par bya ste /
translated: But if it is a particular, then it is a particular in the sense of a specific property, and it is not a universal.🔽But if it is a universal, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a generality, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a particular, then it is a particular in the sense of a specific property, and it is not a universal.

original: gsal ba'i dngos po spyi las gzhan pa'i ngo bo'i spyi mi 'dod pas bye brag pa'i lta ba khas len par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dngos po spyi las gzhan pa'i ngo bo'i spyi mi 'dod pas bye brag pa'i lta ba khas len par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is a universal, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a generality, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a particular, then it is a particular in the sense of a specific property, and it is not a universal.🔽But if it is a universal, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a generality, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a particular, then it is a particular in the sense of a specific property, and it is not a universal.

original: de la yang sngar bshad pa'i skyon gyis lkog tu gyur pa rang gi ngo bos rtogs par mi nus pas rtags la brten pas mngon sum las rjes su dpag pa logs shig tu bshad de /
analyzed: de la yang sngar bshad pa'i skyon gyis lkog tu gyur pa rang gi ngo bos rtogs par mi nus pas rtags la brten pas mngon sum las rjes su dpag pa logs shig tu bshad de /
translated: But if it is a universal, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.🔽But if it is a generality, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and it is not a particular.

original: de nyid kyang rang gi mtshan nyid de ma yin pa las ldog pa la spyi'i mtshan nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid kyang rang gi mtshan nyid de ma yin pa las ldog pa la spyi'i mtshan nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: But if it is a particular, then it is a particular in the sense of a specific property, and it is not a universal.🔽But if it is a universal, then it is a universal in the sense of a generality, and

original: 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid ni zhes spyi'i mtshan nyid du byas pa des na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid yul yin pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir rgya cher mi bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid ni zhes spyi'i mtshan nyid du byas pa des na rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid yul yin pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir rgya cher mi bshad do //
translated: Since this is what is indicated, there is no contradiction in taking character as a general characteristic, and therefore it is not explained at length.

original: mdor bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni zlos par dogs pa bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni zlos par dogs pa bsal ba yin te /
translated: The phrase in brief dispels the doubt that it is redundant.

original: rgya cher ni rnam 'grel la sogs par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya cher ni rnam 'grel la sogs par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is explained at length in the Pramanavarttika and so forth.

original: rtags kyi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtags kyi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The definition of a reason is an inference.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / tshad ma dang / de nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / tshad ma dang / de nges pa'o //
translated: This has four parts: its nature, its divisions, its valid cognition, and its ascertainment.

original: de la phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni /
analyzed: de la phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa ni /
translated: The phrase a property of the subject that is pervaded by that

original: gtan tshigs zhes bya bas ni rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs zhes bya bas ni rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
translated: indicates its nature.

original: de ni rnam gsum nyid ces bya bas rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam gsum nyid ces bya bas rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase it is of three types indicates its divisions.

original: med na mi 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu dbye ba nges par byed pa'i tshad ma nye bar bkod do ;
analyzed: med na mi 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu dbye ba nges par byed pa'i tshad ma nye bar bkod do ;
translated: The phrase it is a necessary relation indicates the valid cognition that ascertains its divisions.

original: / rnam gsum gyi rab tu dbye ba yang rtags gsum po rnams kyi ngo bo dang re re'i ngo bo nges par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: / rnam gsum gyi rab tu dbye ba yang rtags gsum po rnams kyi ngo bo dang re re'i ngo bo nges par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: The threefold division is to be explained as the application of the three kinds of evidence, each of which has its own nature.

original: de la phyogs kyi chos ni phyogs kyi cha'i chos kyis khyab pa med na mi 'byung ba yin no zhes mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la phyogs kyi chos ni phyogs kyi cha'i chos kyis khyab pa med na mi 'byung ba yin no zhes mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The definition of the property of the position is: “The property of the position is the pervasion of the property of the position, without which it does not occur.”

original: gtan tshigs zhes bya bas ni mtshan gzhi bstan to //🔽gtan tshigs de ni rnam gsum nyid //
analyzed: gtan tshigs zhes bya bas ni mtshan gzhi bstan to // gtan tshigs de ni rnam gsum nyid //
translated: The term “reason” indicates the basis of the definition.

original: ces bya bas dbye ba brjod do //
analyzed: ces bya bas dbye ba brjod do //
translated: The line “That reason is of three kinds” states the division.

original: 'on te gtan tshigs gzhan med par nges par gyur na rnam pa gsum kho na zhes bya ba rigs kyi 'gran zla med par nges pas yod pa rnams la nges par gzung ba dang bcas par gtan la dbab po //
analyzed: 'on te gtan tshigs gzhan med par nges par gyur na rnam pa gsum kho na zhes bya ba rigs kyi 'gran zla med par nges pas yod pa rnams la nges par gzung ba dang bcas par gtan la dbab po //
translated: If it is certain that there is no other reason, then there are only three kinds. Thus, the existence of the three kinds is ascertained by the certainty that there is no rival reason.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: Someone objects:

original: gang phyir 'di kho na yin zhes //
analyzed: gang phyir 'di kho na yin zhes //
translated: “Since it is certain that this alone is the reason,

original: 'di yod par ni gtan la 'bebs //
analyzed: 'di yod par ni gtan la 'bebs //
translated: its existence is ascertained.

original: dngos gzhan med par rigs pa ci //
analyzed: dngos gzhan med par rigs pa ci //
translated: What is the point of another reason?

original: rjes 'gro med na 'di ma yin //
analyzed: rjes 'gro med na 'di ma yin //
translated: If there is no pervasion, it is not this reason.”

original: zhe'o / gtan tshigs med par ni mngon sum gyis mi rtogs te //
analyzed: zhe'o / gtan tshigs med par ni mngon sum gyis mi rtogs te //
translated: No, because without a reason, perception does not understand nonexistence.

original: de yul med pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yul med pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory that it be the object of perception.

original: de lta na dngos po med pa ni dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi @184b cha'i med pa'i mtshan nyid yin na de'i dbang po dang nye ba med pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi yul yin par 'gal lo //🔽gang yang / re zhig dbang pos 'di med ces //
analyzed: de lta na dngos po med pa ni dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi @184b cha'i med pa'i mtshan nyid yin na de'i dbang po dang nye ba med pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi yul yin par 'gal lo // gang yang / re zhig dbang pos 'di med ces //
translated: Thus, if nonexistence is the characteristic of the absence of the nature of an entity, it is contradictory that it be the object of perception, because it is not related to a sense faculty.🔽And also:

original: blo ni skyed par byed pa yin //🔽dngos po'i cha dang 'brel nyid kyi //
analyzed: blo ni skyed par byed pa yin // dngos po'i cha dang 'brel nyid kyi //
translated: First, the mind is produced by the sense faculty, thinking “This does not exist.”🔽Because the sense faculty is suitable,

original: dbang po rung ba yin phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: dbang po rung ba yin phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: due to its connection with a part of an entity.

original: yang na nus pa thams cad kyis stong ba'i mtshan nyid de yang don gyi nus pa la ltos pa'i mngon sum gyi yul du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na nus pa thams cad kyis stong ba'i mtshan nyid de yang don gyi nus pa la ltos pa'i mngon sum gyi yul du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is contradictory that the characteristic of being empty of all abilities be the object of perception, which depends on the ability of an object.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang gtan tshigs gzhan med pa mi rtogs te //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang gtan tshigs gzhan med pa mi rtogs te //
translated: Also, nonexistence is not understood by inference, because there is no other reason.

original: de ni rtags rnam pa gsum la brten pa kho nar bshad pas so //
analyzed: de ni rtags rnam pa gsum la brten pa kho nar bshad pas so //
translated: Because it is explained that it is only based on three types of evidence.

original: rnam gsum nyid ces bya ba da ni bshad par bya ste //
analyzed: rnam gsum nyid ces bya ba da ni bshad par bya ste //
translated: Now, the three kinds of non-apprehension are to be explained.

original: de la 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag ni sgrub pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir dgag pa mi byed la mi dmigs pa las kyang gtan tshigs gzhan med par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag ni sgrub pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir dgag pa mi byed la mi dmigs pa las kyang gtan tshigs gzhan med par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Of these, the effect and nature are not negated, because they prove the probandum. And from non-apprehension, it is not certain that there is no other reason.

original: gang gi phyir de ni rnam pa bzhir gnas te //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni rnam pa bzhir gnas te //
translated: Because it is established in four ways:

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa sgrub pa ste de la mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo shes pa gcig la 'dre ba rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi ngo bo mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa sgrub pa ste de la mtshungs par rung ba'i ngo bo shes pa gcig la 'dre ba rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi ngo bo mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha
translated: non-apprehension of nature, effect, and pervader, and apprehension of the contradictory. Of these, non-apprehension of nature is the non-apprehension of the nature of something else, which is the non-apprehension of a single cognition of a nature that is suitable to be mixed with it.

original: snyad kyi gtan tshigs su 'dod pa dang / gtan tshigs gzhan gtan med par khas blangs pas rjes su bstan pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: snyad kyi gtan tshigs su 'dod pa dang / gtan tshigs gzhan gtan med par khas blangs pas rjes su bstan pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: It is asserted as a reason for the designation of non-existence, and it is not the nature of an instruction because it is accepted as the complete non-existence of another reason.

original: gal te zhig na yul la sogs pa kho na la 'gog na ni 'dir 'gyur gyi gtan med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhig na yul la sogs pa kho na la 'gog na ni 'dir 'gyur gyi gtan med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If it is negated only in relation to the object, etc., then it would be so, but not if it is completely non-existent.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag kyang 'bras bu khyab par bya ba med pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po yin na gtan tshigs gzhan ni gtan med par khas blangs pa la rnam pa 'di lta bu mi srid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag kyang 'bras bu khyab par bya ba med pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dngos po yin na gtan tshigs gzhan ni gtan med par khas blangs pa la rnam pa 'di lta bu mi srid do //
translated: But if one accepts that there is no other type of reason, then this type of reason is impossible.

original: de ji ltar de dag gis de med par go bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar de dag gis de med par go bar 'gyur /
translated: How could one understand that something does not exist on the basis of those?

original: 'gal ba yang rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba gzhan yod na med par go bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'byung ba gzhan yod na med par go bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pa yang mi srid do //
translated: Also, the observation of a contradictory object is impossible because if the cause of an effect is complete, it is understood that the effect exists.

original: srid pa yang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar gtan tshigs 'gog par byed pa yin zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: srid pa yang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa rnams ji ltar gtan tshigs 'gog par byed pa yin zhes dogs pa la /
translated: If it is possible, then how do you refute the reason of the nonobservation of a result and so on?

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: A reason that is a different type from those three is a fallacious reason.

original: des na gang gi phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because a reason that is a different type from the three types of reasons is a fallacious reason,

original: de ni rnam gsum nyid ces de ltar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ni rnam gsum nyid ces de ltar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that there are only three types.

original: 'dir ni gang dang gang nges pa de dang de las bzlog pa la mi mthun pa'i @185a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni gang dang gang nges pa de dang de las bzlog pa la mi mthun pa'i @185a * //
translated: Here, whatever is ascertained is pervaded by the opposite of that, which is the discordant side.

original: phyogs kyis khyab pa de'i nges pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyis khyab pa de'i nges pa grub pa yin te /
translated: The establishment of that ascertainment is as follows.

original: dper na gang yod pa de skad cig ma kho na'o zhes pas yod pa skad cig ma rnams la nges par brjod pas yod pa las bzlog pa med pas skad cig ma'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skad cig ma ma yin pa la khyab pa grub pa de bzhin🔽du 'dir yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum du nges pas gtan tshigs las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba la grangs gsum las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don gyis khyab pas grangs gsum kho nar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na gang yod pa de skad cig ma kho na'o zhes pas yod pa skad cig ma rnams la nges par brjod pas yod pa las bzlog pa med pas skad cig ma'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skad cig ma ma yin pa la khyab pa grub pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum du nges pas gtan tshigs las bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba la grangs gsum las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don gyis khyab pas grangs gsum kho nar nges pa yin no //
translated: For example, “Whatever exists is momentary” expresses the ascertainment of existence in momentary things. Since nonexistence is the opposite of existence, the non-momentary, which is the discordant side of the momentary, is established as being pervaded by existence.🔽In the same way, here, since the three types of reasons are ascertained, the three types of fallacious reasons, which are the opposite of the reasons, are established as being pervaded by the meaning that is outside of the three types. Therefore, they are ascertained as only three.

original: des na gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po las tha dad pa'i don rnams kyis gtan tshigs ltar snang ba bstan to //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po las tha dad pa'i don rnams kyis gtan tshigs ltar snang ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, the three types of fallacious reasons are taught by means of the objects that are different from the three types of reasons.

original: des na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i don rnams ni gtan tshigs ma yin par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i don rnams ni gtan tshigs ma yin par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, objects that are different from the three kinds of evidence, namely, observation of an effect, observation of an essential property, and nonobservation, are definitely not evidence.

original: gtan tshigs dang der snang ba dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid gtan tshigs su rtog pa'i dus kho nar 'gal bar rtogs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang der snang ba dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid gtan tshigs su rtog pa'i dus kho nar 'gal bar rtogs te /
translated: The evidence and the appearance of evidence are mutually exclusive, and this is understood as soon as one conceives of the evidence.

original: de'i bdag nyid du de nges par snang pa'i shes pa nyid de las bzlog pa gzhan pa de snang bar rtogs pa ni phan tshun gcig la gcig med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du de nges par snang pa'i shes pa nyid de las bzlog pa gzhan pa de snang bar rtogs pa ni phan tshun gcig la gcig med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the cognition that perceives the appearance of the evidence as having that nature is understood to perceive the appearance of something else that is different from it, and this is because it is ascertained that they are mutually exclusive.

original: de la gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las bzlog pa'i don rnams la gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nye bar dmigs pas rang nyid dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs gsal ba de yang gtan tshigs gsum las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don ni gtan tshigs med par khas ma blangs
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las bzlog pa'i don rnams la gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nye bar dmigs pas rang nyid dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs gsal ba de yang gtan tshigs gsum las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don ni gtan tshigs med par khas ma blangs
translated: In this regard, the observation of objects that are the opposite of the three kinds of evidence is the observation of the appearance of evidence. The evidence that is the opposite of the evidence that is the opposite of the three kinds of evidence is the evidence that is the opposite of the evidence that is the opposite of the three kinds of evidence.🔽The evidence that is the opposite of the three kinds of evidence is the evidence that is the opposite of the three kinds of evidence.

original: so // 'on kyang de rnams la gtan tshigs dgag pa ni gtan tshigs su rmongs pa 'ba' zhig gis gzhan la grags pa de nyid de la sgro 'dogs pa 'am the tshom za ba de 'gal ba dmigs pas bsal to //
analyzed: so // 'on kyang de rnams la gtan tshigs dgag pa ni gtan tshigs su rmongs pa 'ba' zhig gis gzhan la grags pa de nyid de la sgro 'dogs pa 'am the tshom za ba de 'gal ba dmigs pas bsal to //
translated: However, the refutation of the reason in those is that the mere confusion about the reason is imputed to that by others, or the doubt about that is removed by the observation of contradiction.

original: gtan med na ji ltar 'gal ba yin zhes de ji ste brjod /
analyzed: gtan med na ji ltar 'gal ba yin zhes de ji ste brjod /
translated: If it is utterly nonexistent, how could it be contradictory? Why is that said?

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba med na gang gis na de'i rigs pas thams cad la nye bar brjod dam /
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba med na gang gis na de'i rigs pas thams cad la nye bar brjod dam /
translated: If there is no contradiction in the sense of not coexisting, then by what is that type of contradiction applied to everything?

original: gang dang gang 'gog pa de dang de la 'gal bar rtogs pa ma yin na gang gis ji ltar med pa 'ga' zhig dang 'gal bar rtogs zhes rtsod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang 'gog pa de dang de la 'gal bar rtogs pa ma yin na gang gis ji ltar med pa 'ga' zhig dang 'gal bar rtogs zhes rtsod pa yin te /
translated: If it is not understood that whatever is refuted is contradictory, then by what is it understood that some nonexistent is contradictory?

original: 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod do zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na la grang ba'i reg pa dang me 'gal bar mi 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod do zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na la grang ba'i reg pa dang me 'gal bar mi 'byung la /
translated: Here, the mere absence of cold contact is not understood to be contradictory with the presence of fire.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa nyid 'di gzhan la 'gal bar rtogs pa'i @185b mes bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la 'gog pa de bzhin du gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nye bar dmigs pas gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don rnams la bkag pa
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa nyid 'di gzhan la 'gal bar rtogs pa'i @185b mes bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la 'gog pa de bzhin du gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nye bar dmigs pas gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don rnams la bkag pa
translated: In the same way, the negation of objects that are external to the three kinds of reasons is accomplished by the observation of fallacious reasons.

original: yin na / thams cad la gtan med pa yang mtshan nyid kyi 'gal bar rtogs te /
analyzed: yin na / thams cad la gtan med pa yang mtshan nyid kyi 'gal bar rtogs te /
translated: If one realizes the contradiction of the definition, then one realizes that it is completely nonexistent in everything.

original: dper na skad cig ma bzhin du skad cig ma ma yin pa de ni dngos po 'ga' zhig la yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na skad cig ma bzhin du skad cig ma ma yin pa de ni dngos po 'ga' zhig la yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is impossible for anything to be momentary and not momentary, just as it is impossible for anything to be momentary and not momentary.

original: de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, existence and nonexistence are also like this.

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir blo gros ngan pa'i 'dod pa de rnams la shin tu grub pas chog go //
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir blo gros ngan pa'i 'dod pa de rnams la shin tu grub pas chog go //
translated: Since the definition is devoid of all ability, it is completely established in those who have bad ideas.

original: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho nar nges pas de las bzlog pa la de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis khyab par gyur pa 'di gnas pa yin te //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho nar nges pas de las bzlog pa la de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis khyab par gyur pa 'di gnas pa yin te //
translated: Since the reason is definitely only threefold, the pervasion of the opposite by the incompatible factor of that is established.

original: de la nges par gyur pa yin no zhes dgos pa dang ldan pas bzlog pa la khyab pa bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de la nges par gyur pa yin no zhes dgos pa dang ldan pas bzlog pa la khyab pa bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: Since it is necessary to ascertain that, in order to demonstrate the pervasion of the opposite, the text says, “The fallacious reason is other than those.”

original: de ltar gyur na de ni skad cig ma'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa las bzlog pas khyab pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas nges kyi //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na de ni skad cig ma'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa las bzlog pas khyab pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas nges kyi //
translated: If that were the case, then the pervasion of the opposite by the incompatible factor of the momentary would be ascertained by valid knowledge that contradicts it.

original: 'dir ni gsum gyi grangs las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don rnams la gtan tshigs ltar snang bas khyab pa la tshad mas gang zhig gis nges she na //
analyzed: 'dir ni gsum gyi grangs las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don rnams la gtan tshigs ltar snang bas khyab pa la tshad mas gang zhig gis nges she na //
translated: But here, how is the pervasion of the fallacious reason with regard to objects that are outside of the enumeration of the three ascertained by valid knowledge?

original: med na mi 'byung nges phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges phyir ro //
translated: Because of the ascertainment of the invariable relation.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so ;
translated: Thus he says,🔽“Because of the ascertainment of the invariable relation.”

original: / gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las tha dad pa'i rtags khas len pa'am /
analyzed: / gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las tha dad pa'i rtags khas len pa'am /
translated: The opponent asserts a reason that is different from the three types of reasons.

original: the tshom za ba nyid la dngos po la phyogs kyi chos nyid yod du zin kyang med na mi 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: the tshom za ba nyid la dngos po la phyogs kyi chos nyid yod du zin kyang med na mi 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if the property of the position exists in the subject, if the invariable concomitance does not exist, then the reason is not established.

original: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur te de ni gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur te de ni gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This will be explained later, because it is stated that there is no invariable concomitance other than the three kinds of reasons.🔽When the invariable concomitance is incomplete, the fallacious reasons are like the nonestablished, contradictory, and uncertain reasons, which are pervasions by similar attributes.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ma tshang na gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa chos mtshungs pas khyab pa'i gzhal bya nyid la sogs par nges pa bzhin du gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ma tshang na gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa chos mtshungs pas khyab pa'i gzhal bya nyid la sogs par nges pa bzhin du gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The fallacious reasons are like the probandum.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ma tshang las zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ma tshang las zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: From the incompleteness of the invariable concomitance, it is a natural reason.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ma tshang ba yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum la tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i don rnams khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas de grub pa yin te //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ma tshang ba yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum la tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i don rnams khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas de grub pa yin te //
translated: If it is not established, then the non-observation of a pervader is established by the non-observation of an effect, cause, or nature.🔽The non-observation of a pervader is established by the non-observation of an essential quality.🔽The non-observation of an essential quality is established by the non-observation of an effect.

original: de ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis med na mi 'byung ba la khyab bo //🔽de @186a * //
analyzed: de ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis med na mi 'byung ba la khyab bo // de @186a * //
translated: The non-observation of an effect is established by the non-observation of a cause.🔽The non-observation of a cause is established by the non-observation of a nature.🔽The non-observation of a nature is established by the observation of a contradictory object.

original: dag de la gdon mi za bar yod la de yang de dag kho na la yod de de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang de las byung ba ma yin pa ni de la rag las pa med pas de la mi 'khrul par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: dag de la gdon mi za bar yod la de yang de dag kho na la yod de de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang de las byung ba ma yin pa ni de la rag las pa med pas de la mi 'khrul par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro
translated: The observation of a contradictory object is established by the observation of a contradictory object.🔽The observation of a contradictory object is established by the observation of an effect.

original: // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'am //
analyzed: // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'am //
translated: The observation of an effect is established by the observation of a cause.🔽The observation of a cause is established by the observation of a nature.

original: rang bzhin nges par byed pa las //🔽med na mi 'byung nges pa ste //🔽ma mthong las min mthong las min //
analyzed: rang bzhin nges par byed pa las // med na mi 'byung nges pa ste // ma mthong las min mthong las min //
translated: The observation of a nature is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.

original: gzhan du gzhan ni gzhan dag dang // nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang //
analyzed: gzhan du gzhan ni gzhan dag dang // nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang //
translated: The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality.🔽The observation of an essential quality is established by the observation of an essential quality

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos //🔽yin na gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos // yin na gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: The other is a reason that is a property of the object.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is a property of the object, it is like the color of cloth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang ro la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin la 'on kyang rang gi rgyu la mi 'khrul ba'i sgo nas de'i rgyu las byung ba kho na med na mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang ro la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin la 'on kyang rang gi rgyu la mi 'khrul ba'i sgo nas de'i rgyu las byung ba kho na med na mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya
translated: Form and so on do not arise without taste and so on, but they are not their essence. However, they are the reason for their non-arising when absent, because they arise from their own causes without error.

original: ba'i / gzhan du na de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa dang // de la rag las pa 'am rgyu la rag las pa de med na mi 'byung bar brtags na ni thams cad kyi don me med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba'i / gzhan du na de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa dang // de la rag las pa 'am rgyu la rag las pa de med na mi 'byung bar brtags na ni thams cad kyi don me med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if it is imagined that something that is not of the nature of that, or that is not dependent on it, or that is not dependent on its cause, does not arise when absent, then everything would not arise when fire is absent,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no distinction.

original: gal te don gcig tu 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan gzugs dang ro la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don gcig tu 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan gzugs dang ro la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the reason for their being combined into one object is that they do not arise when form, taste, and so on are absent,

original: 'on te 'du ba yang brten pa dang rten du gyur par nye bar brjod de /
analyzed: 'on te 'du ba yang brten pa dang rten du gyur par nye bar brjod de /
translated: then combination is also described as the support and the supported.

original: de yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid yin na phan 'dogs pa med par ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de yang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid yin na phan 'dogs pa med par ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas mi 'grub po //
translated: Moreover, if it were the nature of the thing that is the basis and the dependent, then it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no benefit, and so it is not established.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa kho na la don gcig tu 'du ba yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa kho na la don gcig tu 'du ba yin te /
translated: The two are said to be the same in meaning when they are dependent on the same collection.

original: ji ltar 'du ba'am gzhan pa'i 'brel pa mi srid pa de ltar 'brel ba brtag par bstan bcos mdzad pas rgyas par bstan pas de nyid du nges par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'du ba'am gzhan pa'i 'brel pa mi srid pa de ltar 'brel ba brtag par bstan bcos mdzad pas rgyas par bstan pas de nyid du nges par bya'o //
translated: The treatise has taught at length how it is impossible for them to be a collection or to be related in any other way, and so this should be ascertained from that.

original: gal te des de rgyu'am bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po 'am de'i bdag nyid du zin kyang des na mi 'byung ba las gzhan ma yin no zhes 'dir dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi lan brjod de /
analyzed: gal te des de rgyu'am bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po 'am de'i bdag nyid du zin kyang des na mi 'byung ba las gzhan ma yin no zhes 'dir dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi lan brjod de /
translated: If it were the cause of that or the thing that gives rise to it, or if it were the nature of that, then it would not be different from that which does not arise.

original: gang 'di ltar gyur pa ni kho bo 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi khyod kyis kyang mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar gyur pa ni kho bo 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi khyod kyis kyang mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: Here the response is given in terms of the nature of things, and it is not just I who see it this way, but you do as well.

original: de lta na slo bur bde dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar 'ga' ba zhig mi 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta na slo bur bde dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar 'ga' ba zhig mi 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: If that were so, then it would not be the case that the nature of things is not to be impermanent.

original: gtan tshigs yul dang dus dang rdzas nges par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs yul dang dus dang rdzas nges par mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not possible to restrict the object, time, and substance of a reason.

original: de cung zad gcig la lar 'jig pa 'am ma yin pa dang gang gang la cung zad cig rag las pa'am rag las pa med pa de lta ma yin na khyad par med pa'i phyir @186b 'dod pa'i yul dang dus rdzas bzhin du yul la sogs pa gzhan🔽na yod pa la gang gis na bsal par nus /
analyzed: de cung zad gcig la lar 'jig pa 'am ma yin pa dang gang gang la cung zad cig rag las pa'am rag las pa med pa de lta ma yin na khyad par med pa'i phyir @186b 'dod pa'i yul dang dus rdzas bzhin du yul la sogs pa gzhan na yod pa la gang gis na bsal par nus /
translated: If it were not so, then because there would be no difference, like a desired object, time, and substance, it would be impossible to eliminate the existence of something in another place, etc.

original: de'i phyir gang gang zhig las med kyang 'byung bar mthong ba de dang de ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa de kho na nyid sems pas 'di brjod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gang zhig las med kyang 'byung bar mthong ba de dang de ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa de kho na nyid sems pas 'di brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, the one who reflects on reality says this: “Whatever is seen to arise without a cause is the cause of error.”

original: rkang pa brkyang ba'i dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa brkyang ba'i dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the cause of error is the object of the outstretched leg.

original: de yang mi 'khrul pa'i rgyu ji ltar bshad pa las gzhan du rjes su sbyor na ni de ma tshang bas gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid la brten pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de yang mi 'khrul pa'i rgyu ji ltar bshad pa las gzhan du rjes su sbyor na ni de ma tshang bas gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid la brten pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: Moreover, if one were to apply the reason in a way that is different from the way it was explained, then, since it would be incomplete, it would not be based on the definition of a reason.

original: de skad du yang /🔽ldan pa la sogs pa gang rnams la //
analyzed: de skad du yang / ldan pa la sogs pa gang rnams la //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽If there is no such relation

original: 'brel pa de 'dra yod min na //
analyzed: 'brel pa de 'dra yod min na //
translated: as inherence and so on,

original: de ni gtan tshigs min zhes bshad //
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs min zhes bshad //
translated: then it is said that it is not a reason.

original: 'khrul pa srid pa nyid kyi phyir //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa srid pa nyid kyi phyir // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because error is possible.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dang gang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med pa de dang de ni med na mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni gang dang gang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med pa de dang de ni med na mi 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Here the syllogism is: Whatever does not have the nature of that or arise from that is not necessarily not present when that is not present,

original: dper na gzhal bya la sogs pas mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzhal bya la sogs pas mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, impermanence in relation to the object of comprehension and so on.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i don de rnams kyang 'ga' zhig tu de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i don de rnams kyang 'ga' zhig tu de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The objects that are different from nature, effect, and nonapprehension are sometimes not present when that is not present, that is, the pervasion is nonapprehension of the pervader.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir 'di ni de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir 'di ni de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa kho na'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is included in the reason of intrinsic nature, so this is only the relation of identity of that.

original: khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa kho nas khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu ldog pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa kho nas khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu ldog pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: The non-apprehension of the pervader and the non-apprehension of the effect also prove the negation of the pervaded and the effect, respectively, only by the relation of identity and origination.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir de tsam dang 'brel ba //
translated: Therefore, there is only that much relation.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid //
translated: The intrinsic nature of that is intrinsic nature.

original: ldog par 'gyur ba'am rgyu yis ni //
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ba'am rgyu yis ni //
translated: There is negation by cause,

original: 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and there is no error in the effect.

original: de ltar des gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang grangs nges pa dang / de'i 'thad pa zhes bya ba don rnam pa gsum tshigs su bcad pa 'dir rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar des gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid dang grangs nges pa dang / de'i 'thad pa zhes bya ba don rnam pa gsum tshigs su bcad pa 'dir rgyas par bshad do //
translated: Thus, he explains in this verse the three topics: the definition of the reason, the determination of the number of reasons, and the proof of that.

original: yang na rnam gsum nyid ces bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos de rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam gsum nyid ces bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos de rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or else, the phrase “just three types” means that the property of the subject has just three modes.

original: rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang mi dmigs par bshad pa ni de'i chas khyab pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang mi dmigs par bshad pa ni de'i chas khyab pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The explanation of the property of the subject as nature, effect, and nonobservation is not different from the pervasion by the property of the subject.

original: de yang de'i chas khyab pa rnam pa gsum yin no zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de yang de'i chas khyab pa rnam pa gsum yin no zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: That is also connected to the statement “the property of the subject has just three modes of pervasion.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that the property of the subject is necessarily nonexistent.
