translated: The word “or” indicates that the forward pervasion and the counter pervasion have the same meaning, but the words are not the same.

original: des na mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag gi sbyor ba gcig gis gnyi ga rtogs te /
analyzed: des na mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag gi sbyor ba gcig gis gnyi ga rtogs te /
translated: Therefore, one application to the similar class or the dissimilar class makes both known.

original: dpag pa dang sgrub pa'i tshul dag gi 'jug pa tha dad kyang don dam pa de'i bdag nyid yin pas gnyi ga rtogs par bstan to //
analyzed: dpag pa dang sgrub pa'i tshul dag gi 'jug pa tha dad kyang don dam pa de'i bdag nyid yin pas gnyi ga rtogs par bstan to //
translated: Although the ways of inferring and proving are different, they are both taught to make known the ultimate, which is the nature of that.

original: ldog pa ni bsgrub bya ldog pas rtags ldog pa'i chos yin to /
analyzed: ldog pa ni bsgrub bya ldog pas rtags ldog pa'i chos yin to /
translated: The counter pervasion is the property of the reason that is the counter-reversal of the probandum.

original: rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa'i chos yin na ni rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo 'di dngos po la 'di 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa'i chos yin na ni rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo 'di dngos po la 'di 'gal ba med do //
translated: If the two properties are of the same nature, then this forward pervasion is not contradictory in terms of the entity.

original: ci phyogs kyi chos kyang yin nam zhe na /🔽bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad mas bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ci phyogs kyi chos kyang yin nam zhe na / bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad mas bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Is it also the property of the subject?🔽It is explained by valid knowledge just as it is.

original: nges pa'i zhar la de yang 'dir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i zhar la de yang 'dir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is taught here as a supplement to the ascertainment.

original: gal te nges pa go bar byed pa nyid du bshad pas ji ltar slar yang rjes su 'gro ba'i don gyis khyab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nges pa go bar byed pa nyid du bshad pas ji ltar slar yang rjes su 'gro ba'i don gyis khyab pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the reason is stated in order to make the meaning understood, then how is there pervasion by the meaning of the forward pervasion?

original: gang gi tshe gtan tshigs thams cad la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtan tshigs thams cad la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “When there is no probandum in any reason,”

original: gtan tshigs gang dang gang la bsgrub par bya ba de dang de las med pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos des gtan tshigs de la khyab pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang dang gang la bsgrub par bya ba de dang de las med pa de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos des gtan tshigs de la khyab pa mi 'grub po //
translated: because when there is no probandum in any reason, then the probandum does not establish the pervasion of that reason.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs gang dang gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de dang de la yod pa ni khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo'i khyab pa'o //🔽gang dang gang ldog pa nges pas de yang ldog @193a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs gang dang gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de dang de la yod pa ni khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo'i khyab pa'o // gang dang gang ldog pa nges pas de yang ldog @193a * //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the probandum in any reason is the essence of the pervading property, which is the pervasion. This is the pervasion by the essence of the forward pervasion.🔽That which is ascertained by the negation of the forward pervasion is also established as pervaded by that negation.

original: pa des khyab par 'grub kyi bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa des khyab par 'grub kyi bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the opposite is not.

original: des na khyab par bya ba'i ngo bo'i khyab pa ni ldog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na khyab par bya ba'i ngo bo'i khyab pa ni ldog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion of the nature of the pervaded is the nature of the reverse.

original: yang na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos khyab par byed pa med na khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos khyab par byed pa med na khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, because the pervasion of the probandum is not established without the pervader.

original: de na gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bya ba spangs pa yin no//
analyzed: de na gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bya ba spangs pa yin no//
translated: Therefore, the pervasion of the reason is abandoned.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos khyab par byed pa med pa ga las she na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos khyab par byed pa med pa ga las she na /
translated: How is the probandum pervaded by the absence of the pervader?

original: bdag nyid ldog na gtan tshigs ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ldog na gtan tshigs ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the self is reversed, the reason is not reversed.

original: ldog pa'i bdag nyid ni ldog par byed pa khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pa'i bdag nyid ni ldog par byed pa khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The nature of the reverse is the pervader of the reverse because

original: cig shos de med pa la med pa kho na khyab par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos de med pa la med pa kho na khyab par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the other is pervaded by the absence of that absence.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa yod pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya pa khyab pa ldog pa'i bdag nyid kho na la yod par rtogs te khyab par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa yod pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya pa khyab pa ldog pa'i bdag nyid kho na la yod par rtogs te khyab par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the mere existence of the reverse, the pervasion of the probandum is understood to exist only in the nature of the reverse, and the characteristic of the pervaded property is established.

original: de bas na de'i chas khyab pa'i tshig gis gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad mas nges pa dag gis de'i chas khyab pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i chas khyab pa'i tshig gis gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bshad pa'i phyir ro // de ltar de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad mas nges pa dag gis de'i chas khyab pa nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the words “by virtue of which” indicate pervasion by that.🔽Thus, by means of valid cognitions that ascertain the positive and negative concomitance just as they are, one ascertains the pervasion by that.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad mas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang phyogs chos nges pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad mas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang phyogs chos nges pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the positive and negative concomitance and the property of the subject are ascertained by means of valid cognitions that have the nature just as they are explained.

original: de la tshad ma gang dang gang gis nges pa de bstan pa'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la tshad ma gang dang gang gis nges pa de bstan pa'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show which valid cognitions ascertain which, he says “in regard to that,” and so on.

original: de la phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa de rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa de rnams la'o //
translated: In regard to that means in regard to those, the property of the subject and so on.

original: phyogs kyi chos nges pa'i skabs phyis bstan du zin kyang mdo'i rim pas thog mar brjod bas phyogs kyi chos nges pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nges pa'i skabs phyis bstan du zin kyang mdo'i rim pas thog mar brjod bas phyogs kyi chos nges pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Although the occasion for ascertaining the property of the subject comes later, because of the order of the text, it is mentioned first. Therefore, “ascertaining the property of the subject” is supplied.

original: rab tu grub pa 'di ci zhig yin zhe na rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa 'di ci zhig yin zhe na rtogs pa'o //
translated: What is this establishment? It is the realization.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: With respect to what?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la'o ;
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la'o ;
translated: With respect to the subject to be established.

original: / gang gis she na /
analyzed: / gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: By means of perception and inference.

original: phyogs kyi chos thams cad mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos thams cad mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that all the properties of the subject are ascertained by perception and inference,

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig la kha cig gis yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'am gyi sgra smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig la kha cig gis yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'am gyi sgra smos pa yin no //
translated: but in order to indicate that some are ascertained by some, the word “or” is used.

original: mngon sum gyis kyang rang nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa nyid yin du zin kyang de ma thag tu spyir rtog pa'i rnam pa skyed pa'i phyir rab tu grub pa la nye bar brtags nas nges par brjod do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis kyang rang nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa nyid yin du zin kyang de ma thag tu spyir rtog pa'i rnam pa skyed pa'i phyir rab tu grub pa la nye bar brtags nas nges par brjod do //
translated: Even though perception is itself the form of its own particular characteristic, it is said to be ascertained by means of the establishment of the conceptual form that immediately follows it, having imagined it.

original: mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ma gtogs pa rtogs pa med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la ma gtogs pa rtogs pa med do zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that there is no realization apart from the conceptual form that arises after perception.

original: des na gal te spyi'i ngo @193b po'i rtags rnam par 'jog pa de lta na yang rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa kho na de rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos mngon sum yin par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can rab tu grub
analyzed: des na gal te spyi'i ngo @193b po'i rtags rnam par 'jog pa de lta na yang rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa kho na de rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos mngon sum yin par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can rab tu grub
translated: Therefore, even if the reason is posited as a universal, it is posited as the reason for the realization of the specific characteristic alone. Therefore, the property of the subject, the direct perception, is established.🔽

original: pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, even if the reason is posited in terms of a universal, since the cause of positing it is the perception of the intrinsic identity alone, it is said that the property of the subject is established by the perception of the property of the subject.

original: 'di yang de ma thag kho nar gsal bar byed bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang de ma thag kho nar gsal bar byed bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be clarified immediately below.

original: yang na rjes su dpag par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la phyogs kyi chos rab tu grub par nges pa dang / tshad ma dang 'bras bu tha dad ni rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag pas nges so //
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag par bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la phyogs kyi chos rab tu grub par nges pa dang / tshad ma dang 'bras bu tha dad ni rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag pas nges so //
translated: Or, the property of the subject is ascertained as established in the subject of the proposition to be proven by inference, and the difference between the valid cognition and the result is ascertained by inference.

original: 'dir dpe ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dper nas phyogs la du ba zhes bya ba smos so gang zhig du ba'i spyi mngon sum gyis nges so snyam du sems nas sa phyogs dang 'brel pa'i me mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dper nas phyogs la du ba zhes bya ba smos so gang zhig du ba'i spyi mngon sum gyis nges so snyam du sems nas sa phyogs dang 'brel pa'i me mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: Here, the examples are stated in order, such as “smoke on the mountain,” thinking that the universal of smoke is ascertained by direct perception, but fire related to the mountain is not directly perceived.

original: gang yang mngon sum la nam mkha'i cha'i ngo bo snang ba la sogs pa du ba'i bdag nyid dang ldan par mthong ba 'di me dang ldan par mthong ba ni med pa de'i phyir ji ltar sa phyogs kyi du ba mngon sum la rab tu grub pa yin
analyzed: gang yang mngon sum la nam mkha'i cha'i ngo bo snang ba la sogs pa du ba'i bdag nyid dang ldan par mthong ba 'di me dang ldan par mthong ba ni med pa de'i phyir ji ltar sa phyogs kyi du ba mngon sum la rab tu grub pa yin
translated: Therefore, how can the smoke of a place be established in a direct perception?

original: na / de'i phyir du ba kho na chos can du rigs te /
analyzed: na / de'i phyir du ba kho na chos can du rigs te /
translated: Therefore it is logical that only the smoke is the subject.

original: du ba 'di me dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: du ba 'di me dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: This smoke possesses fire

original: du ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: du ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is smoke.

original: me dang bcas pa'i du ba'i cha shas yongs su snang na steng du gnas pa'i cha me dang lhan cig tu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me dang bcas pa'i du ba'i cha shas yongs su snang na steng du gnas pa'i cha me dang lhan cig tu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the part of the smoke that possesses fire is completely visible, then the part that is located above does not exist together with the fire.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar du ba'i spyi'i chos can mngon sum ma yin ;
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar du ba'i spyi'i chos can mngon sum ma yin ;
translated: Since it is not a direct perception, how can the general subject of smoke not be a direct perception?

original: gal te du ba'i yan lag mngon sum du grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te du ba'i yan lag mngon sum du grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the parts of the smoke are established in a direct perception,

original: yan lag las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'am /
analyzed: yan lag las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'am /
translated: since they are not different from the parts, worldly people would conceive of them as one.

original: sa phyogs kyang de tsam du gcig tu brtags pa gsal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sa phyogs kyang de tsam du gcig tu brtags pa gsal bar mi nus so //
translated: And it is not possible to clearly determine that the place is just that much.

original: sa phyogs nyid la yang me bstan par bya ba yin gyi du ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa phyogs nyid la yang me bstan par bya ba yin gyi du ba ni ma yin no //
translated: And the place itself is to be indicated by the fire, not by the smoke.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos nas go bar byed pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos nas go bar byed pa ni gang /
translated: What is the effect-reason that is understood in dependence on place, time, and so on?

original: 'gal 'bras la yang yul dang ni //
analyzed: 'gal 'bras la yang yul dang ni //
translated: And in the case of contradictory effects,🔽dependence on place,

original: dus la sogs pa ltos par 'dod //
analyzed: dus la sogs pa ltos par 'dod //
translated: time, and so on is accepted.

original: gzhan du 'khrul 'gyur mi grang ba //
analyzed: gzhan du 'khrul 'gyur mi grang ba //
translated: Otherwise there would be error, as in the non-cold

original: sgrub pa la ni thal ba bzhin //
analyzed: sgrub pa la ni thal ba bzhin //
translated: in the proof, as in the reductio.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is stated.

original: de'i phyir yul la sogs pa la ltos pa me sgrub par byed pa'i du ba dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs chos can du bzung na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul la sogs pa la ltos pa me sgrub par byed pa'i du ba dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs chos can du bzung na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, when the subject, the place possessing smoke that proves fire, is taken in dependence on place and so on, there is no contradiction.🔽For example, in dependence on place and so on, a tree possessing a heron is a prover of water,

original: dper na chu skyar dang ldan pa'i shing la sogs pa yul la sogs pa la ltos nas chu sgrub par byed pa'am //
analyzed: dper na chu skyar dang ldan pa'i shing la sogs pa yul la sogs pa la ltos nas chu sgrub par byed pa'am //
translated: For example, in dependence on a tree with a crane, a place, and so on, water is established.

original: sgra la byas pa ni rkyen tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs ba rjes su @194a * //
analyzed: sgra la byas pa ni rkyen tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs ba rjes su @194a * //
translated: The term “sound” is different because it is a different condition.🔽

original: dpog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dpog pa bzhin no //
translated: The case of sound is like the case of inference, where the reason is different from the property to be established.

original: 'dir ji ltar mngon par brjod pa'i mngon sum gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can phyogs kyi chos su rab tu grub pa dgos pa ma rtogs nas gzhon nu ma len gyis ji ltar spyi'i bdag nyid du ba la sogs pa'i rtags mngon sum du rtogs pa med🔽pa las yin ;
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar mngon par brjod pa'i mngon sum gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can phyogs kyi chos su rab tu grub pa dgos pa ma rtogs nas gzhon nu ma len gyis ji ltar spyi'i bdag nyid du ba la sogs pa'i rtags mngon sum du rtogs pa med pa las yin ;
translated: Here, not understanding the need for the property of the subject to be established as the property of the subject by the direct perception of verbal expression, Kumarila asks, how can the reason such as smoke be directly perceived as having the nature of a universal?🔽When one merely applies the reason to the subject, how can one apprehend their relation?

original: rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa 'am chos can la yang de tsam zhig nye bar sbyor ba na 'di dag gi 'brel pa gang gis 'dzin pa yin snyam nas slar rtsod pa ni des na mngon sum sngon du song ba dang rjes su dang ga ba la sogs🔽pa'i chos kyi rgyu mtshan yin no zhes rnam bshad byed pas /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa 'am chos can la yang de tsam zhig nye bar sbyor ba na 'di dag gi 'brel pa gang gis 'dzin pa yin snyam nas slar rtsod pa ni des na mngon sum sngon du song ba dang rjes su dang ga ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi rgyu mtshan yin no zhes rnam bshad byed pas /
translated: Thus, the explanation is that the relation is apprehended by the prior direct perception and subsequent cognition, etc.

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro nyid kyis //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro nyid kyis //
translated: The prior direct perception

original: rjes dpag la sogs ji ltar 'gyur //🔽gal te rtogs med dbang po'i blo //
analyzed: rjes dpag la sogs ji ltar 'gyur // gal te rtogs med dbang po'i blo //
translated: How then could there be inference and so on?

original: dran pa la ni mi stos na //
analyzed: dran pa la ni mi stos na //
translated: If the sense consciousnesses do not require memory,

original: rtags dang chos can 'brel pa dag / de ltar rtogs pa med pas kyang //
analyzed: rtags dang chos can 'brel pa dag / de ltar rtogs pa med pas kyang //
translated: then they would not apprehend the relationship between the reason and the property to be proven.

original: mi 'dzin ces bya ba la rtags la sogs pa mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa spangs pa yin na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir /🔽rnam rtog de la don dngos kyis //
analyzed: mi 'dzin ces bya ba la rtags la sogs pa mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa spangs pa yin na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir / rnam rtog de la don dngos kyis //
translated: If you say that the apprehension of the reason and so on by direct perception is refuted because they are nonconceptual,🔽then the conceptual consciousness that apprehends the reason and so on would not be able to induce the realization of the probandum because it is not related to the probandum by the relation of nature and effect.

original: phan 'dogs par ni mi 'dod phyir //🔽snga ma lta ba'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par ni mi 'dod phyir // snga ma lta ba'i shes pa ni //
translated: This is because you do not assert that the conceptual consciousness is assisted by the real thing.

original: dang por rnam rtog med par yod //
analyzed: dang por rnam rtog med par yod //
translated: Therefore the prior consciousness that sees the reason and so on exists without conceptualization.🔽It arises from a limited real thing that is similar to the consciousness of a mute child and so on.

original: byis pa lkugs sogs shes pa dang // 'dra ba nyi tshe'i dngos las skyes //
analyzed: byis pa lkugs sogs shes pa dang // 'dra ba nyi tshe'i dngos las skyes //
translated: Also, the consciousness that ascertains the reason and so on is direct perception.

original: de las gzhan yang dngos chos nas ;
analyzed: de las gzhan yang dngos chos nas ;
translated: This is because it arises from a real thing that is not a universal.

original: / rigs la sogs pa gang gang gi / nges par byed pa'i blo de yang //
analyzed: / rigs la sogs pa gang gang gi / nges par byed pa'i blo de yang //
translated: Also, the consciousness that ascertains whatever is a reason and so on is direct perception.

original: mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa yin //
translated: This is because it arises from a real thing that is not a universal.

original: zhes smras na /
analyzed: zhes smras na /
translated: If you say this,

original: bde bar gshegs pa kho na la 'dir rtags dag dang chos can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum 'di dag skyon yin gyi /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa kho na la 'dir rtags dag dang chos can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum 'di dag skyon yin gyi /
translated: The Sugata alone has these nonconceptual direct perceptions that apprehend the relation between the reason and the subject here.

original: kho bo cag rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum 'dod pa la bshad pa ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: kho bo cag rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum 'dod pa la bshad pa ltar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: We do not assert that we have direct perception that is conceptual.

original: de'i phyir / de yis skyon brjod pa bsal ba'i phyir du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de yis skyon brjod pa bsal ba'i phyir du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To dispel the faults that he mentions, Bhāviveka says, “The place that has smoke” and so on.

original: de'i 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows.

original: mngon sum ni mdun na gnas pa'i rten dang brten pa du ba dang sa phyogs la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i ngo bos du ba la sogs pa rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ni rang rang gi ngo bo la rnam par gnas pas thams
analyzed: mngon sum ni mdun na gnas pa'i rten dang brten pa du ba dang sa phyogs la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i ngo bos du ba la sogs pa rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ni rang rang gi ngo bo la rnam par gnas pas thams
translated: Direct perception is the establishment of the place and the thing that is located there, such as smoke and the place where it is located. The essence of that is that smoke and so on are distinguished from things of the same type and from things of a different type. Since each of them is present in its own nature,

original: cad kyi nus pa rnams phan tshun ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cad kyi nus pa rnams phan tshun ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: all of their potencies are of a nature that is not mixed with each other.

original: de'i nus pa las 'byung ba'i ji ltar @194b gnas pa'i rjes su byed pa las phyis dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i nus pa las 'byung ba'i ji ltar @194b gnas pa'i rjes su byed pa las phyis dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from the power of that, the two conceptual thoughts of negation and affirmation arise later, in accordance with the way things are.

original: gang gis sa phyogs kyi du ba chos dang chos can du grags pa de yang rten dang brten pa bzhin du 'dir yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes brtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis sa phyogs kyi du ba chos dang chos can du grags pa de yang rten dang brten pa bzhin du 'dir yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes brtag pa ste /
translated: And the smoke that is known as the property and the subject in the place is also here like the basis and the dependent, but not elsewhere.

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba goms pa bsal ba dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan gyis rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba goms pa bsal ba dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gzhan gyis rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
translated: Just as the conceptual thought arises from the removal of the experience of familiarity and from other cooperative conditions.

original: de'i phyir / chos dang chos can gyi ngo bo nges ba dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos dang chos can gyi ngo bo nges ba dang 'brel pa /
translated: Therefore, the definite connection between the nature of the property and the subject

original: nges pa mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: is established by the reason of definite perception.

original: de lta na du ba de nyid phyogs la 'brel par nges pa ni gang 'di la 'di'o zhes nges par byed pa dang / de ni rnam par rtog pas kyang mngon sum gyis ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta na du ba de nyid phyogs la 'brel par nges pa ni gang 'di la 'di'o zhes nges par byed pa dang / de ni rnam par rtog pas kyang mngon sum gyis ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of the connection of that smoke with the place is the ascertainment of “this here,” and that is established just as it is described by direct perception, even by conceptual thought.

original: rten dang brten pa'i rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no relation of the supported and the supporter.

original: dngos po rnam pa gnyis las gzhan kho na rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig gi 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni med do //
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa gnyis las gzhan kho na rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid 'ga' zhig gi 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni med do //
translated: There is no connection of any kind, other than the two kinds of entities, that has the characteristic of the supported and the supporter.

original: mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba las phyi nas rnam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba las phyi nas rnam par 'gyur te /
translated: After the experience by direct perception, there is a transformation.

original: dngos po las gyur pa de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po las gyur pa de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is excluded from the entities.

original: de'i phyir de nyid de bzhin du gnas pa don gnyis la brten nas rnam par rtog pa d'i sgro 'dogs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid de bzhin du gnas pa don gnyis la brten nas rnam par rtog pa d'i sgro 'dogs pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, just that, remaining just as it is, is the superimposition of that conceptual thought, which is based on the two objects.

original: de ni 'brel pa dang 'brel pa can dang tha dad pa khyab par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba dag gis 'jig rten na chos can gyi tha snyad du byed kyi don dam par ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'brel pa dang 'brel pa can dang tha dad pa khyab par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba dag gis 'jig rten na chos can gyi tha snyad du byed kyi don dam par ma yin no //
translated: It is related to the related and the different, and it is related to the non-excluded and the excluded, and in the world it is used as the subject of a proposition, but not ultimately.

original: spyi'i tha snyad kyang rigs mi mthun pa'i ldog pa dngos po la mi brten pa ni ma yin par rgya cher byas so //
analyzed: spyi'i tha snyad kyang rigs mi mthun pa'i ldog pa dngos po la mi brten pa ni ma yin par rgya cher byas so //
translated: And the convention of the universal is not based on the non-entity of the exclusion of the heterogeneous, as has been extensively explained.

original: de dag nyid tha dad kyang nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pas dben pa'i ngo bo can ni gcig tu nges pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid tha dad kyang nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pas dben pa'i ngo bo can ni gcig tu nges pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even though they are different, they are the cause of the cognition that ascertains the one, because they are the nature of the exclusion of the heterogeneous by way of experience.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And thus it is said:

original: gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa //
analyzed: gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa //
translated: The cognition of the one object, etc.

original: don gcig sgrub la kha cig ni //
analyzed: don gcig sgrub la kha cig ni //
translated: Some are established as the one object,

original: tha dad yin yang rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: tha dad yin yang rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Even though they are different, by nature,

original: nges te dbang po la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: nges te dbang po la sogs bzhin //
translated: Like the sense faculties, etc.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: des na spyi'i rnam par rtog pa'i dran pa kho na bzang ba la 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: des na spyi'i rnam par rtog pa'i dran pa kho na bzang ba la 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the memory of the universal is the only good apprehension.

original: der snang ba'i du ba'i rnam pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ni mngon sum kho nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang ba'i du ba'i rnam pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ni mngon sum kho nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the exclusion of the form of smoke that appears there from what is dissimilar is apprehended only by perception.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ni log pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ni log pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: And the exclusion of what is dissimilar is not different from the non-existence of the dissimilar.

original: gang 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For, if it were, then it would be something that is not apprehended by perception.

original: de'i phyir @195a * //🔽ji ltar mthong ba'i du ba la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan las ldog pa ni bdag gis brtags pa yin no zhes rtogs par byed pa po yang nges pa'i dbang gis dran pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: de'i phyir @195a * // ji ltar mthong ba'i du ba la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan las ldog pa ni bdag gis brtags pa yin no zhes rtogs par byed pa po yang nges pa'i dbang gis dran pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: Therefore,🔽the exclusion of other in the particular of smoke that is seen is imagined by me.

original: mngon sum gyi stobs las byung ba nyid ni dngos po'i yul med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi stobs las byung ba nyid ni dngos po'i yul med pa yang yin no //
translated: The conceptual cognition that ascertains this is also of two kinds: that which arises from the power of perception and that which does not have an existent object.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir gang /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang /
translated: [verse 1]

original: spyi ni nyams myong med pas na //
analyzed: spyi ni nyams myong med pas na //
translated: Since the universal is not experienced,

original: dran dang rnam par shes pa 'di //
analyzed: dran dang rnam par shes pa 'di //
translated: this memory and cognition

original: tha dad med par gang brjod na //
analyzed: tha dad med par gang brjod na //
translated: are said to be non-different.

original: nges par dran pa'i nus pa yis //
analyzed: nges par dran pa'i nus pa yis //
translated: It is ascertained by the power of memory

original: mo gsham bu yang yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: mo gsham bu yang yod par 'gyur //
translated: The son of a barren woman would exist.

original: zhes bya ba bshad pa de dag kyang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad pa de dag kyang gsal ba yin no //
translated: The explanations of these are clear.

original: yang na gzhon nu ma len gyis smras pa mngon sum gyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod pas du ba la sogs pa'i spyi ni rjes su dpag pa'i gzung ba kho na ste //
analyzed: yang na gzhon nu ma len gyis smras pa mngon sum gyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod pas du ba la sogs pa'i spyi ni rjes su dpag pa'i gzung ba kho na ste //
translated: Or, as Kumarila says, the object of direct perception is a particular, and the object of inference is a universal. Therefore, the universal of smoke and so on is only apprehended by inference.

original: de la rtags 'dzin pa yang thug pa med par 'gyur te rjes su dpag pa de ni gzhan gyi stobs kyis skye la de yang spyi'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de la rtags 'dzin pa yang thug pa med par 'gyur te rjes su dpag pa de ni gzhan gyi stobs kyis skye la de yang spyi'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Moreover, the apprehension of the reason would be endless, because that inference arises by the power of another, and that is a universal.

original: de rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the object of another inference.

original: de bzhin du gzhan de yang 'ga' zhig gi rtags gcig kyang dus stong phrag gis kyang rtogs par byed pa med na kye ma ci skyes bu'i tshe thung du yis yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan de yang 'ga' zhig gi rtags gcig kyang dus stong phrag gis kyang rtogs par byed pa med na kye ma ci skyes bu'i tshe thung du yis yin nam /
translated: In the same way, if one does not understand even one reason after a thousand years, what can be done with the short life of a human?

original: de skad du //
analyzed: de skad du //
translated: Thus he says:

original: rjes su dpag pa med na ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med na ni //
translated: Without inference,

original: gang gi spyi rtogs med pa dang // rtags ni rnam par bsal ba na //
analyzed: gang gi spyi rtogs med pa dang // rtags ni rnam par bsal ba na //
translated: And when the universal is not understood, and the sign is eliminated,

original: rjes su dpag ba 'jug pa med //🔽spyi ma yin pa'i rtags kyang ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag ba 'jug pa med // spyi ma yin pa'i rtags kyang ni //
translated: Inference does not operate.

original: 'ga' zhig kyang ni mi 'dod na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang ni mi 'dod na //
translated: And no one accepts a sign that is not a universal.

original: rtags ni rtogs pa med pa yi //
analyzed: rtags ni rtogs pa med pa yi //
translated: And a sign that is not understood

original: cung zad yod par bstan du med //
analyzed: cung zad yod par bstan du med //
translated: cannot be taught to exist in the least.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa ni //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa ni //
translated: And that inference

original: gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur na slar //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur na slar //
translated: would be understood by another,

original: de las byung ba'i rtags las ni //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rtags las ni //
translated: and from that, the sign would arise.

original: spyi shes pa dang 'brel pa las //
analyzed: spyi shes pa dang 'brel pa las //
translated: From the connection with the knowledge of the universal,

original: de'i yang rjes su dpag pa nyid //
analyzed: de'i yang rjes su dpag pa nyid //
translated: that would also be inference.

original: rtags las kyang ni yang dag byung //🔽rjes su dpag pa gzhan nyid kyi //
analyzed: rtags las kyang ni yang dag byung // rjes su dpag pa gzhan nyid kyi //
translated: And from the sign, it would arise correctly.🔽If it is considered that inference

original: de bzhin shes par brtag na ni //
analyzed: de bzhin shes par brtag na ni //
translated: is like that,

original: rtags dang rtags can rjes dpag dag / mtha' yas phyir na rtags gcig la //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can rjes dpag dag / mtha' yas phyir na rtags gcig la //
translated: because the sign and the inferential evidence are infinite,

original: dus mi stong phrag mang pos kyang //
analyzed: dus mi stong phrag mang pos kyang //
translated: many thousands of signs

original: rtogs par byed pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa yod ma yin //
translated: would not be able to be understood by one.

original: ces dogs pa la du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs zhes ba la sogs pa smos pa ni 'di snyam du dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: ces dogs pa la du ba dang bcas pa'i phyogs zhes ba la sogs pa smos pa ni 'di snyam du dgos pa yin te /
translated: The passage beginning The position that is associated with smoke is in response to the following doubt.

original: rjes su dpag pa las gzhan gang gis spyi rtogs pa med na ni khyod zer ba'i skyon @195b 'dir 'gyur na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las gzhan gang gis spyi rtogs pa med na ni khyod zer ba'i skyon @195b 'dir 'gyur na /
translated: If there is no way to understand universals other than through inference, then you are correct that we would be at fault.

original: kho bo cag mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pas spyi rtogs te /
analyzed: kho bo cag mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pas spyi rtogs te /
translated: However, we understand universals through conceptual thought that arises from perception, and that is naturally nonerroneous.

original: dper na nor bu'i 'od las nor bu 'khrul pa bzhin du rtags kyi rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid la rten pa'i phyir brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pas mi slu ba yin no ;
analyzed: dper na nor bu'i 'od las nor bu 'khrul pa bzhin du rtags kyi rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid la rten pa'i phyir brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pas mi slu ba yin no ;
translated: For example, just as a jewel is mistaken for the light of a jewel, the conceptual thought of a reason is based on the particular, and so it is nondeceptive because it is indirectly related to the thing.

original: /'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i du ba'i spyi rtags su 'jog pa ni du ba mthong ba la brten nas der nges pa yin no //
analyzed: /'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid kyang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i du ba'i spyi rtags su 'jog pa ni du ba mthong ba la brten nas der nges pa yin no //
translated: The reason based on effect is also posited as a reason that is a universal that appears to conceptual thought, and it is ascertained in that way based on seeing smoke.

original: du ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi du ba ni rtags su gzhag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: du ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi du ba ni rtags su gzhag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to posit smoke that is the intrinsic identity of smoke as the logical reason.

original: de thun mong ma yin pa mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir de'i chas khyab pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de thun mong ma yin pa mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir de'i chas khyab pa mi rigs so //
translated: Because it does not occur in the similar class, it is not reasonable that it be pervaded by that.

original: bsgrub bya sgrub byed brtags pa la /
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub byed brtags pa la /
translated: In the examination of the proof of the probandum,

original: dngos po mthong ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos po mthong ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: because the thing is not seen,🔽and also, “The universal characteristic is the object of inference,”

original: zhes pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba yang gang gsungs pa na /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba yang gang gsungs pa na /
translated: when this is stated,

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag pa kho na'i yul yin no zhes nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su dpag pa kho na'i yul yin no zhes nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: one should not hold that the universal characteristic is only the object of inference.

original: mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / de ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi 'ang yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / de ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi 'ang yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of conceptual cognition that arises after perception, and it is also the object of other conceptual cognitions.

original: 'on kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the universal characteristic is only the object of inference,

original: nges par gzung bas rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par gzung bas rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to refute the object of intrinsic identity, which is ascertained.

original: de la du ba dang lhan cig tu gnas pa ni du ba dang bcas pa'i zhes bya bas phyogs kyi chos kyi don bstan pa nyid rigs pa dang / sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di'i sa bon du ba dang bcas pa mthong ba dang ldan pa mngon sum gyis zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de la du ba dang lhan cig tu gnas pa ni du ba dang bcas pa'i zhes bya bas phyogs kyi chos kyi don bstan pa nyid rigs pa dang / sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di'i sa bon du ba dang bcas pa mthong ba dang ldan pa mngon sum gyis zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: There, the co-existence with smoke is the meaning of the term “possessing smoke.” The word “only” teaches the meaning of the property of the subject. The seed of the proof statement is “the perception of the possession of smoke.”

original: ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What kind of perception?

original: don gzhan gyis dben pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: don gzhan gyis dben pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of being devoid of other objects.

original: don gzhan ni rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan ni rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Other objects are of the same type or of a different type.

original: dben pa ni ma 'brel pa'o zhes 'dir rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dben pa ni ma 'brel pa'o zhes 'dir rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Devoid means not connected.

original: dngos po thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: All things abide in their own nature,

original: rang gi ngo bo la 'dre ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la 'dre ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for them to be mixed up with their own nature.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar thal bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar thal bar 'gyur ro//
translated: If it were otherwise, everything would be connected with everything.

original: 'dis ni dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan bshad pa dang spyir nye bar rtogs pa'i sa bon yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan bshad pa dang spyir nye bar rtogs pa'i sa bon yin te /
translated: This explains the reason for the conceptual thought of negation, and in general it is the seed of apprehension.

original: de skad du //🔽ming don gang ldan phan tshun du //
analyzed: de skad du // ming don gang ldan phan tshun du //
translated: Thus it is said:🔽The seed of this is the mutual

original: tha dad pa 'di sa bon yin //🔽ces bshad do //🔽'di ltar don gzhan las ldog pa ni phan tshun tha dad kyang spyir nye bar mthong bas de dag tha dad pa'i ngo bo @196a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'di sa bon yin // ces bshad do // 'di ltar don gzhan las ldog pa ni phan tshun tha dad kyang spyir nye bar mthong bas de dag tha dad pa'i ngo bo @196a * //
translated: difference of name and referent.

original: mi mngon ba la tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du sgro btags nas rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
analyzed: mi mngon ba la tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du sgro btags nas rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
translated: Thus, the exclusion of other referents is the mutual difference, but in general it is seen as similar. Therefore, conceptual thought arises by superimposing the nature of nondifference on the nature of difference.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni don gzhan las tha dad pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni don gzhan las tha dad pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The so-called uncommon nature is the nature that is different from other referents.

original: ji ltar gzhon nu ma len gyis don gzhan gyis dben pa'i ngo bo dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bzung ba yin gyi mngon sum gyi nges pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsam pa ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhon nu ma len gyis don gzhan gyis dben pa'i ngo bo dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bzung ba yin gyi mngon sum gyi nges pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsam pa ltar ma yin te /
translated: Just as Prince Virūḍhaka thought that the nature that is isolated from other referents is apprehended by the valid knowledge of nonexistence, but it is not ascertained by direct perception.

original: dngos po'i nus pa las byung ba'i mngon sum las gzhan du mthong ba ni mi srid de 'khrul ba thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa las byung ba'i mngon sum las gzhan du mthong ba ni mi srid de 'khrul ba thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible to see anything other than what arises from the power of the object, because error would result.

original: de na bdag nyid mthong ba dang ldan par gyur pa'i skyes bu la de ma thag tu dran pa rtags shes pa skye'o zhes bya bar 'brel to ;
analyzed: de na bdag nyid mthong ba dang ldan par gyur pa'i skyes bu la de ma thag tu dran pa rtags shes pa skye'o zhes bya bar 'brel to ;
translated: Therefore, when a person who has the power of sight sees the smoke, immediately after that, the knowledge of the sign, which is memory, arises.

original: / dran pa ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: / dran pa ni dran pa'o //
translated: Memory is recollection.

original: rtags snang ba'i shes pa ni rtags shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtags snang ba'i shes pa ni rtags shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the sign is the knowledge of the appearance of the sign.

original: 'di mngon sum gyi rjes la byung ba'i rtogs pa la spyi snang bas nges rtags rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: 'di mngon sum gyi rjes la byung ba'i rtogs pa la spyi snang bas nges rtags rnam par 'jog go //
translated: This is the definition of the sign, because it is a conception that arises after perception and appears as a universal.

original: don dam pa yul ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa yul ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object of the ultimate?

original: 'di ltar mthong ba tha dad pa'i yul can zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba tha dad pa'i yul can zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said that it has a different object.

original: gang dang gang du ba la sogs pa mthong ba ni ji ltar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang du ba la sogs pa mthong ba ni ji ltar mthong ba'o //
translated: That which is seen, such as smoke, is as it is seen.

original: de tha dad pa ni don dam par de gzhan las ldog pa'i yul can gyi rtags shes pa gang dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de tha dad pa ni don dam par de gzhan las ldog pa'i yul can gyi rtags shes pa gang dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That is different, in the sense that it is the object of a reason-­cognizing consciousness that is the opposite of that other, and it is the nature of the negation and the affirmation.

original: de ni de skad du /
analyzed: de ni de skad du /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: nges pa'i shes pa rnams ni sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yul med kyang de'i yul du brjod do zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa rnams ni sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yul med kyang de'i yul du brjod do zhes gsungs so ;
translated: “The ascertaining consciousnesses have the effect of eliminating superimpositions. Even though they do not have an object, they are said to have one.”

original: / rtogs par byed pa pos nges pa'i don ni ji ltar mthong ba tha dad pa de'i yul can yin pa de'i phyir dran pa'i ngo bo don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / rtogs par byed pa pos nges pa'i don ni ji ltar mthong ba tha dad pa de'i yul can yin pa de'i phyir dran pa'i ngo bo don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: The ascertaining consciousness of the definitive meaning is the consciousness that sees the difference in the way things are. Therefore, the nature of memory is not ultimate.

original: rnam par rtog pas ji ltar mthong ba'i dngos po las gyur pa tha dad pa la reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas ji ltar mthong ba'i dngos po las gyur pa tha dad pa la reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousness that conceptualizes does not touch the thing that is seen as different.

original: 'o na ni khyed de ltar brjod pa na kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni khyed de ltar brjod pa na kho bo cag gi 'dod pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa kho na ste /
translated: Well then, when you say this, you are simply following what we assert.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo yod pa dang med pa dag gi bdag nyid kho na'i dngos po mthong ba ni dgag pa sgrub pa'i rtogs pa khas blangs pa'i phyir dang mthong ba'i lta ba'i shes pa'i ming yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo yod pa dang med pa dag gi bdag nyid kho na'i dngos po mthong ba ni dgag pa sgrub pa'i rtogs pa khas blangs pa'i phyir dang mthong ba'i lta ba'i shes pa'i ming yin no //
translated: The perception of things that are the nature of the existence and nonexistence of self and other is the understanding of the establishment of negation, because it is accepted, and it is the name of the knowledge of the view of seeing.

original: kho bo cag mngon sum sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa la khyed kyang mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid der snang bar brjod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag mngon sum sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa la khyed kyang mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid der snang bar brjod do //
translated: We say that you also have the appearance of the valid knowledge of perception in the conception that establishes perception.

original: thams cad rigs mthun pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi'i ngo bo mthong bas ma rtogs pa rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rigs mthun pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi'i ngo bo mthong bas ma rtogs pa rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the understanding of what was not understood through seeing the universal nature that is concomitant with all things of the same type.

original: de ni sngar med don shes pa //🔽nges pa gnod pa spangs pa dang // ma nyams rgyu las byung ba ni //
analyzed: de ni sngar med don shes pa // nges pa gnod pa spangs pa dang // ma nyams rgyu las byung ba ni //
translated: That is the knowledge of a previously unknown object.

original: tshad mar 'jig rten yang dag 'dod //
analyzed: tshad mar 'jig rten yang dag 'dod //
translated: The world accepts as valid knowledge🔽That which is ascertained, free from error,🔽Arisen from unimpaired causes.

original: ces bya ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan @196b nyid dang ldan pa dang yod pa'i don dang 'brel par gyur pa dang dbang po rnams yod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan @196b nyid dang ldan pa dang yod pa'i don dang 'brel par gyur pa dang dbang po rnams yod pa'o //
translated: It has the characteristics of valid knowledge, is related to an existent object, and has unimpaired faculties.

original: dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu dngos po med par bshad pa ni tshad ma gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu dngos po med par bshad pa ni tshad ma gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: The result of a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation is explained as a non-existent thing by another valid cognition.

original: dngos po'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum la sogs pa des ni med pa'i cha ma yin la dngos po nyid rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum la sogs pa des ni med pa'i cha ma yin la dngos po nyid rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The direct perception, etc., that is a consciousness having an existent thing as its object does not have a non-existent part, but it is the realization of an existent thing.

original: de ni yod pa'i cha'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yod pa'i cha'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it has an existent thing as its object.

original: de'i phyir dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis de dngos po med pa'i tshad mar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis de dngos po med pa'i tshad mar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that a non-affirming negation is a valid cognition of a non-existent thing by virtue of its generating a conceptual thought that is a negation.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa shes pa bskyed pa nyid kyi dbang po'i mngon sum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa shes pa bskyed pa nyid kyi dbang po'i mngon sum zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as a consciousness that produces a consciousness of form, etc., is called a sense direct perception.

original: de la de lta bu nyid 'ba' zhig ni dran pa'i rtags shes pa zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la de lta bu nyid 'ba' zhig ni dran pa'i rtags shes pa zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
translated: In that regard, it is not reasonable to call a consciousness that has such a form alone a memory inference,

original: sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni spyi ma bzung bas dran pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni spyi ma bzung bas dran pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that it is a memory due to the apprehension of a universal.

original: dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang rtags shes pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang rtags shes pa mi 'dod do //
translated: Also, they do not assert that the sign is known in the case of a negative concept.🔽Why is that? They say that memory itself apprehends the universal and apprehends the part that is nonexistent.

original: 'di ga las she na dran pa nyid des spyi bzung ba la 'dzin pa dang / med pa'i cha 'dzin pa yin no zhes rgyal dpog pa rnams kyis brjod pa'i dogs pa'i gnas skabs mthong nas dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa dpyad pa rtsom pa ni de la de rnams mthong ba la dgag
analyzed: 'di ga las she na dran pa nyid des spyi bzung ba la 'dzin pa dang / med pa'i cha 'dzin pa yin no zhes rgyal dpog pa rnams kyis brjod pa'i dogs pa'i gnas skabs mthong nas dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa dpyad pa rtsom pa ni de la de rnams mthong ba la dgag
translated: Seeing that this is a doubtful case, they begin the analysis of whether a negative concept and an affirmative concept are valid knowledge or not.🔽The first of these concepts is as follows.

original: pa dang sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi dang po gang yin pa 'di ni /🔽snga mar lta ba'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: pa dang sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi dang po gang yin pa 'di ni / snga mar lta ba'i shes pa ni //
translated: The first is the prior

original: thog mar rtog pa med pa yod //
analyzed: thog mar rtog pa med pa yod //
translated: nonconceptual consciousness.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rab tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba dang por bshad pa yul thun mong ma yin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul bstan pa de nyid tshad ma yin gyi dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i rnam par
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rab tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba dang por bshad pa yul thun mong ma yin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul bstan pa de nyid tshad ma yin gyi dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i rnam par
translated: Thus, the first explanation of the nonconceptual engagement is called the uncommon object, which is the teaching of the object of intrinsic identity. It is valid cognition, and it is not conceptual in the sense of negation and affirmation.

original: rtog pa yang ma yin te de nyid la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rigs pa'i phyir dang cig shos la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa yang ma yin te de nyid la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rigs pa'i phyir dang cig shos la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition of valid cognition is logical in that very case, and because it is impossible in the other case.

original: 'di ltar ma rtogs pa'i yul can dang don byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa nyid mthong ba la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rtogs pa'i yul can dang don byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa nyid mthong ba la yod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the definition of valid cognition with an object of non-realization and with an object of establishing the performance of an object is seen to exist in perception.

original: de la dang po zhes bya ba ni sngar med pa'i don gyi rnam par shes pa bshad do //
analyzed: de la dang po zhes bya ba ni sngar med pa'i don gyi rnam par shes pa bshad do //
translated: Therein, first explains the consciousness of a previously non-existent object.

original: yul thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni don byed ba sgrub pa'i yul nyid de /
analyzed: yul thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni don byed ba sgrub pa'i yul nyid de /
translated: The so-called uncommon object is the object of establishing the performance of an object.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis don byed pa sgrub par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis don byed pa sgrub par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is able to establish the performance of an object by intrinsic identity.

original: de la re zhig dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i don gyi yul gyi sa dran pa bstan pa yin te /🔽de la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la re zhig dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i don gyi yul gyi sa dran pa bstan pa yin te / de la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: First, the conception of negation is the memory of the object of a sense perception.

original: thun mong ma yin ba de ltar gyur pa don gzhan @197a * //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin ba de ltar gyur pa don gzhan @197a * //
translated: “ In that case” means that the uncommon object is seen as a nature not related to another object.🔽Therefore, the nature of the existent is seen as a nature not mixed with the nature of the nonexistent.🔽If the nature of the existent is not different from the nature of the nonexistent, then the nature of the existent is the nature of the nonexistent.🔽If the nature of the existent is not different from the nature of the nonexistent, then the nature of the existent is the nature of the nonexistent.

original: dang ma 'brel pa'i ngo bo mthong bas ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo'i nus pa las byung ba mthong ba rtogs par gyur pa de lta na yod pa'i cha las tha dad pa med pa'i cha 'dod pa yang yod pa'i cha'i rang bzhin ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo'i brtags🔽pa na gzhan du ni med pa'i cha de nyid mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dang ma 'brel pa'i ngo bo mthong bas ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo'i nus pa las byung ba mthong ba rtogs par gyur pa de lta na yod pa'i cha las tha dad pa med pa'i cha 'dod pa yang yod pa'i cha'i rang bzhin ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo'i brtags pa na gzhan du ni med pa'i cha de nyid mi 'grub bo //
translated: If the nature of the existent is not different from the nature of the nonexistent, then the nature of the existent is the nature of the nonexistent.🔽If the nature of the existent is not different from the nature of the nonexistent, then the nature of the existent is the nature of the nonexistent.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo med na med pa'i cha yod par gyur pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo med na med pa'i cha yod par gyur pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If the nature of the existent is not different from the nature of the nonexistent, then the nature of the existent is the nature of the nonexistent.🔽If the nature of the existent is not different from the nature of the nonexistent, then the nature of the existent is the nature of the nonexistent.🔽If the nature of the existent is not different from the nature of the nonexistent, then the nature of the existent is the nature of the nonexistent.🔽If the nature of the existent is not different from the nature of the nonexistent, then the nature of the existent is the nature of the nonexistent.

original: 'dres pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs las 'ongs pa cung zad cig kyang byed pa med pa'i chas srid kyang spang bar mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyis na de 'jig pa la 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rigs so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs las 'ongs pa cung zad cig kyang byed pa med pa'i chas srid kyang spang bar mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyis na de 'jig pa la 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rigs so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And for that very reason, it is not possible for the cause of destruction to destroy it.

original: nges 'dres pa'i ngo bo 'jig pa ni rang gi rgyu kho na'i rang bzhin ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo las skyes na mdzes kyi /
analyzed: nges 'dres pa'i ngo bo 'jig pa ni rang gi rgyu kho na'i rang bzhin ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo las skyes na mdzes kyi /
translated: If the nature of a mixture is destroyed, it is more beautiful if it is produced from the unmixed nature of its own cause.

original: ci dka' thub kyi la tu ba'i rigs pa khas len par byed dam /
analyzed: ci dka' thub kyi la tu ba'i rigs pa khas len par byed dam /
translated: Do you accept the reasoning of the ascetic Lāṭa?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin kho na yod pa rnam la gzhan pa'i ngo bo brtag pa'i phyir med pa'i cha ni bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin kho na yod pa rnam la gzhan pa'i ngo bo brtag pa'i phyir med pa'i cha ni bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only the existent has a nature, and the nonexistent does not have a nature that is imagined to be different from that.

original: de yang de ltar mthong nas 'dzin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang de ltar mthong nas 'dzin pa kho na'o //
translated: And that is seen and apprehended in that way.

original: de'i tshe de ltar gyur pa de'i don gang dang gang gis thun mong ma yin par mthong ba'i dngos po ni spyi'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ltar gyur pa de'i don gang dang gang gis thun mong ma yin par mthong ba'i dngos po ni spyi'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: At that time, the thing that is seen as not shared by that which is so is not a universal.

original: de'i ngo bo ma tshang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ma tshang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its nature is not complete.

original: de thun mong ma yin pa de dang des ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni spyi'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag nyid gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de thun mong ma yin pa de dang des ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni spyi'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de dag nyid gsal bar byed do //
translated: The nature of that which is not that uncommon thing is not the general nature.

original: de'i phyir don gzhan las tha dad pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i di gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gzhan las tha dad pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i di gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is not a different nature that is dissimilar from another thing, it is not different from another thing.

original: mngon par brjod pa ni mngon du smras pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa ni mngon du smras pa'o //
translated: The term expression means that which is expressed.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun par rab tu 'jug par mthong ba'i mngon sum gyi stobs kyis dran pa skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun par rab tu 'jug par mthong ba'i mngon sum gyi stobs kyis dran pa skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: The memory arises by the power of perception that sees the operation of the dissimilar characteristics.

original: gang rtags kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i rnam par bcad pa'i yul la yang dran pa yod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rtags kyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i rnam par bcad pa'i yul la yang dran pa yod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that memory exists in regard to the object that is excluded by the power of the reason.

original: yul ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: yul ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the object?

original: de ma yin pa la ldog pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: de ma yin pa la ldog pa'i yul can no //
translated: The object is the exclusion of that which is not that.

original: de'i sgras ni mthong ba'i yul gyi dngos po la snyegs so //
analyzed: de'i sgras ni mthong ba'i yul gyi dngos po la snyegs so //
translated: The word that refers to the thing that is the object of perception.

original: de ma yin pa ni rigs mi mthun pa de ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa ni rigs mi mthun pa de ma yin pa'o //
translated: The non-cow is the dissimilar class, i.e., the non-cow.

original: de las ldog pa ni de ma yin pa las ldog pa'o ;
analyzed: de las ldog pa ni de ma yin pa las ldog pa'o ;
translated: The exclusion of that is the exclusion of the non-cow.

original: / de'i yul gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du ste /
analyzed: / de'i yul gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du ste /
translated: That which is the object of that is just that.

original: ji ltar mthong ba nyid don gzhan dag las tha dad par brtags pa ni rtogs par byed pa pos mngon par zhen nas de skad brjod kyi don dam par yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba nyid don gzhan dag las tha dad par brtags pa ni rtogs par byed pa pos mngon par zhen nas de skad brjod kyi don dam par yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as it is seen, it is imagined to be different from other objects. The one who understands it expresses it in that way, but ultimately there is no object.

original: de tshad ma yin pa ni med pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tshad ma yin pa ni med pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that non-existence is the result of valid cognition.

original: dran pa @197b skyed par byed pas tshad mar mi rigs so //
analyzed: dran pa @197b skyed par byed pas tshad mar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that it is valid cognition because it produces memory.

original: ci'i phyir tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not valid cognition?

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam pa gsal ba la sogs pa rkyen gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i bye brag de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam pa gsal ba la sogs pa rkyen gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i bye brag de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it apprehends the specific characteristics of the clear and so forth that are seen, which depend on other conditions.

original: mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i ma yin te /
translated: It is not the object of conceptual thought, as in I saw it.

original: mthong bar khyad par med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad la rnam par rtog pa skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong bar khyad par med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad la rnam par rtog pa skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because there is no difference in seeing, it follows that a concept would arise with regard to all aspects.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig goms pa la sogs pa'i rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir rnam pa 'dzin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig goms pa la sogs pa'i rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir rnam pa 'dzin par brjod do //
translated: However, it is said that a certain aspect is apprehended because it depends on conditions such as habituation.

original: khyed kyang ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa yin yang /
analyzed: khyed kyang ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa yin yang /
translated: Even though you also apprehend the aspect as it is seen,

original: ci'i phyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa de bsal bar bstan pa'i phyir snga ma lta ba'i shes pa skye ba'i dus su thun mong ma yin la ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo mthong nas thun mong ma yin pa ni don gzhan gyi ngo bor mi 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid brjod pa de bsal bar bstan pa'i phyir snga ma lta ba'i shes pa skye ba'i dus su thun mong ma yin la ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo mthong nas thun mong ma yin pa ni don gzhan gyi ngo bor mi 'gyur ro zhes
translated: why is the definition of valid cognition stated? In order to demonstrate that, it is said that when the seeing consciousness arises, it sees the uncommon, unmixed nature, and the uncommon does not become the nature of another object.

original: mngon par brjod pa ni mngon par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa ni mngon par brtags pa'o //
translated: The term superimposition means imputation.

original: dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni sngon med pa'i don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir sngon med pa'i don rnam par shes pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni sngon med pa'i don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir sngon med pa'i don rnam par shes pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of negation is the consciousness of a non-existent object, because it is the abandonment of a consciousness of a non-existent object.

original: sngar med pa'i don gyi rnam par shes pa tshad ma yin no zhes khyed kyis brjod do //
analyzed: sngar med pa'i don gyi rnam par shes pa tshad ma yin no zhes khyed kyis brjod do //
translated: You say that a consciousness that has a meaning that did not exist previously is a valid cognition.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: A conceptual cognition that is a negation is not a valid cognition in the way that has been explained.

original: de lta na ni sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then an affirming conceptual cognition would be a valid cognition.

original: de sngon med pa'i rnam par shes pa mi srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de sngon med pa'i rnam par shes pa mi srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not impossible for a consciousness to be new.

original: de so sor snang ba'i rjes su byed pa'i spyi'i rnam pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo la dmigs pa ni ma mthong bas ma rtogs pas rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de so sor snang ba'i rjes su byed pa'i spyi'i rnam pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo la dmigs pa ni ma mthong bas ma rtogs pas rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: The aspect of a generality that is in accordance with the individual appearance is not observed to be the object of an uncommon entity that is not realized because it is realized.

original: de gang gis na tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: de gang gis na tshad ma ma yin /
translated: How could it not be a valid cognition?

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: In that way,

original: de las gzhan yang dngos chos ni //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang dngos chos ni //
translated: the statement “A thing and a non-thing are not the objects of operation of a single cognition” and so on,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa 'di dag gzhon nu ma len gyis brjod pa'i dogs pa bsu nas sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshad ma yang bsal ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa 'di dag gzhon nu ma len gyis brjod pa'i dogs pa bsu nas sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshad ma yang bsal ba ni /
translated: having anticipated the doubt expressed by Kumarila, the refutation of an affirming conceptual cognition that is a valid cognition is

original: don byed pa bsgrub pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don byed pa bsgrub pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: stated with “The establishment of a functioning thing.”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la lta ba'i shes pas mthong ba'i phyir dang / de bsgrub pa mthong ba med pa ni don byed pa sgrub pa'i ngo bo rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa med pas sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la lta ba'i shes pas mthong ba'i phyir dang / de bsgrub pa mthong ba med pa ni don byed pa sgrub pa'i ngo bo rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa med pas sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because it is seen by a consciousness that sees its own characteristic, and because the establishment of that is not seen, the conceptual cognition that establishes the nature of the establishment of the object’s function is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te des kyang ma rtogs pa'i spyi rtogs pa yin no zhes brjod pa de lta na yang de'i don byed pa sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i rtog pa ni rab rib can gyi shes pa la sogs pa bshad pa bzhin du sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog🔽pa tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te des kyang ma rtogs pa'i spyi rtogs pa yin no zhes brjod pa de lta na yang de'i don byed pa sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i rtog pa ni rab rib can gyi shes pa la sogs pa bshad pa bzhin du sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Even if one says that a universal that is not realized by that is realized, because it does not establish the object’s function, the conceptual cognition of that is not a valid cognition, just like the cognition of one with cataracts, and so on.

original: de la gzhan yang dngos chos ni //🔽@198a * // rigs la sogs pa gang gang gi //
analyzed: de la gzhan yang dngos chos ni // @198a * // rigs la sogs pa gang gang gi //
translated: Moreover, the object and the phenomenon

original: blo yis nges pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: blo yis nges pa zhes brjod do //
translated: are said to be ascertained by the mind🔽in terms of the class and so on.

original: de las gzhan yang dngos po 'dzin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mngon sum gyi yul nyid ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang dngos po 'dzin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i mngon sum gyi yul nyid ni dngos po'o //
translated: Moreover, the object is the object of nonconceptual direct perception that apprehends things.

original: rigs la sogs pa ni bye brag tu rtogs pa ni blo yis mngon bar zhen par brjod de /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa ni bye brag tu rtogs pa ni blo yis mngon bar zhen par brjod de /
translated: The understanding of the specific, such as the universal, etc., is said to be the mental apprehension of the object.

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas rtogs pas de la tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas rtogs pas de la tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Since that is understood by nonconceptual consciousness, it is a valid cognition.

original: rigs ni don byed pa sgrub pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs ni don byed pa sgrub pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: But the universal is not understood by that, because it does not accomplish the function of the object.

original: skra shad la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du ma rtogs pa rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du ma rtogs pa rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the consciousness of floating hairs, etc., the understanding of the unreal is not a valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don byed pa'i nus pas stong pa'i spyi ni dbang po dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don byed pa'i nus pas stong pa'i spyi ni dbang po dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum srid pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the universal, which is empty of the capacity to perform a function, is not possible as a direct perception, because it is not related to the sense faculties.

original: dang gi sgras ni dran pa nyid dang zhes sngar bshad zin pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni dran pa nyid dang zhes sngar bshad zin pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word “and” includes memory, as explained above.

original: dran pa nyid kyang phyis bshad par bya'o /
analyzed: dran pa nyid kyang phyis bshad par bya'o /
translated: Memory will be explained later.

original: rjes su dpag pa bzhin ces bya ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bzhin ces bya ba'i chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: “Like inference” is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyis don byed pa sgrub pa'i sa phyogs chos can rtogs kyang me don byed pa sgrub pa'i spyi'i rnam pa lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyis don byed pa sgrub pa'i sa phyogs chos can rtogs kyang me don byed pa sgrub pa'i spyi'i rnam pa lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa med do //
translated: Just as perception realizes the subject, the place that accomplishes the function of the object, it does not realize the hidden universal aspect that accomplishes the function of the object, fire.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par rtog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par rtog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
