translated: Because it is not able to conceive it by means of its own characteristics.

original: rtogs par byed pa pos sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa spyi'i rnam pa don byed pa sgrub pa ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa pos sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa spyi'i rnam pa don byed pa sgrub pa ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med do //
translated: The conceiver, the conceptual consciousness, does not realize the unrealized universal aspect that accomplishes the function of the object.

original: de lta ba'i shes pas rtogs pa de'i phyir dran pa zhes bya ba 'dir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ba'i shes pas rtogs pa de'i phyir dran pa zhes bya ba 'dir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because of that, the cognition that realizes it is called memory. Therefore it is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te don byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul kho na la tshad ma yin gyi cig shos la ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las shes she na /
analyzed: gal te don byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul kho na la tshad ma yin gyi cig shos la ma yin no zhes bya ba ga las shes she na /
translated: If it is asked, “How do we know that a valid cognition is only with regard to the object that accomplishes the function and not the other?”

original: gang gi phyir don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu ni phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang / yongs su spangs pa thams cad don du gnyer gyi bya rog dang ta la'i rigs pas ni 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu ni phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang / yongs su spangs pa thams cad don du gnyer gyi bya rog dang ta la'i rigs pas ni 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin te /
translated: Because a person who seeks to accomplish a purpose seeks all that is beneficial and all that is harmful, in order to obtain and to avoid, respectively.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa blo sngon du gtong ba tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin pa zhig yin /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa blo sngon du gtong ba tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin pa zhig yin /
translated: But a crow or a palm tree does not seek anything, because they do not have conceptual thoughts, they do not have prior mental activity, and they are neither valid cognitions nor nonvalid cognitions.

original: tshad ma las ni thams cad du 'jug par byed kyi /
analyzed: tshad ma las ni thams cad du 'jug par byed kyi /
translated: One engages in everything through valid cognition,

original: tshad ma ma yin pas ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pas ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin te /
translated: but not through nonvalid cognition, even in some cases,🔽because deception is possible.

original: slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhes gnyi ga tshol ba yin gyi nyon mongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhes gnyi ga tshol ba yin gyi nyon mongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, both seek a purpose. But the afflictions are not like that.

original: de'i phyir don byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul kho na la tshad mar brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir don byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul kho na la tshad mar brjod de /
translated: Therefore, valid cognition is said to be only with regard to an object that accomplishes a purpose,

original: de'i don byed pa sgrub pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir dang / cig shos ni bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don byed pa sgrub pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir dang / cig shos ni bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the accomplishment of its purpose is a limb of engagement, and the other is the opposite.

original: de ltar ni tshad ma ni mi slu bar byed pa ma 'khrul ba zhes 'jig rten yang @198b brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar ni tshad ma ni mi slu bar byed pa ma 'khrul ba zhes 'jig rten yang @198b brjod do //
translated: Thus, the world also says that valid knowledge is non-deceptive, i.e., non-erroneous.

original: gang don byed pa sgrub pa ma rtogs na de la 'jug pa med pas 'di ga las thob ba yin /
analyzed: gang don byed pa sgrub pa ma rtogs na de la 'jug pa med pas 'di ga las thob ba yin /
translated: If one does not understand the establishment of the object’s function, one will not engage in it, so how can one obtain it?

original: de ji ltar mi slu bar byed pa de rtogs pa sngon du gtong bar byed pas tshad mar brjod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi slu bar byed pa de rtogs pa sngon du gtong bar byed pas tshad mar brjod par 'gyur /
translated: How can it be non-deceptive? Because it is preceded by the understanding of that, it is called valid knowledge.

original: gal te de lta na spyi yang don byed pa sgrub pa nyid des de'i yul la sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na spyi yang don byed pa sgrub pa nyid des de'i yul la sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then a universal also establishes the object’s function, so a conceptual cognition that establishes its object would be valid knowledge.

original: spyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /🔽cung zad cig kyang des bsgrub par bya ba khas ma blangs te /
analyzed: spyis ni zhes bya ba smos te / cung zad cig kyang des bsgrub par bya ba khas ma blangs te /
translated: To respond: A universal does not establish anything at all.

original: tha mi dad pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa 'am gzhan la ni bsal bas bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa 'am gzhan la ni bsal bas bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is not accepted that it establishes anything at all, because it is said to be the characteristic of a non-distinct cognition, or it is imputed to establish the object’s function by the exclusion of another.

original: ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'o//
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'o//
translated: It is the understanding of its own characteristic.

original: gsal ba rtogs pa ni lta ba'i shes pa'i ming yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba rtogs pa ni lta ba'i shes pa'i ming yin no //
translated: The realization of the manifest is the name of the knowledge of the view.

original: 'og tu ni dus phyis de'i mthu las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa can gyi /🔽rnam par shes pa'i bzung ba yin pas so //
analyzed: 'og tu ni dus phyis de'i mthu las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa can gyi / rnam par shes pa'i bzung ba yin pas so //
translated: Later on, it is the object of the conceptual consciousness that arises from the power of that.

original: de'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i sgra ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Because of that, the word “that” is connected with the realization of the intrinsic nature.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis brjod pa ni ji skad du brjod pas mthong ba'i rjes la rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid do zhes bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis brjod pa ni ji skad du brjod pas mthong ba'i rjes la rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid do zhes bsal ba yin te /
translated: The statement by another person, “The other thing, etc.,” is a refutation of the claim that conceptual thought after seeing, as expressed, is a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: phyis ni thams cad du cung zad cig kyang don byed par nye ba btags pa med do //
analyzed: phyis ni thams cad du cung zad cig kyang don byed par nye ba btags pa med do //
translated: Later on, there is no designation of any function whatsoever in all cases.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i spyi ni rgyu 'am khyab par byed pa dang ; rtags 'brel pa nges pa'i sgo nas don byed pa sgrub pa'i yul ma rtogs pa'i don byed pa rtogs pa'i phyir de'i yul tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i spyi ni rgyu 'am khyab par byed pa dang ; rtags 'brel pa nges pa'i sgo nas don byed pa sgrub pa'i yul ma rtogs pa'i don byed pa rtogs pa'i phyir de'i yul tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: The universal that is the object of an inferential concept is a valid cognition with regard to its object, because it proves the existence of a functioning thing by means of a reason that is related to the cause or the pervader, and because it realizes the functioning thing that was not previously realized.

original: 'di ni de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir don byed pa sgrub par byed pa ni lta ba'i shes pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir don byed pa sgrub par byed pa ni lta ba'i shes pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: But the view that a functioning thing is established by a view consciousness is not like that, because it does not realize that.

original: 'dir dpe ni /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni /
translated: Here is an example:

original: dper na sngon po mthong ba na sngon po'o snyam du shes pa snang bzhin te zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dper na sngon po mthong ba na sngon po'o snyam du shes pa snang bzhin te zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: When one sees blue, the consciousness that thinks blue is as if it were an appearance.

original: spyi ni cung zad cig kyang don byed par nye bar brtag par mi bya'o zhes rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: spyi ni cung zad cig kyang don byed par nye bar brtag par mi bya'o zhes rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The universal does not at all function to examine the real.

original: 'o na 'di rtags kyi rnam pa la snang ba'i spyi'i gnas skabs su de la dpe gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di rtags kyi rnam pa la snang ba'i spyi'i gnas skabs su de la dpe gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Well, if the universal that appears in the aspect of the reason is the object of the view, what is the use of another example?

original: mthong ba thams cad kyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang mtshungs par gzhan gyis khas blangs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba thams cad kyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang mtshungs par gzhan gyis khas blangs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the conceptual thought that arises after seeing is like the valid cognition of direct perception, because it is accepted by others.

original: gal te sngon po yin no zhes mthong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las snang ba'i spyi don byed par cis na brtag par mi bya /
analyzed: gal te sngon po yin no zhes mthong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las snang ba'i spyi don byed par cis na brtag par mi bya /
translated: Why is it not imagined that the universal that appears from the conceptual thought that arises after seeing “it is blue” performs a function?

original: gsal ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don de yang don gzhan @199a * //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don de yang don gzhan @199a * //
translated: And that object to be established, the particular, is not imagined to perform a function for another object,

original: gyis de'i don byed pa brtag par mi bya ba'i phyir de yang don byed pa sgrub pa med pas na dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyis de'i don byed pa brtag par mi bya ba'i phyir de yang don byed pa sgrub pa med pas na dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is not established as a performer of a function. Therefore it follows that it is a nonthing.

original: 'o na te tha mi dad pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang brjod pa'i rang bzhin bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa yin pas ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na te tha mi dad pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang brjod pa'i rang bzhin bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa yin pas ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But if it is established as the nature of a consciousness that is not different and as the nature of an expression, it is not established,

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: because it is the cause of its own object to be established.

original: de nyid ces bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba smos te //
translated: “That itself” is stated.

original: lta ba'i shes pas nye bar dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni //
analyzed: lta ba'i shes pas nye bar dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni //
translated: That which is observed by the cognition of seeing is

original: sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni sngon po'i gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni sngon po'i gsal ba'o //
translated: the particular characteristic of blue, which is the manifestation of blue.

original: rnam pa de lta bus bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bus bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa yin te /
translated: It is the object to be established by that kind of cognition, because

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sgras ni spyi tsam du mngon par 'dod pa ni 'dra ba nyid ming gi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir thun mong ba'i ngo bo 'di yang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sgras ni spyi tsam du mngon par 'dod pa ni 'dra ba nyid ming gi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir thun mong ba'i ngo bo 'di yang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the word “that kind” is asserted to be merely a universal, and this common nature is also similar because it is a synonym for similarity.

original: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i bsgrub par bya ba ni sngon po'i spyi bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad pa'i shes par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid don gyi bya ba byed par nus pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'di yin no zhes de bzhin du bshad do
analyzed: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i bsgrub par bya ba ni sngon po'i spyi bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad pa'i shes par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid don gyi bya ba byed par nus pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'di yin no zhes de bzhin du bshad do
translated: Therefore, the object to be established by that kind is the universal of blue, which is the object to be established. The ability to perform the function of the object characterized by the definition of cognition is its particular characteristic. Thus it is explained.

original: // 'di snyam du dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: // 'di snyam du dgongs pa yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba tha dad pa yang 'ga' zhig dang nye bar gyur pa las dang 'bras bu gcig tu nges pa'i mtshan nyid du mtshungs pa gcig tha mi dad pa byed pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba tha dad pa yang 'ga' zhig dang nye bar gyur pa las dang 'bras bu gcig tu nges pa'i mtshan nyid du mtshungs pa gcig tha mi dad pa byed pas na /
translated: Thus, the difference of the manifestation is the same as the similarity of the definition of the one effect from the one cause.

original: de las gzhan pa'i spyi dang ldan pa med de /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i spyi dang ldan pa med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no other universal than that.

original: de lta ma yin na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de ltar na tha mi dad pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi don bya ba sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na tha mi dad pa'i shes pa dang brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi don bya ba sgrub par byed do //
translated: Thus, the activity of the object is accomplished by the cognition and expression that are not different.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma med pa dang tshad mas gnod pa'i spyi yang khas blangs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma med pa dang tshad mas gnod pa'i spyi yang khas blangs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of accepting a universal that is not a valid cognition and is contradicted by valid cognition?

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la ji lta ba'i rnam pa 'di mi gsal ba'i ngo bo snang ba la de lta bu'i rnam pa gsal ba mthong ba rnams la de nye bar mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa la ji lta ba'i rnam pa 'di mi gsal ba'i ngo bo snang ba la de lta bu'i rnam pa gsal ba mthong ba rnams la de nye bar mi rtogs so //
translated: Thus, in the cognition of inference, etc., the form that appears in that way is not clearly manifest. Those who see the clearly manifest form in that way do not understand it.

original: gsal ba gcig kho na mthong ba'i dus su sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo gsal bar snang ba na de ji ltar mthong ba med par brtags nas bdag nyid la bdag nyid slu bar byed dam /
analyzed: gsal ba gcig kho na mthong ba'i dus su sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo gsal bar snang ba na de ji ltar mthong ba med par brtags nas bdag nyid la bdag nyid slu bar byed dam /
translated: When one sees only a single clarity, if the entity of blue, etc., appears clearly, then how could one, having imagined that it is not seen, deceive oneself?

original: gal te gsal ba'i ngo bo dang 'dres pas 'di lcags kyi gong bu'i me bzhin du snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i ngo bo dang 'dres pas 'di lcags kyi gong bu'i me bzhin du snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it appears like the fire of an iron ball, because it is mixed with the entity of clarity,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: thams cad du tha dad pa dang // tha mi dad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad du tha dad pa dang // tha mi dad pa'i rnam par gzhag pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because it would follow that there would be no presentation of difference or non-difference in any case.

original: 'di'i lan ni gzhan du yang rnyed par sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni gzhan du yang rnyed par sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reply to that is easily found elsewhere.

original: @199b spyi'i ngo bo la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba rnam pa gnyis ni med de /
analyzed: @199b spyi'i ngo bo la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba rnam pa gnyis ni med de /
translated: In general, there is no such thing as clarity or unclarity, because

original: gang gi gcig ni mthong ba'i rnam pa dang / gzhan rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i don gnyis su khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi gcig ni mthong ba'i rnam pa dang / gzhan rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'i don gnyis su khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: it would follow that one would have to accept that the object of a cognition that is a form of seeing is different from the object of a cognition that is inferential, etc.

original: so sor snang ba tha dad pa nyid thams cad du dngos po tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor snang ba tha dad pa nyid thams cad du dngos po tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason for positing the difference of entities in all cases is the difference of individual appearances.

original: spyi la spyi gzhan yod par thal bar 'gyur ba spyi gzhan med par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi la spyi gzhan yod par thal bar 'gyur ba spyi gzhan med par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that a universal would have another universal, and you accept that there is no other universal.🔽This also refutes the following statement:🔽The cognition that has the nature of

original: 'dis ni / dngos rnams kun la ldog pa dang // rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid blo //
analyzed: 'dis ni / dngos rnams kun la ldog pa dang // rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid blo //
translated: the exclusion and the inclusion of all things

original: skye ba'i bdag nyid gnyis med na //
analyzed: skye ba'i bdag nyid gnyis med na //
translated: Does not have a dual nature of arising.🔽That is also illogical.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: And also:🔽The error and the designation

original: / gang rung 'dir ni 'khrul pa dang // nye bar btags par mi 'dod do //🔽thams cad dus su blo brten phyir //
analyzed: / gang rung 'dir ni 'khrul pa dang // nye bar btags par mi 'dod do // thams cad dus su blo brten phyir //
translated: are not accepted in any way here.🔽And also:🔽The error that is said to be

original: 'khrul par brjod pa de 'khrul pa //🔽zhes bya ba gang smras pa de dag kyang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul par brjod pa de 'khrul pa // zhes bya ba gang smras pa de dag kyang bsal ba yin no //
translated: the error of the cognition that is always present.

original: gal te gang gi phyir dbang po'i blor mngon par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang gi phyir dbang po'i blor mngon par brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If you assert that the cognition of the senses is the object of the desire to speak, then it is not established.

original: sngon po la sogs pa mi gsal ba'i rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba'i rnam pa de la nye bar mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa mi gsal ba'i rnam pa sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba'i rnam pa de la nye bar mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspect of blue, etc., that is not clear does not clearly conceive the aspect of blue, etc., that is clear.

original: gsal ba yang gnyis pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang de yod na 'gyur na gsal ba gnyis kyi bar du ma khyab pa dang ldan pa de ji ltar de'i rjes su 'gro ba yin /
analyzed: gsal ba yang gnyis pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang de yod na 'gyur na gsal ba gnyis kyi bar du ma khyab pa dang ldan pa de ji ltar de'i rjes su 'gro ba yin /
translated: And if the clear is concomitant with the second, and if it exists when that exists, then how could the clear that is not pervaded by the two be concomitant with that?

original: yang na khyab par nye bar dmigs par 'gyur na de ni de la rtogs pa med pa ga la yin /
analyzed: yang na khyab par nye bar dmigs par 'gyur na de ni de la rtogs pa med pa ga la yin /
translated: Or, if it is perceived as pervaded, then how could it not be realized in that?

original: gsal ba mi gsal ba'i ngo bor mi srid de gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba mi gsal ba'i ngo bor mi srid de gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible that the clear is the nature of the unclear, because they are one.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gal te rigs ni kun la yod //
analyzed: gal te rigs ni kun la yod //
translated: If the type exists in all,

original: gcig de gsal bas gsal ba nyid //
analyzed: gcig de gsal bas gsal ba nyid //
translated: then the one is clear because of the clear.

original: tha dad med phyir kun la mthong //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir kun la mthong //
translated: Since there is no difference, it is seen in all.

original: de yang gsal ba la ltos min //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang gsal ba la ltos min //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
translated: And that is not dependent on the clear.

original: gsal ba gcig la nye bar dmigs par gyur na yang 'jig rten na gsum po ma lus pa khyab pa'i ngo bo 'am ma lus pa'i rten la khyab pa mthong bar 'gyur na //
analyzed: gsal ba gcig la nye bar dmigs par gyur na yang 'jig rten na gsum po ma lus pa khyab pa'i ngo bo 'am ma lus pa'i rten la khyab pa mthong bar 'gyur na //
translated: But when one observes a single entity, one sees the nature of the totality of the world, or the totality of the support, as pervaded by that entity.

original: gang la cung zad gcig kyang skad cig ma la sogs pa bzhin du mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang la cung zad gcig kyang skad cig ma la sogs pa bzhin du mthong ba dang ma mthong ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that one sees a part of it, such as an instant, and does not see the rest.

original: gal te mthong ba yang rten gcig la mthong bar mthong bar zhen gyi thams cad la ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba yang rten gcig la mthong bar mthong bar zhen gyi thams cad la ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that one sees the support as seen in one part, but not as seen in all parts,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rnam par rtog pas de mthong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas de mthong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that it is seen by conceptual thought.

original: nges pas yul du byas pa ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs te /🔽des na thams cad @200a * //
analyzed: nges pas yul du byas pa ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs te / des na thams cad @200a * //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the object of a determinate awareness is not determined.

original: du song ba'i ngo bo mthong na don thams cad mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du song ba'i ngo bo mthong na don thams cad mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one sees the nature of the totality, it follows that one sees all objects.

original: de ni mthong ba de dang lhan cig nye bar dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba de dang lhan cig nye bar dmigs pa'am /
translated: If one sees that, one observes it together with that.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa rang bzhin nye bar mi dmigs pa rigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa rang bzhin nye bar mi dmigs pa rigs pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not logical that the nature of the object is not perceived,

original: de ji ltar dbang po'i blo yis gnyis kyi bdag nyid yin ;
analyzed: de ji ltar dbang po'i blo yis gnyis kyi bdag nyid yin ;
translated: how could the nature of the object be the nature of the two, the object and the cognition?

original: yang na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i blo'i yin na /
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i blo'i yin na /
translated: If it is the cognition of inference and so on,

original: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba med pas gang las gnyis kyi bar du 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba med pas gang las gnyis kyi bar du 'gyur /
translated: then since it does not appear to have its own characteristics, how could it be the nature of the two?

original: de rnams kyi spyi 'dzin pa rnams la gsal ba lta bu'i mtshan nyid gsal ba ni med de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi spyi 'dzin pa rnams la gsal ba lta bu'i mtshan nyid gsal ba ni med de /
translated: The cognition of the universals of those does not have the characteristic of clarity, as it appears to be.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la snang ba de med kyang de srid pa'i phyir dang ; rnam pa gzhan rang gi shes pa la so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la snang ba de med kyang de srid pa'i phyir dang ; rnam pa gzhan rang gi shes pa la so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it does not appear to have its own characteristics, it is possible, because the other aspect appears individually to its own cognition.

original: gcig la rnam pa du ma mi rigs pas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la rnam pa du ma mi rigs pas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical that one thing has many aspects, because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i don gyi gzung bar bya ba 'di tha mi dad pa'i spyi'i blo la so sor snang ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i don gyi gzung bar bya ba 'di tha mi dad pa'i spyi'i blo la so sor snang ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the object of a different object that is apprehended is not individually apparent to the cognition of a nondifferent universal, because it does not appear to have its own characteristics.

original: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa goms ba'i bag chags las skye ba yod pa de bzhin du snang ba'i phyir dang / brten pa'i phyir blo ni 'jig pa med par 'gyur na skad cig mar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa goms ba'i bag chags las skye ba yod pa de bzhin du snang ba'i phyir dang / brten pa'i phyir blo ni 'jig pa med par 'gyur na skad cig mar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, because of the appearance of the arising of the mind from the latent potentialities of the habitual tendencies of the false conceptual thoughts of beginningless error, and because of the support, the mind is not destroyed.

original: 'on kyang gnod pa med pa nyid de yang 'di mi srid de gnod par byed pa'i cha tsam bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod pa med pa nyid de yang 'di mi srid de gnod par byed pa'i cha tsam bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is not possible that it is not impaired, because the part that impairs it has been explained.

original: rgyas pa yang yod pa 'jig pa ji lta ba'i gnas skabs 'di nyid de dang der bshad pa'i gnod par byed pa nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa yang yod pa 'jig pa ji lta ba'i gnas skabs 'di nyid de dang der bshad pa'i gnod par byed pa nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: And the extensive explanation of this is just the occasion of the destruction of what exists, and the impairment that is explained there should be ascertained.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar gsal ba la spyi gzhan med kyang gcig pa byed pa de lta na tha mi dad pa'i shes pa brjod la 'jug par yang byed pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar gsal ba la spyi gzhan med kyang gcig pa byed pa de lta na tha mi dad pa'i shes pa brjod la 'jug par yang byed pa'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, just as a universal does not exist as another in the manifestation, but is the maker of the one, in the same way, because it engages the expression of the consciousness that is not different,

original: de nyid sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid dag spyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid dag spyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that the universal is established by the specific characteristics of blue, and that it performs a function.🔽And also:

original: gang yang / gal te spyi gzhan mi 'dod na //
analyzed: gang yang / gal te spyi gzhan mi 'dod na //
translated: If you do not accept that the universal is different,

original: de yi 'jug pa nges pa can //
analyzed: de yi 'jug pa nges pa can //
translated: then its application would be restricted.

original: ba lang nyid kyang med na ni //
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyang med na ni //
translated: If the universal cow did not exist,

original: ci phyir ba lang blor mi nges //
analyzed: ci phyir ba lang blor mi nges //
translated: why is the cognition of cow not ascertained?

original: ji ltar tha dad nyid mtshungs kyang //
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad nyid mtshungs kyang //
translated: Although it is the same in terms of being different,

original: ldog rnams 'ga' la 'jug ba ni //🔽ba lang nyid sogs rgyu mtshan ni //
analyzed: ldog rnams 'ga' la 'jug ba ni // ba lang nyid sogs rgyu mtshan ni //
translated: the reversals are applied to some.🔽Even though there is no reason such as the universal cow,

original: med kyang de bzhin blo 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: med kyang de bzhin blo 'byung 'gyur //
translated: the cognition arises in that way.

original: zhes bya ba phyogs snga mar byas nas /🔽yul med na ni blo rnams ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba phyogs snga mar byas nas / yul med na ni blo rnams ni //
translated: Having made this the opponent’s position,🔽since you assert that cognitions do not arise

original: skye ba med par 'dod pa yis //🔽gzhan las bye brag 'dod pa na //
analyzed: skye ba med par 'dod pa yis // gzhan las bye brag 'dod pa na //
translated: in the absence of an object,

original: des na spyi de nges pa yin //
analyzed: des na spyi de nges pa yin //
translated: then that universal is ascertained.

original: @200b des na de med skye na ni //
analyzed: @200b des na de med skye na ni //
translated: Therefore, if it arises in the absence of that,

original: yul med phyin ci log tu 'gyur //
analyzed: yul med phyin ci log tu 'gyur //
translated: it would be a mistaken cognition without an object.

original: gzhan med na ni mi 'gag na //
analyzed: gzhan med na ni mi 'gag na //
translated: If it does not cease in the absence of another,

original: spyi 'di la ni nyes pa med //
analyzed: spyi 'di la ni nyes pa med //
translated: then this universal is not faulty.

original: ces bya ba gang yang phyin ci log pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon brjod pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzhung lugs kyi rigs pa dri ma med pa'i blo la gnod pa med do ;
analyzed: ces bya ba gang yang phyin ci log pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon brjod pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzhung lugs kyi rigs pa dri ma med pa'i blo la gnod pa med do ;
translated: This is the objection that is advanced against the theory of error. But it does not invalidate the stainless reasoning of the scriptures of the Tathāgata.

original: / spyi'i blo rnams ni gnod pa byed pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyin ci log tu khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / spyi'i blo rnams ni gnod pa byed pa'i rkyen gyi mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyin ci log tu khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in general, the mind is accepted as erroneous because it is endowed with the characteristics of a condition that is invalid.

original: ci phyir nog sogs ldan rnams la //
analyzed: ci phyir nog sogs ldan rnams la //
translated: Why is it that those who possess a hump and so on are called oxen?

original: ba lang gang phyir de bdag nyid //
analyzed: ba lang gang phyir de bdag nyid //
translated: Because they are of that nature.

original: ci phyir 'di de'i bdag ce na //
analyzed: ci phyir 'di de'i bdag ce na //
translated: Why is this of that nature?

original: rang bzhin yin zhes go bar bya //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin zhes go bar bya //
translated: It is understood to be the intrinsic nature.

original: zhes bya ba smos pa ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa ni //
translated: This is what is said.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin thun mong ma yin ba gsal ba skye ba dang 'jig pa dag gi spyi skye ba med pa dang ldan pa mi rigs te 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan par tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin thun mong ma yin ba gsal ba skye ba dang 'jig pa dag gi spyi skye ba med pa dang ldan pa mi rigs te 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan par tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that the intrinsic nature of the manifest, which is not common, should possess the generality of origination and destruction, which are not originated, because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be endowed with contradictory properties and would be different.

original: gal te de yis bdag nyid 'dod //
analyzed: gal te de yis bdag nyid 'dod //
translated: If you accept that it is of that nature,

original: gsal ba'i skye dang skye med dang // 'jig dang 'jig med ci ste 'dod //
analyzed: gsal ba'i skye dang skye med dang // 'jig dang 'jig med ci ste 'dod //
translated: And that there is destruction of the manifest, and no destruction of the unmanifest?

original: de bzhin rjes 'gro med ces min //
analyzed: de bzhin rjes 'gro med ces min //
translated: It is not that there is no concomitance with that.

original: gsal ba'i skye bas mi skye grang //
analyzed: gsal ba'i skye bas mi skye grang //
translated: Is it that the production of the manifest does not produce?

original: rten gzhan las ni 'ong med pa //
analyzed: rten gzhan las ni 'ong med pa //
translated: It does not come from another basis.

original: de yi yul na sngar yod min //
analyzed: de yi yul na sngar yod min //
translated: It does not exist previously in its object.

original: de yis ji ltar 'brel pa yin //
analyzed: de yis ji ltar 'brel pa yin //
translated: How could it be related to that?

original: gal te gsal 'jig mi 'jig na //
analyzed: gal te gsal 'jig mi 'jig na //
translated: If the manifest is not destroyed when destroyed,

original: gsal ba gzhan la med 'gro ba //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan la med 'gro ba //
translated: The manifest would go to another.

original: des stong yul la gnas pa med //
analyzed: des stong yul la gnas pa med //
translated: It would not abide in the object empty of that.

original: rigs de gang la yod pa smos //
analyzed: rigs de gang la yod pa smos //
translated: Say what kind it would be!🔽If you do not assert that the production of the manifest

original: gal te gsal ba'i skye ba dang // rigs de 'brel par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i skye ba dang // rigs de 'brel par mi 'dod na /
translated: Is related to that kind,🔽How could you assert that it has that nature

original: ma bslad pa yi blo can la //🔽de yi bdag nyid ji ltar 'dod //
analyzed: ma bslad pa yi blo can la // de yi bdag nyid ji ltar 'dod //
translated: In the mind of one uncontaminated by error?

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na spyi'i don gyi bya ba byed bar de nyid des rtogs na rnam par rtog pa tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na spyi'i don gyi bya ba byed bar de nyid des rtogs na rnam par rtog pa tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: If the mere intrinsic identity of blue, etc. performs the referential function of the universal, and it is just that which is realized by that, then conceptual cognition would be valid knowledge.

original: de'i sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de'i sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos te //
translated: In response to that, he says, “The intrinsic identity of blue, etc.”

original: bdag nyid des sngon po'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba byed par rang bzhin mthong ba nyid lta ba'i shes pa zhes ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid des sngon po'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba byed par rang bzhin mthong ba nyid lta ba'i shes pa zhes ba'o //
translated: The self-nature of that is seen to be the nature of the object to be accomplished, blue, and is called the knowledge of seeing.

original: de'i phyir bya ba grub pa las khyab par mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba grub pa las khyab par mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, how can the knowledge of conceptualization, which does not pervade from the accomplishment of the object, be valid cognition?

original: 'on te spyi nyid de ltar lhag par rtogs pa'i sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshad ma yod do //
analyzed: 'on te spyi nyid de ltar lhag par rtogs pa'i sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshad ma yod do //
translated: But if the universal itself is thus realized in excess, there is the valid knowledge of the conceptualization of blue.

original: spyi don med pa'i bya ba byed pa ni ma yin te sngon po bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa'i sngon po dang lhan cig tu byung nas byed par 'gyur ba'i @201a * //
analyzed: spyi don med pa'i bya ba byed pa ni ma yin te sngon po bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa'i sngon po dang lhan cig tu byung nas byed par 'gyur ba'i @201a * //
translated: The universal does not perform the function of the object that is nonexistent, but having arisen together with the blue that performs the function of the object to be accomplished, blue, it performs the function.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid spyi yin par 'dod do zhe na //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid spyi yin par 'dod do zhe na //
translated: The nature of the manifest itself is asserted to be the universal.

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid bzung ba'i dus byis byung ba'i sngon bo zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid bzung ba'i dus byis byung ba'i sngon bo zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: When its own characteristic is apprehended, the blue that arises later

original: gsal ba'i dus phyis byung bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dus phyis byung bar nus pa'o //
translated: is able to arise after the time of the manifest.

original: gal te rtags bzung ba'i dus phyis byung ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam pa gsal ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba byed pa ni spyi'i rnam par rtog pas gzhag par nus pa yin no snyam nas //
analyzed: gal te rtags bzung ba'i dus phyis byung ba ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam pa gsal ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba byed pa ni spyi'i rnam par rtog pas gzhag par nus pa yin no snyam nas //
translated: If it is thought that the object of the action of the probandum, which occurs after the time of the apprehension of the reason, is able to be posited by a conception of a universal,

original: sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi sngon po'i spyis sngon po'i don gyis bsgrub par bya ba byed pa gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi sngon po'i spyis sngon po'i don gyis bsgrub par bya ba byed pa gtso bo la sogs pa byed pa yin no //
translated: then the object of the conception of blue would be the universal of blue, and the object of the conception of blue would perform the action of the probandum, such as being the principal cause.

original: de gsal ba ni rang bzhin du rung bar gyur pa la rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsal ba ni rang bzhin du rung bar gyur pa la rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that would be clear, because it is impossible for the nature of a conception to be suitable as the nature of a permanent thing.

original: rtag pa'i rang bzhin de 'dzin pa ni sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyis ni sngon po'i bsgrub par bya ba 'am gzhan pa'i don bya ba mi byed de //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rang bzhin de 'dzin pa ni sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyis ni sngon po'i bsgrub par bya ba 'am gzhan pa'i don bya ba mi byed de //
translated: The apprehension of that permanent nature is not the object of the conception of blue, nor does it perform the action of the probandum, nor does it perform the action of another object.

original: rim dang / cig car la sogs pas 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam mo //
analyzed: rim dang / cig car la sogs pas 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam mo //
translated: This is because it is contradictory in terms of sequence, simultaneity, and so on.

original: de ltar sngon po de mthong ba na sngon po'o zhes shes pa la so sor snang ba'i spyi ni cung zad cig kyang don byed par nye bar btags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngon po de mthong ba na sngon po'o zhes shes pa la so sor snang ba'i spyi ni cung zad cig kyang don byed par nye bar btags par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, when blue is seen, the universal that appears distinctly to the consciousness that thinks “blue” should not be imputed to perform a function in the slightest.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa med pa'i yul yin na yang mngon sum gyis rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog ba tshad mar thal bar 'gyur na ni ha cang khyab ches so snyam nas ;
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa med pa'i yul yin na yang mngon sum gyis rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog ba tshad mar thal bar 'gyur na ni ha cang khyab ches so snyam nas ;
translated: If it were the case that a direct perception could be valid knowledge even though its object does not perform a function, then it would follow, absurdly, that the conceptual consciousness that arises after a direct perception would also be valid knowledge.🔽Thinking that this is too broad,

original: de la snga na med pa'i don gyi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dpyod pa bas khyad par can nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la snga na med pa'i don gyi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dpyod pa bas khyad par can nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: the author of the Nyāyabinduh presents the following definition of valid knowledge in order to show that it is a consciousness that is new with regard to its object:

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar don byed pa med pa sgrub pa'i yul gyis ni mthong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar don byed pa med pa sgrub pa'i yul gyis ni mthong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar mi rigs so //
translated: because it is not correct that a conceptual consciousness that arises after seeing can be valid knowledge with regard to an object that does not perform a function,

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag 'dod pa'i tshad ma mi slu ba can shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bsal nas ma rtogs pa'i don gyi yul can ni tshad ma ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag 'dod pa'i tshad ma mi slu ba can shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bsal nas ma rtogs pa'i don gyi yul can ni tshad ma ste /
translated: Therefore, having eliminated the definition of valid knowledge called “non-deceptive consciousness” that we assert, the object of a non-cognizing subject is valid knowledge.

original: de la snga na med pa'i don rnam par shes pa yin no zhes 'dir yang bdag gis kyang bya snyam nas tshad ma'i mtshan nyid gzhan byed pa ha cang khyab ches pas de yongs su spangs nas khyad par gyi khyad par can du nye bar bstan pa ste
analyzed: de la snga na med pa'i don rnam par shes pa yin no zhes 'dir yang bdag gis kyang bya snyam nas tshad ma'i mtshan nyid gzhan byed pa ha cang khyab ches pas de yongs su spangs nas khyad par gyi khyad par can du nye bar bstan pa ste
translated: Thinking that here too I will say that consciousness is the object that did not exist before, he formulates another definition of valid knowledge. Since that is too broad, having completely abandoned that, he teaches a special definition.

original: / khyad par ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: / khyad par ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it special?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba khyad par la 'dis rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar grub la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba khyad par la 'dis rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar grub la /
translated: It is the non-cognizing of its own characteristics. He says that even conceptual thought that infers through this is established as valid knowledge.

original: lta ba'i @201b shes pa'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin pa bsal ba yin no zhes bya bar thams cad legs par gnas so //
analyzed: lta ba'i @201b shes pa'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin pa bsal ba yin no zhes bya bar thams cad legs par gnas so //
translated: He says that conceptual thought that arises after the view is eliminated as valid knowledge. All of this is well stated.

original: de lta na sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa don bya ba med pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul gyis spyi ma rtogs pa rtogs pa'i tshad ma yang bsal to //
analyzed: de lta na sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa don bya ba med pa sgrub par byed pa'i yul gyis spyi ma rtogs pa rtogs pa'i tshad ma yang bsal to //
translated: In that case, the valid cognition that comprehends the object of comprehension, the non-existent object of activity of the conceptual cognition of establishment, is also refuted.

original: rang gi tshig ni bsdus pa yin te dran pa nyid dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa thun mong pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: rang gi tshig ni bsdus pa yin te dran pa nyid dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa thun mong pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The words are abbreviated. The reason that the common conceptual cognition that is the negation of memory is not a valid cognition is

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: stated as “having comprehended its own characteristic.”

original: lta ba'i shes pa de'i mthu las skyes pa can rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i stobs kyis byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni de'i rjes las dngos su skyes pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i 'du byed pas 'phangs pa'i dbang gis sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa ni snang ba dang /
analyzed: lta ba'i shes pa de'i mthu las skyes pa can rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i stobs kyis byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni de'i rjes las dngos su skyes pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i 'du byed pas 'phangs pa'i dbang gis sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa ni snang ba dang /
translated: The conceptual cognition that arises from the power of that seeing consciousness, which arises from the power of comprehending its own characteristic, is not directly produced from that, and due to the projection of the formative forces of seeing, it conforms to the unclear aspect of the own characteristic of blue, and

original: brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byed par brjod do //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byed par brjod do //
translated: it is said to unify the appearance and the object of investigation.

original: dngos po yod pa'i cung zad cig kyang 'di nyid rjes su byed pa med pa de ni dran pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'i cung zad cig kyang 'di nyid rjes su byed pa med pa de ni dran pa kho na'o //
translated: It is memory alone, which does not have the slightest thing that is a real entity as its object.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po'i yul gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i yul gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a real entity, because it is the result of a real entity as its object.

original: skyes bu rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa 'di'i 'bras bu ste der mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa 'di'i 'bras bu ste der mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: It is the result of the engagement of a person in his own characteristics, because it is attached to that.

original: gang gi phyir de'i yul can gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dran pa kho na yin pa de bas na mthong ba'i stobs las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i yul can gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dran pa kho na yin pa de bas na mthong ba'i stobs las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Since it is the result of the subject of that, it is memory alone. Therefore, conceptual thought that arises from the power of seeing is not a valid cognition.

original: de lta na dran pas nyams su myong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi cha'i yul yin du zin kyang don dam pa de'i yul ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na dran pas nyams su myong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi cha'i yul yin du zin kyang don dam pa de'i yul ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Even though it has as its object the part of the own characteristic that is experienced by memory, it is not the ultimate object of that,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang po'i blo 'gyur ba gsal ba'i ngo bo dran pa la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang po'i blo 'gyur ba gsal ba'i ngo bo dran pa la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the clear nature of the transformation of the cognition of the sense faculty that has the own characteristic as its object does not appear to memory.

original: 'on kyang ji skad bshad pa'i 'bras bu kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji skad bshad pa'i 'bras bu kho na ste /
translated: However, the result is just as explained.

original: de yang sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di dran par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di dran par mi 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, since it is similar to the conceptual thought that establishes, how could it not be memory?

original: 'on te de la 'dir rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa dran pa'i ngo bo yin yang tshad mar 'dod de'i ltar gang me ma yin pa las ldog pa kho na'i dngos po tsam tshang ba ngal sogs pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa de nyid phyogs
analyzed: 'on te de la 'dir rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa dran pa'i ngo bo yin yang tshad mar 'dod de'i ltar gang me ma yin pa las ldog pa kho na'i dngos po tsam tshang ba ngal sogs pa nyams su myong bar gyur pa de nyid phyogs
translated: But even though the conceptual thought that recollects is the nature of inference, it is accepted as valid knowledge.

original: kyi khyad par la du ba mthong bas dran pa yin pa de bzhin du sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: kyi khyad par la du ba mthong bas dran pa yin pa de bzhin du sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the conceptual thought that establishes is also valid knowledge.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //🔽'di snyam du dgongs @202a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so // 'di snyam du dgongs @202a * //
translated: He says, “Because the nature of a thing that is not understood is not understood.”

original: pa yin te /
analyzed: pa yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: tshang bang la sogs pa me ma yin pa las ldog pa'i dngos po tsam sngar nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de yul la sogs pa dang 'brel pa nyid la rjes su dpag pa ni dran pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshang bang la sogs pa me ma yin pa las ldog pa'i dngos po tsam sngar nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de yul la sogs pa dang 'brel pa nyid la rjes su dpag pa ni dran pa ma yin no //
translated: Whatever is experienced previously as a mere thing that is the opposite of non-fire, such as a kitchen, is not inference in relation to the object, etc.

original: 'on kyang phyogs gang la sngar nyams su myong ba de dang 'brel pa de bas na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la dang dpe la bzung ba gnyi ga me ma yin pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad
analyzed: 'on kyang phyogs gang la sngar nyams su myong ba de dang 'brel pa de bas na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la dang dpe la bzung ba gnyi ga me ma yin pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad
translated: However, since it is related to that which was previously experienced in a particular place, it is explained that the object to be established and the example both realize the nature of a thing that is the opposite of non-fire, having eliminated the non-relation of non-realization.

original: nas rtogs par bshad pas 'di tshad ma yin gyi mthong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nas rtogs par bshad pas 'di tshad ma yin gyi mthong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is valid knowledge, but it is not a conception that arises after seeing.

original: de phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because that is mistaken.

original: / gal te dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa'i tshad ma yin par ci'i phyir na mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa'i tshad ma yin par ci'i phyir na mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the non-realization of the nature of a thing is not valid knowledge, why is it not valid knowledge?

original: dngos po'i rten can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rten can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: because it is based on real things.

original: tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po'i rten can nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po'i rten can nyid do //
translated: The presentation of valid cognition is based on real things.

original: tshad ma'i yul bya ba mngon par 'dod pas brjod kyi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul bya ba mngon par 'dod pas brjod kyi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The object of valid cognition is expressed by the desire to act, not by the characteristic of the object.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pas kun du brtags pa'i spyi la dmigs pa ni dngos po la rten pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pas kun du brtags pa'i spyi la dmigs pa ni dngos po la rten pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the conceptual universal that is the object of inference would not be pervaded by the presentation of the characteristic, because it is not based on a real thing.

original: gal te dngos po la brten nas tshad ma rnam par 'jog na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po la brten nas tshad ma rnam par 'jog na /
translated: If valid cognition is presented based on real things,

original: bskal ba'i yul la dmigs pa ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bskal ba'i yul la dmigs pa ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: how can the object of a kalpa be a valid cognition?

original: 'dir yang gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid dngos po nye bar len pa des bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang gtso bo la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid dngos po nye bar len pa des bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, the conception of prakriti and so on is established by the appropriation of real things.

original: gzhan yang dngos po la rten pa can nyid yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po la rten pa can nyid yod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Moreover, there is no fault because it is based on real things.

original: 'on te tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po la rten pa can kho na'o zhes bya ba ga las she na /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po la rten pa can kho na'o zhes bya ba ga las she na /
translated: But how do you know that the definition of valid cognition is based only on real things?

original: don byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “that which is capable of effective action.”

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid du rung ba gang yin pa de ni nus pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid du rung ba gang yin pa de ni nus pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is suitable as the characteristic of pleasure or pain is the object of a capacity.

original: de don du gnyer ba ni thob pa dang 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'jug go /
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba ni thob pa dang 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'jug go /
translated: One who seeks that object engages in seeking the object that has the characteristic of obtaining and rejecting.

original: gal te don byed par rung ba la don du gnyer ba 'jug pa de lta na yang ji ltar tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa dngos po la brten pa yin /
analyzed: gal te don byed par rung ba la don du gnyer ba 'jug pa de lta na yang ji ltar tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa dngos po la brten pa yin /
translated: Even if one engages in seeking that which is suitable as effective action, how is the definition of valid cognition based on real things?

original: don byed par rung ba la brten pa de lta yin na ni 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don byed par rung ba la brten pa de lta yin na ni 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is based on that which is suitable as effective action, then it would be.

original: dngos po don byed rnams la rung ba gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po don byed rnams la rung ba gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of that which is suitable for real things that are capable of effective action.

original: de'i phyir don byed par rung ba la rten @202b pa kho na dngos po la brten pa yin na ji ltar ma yin zhes bya bar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽'dir tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po la brten pa bstan pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa zhes lhag par brjod do zhes brgya la gzhan smra na dngos po tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyi tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa ni rang gi mtshan
analyzed: de'i phyir don byed par rung ba la rten @202b pa kho na dngos po la brten pa yin na ji ltar ma yin zhes bya bar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o // 'dir tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa ni dngos po la brten pa bstan pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa zhes lhag par brjod do zhes brgya la gzhan smra na dngos po tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyi tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa ni rang gi mtshan
translated: Therefore, if the basis of a valid cognition is only that which is capable of effective action, then how could it not be the case that the basis of a valid cognition is a real thing?

original: nyid la brten pa nyid ma yin no //🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: nyid la brten pa nyid ma yin no // gang gi phyir /
translated: Here, if someone else were to say that the presentation of valid cognition is taught as being based on real things, and that the phrase “not comprehending its own characteristic” is an addition, then the presentation of valid cognition that has as its reason a mere real thing would not be based on its own characteristic.

original: gal te yang ma rtogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa ma yin pa de lta na dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam nas ma grub pa'i don brjod pa na /
analyzed: gal te yang ma rtogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa ma yin pa de lta na dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam nas ma grub pa'i don brjod pa na /
translated: If one thinks that even though the non-comprehension of a real thing is not the comprehension of its own characteristic, in that case a conceptual cognition that does not comprehend the nature of a real thing would be a valid cognition, then the expression “unreal object” would be meaningless.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “not comprehending the nature of a real thing” and so on has already been explained.

original: de ma grub par brjod pa ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtogs pa tshad ma yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ma grub par brjod pa ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa rtogs pa tshad ma yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes ga las yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it be said that it is not established? How can it be said that a valid cognition is the realization of the nature of an entity, and the other is not?

original: don byed par rung ba'i zhes bya ba'i brgal zhing brtag pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: don byed par rung ba'i zhes bya ba'i brgal zhing brtag pa bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained the argument and analysis of “that which is suitable to perform a function.”

original: de lta na dngos po'i yul can gyi tshad ma brjod pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can kho na bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na dngos po'i yul can gyi tshad ma brjod pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can kho na bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, when it is said that valid knowledge has an entity as its object, it is explained that it has its own character as its object.

original: de nyid don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / spyi ni bzlog pa ni yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / spyi ni bzlog pa ni yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: This is because it is the defining characteristic of that which is able to perform a function, and because a universal is the opposite of that.

original: nyams su myong ba'i dus phyis byung ba'i sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshad ma yang gsal ba'i gtan tshigs lhag par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i dus phyis byung ba'i sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshad ma yang gsal ba'i gtan tshigs lhag par bshad pa ni /
translated: The later arising conceptual consciousness that has the experience of blue as its object is also a valid knowledge, and the reason for this is stated in the following.

original: de las kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “even more so” is stated.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: It is not only the conceptual consciousness that is a proof, as was explained.

original: sngon po rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba'i phyir dngos po nyid rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sngon po rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba'i phyir dngos po nyid rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because the intrinsic identity of blue is experienced, the thing itself is the intrinsic identity.

original: de la mngon par zhen pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pas yin gyi gzhan du na de la 'jug par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pas yin gyi gzhan du na de la 'jug par mi rigs so //
translated: Attachment to that is attachment to the intrinsic identity, and otherwise it would not be reasonable to engage in it.

original: skyes bu'i 'jug pa ni rang rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa ni de'i mthu las skyes pa rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'jug pa ni rang rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa ni de'i mthu las skyes pa rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The engagement of a person is this: the conceptualization that arises from the power of not understanding the intrinsic identity is not a valid cognition.

original: sngar ma rtogs pa'i don ma rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: sngar ma rtogs pa'i don ma rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin par bshad do //
translated: It has been explained that a non-valid cognition is that which does not understand a previously unknown object.

original: phyis rtogs pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir sgrub ba dang dgag pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa dag skye ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis rtogs pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir sgrub ba dang dgag pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa dag skye ba yin no //
translated: Later, the very understanding arises from the power of understanding, and thus the different entities of affirmation and negation arise.

original: yang na / gal te de'i yul gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes gang bshad pa de nyid lhag pa'i gtan tshigs thabs kyis bsal bar byas so //
analyzed: yang na / gal te de'i yul gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes gang bshad pa de nyid lhag pa'i gtan tshigs thabs kyis bsal bar byas so //
translated: Or, the very statement that it is because it is the effect of the object of that is a further reason, which is refuted by the method.

original: gal te de la mngon par gzhan nas dngos po la skyes bu 'jug @203a * //
analyzed: gal te de la mngon par gzhan nas dngos po la skyes bu 'jug @203a * //
translated: If it is said that the person engages in entities from the perspective of the manifest, then the person would be impermanent.🔽

original: pa de lta na yang spyi ma rtogs pa 'dzin pa mthong bas tha dad pa'i tshad ma cis na mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: pa de lta na yang spyi ma rtogs pa 'dzin pa mthong bas tha dad pa'i tshad ma cis na mi 'dod ce na /
translated: If it is said that the person engages in the thing through the manifestation of the universal, then why not accept a valid cognition that is different from the perception of the universal that is not apprehended?

original: bden te / rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la zhugs na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bden te / rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la zhugs na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Although this is true, it is said that “if one engages only in the particular, then the universal is not apprehended.”

original: mngon sum lta ba'i shes par grags pa dang / grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum lta ba'i shes par grags pa dang / grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition that is known as perception is renowned as being non-different from establishment and happiness.

original: grub pa ni ma mthong ba'i yul yongs su gcad pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni ma mthong ba'i yul yongs su gcad pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa'o //
translated: Establishment is the attainment of the characteristic of the ascertainment of an unseen object.

original: bde ba ni de'i don byed pa rjes su sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su skyong ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni de'i don byed pa rjes su sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su skyong ba'o //
translated: Happiness is the protection that has the characteristic of the accomplishment of the function of that object.

original: grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa ni 'di yin no zhes de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa ni 'di yin no zhes de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: Non-difference of establishment and happiness is explained in this way.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa mngon sum tha mi dad pa grub pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa mngon sum tha mi dad pa grub pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: In that regard, the establishment of the non-difference of the conceptual and non-conceptual perceptions is the adherence to the particular.

original: tha mi dad pa'i bde ba ni lta ba'i shes pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog par yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la 'jug go //🔽'di'i dgos pa ni 'di yin te /🔽gang gi tshe rtogs pa dang mi rtogs pa'i sems gzhal bar bya ba gzhan gyi yul yin pa de'i tshe de la skyes bu 'jug cing bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par rtogs pa'am 'jug pa nyid ni med do //🔽de'i yul nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i spyi tha mi dad pa'i shes pa kho na'i don byed par khas blangs pas rnam par rtog pa skye bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i bde ba ni lta ba'i shes pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog par yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la 'jug go // 'di'i dgos pa ni 'di yin te / gang gi tshe rtogs pa dang mi rtogs pa'i sems gzhal bar bya ba gzhan gyi yul yin pa de'i tshe de la skyes bu 'jug cing bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par rtogs pa'am 'jug pa nyid ni med do // de'i yul nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i spyi tha mi dad pa'i shes pa kho na'i don byed par khas blangs pas rnam par rtog pa skye bar grub pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of the object that is not different from the object is the cognition of the object itself, such as the cognition of the object of the view.🔽The purpose of this is as follows:🔽When the conceptual and non-conceptual cognitions are the objects of another cognition, then at that time, the person engages in that and understands the object to be accomplished, or the engagement itself is not.🔽Since the object itself is accepted as the object of the cognition of the object that is not different from the object, the establishment of the arising of conceptual cognition is accepted.🔽

original: sngon por nyams su myong ba las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya ser po la sogs pa'i yul gyi shes pas ni sngon po'i dngos po la skyes bu 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon por nyams su myong ba las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya ser po la sogs pa'i yul gyi shes pas ni sngon po'i dngos po la skyes bu 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of the object, such as the cognition of blue, is not different from the cognition of the object, such as the cognition of blue, is not different from the cognition of the original: sgrub par byed pa'i don byed pa yang 'ga' zhig tu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i don byed pa yang 'ga' zhig tu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of “establishment” is sometimes “to function.”

original: de'i phyir lta ba'i shes pa nyid gzhal bya las gzhan gyi yul gyi bye brag can dag la de bzhin bshad pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa can las //
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba'i shes pa nyid gzhal bya las gzhan gyi yul gyi bye brag can dag la de bzhin bshad pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa can las //
translated: Therefore, the statement that the knowledge of perception itself has a specific object different from the perceived object is not a correct explanation of the nonconceptual.

original: gnyis kyi bdag nyid dngos po 'dzin zhes bya ba bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi bdag nyid dngos po 'dzin zhes bya ba bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not an explanation of the statement, “The nature of the two is the apprehension of an entity.”

original: de'i phyir sngon po mthong ba kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshad mar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po mthong ba kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshad mar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the mere seeing of blue is nonconceptual valid knowledge.

original: de tha mi dad pa la nye bar sbyor ba'i dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang mthong ba las tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de tha mi dad pa la nye bar sbyor ba'i dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang mthong ba las tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The conceptualization of memory that is applied to that which is not different from it is not different from the seeing.

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma gzhan du rtog par byed pa ni 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma gzhan du rtog par byed pa ni 'bras bu med de /
translated: Otherwise, the conceptualization of another valid knowledge would be fruitless.

original: dran pa dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / rtsol ba la sogs pa tshad mar thal bar 'gyur bas tshad ma 'di tsam nges pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa dang / 'dod pa dang / sdang ba dang / rtsol ba la sogs pa tshad mar thal bar 'gyur bas tshad ma 'di tsam nges pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow, absurdly, that memory, desire, hatred, effort, and so on would be valid cognitions, and so the definite number of valid cognitions would be undermined.

original: gang gi tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos @203b po gcig la rgyun mi 'chad par dbang po'i shes pa skye ba de'i tshe snga ma dang grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir phyi ma'i dbang po'i shes pa rnams tshad ma ma yin par thal
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos @203b po gcig la rgyun mi 'chad par dbang po'i shes pa skye ba de'i tshe snga ma dang grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir phyi ma'i dbang po'i shes pa rnams tshad ma ma yin par thal
translated: When a sense consciousness is uninterruptedly produced with respect to a single thing such as blue, then the later sense consciousnesses would not be valid cognitions because they would not be different from the previously established and experienced object.

original: bar 'gyur bas ma nges pa yin no zhes tshad ma bslad par smra bas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bar 'gyur bas ma nges pa yin no zhes tshad ma bslad par smra bas bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, the proponent of uncontaminated valid knowledge teaches that this is indeterminate.

original: gal te mngon sum snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to this is stated in the lines beginning “If you say that earlier and later moments of direct perception . . .”

original: 'di dag gi lan ni phyi ma tshad ma ma yin par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi lan ni phyi ma tshad ma ma yin par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The response to this is that it does not follow that later moments are not valid cognitions.

original: gang gi phyir du ma la grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ma la grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the establishment and experience of the object are different in the many moments of the sense consciousness.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma re re'i yongs su gcod pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid ni grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma re re'i yongs su gcod pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid ni grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, the object that is ascertained in each moment is the definition of establishment.

original: de'i don byed pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba yongs su skyong ba ste ngo bo tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don byed pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba yongs su skyong ba ste ngo bo tha dad pa'o //
translated: The definition of the experience of that object is the accomplishment of its function. They are different in nature.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //🔽gang gi tshe du ma grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no // gang gi tshe du ma grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not inconclusive because it is reversed when the counter-pervasion is reversed.

original: skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa na'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa na'o //
translated: When the establishment of multiplicity and the difference of pleasure are accepted as the meaning to be established by the distinction of momentariness,

original: gang gi tshe skad cig ma'i bye brag gis phan pa dang mi phan pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa dang yongs su spong bar 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ni gzhan pa la phan pa nye bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skad cig ma'i bye brag gis phan pa dang mi phan pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa dang yongs su spong bar 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ni gzhan pa la phan pa nye bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: when the yogis who desire to obtain and abandon the characteristics of benefit and harm by the distinction of momentariness demonstrate the benefit of others,

original: 'ga' zhig gi rnam pa 'gas la lar nye bar mkho ba yin pa de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi rnam pa 'gas la lar nye bar mkho ba yin pa de'i tshe'o //
translated: when it is useful for someone in some way at some time,

original: dper na mthong ba 'di lam gyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa mthong bas bag la nyal gyi bag chags 'gog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mthong ba 'di lam gyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa mthong bas bag la nyal gyi bag chags 'gog pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the cessation of the latent tendencies of seeing is by the seeing of the receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the suffering of the path.

original: de'i gzhi la 'gal ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhi la 'gal ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of the contradiction in its basis.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni nyon mongs pas dben pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thob pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni nyon mongs pas dben pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thob pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering produces the acquisition of the nature of nirvana, which is the separation from the defilements.

original: bag la nyal dang 'gal ba'i rten la brtan pa skyed nas //
analyzed: bag la nyal dang 'gal ba'i rten la brtan pa skyed nas //
translated: Having produced the stability in the basis that is incompatible with the latent states,

original: des de dag 'dzin pa ni gzhan gyi sems pa la tha dad ba'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des de dag 'dzin pa ni gzhan gyi sems pa la tha dad ba'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: it holds them, because it is the valid cognition that is different from the other mind.

original: gzhan la phan pa'i sbyin pa dang dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa dngos po ma lus pa rgya che ba la khyab pa'i snang ba la gzigs pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das ni don gyi skad cig ma 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig gi gzhan gyi
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i sbyin pa dang dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa dngos po ma lus pa rgya che ba la khyab pa'i snang ba la gzigs pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das ni don gyi skad cig ma 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig gi gzhan gyi
