translated: The Blessed One, who has the vision of the vast and extensive appearance of the bestowal of gifts and consecration for the benefit of others, and who has the inner nature of being the protector and the bond for some through a few moments of meaning for others,

original: don du rjes su bzung ba'am 'ching ba yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don du rjes su bzung ba'am 'ching ba yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: is said to be the one who holds the world.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi skad cig ma re re rnams kyi mtshan nyid la gzigs pa rnams kyi mngon sum gyi sems de'i yul skad cig ma rnams la tha dad pa'i don byed pa dang bcas par nye bar sbyor ba'i grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i🔽phyir ro // @204a * //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi skad cig ma re re rnams kyi mtshan nyid la gzigs pa rnams kyi mngon sum gyi sems de'i yul skad cig ma rnams la tha dad pa'i don byed pa dang bcas par nye bar sbyor ba'i grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro // @204a * //
translated: The objects of the mind that perceives the characteristics of each instant of all things are applied to the performance of distinct functions, because they are established and blissful in distinct ways.

original: de gang gi tshe mngon sum rnams skad cig ma tha dad pa mthong ba'i dbang du byas par brjod pa de'i tshe tha dad pa la nye ba so so ba nyid la ma nges pa med do //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe mngon sum rnams skad cig ma tha dad pa mthong ba'i dbang du byas par brjod pa de'i tshe tha dad pa la nye ba so so ba nyid la ma nges pa med do //
translated: When it is said that the direct perceptions are based on the seeing of distinct instants, then there is no uncertainty about the distinctness of the individual applications.

original: yang na don thams cad gcig tu byed par 'dod pas mngon par zhen pa tha snyad du byed par skyes bu mngon par 'dod pas brjod na /
analyzed: yang na don thams cad gcig tu byed par 'dod pas mngon par zhen pa tha snyad du byed par skyes bu mngon par 'dod pas brjod na /
translated: Or, if one wishes to express the fact that all objects are made into one, and that the person is the one who is born to perform the conventions of adherence,

original: de'i tshe ma lus pa nyid kyis sngon po'i rgyun gyi don gcig pa dang // brten pa'i ngo bor bsgrub par bya ba'i don gcig pa'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir phyi ma yang tshad mar mi 'dod pas ma nges pa ga la yin ces bstan pa ni 'bras bu thun mong pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma lus pa nyid kyis sngon po'i rgyun gyi don gcig pa dang // brten pa'i ngo bor bsgrub par bya ba'i don gcig pa'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir phyi ma yang tshad mar mi 'dod pas ma nges pa ga la yin ces bstan pa ni 'bras bu thun mong pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: At that time, because of the identity of the object of the continuum of blue, and because of the identity of the object to be established as the nature of the support, the later [cognition] is also not accepted as valid cognition. How can there be uncertainty? This is explained by the phrase the common effect.

original: de rgyun du gnas pa'i skad cig ma thams cad la gcig tu mngon par zhen nas tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: de rgyun du gnas pa'i skad cig ma thams cad la gcig tu mngon par zhen nas tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Consistently, all moments are conceived as one and conventionally designated.

original: gang thun mong pa'i skad cig re re la phan tshun du rgyu byed pas tha dad du tshug kyang don dam par phyin ci log pas gcig tu mngon par 'dod pa'i 'chos pa la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o ;
analyzed: gang thun mong pa'i skad cig re re la phan tshun du rgyu byed pas tha dad du tshug kyang don dam par phyin ci log pas gcig tu mngon par 'dod pa'i 'chos pa la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o ;
translated: That which is the common cause for each moment, although distinguished as different, is ultimately conceived as one by error. The effect is blue, etc.

original: / de la phyi ma'i shes pa'i skad cig ma de dag gi mthus don thob par byed pa'i nus ba tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: / de la phyi ma'i shes pa'i skad cig ma de dag gi mthus don thob par byed pa'i nus ba tha dad pa med do //
translated: There is no difference in the power to attain the object by the force of those later moments of cognition.

original: mngon sum snga ma'i yul gyi skad cig ma kho na la de rnams 'jug pa na dang po 'di nyid de la tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum snga ma'i yul gyi skad cig ma kho na la de rnams 'jug pa na dang po 'di nyid de la tshad ma yin no //
translated: When they engage only the moment of the object of the former perception, it is valid with regard to that.

original: de lta na don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams de sgrub par byed pa thob par nus pa'i shes pa tshad ma'i tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: de lta na don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams de sgrub par byed pa thob par nus pa'i shes pa tshad ma'i tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Thus, those who seek to achieve a purpose establish a convention of valid cognition as a consciousness that is able to achieve that which is to be achieved.

original: blo ma nyams pa'i don byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa nyid kyis tshad ma las tha dad pa'i tha snyad shes pa rnams la rigs so //
analyzed: blo ma nyams pa'i don byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa nyid kyis tshad ma las tha dad pa'i tha snyad shes pa rnams la rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that the convention of valid cognition is different from the convention of consciousness because the means of achieving a purpose that is not impaired by other means of achieving a purpose are different.

original: de lta ma yin na dran pa la sogs pa yang tshad mar thal bar 'gyur bas bsal bar bya ba'am 'bras bu med pa'i tshad ma rnam par 'jog pa la rtogs pa dang ldan pa ji ltar gus par byed /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dran pa la sogs pa yang tshad mar thal bar 'gyur bas bsal bar bya ba'am 'bras bu med pa'i tshad ma rnam par 'jog pa la rtogs pa dang ldan pa ji ltar gus par byed /
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that memory and so on would be valid cognition. How could those who understand the presentation of valid cognition posit it as something to be refuted or as a valid cognition that is fruitless?

original: de dag thun mong gi 'bras bu'i nus pa tha mi dad pa gang zhig yin snyam na /
analyzed: de dag thun mong gi 'bras bu'i nus pa tha mi dad pa gang zhig yin snyam na /
translated: If it is asked what is the undifferentiated potency that is the common result of those,

original: du ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: du ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said that it is the other and other smoke.

original: de'i gzhal bar bya ba me de dang nye ba de rnams la de'i yul lta bu rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas me tsam bsgrub par bya ba'i don la 'bar ba la sogs pa la su zhig slu ba yin /
analyzed: de'i gzhal bar bya ba me de dang nye ba de rnams la de'i yul lta bu rjes su dpag pa'i shes pas me tsam bsgrub par bya ba'i don la 'bar ba la sogs pa la su zhig slu ba yin /
translated: Who is deceived about the mere fire that is the object of the inference that proves the probandum, the mere fire that is the object of the perception that is the means of knowing the fire that is the object of the inference?

original: de'i don bya ba sgrub par byed pa thob par nus pa tha dad pa med pas ji ltar tshad ma tha dad par mkhas pa la mi rigs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i don bya ba sgrub par byed pa thob par nus pa tha dad pa med pas ji ltar tshad ma tha dad par mkhas pa la mi rigs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: Since the means of knowing the object of the inference are not different, it is not reasonable for the wise to posit different means of knowledge.

original: gang gi tshe gdung ba lnga pas gdung bar 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe du ba gzhan @204b dang gzhan gyis gzhal bar bya ba'i me dang nye ba'i yul la yang rjes su dpag pa'i nus pa tha dad pa'i tshad ma bsal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gdung ba lnga pas gdung bar 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe du ba gzhan @204b dang gzhan gyis gzhal bar bya ba'i me dang nye ba'i yul la yang rjes su dpag pa'i nus pa tha dad pa'i tshad ma bsal bar mi nus so //
translated: When the five-peaked mountain is on fire, the fire that is the object of the perception that is the means of knowing the fire that is the object of the inference is not different from the fire that is the object of the inference that proves the probandum, the mere fire that is the object of the perception that is the means of knowing the fire that is the object of the inference.

original: de ltar na ji ltar sngon po mthon nas sngon po'o snyam pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i dpes sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin pa bsal nas rnal ma'i don la nye bar sbyor ba /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar sngon po mthon nas sngon po'o snyam pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i dpes sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin pa bsal nas rnal ma'i don la nye bar sbyor ba /
translated: In that case, having refuted the valid knowledge that is a conceptual consciousness of blue by the example of the consciousness that thinks “blue” after seeing blue, it is applied to the meaning of the original statement.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is stated by “This . . .”

original: sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba'i dus phyis byung ba'i sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma bsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: sngon po'i rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba'i dus phyis byung ba'i sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma bsal ba nyid do //
translated: It is the very refutation of the valid knowledge that is a conceptual consciousness of blue that occurs after the time of seeing the intrinsic identity of blue.

original: de min 'dod ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa la yang don gyis phan 'dogs so zhes gzhon nu ma len gyis smras pa na /
analyzed: de min 'dod ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa la yang don gyis phan 'dogs so zhes gzhon nu ma len gyis smras pa na /
translated: When Kumārila says that even though it is not that, it assists the object in conceptual consciousness,

original: phyogs la sogs pa mthong ba'i dus phyis byung ba chos can gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / de dang 'brel pa rtogs pa'i dus su me'i rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba'i dus phyis byung ba'i me'i spyi'i yul la bsgrub bya'i chos kyi rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa mthong ba'i dus phyis byung ba chos can gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / de dang 'brel pa rtogs pa'i dus su me'i rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba'i dus phyis byung ba'i me'i spyi'i yul la bsgrub bya'i chos kyi rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: the subject that is the conceptual consciousness of the property of the subject that occurs after the time of seeing the direction, etc., and the conceptual consciousness of the property to be proven that has as its object the generality of fire that occurs after the time of seeing the intrinsic identity of fire at the time of realizing the connection with that . . .

original: du ba mthong ba'i shes pa'i rjes las byung ba'i spyi snang ba'i rtags kyis rnam par rtog pa dang / sogs pa smos pas chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang tshad ma'i rjes las byung ba'i chos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: du ba mthong ba'i shes pa'i rjes las byung ba'i spyi snang ba'i rtags kyis rnam par rtog pa dang / sogs pa smos pas chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang tshad ma'i rjes las byung ba'i chos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conceptual thought that arises from the perception of the universal that is produced by the cognition that sees smoke, and so on, refers to the conceptual thought that relates the subject and the object, and the conceptual thought that arises from the valid cognition that relates the subject and the object.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi yul la lta ba'i ming can gyi mngon sum du song ba yin gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa ni rtags dang chos can gyi 'brel pa de bzhin du mi 'dzin no snyam pa'i 'jigs pas tshad mar khas blangs pa gang yin
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi yul la lta ba'i ming can gyi mngon sum du song ba yin gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa ni rtags dang chos can gyi 'brel pa de bzhin du mi 'dzin no snyam pa'i 'jigs pas tshad mar khas blangs pa gang yin
translated: The cognition that is called “seeing” has as its object the mere nature of the object. It is not conceptual. It does not apprehend the relation between the subject and the object in the same way that the conceptual thought does.

original: pa de bsal ba ni spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa de bsal ba ni spangs pa yin no //
translated: The fear that this is not a valid cognition is removed.

original: snga ma rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul mthong ba gang yin pa la gzhan gyi lta ba'i shes pa zhes tha snyad byed pa de nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: snga ma rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul mthong ba gang yin pa la gzhan gyi lta ba'i shes pa zhes tha snyad byed pa de nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: The cognition that sees the particular object is called “the cognition of seeing.” It is a valid cognition.

original: de'i stobs las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i stobs las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The conceptual thought that arises from the power of that is not a valid cognition.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas de dag legs par gnas so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas de dag legs par gnas so //
translated: The reasonings that have been explained well establish this.

original: phyogs kyi chos dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas grub par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas grub par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the property of the subject and the probandum are ascertained by means of direct perception and inference.

original: de nyid kyis mngon sum gyi phyogs kyi chos nges par brjod pas zhar la mthong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin pa bsal bas mngon sum ma rtogs pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba yin bar bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mngon sum gyi phyogs kyi chos nges par brjod pas zhar la mthong ba'i rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin pa bsal bas mngon sum ma rtogs pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba yin bar bstan to //
translated: By that very fact, the property of the subject of direct perception is ascertained and expressed, and by the way, the conceptual cognition that arises after seeing is excluded from being a valid means of knowledge. Thus it is shown that direct perception is free from non-realization and non-error.🔽If that is so, then why is this [treatise] not a common [treatise] that teaches inference, but rather teaches valid cognition?

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di tsam pa yin gyi yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes thun mong du ma yin no zhe na /🔽grangs la @205a * //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di tsam pa yin gyi yang dag pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes thun mong du ma yin no zhe na / grangs la @205a * //
translated: [The answer is:] The enumeration and so forth are not the main point.

original: sogs pa la log par rtog pa nyid bsal bas kyang 'dir de'i yul yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa la log par rtog pa nyid bsal bas kyang 'dir de'i yul yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: By excluding the misconception of enumeration and so forth, the object of that [misconception] is also excluded here.

original: lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: The realization of the hidden is based on inference.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is said that the property of the subject, the pervasion by that part, and the reason and the evidence are not different from that.

original: phyogs chos kho na dang / de'i chas khyab ba nyid dang / gtan tshigs dang rgyu mtshan dang de las gzhan ma yin no zhes brjod pas lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can gyi tshad ma thams cad rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'dus pas grangs la log par rtog pa bsal bas ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i yul
analyzed: phyogs chos kho na dang / de'i chas khyab ba nyid dang / gtan tshigs dang rgyu mtshan dang de las gzhan ma yin no zhes brjod pas lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can gyi tshad ma thams cad rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'dus pas grangs la log par rtog pa bsal bas ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i yul
translated: Since all valid cognitions that have hidden objects are included in inference, the misconception about the number of valid cognitions is eliminated.

original: la log par rtog ba bsal to //🔽de ltar khyab par byed pa'i cha go bar bya bar rtogs pas de'i chas khyab par brjod pas rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi yin la mngon sum gyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: la log par rtog ba bsal to // de ltar khyab par byed pa'i cha go bar bya bar rtogs pas de'i chas khyab par brjod pas rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi yin la mngon sum gyi yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The misconception about the object of correct knowledge is also eliminated.

original: de thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, by understanding the pervasion, the object of inference is taught to be the universal and the object of perception to be the particular, because the particular is not shared.

original: thun mong ma yin pa yin na yang khyab par byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa yin na yang khyab par byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable that it be a common object, because it is the object of conceptual thought.

original: de la dang por thun mong ma yin pa'i yul yin no zhes brjod pas rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum gyi yul kho nar bshad do //
analyzed: de la dang por thun mong ma yin pa'i yul yin no zhes brjod pas rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum gyi yul kho nar bshad do //
translated: In this regard, first, it is said that it is a non-common object, and thus it is explained that the object of perception is only a specific property.

original: mthong ba nyid tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pas tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pas tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: By explaining that seeing itself is valid knowledge, the result of valid knowledge is taught,

original: de ni don rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the realization of an object, and because it is of that nature.

original: de bzhin du de'i sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa bshad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa bshad par bya ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, in order to teach its two types of application, inference for the sake of others should be explained,

original: de'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags bshad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags bshad pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the explanation of the sign with three modes.

original: mdor bsdus nas rjes su dpag pa bstan par 'dod pa yin na de yang thams cad kyang yod pa'i phyir na 'dir ci'i phyir rjes su dpag ba bstan pa'i phyir zhes bshad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas rjes su dpag pa bstan par 'dod pa yin na de yang thams cad kyang yod pa'i phyir na 'dir ci'i phyir rjes su dpag ba bstan pa'i phyir zhes bshad par bya zhe na /
translated: If you wish to teach inference in brief, then since all of that is present, why is it explained here that inference is taught in order to establish the other?

original: bden na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de smos so //
analyzed: bden na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de smos so //
translated: It is mentioned because it is primary.

original: 'di ltar gtso bo ni skyes bu la nye bar mkho ba'i de kho na nyid 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rjes su dpag pa kho nas nges pa yin pa de gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gtso bo ni skyes bu la nye bar mkho ba'i de kho na nyid 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rjes su dpag pa kho nas nges pa yin pa de gtso bo yin no //
translated: Thus, the primary is the ascertainment of the reality that is necessary for a person by inference alone of the four noble truths. That is primary.

original: de ltar mngon sum gyi yul la yang slu ba srid pas rjes su dpag pa gzhan gtan la 'bebs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i phyir de gtso bo yin pa dang 'jug par byed pa yin pa 'di'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum gyi yul la yang slu ba srid pas rjes su dpag pa gzhan gtan la 'bebs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de'i phyir de gtso bo yin pa dang 'jug par byed pa yin pa 'di'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: Thus, since deception is possible even in the domain of direct perception, inference is the reason for establishing the other. Therefore, it is primary and engaging it is primary here.

original: de lta na yang gang nyams su myong ba'i 'bras bu bde @205b ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'am nyams su myong bar gyur pa 'bras bu mthong ba la de 'jug pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang nyams su myong ba'i 'bras bu bde @205b ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'am nyams su myong bar gyur pa 'bras bu mthong ba la de 'jug pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: But even so, the result that is experienced, whether it is the attainment of pleasure or pain, is not the object of the engagement of that direct perception,

original: 'bras bu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result has already been achieved.

original: de'i phyir gang ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum de la yang rjes su dpag pa kho na rab tu 'jug go//
analyzed: de'i phyir gang ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum de la yang rjes su dpag pa kho na rab tu 'jug go//
translated: Therefore, even in the case of direct perception of the future result, whether it is the attainment of pleasure or pain, it is only inference that engages it.

original: de ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal du rung ba nyid ni mngon sum gyis nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal du rung ba nyid ni mngon sum gyis nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The suitability of future pleasure and pain is not ascertained by direct perception,

original: 'bras bu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result is hidden.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu dngos po mi rtogs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu dngos po mi rtogs so zhes bshad do //
translated: “One does not understand a thing that is a result from a cause that is not directly perceived.”

original: de'i phyir sngar nyams su myong ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa dang chos mthun pa mngon sum gyi yul yin du zin kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rung ba mngon sum gyis nges par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar nyams su myong ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa dang chos mthun pa mngon sum gyi yul yin du zin kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rung ba mngon sum gyis nges par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, even though the object of direct perception is similar to the establishment of previously experienced pleasure and pain, it is not possible for direct perception to ascertain a suitable future thing.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: dper na mthong ba dang chos mthun pa de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa de nyid thob bo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dper na mthong ba dang chos mthun pa de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa de nyid thob bo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Just as it is similar to what is seen, in the same way, it is said that inference establishes that very thing.

original: de lta na gnyi ga yang 'jug par byed pa nyid de gnyi gas don yongs su bcad nas 'jug go zhes bshad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na gnyi ga yang 'jug par byed pa nyid de gnyi gas don yongs su bcad nas 'jug go zhes bshad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how can it be explained that both are engaged, since both ascertain the meaning and engage?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa me dang chu la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo mngon sum du grub la ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu rung ba'i yul ni rjes su dpag pas yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang 'jug par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa me dang chu la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo mngon sum du grub la ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu rung ba'i yul ni rjes su dpag pas yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang 'jug par byed pa dang /
translated: Because the establishment of pleasure and pain, such as fire and water, is established by direct perception, and the object of a suitable future result is by inference, both are engaged.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du song ba nyid phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang yongs su spangs pa dag la ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'i rung ba'i yul la mngon sum gyis nges pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa sngon du song ba nyid phan pa dang mi phan pa thob pa dang yongs su spangs pa dag la ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'i rung ba'i yul la mngon sum gyis nges pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that the ascertainment by direct perception of the suitability of the future result in the obtaining or avoiding of benefit or harm is preceded by right knowledge.

original: tshu rol mthong bas ma 'ongs pa'i 'dras bu rung ba nges pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gtso bo yin pas de smos so zhes bya ba spros pas chog pas rgya cher mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong bas ma 'ongs pa'i 'dras bu rung ba nges pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gtso bo yin pas de smos so zhes bya ba spros pas chog pas rgya cher mi sbyar ro //
translated: Since inference is primary in the ascertainment of the suitability of the future result by one who sees only the present, it is mentioned. Since elaboration is enough, I will not elaborate further.

original: de la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu'i phyogs kyi chos nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i thabs mtshungs pas tha mi dad par bshad do //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu'i phyogs kyi chos nges pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i thabs mtshungs pas tha mi dad par bshad do //
translated: There, the non-observation of essence and the ascertainment of the property of the subject in the effect-side are explained as not different because they are similar means of establishing the probandum.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa yang bsgrub par bya ba'i thabs tha dad pas tha dad par bstan pa 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa yang bsgrub par bya ba'i thabs tha dad pas tha dad par bstan pa 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of pervasion and counter-pervasion are taught as different because they are different means of establishing the probandum. The result is the ascertainment of the suitability of the future result.

original: re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges par rang gi tshad mas rgyu mtshan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges par rang gi tshad mas rgyu mtshan bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the reason of nature is ascertained by the ascertainment of the pervasion.

original: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /🔽phyogs kyi chos nges pa 'ba' zhig bstan pa ni @206a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang zhes bya ba smos te / phyogs kyi chos nges pa 'ba' zhig bstan pa ni @206a * //
translated: The ascertainment of the pervasion is stated by one’s own valid knowledge.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The property of the subject is not taught alone.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba nges pa gang yin pa yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la brjod do zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba nges pa gang yin pa yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la brjod do zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: Or, the ascertainment of the pervasion is stated in the reason of nature.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi yod pa tsam ni thob pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi yod pa tsam ni thob pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere existence of the proving property is not dependent on other reasons, such as attainment.

original: de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i khyab pa de grub pa gang yin pa de ni rang zhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel ba nges pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i khyab pa de grub pa gang yin pa de ni rang zhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi 'brel ba nges pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the pervasion that is related to that is the ascertainment of the relation of the reason of nature.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi dngos po tsam dang 'brel par su zhig la grub ce na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi dngos po tsam dang 'brel par su zhig la grub ce na /
translated: To whom is the mere thing of the proving property related?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ngo //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ngo //
translated: To the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni 'dir chos dang chos can gyi spyi'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir chos yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin bshad do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni 'dir chos dang chos can gyi spyi'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir chos yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin bshad do //
translated: The probandum is the property of the subject, which is one part of the general property of the subject.

original: gang dang gang la sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa de dang de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyang rgyu mtshan gzhan la mi ltos par yod pa'i phyir don de ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang la sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa de dang de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyang rgyu mtshan gzhan la mi ltos par yod pa'i phyir don de ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges par grub pa yin no //
translated: In whatever subject the proving property exists, the probandum property also exists, without depending on another reason. Thus, the meaning of the pervasion of the natural reason is established.

original: ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam la rag las pa yang yin zhe na de yong pa na sgrub par byed pa'i chos de yod pa ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin te de yod pa des de yod pa yin pas
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam la rag las pa yang yin zhe na de yong pa na sgrub par byed pa'i chos de yod pa ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin te de yod pa des de yod pa yin pas
translated: How is it that the existence of the probandum property depends only on the existence of the proving property? When that exists, the existence of the proving property is its nature. By its existence, that exists.

original: so // gang gi tshe sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i rang bzhin gyis de tsam dang 'brel ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: so // gang gi tshe sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i rang bzhin gyis de tsam dang 'brel ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How can the property of the reason and the property to be established be related to that extent by the nature of that?

original: rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that they would be essenceless.

original: 'o na ni de'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i phyir ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if they are not different in nature, how can they be the property to be established and the property that establishes it?

original: dngos su na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos su na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “In actuality,”

original: don dam par ro //
analyzed: don dam par ro //
translated: ultimately.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dus su de ma yin pa las phan tshun ldog pa'i don gyi rgyu mtshan rtog pa can gyi blo tha dad par snang bas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa la nyams pa med do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dus su de ma yin pa las phan tshun ldog pa'i don gyi rgyu mtshan rtog pa can gyi blo tha dad par snang bas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa la nyams pa med do //
translated: When there is the conceptualization of the property to be established and the property that establishes it, the reason that is the object that is the opposite of what is not that appears to the conceptual mind as different, and so there is no fault in the property to be established and the property that establishes it.

original: 'di don dam par na sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang chos can dang byas pa la sogs pa tha dad par dmigs par bya ba med de /
analyzed: 'di don dam par na sgrub par byed pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang chos can dang byas pa la sogs pa tha dad par dmigs par bya ba med de /
translated: In reality, there is no object of observation that is a different phenomenon, such as that which is to be established and that which establishes it, or a subject and a predicate, or that which is produced and that which produces it.

original: 'brel pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not related, it is not correct that that which is to be established and that which establishes it are related.

original: gal te byas pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa la 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byas pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa la 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the relationship is the relationship of inherence in that which is produced and impermanent, and so on,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.🔽Because it is not correct that a relationship of inherence exists in a different object, it would be a relationship that is not related to that object.🔽Because it is necessary to imagine another relationship in that situation, it would follow that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de yang don gzhan la 'dis don 'di la 'du ba zhes bya ba 'brel pa med par 'gyur ba de'i gnas skabs yin par 'brel pa gzhan brtag @206b dgos pas thug pa med bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'du ba'i yod par brtag na ni byas ba la sogs pa rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa 'dod na 'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang don gzhan la 'dis don 'di la 'du ba zhes bya ba 'brel pa med par 'gyur ba de'i gnas skabs yin par 'brel pa gzhan brtag @206b dgos pas thug pa med bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'du ba'i yod par brtag na ni byas ba la sogs pa rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa 'dod na 'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is imagined that there is a relationship of inherence, then it would also be correct to assert that that which is produced and so on is permanent and a self and so on.

original: gang byas pa nyid la sogs ba sgra kho na la 'du ba stobs gang yin bas de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang byas pa nyid la sogs ba sgra kho na la 'du ba stobs gang yin bas de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If the relationship of inherence in that which is produced and so on is only in the word, then it would follow that it would engage only that.

original: de nyid rtag pa mngon par 'dod pa rnams la yang gcig pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir byas pa la sogs pa bdag la sogs pa 'jug pa gang gis na bsal bar nus /
analyzed: de nyid rtag pa mngon par 'dod pa rnams la yang gcig pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir byas pa la sogs pa bdag la sogs pa 'jug pa gang gis na bsal bar nus /
translated: Also, for those who assert that it is permanent, it is accepted as being the same, so how could it be possible to eliminate the application of “product” and so on to the self?

original: 'on te gang ma byung ba las byung ba'i chos dang byung nas kyang med pa'i chos ni mi brtan pa'i ngo bor yod pa de nyid la byas pa la sogs pa 'jug go zhes rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang ma byung ba las byung ba'i chos dang byung nas kyang med pa'i chos ni mi brtan pa'i ngo bor yod pa de nyid la byas pa la sogs pa 'jug go zhes rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
translated: If you posit that the application of “product” and so on is to that which is by nature unstable, a phenomenon that arises from that which did not exist and that having arisen becomes nonexistent,

original: de lta na de nyid ma byung ba las byung ba rang bzhin nam byung zin pa mi brten pa'i dngos po nyid la de phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo rgyu mtshan du ci ste mi 'dod
analyzed: de lta na de nyid ma byung ba las byung ba rang bzhin nam byung zin pa mi brten pa'i dngos po nyid la de phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo rgyu mtshan du ci ste mi 'dod
translated: then why do you not assert that the conceptual mind that is the object of the elimination of the superimposition of that which is arisen from that which did not exist as having an essence or that which having arisen becomes unstable as the reason for the application of “product” and so on?

original: / de nyid kyis don dam par tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa'i chos dang chos can 'jug na bar du lhag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: / de nyid kyis don dam par tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa'i chos dang chos can 'jug na bar du lhag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If the object and subject are applied as not being ultimately different, what is the point of adding something in the middle?

original: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ldog pa dang ldan pa ni khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ldog pa dang ldan pa ni khas blangs dgos so //
translated: The reason because of being produced and so on must be accepted as having the property of the subject.

original: de lta na /🔽yod pa tsam gyis byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de lta na / yod pa tsam gyis byas pa'i phyir //
translated: If that is so,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: then the mere existence of the reason is not the cause of understanding the property of the thesis.

original: de dag rtag du nye ba nyid kyis gtan tu de'i chos rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag rtag du nye ba nyid kyis gtan tu de'i chos rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are always present, it would follow that the property of the thesis is always understood.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba kho na ste /
translated: However, it is only the appearance of conceptual thought.

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi snang ba nyid kyi rnam pa phyi rol dngos po lta bur mngon par zhen pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas byas pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo rtogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi snang ba nyid kyi rnam pa phyi rol dngos po lta bur mngon par zhen pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas byas pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo rtogs par byed kyi /
translated: Moreover, that conceptual thought, following after the mere appearance of its own aspect, as if it were an external thing, makes one understand the nature of things such as impermanence and so on.

original: don dam par na reg pa med kyang de'i ngo bo brgyud pas de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par na reg pa med kyang de'i ngo bo brgyud pas de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ultimately, there is no contact, but because it is indirectly the cause of that, it is called the reason.

original: ldog pa'i chos kyang de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan tsam gyis yongs su brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i chos kyang de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan tsam gyis yongs su brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: And the property of the counter-correlate is to be imagined merely as the reason for the arising of that.

original: de rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du yod pa de mchog yin pas gdon mi za bar khas blangs bar bya ba'i phyir dang / ldog pa dang ldan pas chos grub zin pa'i don du khas blang ba'i phyir de brtags pas chog go //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du yod pa de mchog yin pas gdon mi za bar khas blangs bar bya ba'i phyir dang / ldog pa dang ldan pas chos grub zin pa'i don du khas blang ba'i phyir de brtags pas chog go //
translated: Since that very reason for the imagination is the reason for the arising of the imagination, it is the best, and so must be accepted without doubt. And since the property of the counter-correlate is to be accepted as the established object, it is enough to imagine it.

original: gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas kyang dngos po kho na la gnas pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs par @207a * //🔽bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar mi rtag pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas kyang dngos po kho na la gnas pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs par @207a * // bya ba yin te /
translated: One must understand that impermanence, without doubt, is the very nature of things, by way of difference.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa don byed pa don du gnyer ba rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa don byed pa don du gnyer ba rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who seeks to accomplish a purpose engages in what is consistent with it.

original: gzhan du na mi rtag pa las tha dad pa'i rtag pa yin pa'i phyir de khong du chung ba don du gnyer ba sgra 'di mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba don byed pa don du gnyer bas sgra rtag pa la sogs par bsams nas ci mi rtag
analyzed: gzhan du na mi rtag pa las tha dad pa'i rtag pa yin pa'i phyir de khong du chung ba don du gnyer ba sgra 'di mi rtag par bsgrub par bya ba don byed pa don du gnyer bas sgra rtag pa la sogs par bsams nas ci mi rtag
translated: Otherwise, since it is permanent, it is different from impermanence, and one who seeks to understand it would not seek to establish that sound is impermanent.

original: pa phan ba med pa dpyod par byed dam /
analyzed: pa phan ba med pa dpyod par byed dam /
translated: What would be the point of analyzing whether sound is impermanent or not?

original: gal te rtag pa la yang mi rtag pa khong du chud pas de nyid la 'jug te cis na sgra mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid yin /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa la yang mi rtag pa khong du chud pas de nyid la 'jug te cis na sgra mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid yin /
translated: If one understands permanence as impermanence, then one would engage in that. Why is sound not the nature of permanence?

original: de'i sgo nas rab tu rtogs so zhe na //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas rab tu rtogs so zhe na //
translated: One understands it through that.

original: ci bar du gcod pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ci bar du gcod pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of this obstruction?

original: bar du gcod pa med pa kho nas rtogs pa yong na mdzes te /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa med pa kho nas rtogs pa yong na mdzes te /
translated: If understanding definitely occurs without obstruction, that is good,

original: de nyid don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one seeks that.

original: de 'dir shin tu spros pa ni yongs su rdzogs par dka' bas chog go //
analyzed: de 'dir shin tu spros pa ni yongs su rdzogs par dka' bas chog go //
translated: Here, since it is very extensive, it is difficult to complete.

original: rgyal dpog pa gang dag gis bsams pa /
analyzed: rgyal dpog pa gang dag gis bsams pa /
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas think:

original: gang dag shin tu tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i chos de dag nyid 'di ni rigs pa can la sogs pa la skyon yin gyi kho bo cag rnam pa 'gas tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag shin tu tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i chos de dag nyid 'di ni rigs pa can la sogs pa la skyon yin gyi kho bo cag rnam pa 'gas tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la skyon med do zhe na /
translated: But those who hold that phenomena are absolutely distinct, such as the Naiyāyikas, etc., are at fault. We are not at fault in any way with regard to the nature of phenomena that are sometimes distinct and sometimes not distinct.

original: de dag kyang dngos po'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo khas blangs nas bsgrub par bya ba chos rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad par khas blangs pa'i 'bras bu cung zad cig nye bar ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang dngos po'i ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo khas blangs nas bsgrub par bya ba chos rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad par khas blangs pa'i 'bras bu cung zad cig nye bar ma mthong ste /
translated: They also, having accepted the nature of the phenomenon that establishes the nature of things, do not see the slightest result of accepting that some of the phenomena to be established are distinct.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'thad pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas 'thad pa yang yin no //
translated: The relation between the thing to be established and the means of establishment is tenable from the point of view of distinct conceptual distinctions.

original: bdag nyid gcig pa la rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid gcig pa la rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha dad pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that something that is the same entity is distinct in some respects.

original: rang bzhin gcig pa la tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa la tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not distinct in a single nature.

original: gal te de las kyang de dag rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de las kyang de dag rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are identical in some way, but different in some way,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then no.

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be an infinite regress.

original: de lta na chos de dag gi rang bzhin gcig pa yin du zin kyang tha dad pa ldan pa des na rang bzhin gyis rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni tha mi dad pa gzhan pa zhig gi rang bzhin khas blang bar bya dgos
analyzed: de lta na chos de dag gi rang bzhin gcig pa yin du zin kyang tha dad pa ldan pa des na rang bzhin gyis rnam pa 'ga' zhig tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni tha mi dad pa gzhan pa zhig gi rang bzhin khas blang bar bya dgos
translated: Thus, even if the nature of those phenomena were identical, because of their difference in being different, you would have to accept that there is some way in which they are not identical, namely, in being different from each other.

original: te / de bzhin du de las gzhan pa yin no zhes tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa mtha' yas pa'i rang bzhin brgyud pa blos brtags su zin kyang /
analyzed: te / de bzhin du de las gzhan pa yin no zhes tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa mtha' yas pa'i rang bzhin brgyud pa blos brtags su zin kyang /
translated: In the same way, even if you imagine that there is an infinite regress of natures, such that they are different in some way, but identical in some way,

original: gnyis ga'i ngo bo mtha' yas pa'i rang bzhin brgyud pa snang ba ni med pa'i phyir @207b de btags pas bdag nyid ci slu bar byed dam /
analyzed: gnyis ga'i ngo bo mtha' yas pa'i rang bzhin brgyud pa snang ba ni med pa'i phyir @207b de btags pas bdag nyid ci slu bar byed dam /
translated: then since there is no appearance of an infinite regress of natures, both of which are of the nature of the other, what is the point of imagining them?

original: khyad rnam pa 'gas tha dad pa khas blangs pas na tha dad pa'i phyogs rnams kyi ji ltar skyon gyi gnas skabs med pa yin /
analyzed: khyad rnam pa 'gas tha dad pa khas blangs pas na tha dad pa'i phyogs rnams kyi ji ltar skyon gyi gnas skabs med pa yin /
translated: Since you accept that they are different in some respects, how can you avoid the problem that the different parts are not the same?

original: gang bdag nyid kyi mdun na gnas pa la 'di chos so 'di chos can no zhes rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang bdag nyid kyi mdun na gnas pa la 'di chos so 'di chos can no zhes rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: You may say, “We posit that which is present before us as the phenomenon and the property-possessor, and we posit that which is to be proven as the property.”

original: gal te des tha dad pa de ni tha dad pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ma nges par rtsod pa ga la yin /
analyzed: gal te des tha dad pa de ni tha dad pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ma nges par rtsod pa ga la yin /
translated: If you say that the difference between them is just a difference, then how can you argue that it is not definite?

original: 'on te tha mi dad na 'di sgrub par byed pa'i chos sam 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sam 'di ni chos can zhes tha dad pa de ji ltar don dam par rnam pa gsum 'grub pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad na 'di sgrub par byed pa'i chos sam 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sam 'di ni chos can zhes tha dad pa de ji ltar don dam par rnam pa gsum 'grub pa yin /
translated: If they are not different, then how can you establish the three modes ultimately, saying, “This is the property to be proven,” “This is the property,” or “This is the property-possessor”?

original: de'i phyir de dang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo ldog pa'i brten pa ni blos brtags nas tha dad pa dang ldan pa lta bu'i chos dang chos can du snang bas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang de las gzhan pa'i ngo bo ldog pa'i brten pa ni blos brtags nas tha dad pa dang ldan pa lta bu'i chos dang chos can du snang bas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i
translated: Therefore, the dependence of the exclusion of the nature of that and that other is established by the intellect, and the appearance as the property and the possessor of the property, as if they were different, is related to just that entity which is the probandum and the probans.

original: dngos po de dang de'i rang bzhin yin par rigs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po de dang de'i rang bzhin yin par rigs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that the nature of that entity and that entity are reasonable.

original: de'i dngos po ni ngo bo'i tshig gis bshad do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni ngo bo'i tshig gis bshad do //
translated: The word “nature” explains the entity.🔽Here, too, from what nature and what cause does the entity arise? The nature of the probandum and the probans are related.

original: 'dir yang dngos po de ngo bo gang dang gang gi rgyu las byung ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos po de ngo bo gang dang gang gi rgyu las byung ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang / sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: To what?

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “the proof.”

original: de ni dngos su de'i rang bzhin yin pa bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la gtan tshigs kyi gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa des bzlog pa'i chos dang mi mthun par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos su de'i rang bzhin yin pa bsgrub par bya ba las ldog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la gtan tshigs kyi gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa des bzlog pa'i chos dang mi mthun par 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is the evidence that refutes the counter position, which is the opposite of the probandum, which is the actual nature of that.

original: gang gis bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs de la mi 'jug ste 'gal ba gnyis gcig la lhan cig par mi srid pas de la 'jug pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma rab tu 'jug pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi dngos su de'i rang bzhin yin pas gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa bshad do //
analyzed: gang gis bsgrub par bya ba'i gtan tshigs de la mi 'jug ste 'gal ba gnyis gcig la lhan cig par mi srid pas de la 'jug pa ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma rab tu 'jug pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi dngos su de'i rang bzhin yin pas gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pa bshad do //
translated: The reason does not apply to that, because two contradictions cannot possibly occur together in one place. The application of that is explained as the application of the evidence that refutes, and the application of the probandum itself, which is the actual nature of that.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ldog pa yod pa ni //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs ldog pa yod pa ni //
translated: The existence of the reversal of the reason in the counter position of that

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la 'jug pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la don gzhan la med pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos ni rang bzhin du grub bo //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la 'jug pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la don gzhan la med pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos ni rang bzhin du grub bo //
translated: is established as the nature of that, because it applies to the subject of the probandum. Therefore, the property of the reason, which does not exist elsewhere in the subject of the probandum, is established as the nature of that.

original: de yang dngos su de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos su de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, since it is the nature of the probandum, the mere presence of the proving property and the relation of the probandum to the proving property are ascertained.

original: gang dang gang la sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa de @208a * //
analyzed: gang dang gang la sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa de @208a * //
translated: Whatever has the proving property🔽has the probandum.

original: dang de la bsgrub par bya ba yod do zhes de ltar dngos po nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: dang de la bsgrub par bya ba yod do zhes de ltar dngos po nye bar skye'o //
translated: In this way, the entity is produced.

original: 'di'i dpe ni /
analyzed: 'di'i dpe ni /
translated: The example is

original: dper na gang yod pa de ni skad cig ma kho na yin no zhes nges par bzung bas ni khyab ba smras pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na gang yod pa de ni skad cig ma kho na yin no zhes nges par bzung bas ni khyab ba smras pa yin no //
translated: like saying, Whatever exists is momentary, which is a statement of the pervasion.

original: sgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba de dag gi ngo bo bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba de dag gi ngo bo bshad pa yin no //
translated: The mere presence of the proving property and the relation of the probandum to the proving property are explained as the nature of those.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan med pas yod pa kho na skad cig ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan pas de yang dngos su na de'i rang bzhin yin pas grub pas yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan med pas yod pa kho na skad cig ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan pas de yang dngos su na de'i rang bzhin yin pas grub pas yin no //
translated: Since there is no other reason, it is shown that only what exists is momentary. Therefore, it is established by the nature of that.

original: de grub pa'i thams gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de grub pa'i thams gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod par bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of the existence of a valid cognition that contradicts the establishment of that is as follows:

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa skad cig ma nyid las bzlog pas yod pa'i don byed nus pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir don gyi 'bras bu'i bya ba grub pas de dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa skad cig ma nyid las bzlog pas yod pa'i don byed nus pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir don gyi 'bras bu'i bya ba grub pas de dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: Since non-momentariness is the opposite of momentariness, it is contradictory to the capacity to perform a function. Therefore, it is contradictory to the establishment of the activity of the effect of the object.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni don byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni don byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its characteristic is the characteristic of the capacity to perform a function.

original: dngos po nyid kyi don byed par nus pa'i bdag nyid gang yin ba de ni de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyi don byed par nus pa'i bdag nyid gang yin ba de ni de bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The nature of an entity that is able to perform a function is just as it is explained.

original: don byed pa ni de'i gnas pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po nyid mtshan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: don byed pa ni de'i gnas pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po nyid mtshan par bya ba ste /
translated: The capacity to perform a function is the characteristic of the nature of the existence of an entity.

original: de rnam pa de lta bus dngos po nyid nyams pa ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa de lta bus dngos po nyid nyams pa ni ldog pa'o //
translated: The impairment of an entity in that way is its cessation.

original: de las bzlog pa'i ngo bos med pa nyid 'dren pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i ngo bos med pa nyid 'dren pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since the opposite of that is the nature of nonexistence,

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'di yang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo ste phyis skabs su bab pa dang rang nyid chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'di yang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo ste phyis skabs su bab pa dang rang nyid chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: this valid cognition that contradicts is also the nature of the non-apprehension of the pervasion. Later, when the occasion arises, it will be refuted.

original: de ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i chos rang bzhin du grub bo //🔽de yang dngos su na de'i rang bzhin yin pas sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel par grub po //
analyzed: de ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i chos rang bzhin du grub bo // de yang dngos su na de'i rang bzhin yin pas sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam dang rjes su 'brel par grub po //
translated: This is the proof of the nature of the probandum by the presence of an invalidating cognition.🔽And that is established as the nature of the probans, because it is actually the nature of that.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa de'i bdag nyid du grub pas rjes su 'gro ba nges pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa de'i bdag nyid du grub pas rjes su 'gro ba nges pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the case of a reason based on nature, the presence of an invalidating cognition in the contrapositive is established as the nature of that, and so the ascertainment of the positive concomitance has been explained.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bstan par bya ba ni /
translated: The reason based on effect will now be explained.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of the positive concomitance in the case of a reason based on effect is the topic.🔽Here, what is the nature of cause and effect?

original: 'dir rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu dag gi ngo bo ci zhig / rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid dang // der grub pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu dag gi ngo bo ci zhig / rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid dang // der grub pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The establishment of cause and effect and their existence is called ascertainment.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa dang / ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa de ltar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa dang / ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa de ltar bstan pa ni /
translated: This is the ascertainment of the pervasion of the effect reason.

original: 'di ltar ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The way in which the entity of cause and effect is established is taught by “in this way.”

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The word “in this way” is an illustration.

original: du ba la sogs pa 'di me 'di dmigs na @208b nye bar dmigs so zhes bya ba 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa 'di me 'di dmigs na @208b nye bar dmigs so zhes bya ba 'brel pa'o //
translated: The phrase “this smoke, etc., is observed when that fire is observed” is the connection.

original: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa mngon sum gyi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa mngon sum gyi byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the activity of perception in establishing the entity of cause and effect.

original: mngon sum 'ba' zhig gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dngos po the tshom med par grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum 'ba' zhig gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dngos po the tshom med par grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The entity of cause and effect is not established without doubt by perception alone.

original: 'on kyang sngar mi dmigs pa 'jug pa dang lhan cig brtan par bya ba ni ;
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar mi dmigs pa 'jug pa dang lhan cig brtan par bya ba ni ;
translated: However, non-observation, which was previously mentioned, must be ascertained in combination with perception.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “non-observation of the perceptible” is mentioned.

original: gal te du ba la sogs pa de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i nye bar dmigs pa'i rkyen yod la snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi yod pa ni dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te du ba la sogs pa de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba'i nye bar dmigs pa'i rkyen yod la snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi yod pa ni dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If smoke, etc. were the objective referent of perception, the condition of perception would exist, and the existence of the appearance would be perceived.

original: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye ba las sngar me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye bar dmigs pa las 'bras bu yod par nye bar dmigs pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye ba las sngar me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye bar dmigs pa las 'bras bu yod par nye bar dmigs pa 'grub bo //
translated: From the proximity of the collection of fire, etc., the perception of the collection of fire, etc. is prior to the establishment of the perception of the existence of the effect.

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan ma tshang na ni mi skye bar nye bar dmigs pa'i ngo bo yod pa de'i yul nye ba yin du zin kyang dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pas me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye bar gyur pa las sngon du nye bar🔽dmigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan ma tshang na ni mi skye bar nye bar dmigs pa'i ngo bo yod pa de'i yul nye ba yin du zin kyang dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pas me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye bar gyur pa las sngon du nye bar🔽dmigs pa ni med do //
translated: If the other conditions of perception are incomplete, the perception of the existence of the nature of the effect does not arise. Even if the object is proximate, since it is not the objective referent of perception, the perception of the collection of fire, etc. is prior to the proximity of the collection of fire, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las mi dmigs ba me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye ba skye ba las sngar gzhan nas 'ongs pa'am de yul dang dus nye bas rtsig pa dang re lde la sogs pa la de skye ba'am de'i yul na yod pa yin zhes
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las mi dmigs ba me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nye ba skye ba las sngar gzhan nas 'ongs pa'am de yul dang dus nye bas rtsig pa dang re lde la sogs pa la de skye ba'am de'i yul na yod pa yin zhes
translated: The three possibilities are: arising from something else that came from somewhere else, arising from the wall, fence, and so on due to the proximity of the place and time, or existing in that place.

original: bya ba rnam pa gsum gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rnam pa gsum gsal ba yin no //
translated: These three possibilities are clarified.

original: rnam pa 'di rnams kyis de ma yin pa'i 'bras bu 'gyur na ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di rnams kyis de ma yin pa'i 'bras bu 'gyur na ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect were to arise in any of these three ways, it would arise.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pas de ma yin pa'i 'bras bu'i dogs pa bsal nas de yod na yod par mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa the tshom med par grub po ;
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pas de ma yin pa'i 'bras bu'i dogs pa bsal nas de yod na yod par mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa the tshom med par grub po ;
translated: Therefore, since nonobservation eliminates the doubt of the effect being something else, the relation of cause and effect is established without doubt through the reason of the effect's existence when the cause exists.

original: / gal te me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i dngos po nges pa nye ba na mi snang ba'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig las du ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: / gal te me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i dngos po nges pa nye ba na mi snang ba'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig las du ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
translated: If one doubts that smoke arises from something else that is not fire, such as fuel,

original: me dang byad shing la sogs pa tha dad pas rjes su byed pa'i du ba ni tsan dan dang ga bur dang / aa ka ru dang / skra dang bal la sogs pa'i bud shing tha dad pa de'i rjes su mthun pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa 'di mthong ba'i phyir dang /🔽bud shing gi 'gyur ba che ba dang chung ba'i byed pas me de dang rjes su mthun ba dang me dang bud shing la sogs pa nye ba mi snang ba'i bdag tu nges pa nye ba las mi rigs te /
analyzed: me dang byad shing la sogs pa tha dad pas rjes su byed pa'i du ba ni tsan dan dang ga bur dang / aa ka ru dang / skra dang bal la sogs pa'i bud shing tha dad pa de'i rjes su mthun pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa 'di mthong ba'i phyir dang / bud shing gi 'gyur ba che ba dang chung ba'i byed pas me de dang rjes su mthun ba dang me dang bud shing la sogs pa nye ba mi snang ba'i bdag tu nges pa nye ba las mi rigs te /
translated: Smoke that is different from fire, fuel, etc., is seen to have a different nature that accords with different fuel such as sandalwood, camphor, and agarwood, as well as with different hair, wool, etc.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'brel pa @209a * //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'brel pa @209a * //
translated: It is not reasonable that fire and fuel, etc., are ascertained to be the self that is not manifest due to the proximity of the cause of their arising, because of the absence of a relationship.

original: nyid ni rgyu 'am 'bras bu'i dngos po las yin no //
analyzed: nyid ni rgyu 'am 'bras bu'i dngos po las yin no //
translated: A relationship is from the nature of a cause or an effect.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin na me dang bud shing phrad pas rgyun mi 'chad par du ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin na me dang bud shing phrad pas rgyun mi 'chad par du ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the effect of that, smoke would not arise uninterruptedly from the contact of fire and fuel.

original: de yod na yong pa'i rjes su byed pa 'di yang 'bras bu nyid yin na /
analyzed: de yod na yong pa'i rjes su byed pa 'di yang 'bras bu nyid yin na /
translated: If it were the effect of that, this conformity with its existence would also be the effect of that.

original: de yang du ba la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de yang du ba la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The same applies to smoke.

original: bud shing la sogs pa mi snang ba'i bdag nyid ni rgyu ma yin te bud shing la sogs pa rang gi rgyu shing la sogs ba las 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir de la yang de bzhin du dngos po rtogs na de nyid kyi lan brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bud shing la sogs pa mi snang ba'i bdag nyid ni rgyu ma yin te bud shing la sogs pa rang gi rgyu shing la sogs ba las 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir de la yang de bzhin du dngos po rtogs na de nyid kyi lan brjod par bya'o //
translated: Fuel, etc., which are not of the nature of non-appearance are not the cause, because fuel, etc., are seen to arise from their own causes, such as wood, etc. The same applies to them. If one understands the thing in that way, the answer should be given in the same way.

original: yang rtsod na yang de kho na la lan yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang rtsod na yang de kho na la lan yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one argues further, the answer is just that, so there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'dis tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: By this, dependence on a single collection is also eliminated.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa du ba nyid kyi rgyu brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa du ba nyid kyi rgyu brtag par bya'o //
translated: The cause of smoke itself should be investigated as that which follows and precedes smoke.

original: gal te de yang me dang mtshungs par de yang rgyu yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de yang me dang mtshungs par de yang rgyu yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is also like fire, it has a cause.

original: me la sogs pa yod na gdon mi za bar yod pa la gzhan yang rgyu nyid du brtag par mi bya ste rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me la sogs pa yod na gdon mi za bar yod pa la gzhan yang rgyu nyid du brtag par mi bya ste rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When fire, etc., exist, it is not necessary to investigate another as the cause, because there is no reason.

original: 'bras bu la tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rgyu'i dngos por brtag na /
analyzed: 'bras bu la tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rgyu'i dngos por brtag na /
translated: If you imagine that the cause is a real entity because of the difference in the effect,

original: ji ltar me dang bud shing la sogs pa'am gzhan gang yang rung ba yod na yong ba 'am gzhan yang de yod par nges pa'i nye ba'i rgyu las yin na de tsam gyis ni me la sogs pa'i rgyu nyams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar me dang bud shing la sogs pa'am gzhan gang yang rung ba yod na yong ba 'am gzhan yang de yod par nges pa'i nye ba'i rgyu las yin na de tsam gyis ni me la sogs pa'i rgyu nyams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then, if fire, fuel, etc. exist, or if any other thing exists, or if the cause is a proximate one, the cause of which the existence is certain, then the cause of fire, etc. is not impaired.

original: gang las du ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir nges pas de la 'jug na de ni slu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las du ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir nges pas de la 'jug na de ni slu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one engages in activity because of the certainty that one sees smoke, etc. and then is deceived, that is not a fault of the cause.

original: sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis skye ba nyid kyang 'gro ba sna tshogs su mthong ba'i rgyu nyams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis skye ba nyid kyang 'gro ba sna tshogs su mthong ba'i rgyu nyams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the variety of migrating beings is not impaired, since they are born by the power of the karma of all sentient beings.

original: de'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba na de ma yin pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba na de ma yin pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one engages in activity because of seeing the effect, one does not obtain what is not that.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression.

original: ci yang 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la mi dmigs pa dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo yin zhe na de yod na ni yod la med na ni med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci yang 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la mi dmigs pa dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo yin zhe na de yod na ni yod la med na ni med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you ask, “What is the nature of the reason for the direct perception of the nonobservation of things that are cause and effect?”🔽If it exists, it exists; if it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de kho na yod la 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa yod pa kho na dang / de med pa ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa de med na med pa nyid ni 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de kho na yod la 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa yod pa kho na dang / de med pa ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa de med na med pa nyid ni 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa med pa'o //
translated: That which is asserted to be the cause exists; that which is asserted to be the effect exists. If that which is asserted to be the cause does not exist, that which is asserted to be the effect does not exist.

original: de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yod pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yod pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: That is not different from the existence of cause and effect.

original: de ni de dag las gzhan gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor ma rtogs pa @209b 'am ;
analyzed: de ni de dag las gzhan gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor ma rtogs pa @209b 'am ;
translated: It is not a different nature from them. It is not understood to be the nature of cause and effect.

original: yang na rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin /
analyzed: yang na rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin /
translated: Or, it is the nature of cause and effect that is a nature.

original: gang gi tshe dang po'i phyogs yin pa de'i tshe thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dang po'i phyogs yin pa de'i tshe thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: If the former is the case, then everything would be a real cause and effect.

original: rgyu'i dngos po nges pa med pa des na thams cad thams cad kyi 'bras bur thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rang bzhin gyis de'i ngo bo yin na ni gzhan dang 'brel pa yang de'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po nges pa med pa des na thams cad thams cad kyi 'bras bur thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rang bzhin gyis de'i ngo bo yin na ni gzhan dang 'brel pa yang de'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: Since the nature of a cause is not definite, it follows that everything would be the effect of everything. If it were by nature that entity, then it would not be the entity of another.

original: dngos po so sor nges pa'i ngo bo spangs nas gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po so sor nges pa'i ngo bo spangs nas gzhan dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Having abandoned the nature of individual things, it is not associated with another,

original: ngo bo gzhan la mi brten pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan la mi brten pas so //
translated: because the nature of one thing does not depend on another.

original: gang gis gzhan dang ldan pa de dag gis snga ma'i ngo bo ni 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan dang ldan pa de dag gis snga ma'i ngo bo ni 'jig pa yin te /
translated: That which is associated with another has destroyed its former nature.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni mi rigs par phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni mi rigs par phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: Later we will explain that it is illogical for a cause to destroy.

original: sngar med pa yang skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar med pa yang skye ba ma yin te /
translated: That which did not exist previously is not produced,

original: de las don gzhan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las don gzhan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be different from that.

original: de rnams la grub pa rnams sngar ma grub ba tha mi dad pa'i rgyu can ni de'i rang bzhin du mi rigs pa 'am tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'di dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de rnams la grub pa rnams sngar ma grub ba tha mi dad pa'i rgyu can ni de'i rang bzhin du mi rigs pa 'am tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'di dag rgyu med par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Or else, they would be without cause, whether they are different or nondifferent.

original: / dngos po rnams la gang chos 'gal ba gnas pa dang rgyu tha dad pas so //
analyzed: / dngos po rnams la gang chos 'gal ba gnas pa dang rgyu tha dad pas so //
translated: Because of the presence of contradictory properties and different causes in things.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan med pas tha dad pa med pa de lta na sna tshogs pa gcig par 'gyur ba la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan med pas tha dad pa med pa de lta na sna tshogs pa gcig par 'gyur ba la sogs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
