translated: Therefore, because there is no other reason, if they are nondifferent, the absurd consequence follows that the various are one.

original: so sor snang ba tha dad pa yang gcig la gcig med pa'i ngo bos 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa las 'da' ba ni med do //
analyzed: so sor snang ba tha dad pa yang gcig la gcig med pa'i ngo bos 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa las 'da' ba ni med do //
translated: And the appearance of each as different is not beyond the presence of contradictory properties in one thing by means of a nature that is mutually exclusive.

original: de'i phyir snga ma'i dngos po de'i gnas skabs kho na yin pa'i phyir de dag gzhan dang ldan pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo thob pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma'i dngos po de'i gnas skabs kho na yin pa'i phyir de dag gzhan dang ldan pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo thob pa med do //
translated: Therefore, because it is just the state of the previous thing, they do not obtain the nature of cause and effect even when they possess something else.

original: yang na phyogs gnyis pa yin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin kho nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gzhan don med pa ji ltar nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na phyogs gnyis pa yin pa de'i tshe rang bzhin kho nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gzhan don med pa ji ltar nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Or, if it is the second case, then because the nature of cause and effect is just the nature of the thing itself, how could the nature of the thing itself, which is not different from them, not be experienced?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i blo yang de kho na yod pa nyid tsam dang rjes su 'brel pas //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i blo yang de kho na yod pa nyid tsam dang rjes su 'brel pas //
translated: And the cognition of cause and effect is related to the mere existence of that thing itself.

original: don gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan de ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bos dben pa'i ngo bos gzhan mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan de ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bos dben pa'i ngo bos gzhan mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for the other thing is the observed object, but the nature of the thing itself, which is devoid of the nature of cause and effect, does not appear as different from that.

original: rnam pa de lta bu yang bzung nas brtag na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu yang bzung nas brtag na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to apprehend and investigate such a nature, it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de'i don gzhan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i blo'i rgyu mtshan ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas ji ltar rang yod pa tsam gyis de'i blo 'jug par mi 'gyur rtag tu nye ba nyid kyis de dag 'dir thams @210a * //
analyzed: de'i don gzhan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i blo'i rgyu mtshan ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pas ji ltar rang yod pa tsam gyis de'i blo 'jug par mi 'gyur rtag tu nye ba nyid kyis de dag 'dir thams @210a * //
translated: Since the reason for the cognition of cause and effect, which is different from that, possesses the characteristic of non-apprehension, how could the cognition of that arise from the mere existence of that thing itself? It would always be present, because it is always present.

original: cad kyi tshe skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cad kyi tshe skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would follow that it would arise at all times.

original: bye brag ma bzung bar bye brag tu bya ba yang rang nyid bye brag can du shes pa'i rgyu mtshan mi rigs te /
analyzed: bye brag ma bzung bar bye brag tu bya ba yang rang nyid bye brag can du shes pa'i rgyu mtshan mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not reasonable that a qualifier, without being specified, be the reason for knowing the qualified itself,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur ba yin no //
translated: because it would be the characteristic of non-apprehension.

original: mthong ba yang mi rtogs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: mthong ba yang mi rtogs par mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not reasonable that seeing not be ascertained,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i blo la de'i rgyu mtshan khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i blo la de'i rgyu mtshan khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of cause and effect is accepted as the reason for that.

original: gang gi rgyu mtshan gyis gzhan la de'i blo rten cing nges pa gang yin pa de ni de'i nye bar mtshon par mi rigs pa nyid de dbyig pas dbyig pa can nges par byed pa med na lha sbyin dbyug pa can nye bar mi mtshon pa bzhin no
analyzed: gang gi rgyu mtshan gyis gzhan la de'i blo rten cing nges pa gang yin pa de ni de'i nye bar mtshon par mi rigs pa nyid de dbyig pas dbyig pa can nges par byed pa med na lha sbyin dbyug pa can nye bar mi mtshon pa bzhin no
translated: And it is not reasonable that the reason for the ascertainment of the cognition of that in another be its indication, just as, without the ascertainment of the stick by the stick-possessor, Devadatta is not indicated as the stick-possessor.

original: // rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi 'brel pa don gzhan pa ni 'thad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: // rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi 'brel pa don gzhan pa ni 'thad pa ma yin la /
translated: The relation of cause and effect is not tenable as a different object.

original: 'brel pa gzhan brtags na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo khas blangs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig mi 'byung bar de yod pa dang / de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu de nye ba ma yin pas ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i blor 'gyur /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan brtags na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo khas blangs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig mi 'byung bar de yod pa dang / de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu de nye ba ma yin pas ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i blor 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since cause and effect are not simultaneous, how can there be the cognition of cause and effect?

original: 'gags pa dag de'i shes pas sgro btags nas brtags pa la rtogs pa'i yul nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur mngon par zhen pa yin na ni dngos po'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gags pa dag de'i shes pas sgro btags nas brtags pa la rtogs pa'i yul nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur mngon par zhen pa yin na ni dngos po'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: If you imagine that the cognition of cause and effect is based on the designation of the cessation of the cause by the cognition of the effect, then the object of the cognition is not a real entity.

original: de yang khyad par can yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan khas blangs pa'i phyir ci don gzhan du brtags nas rtogs pa'i yul der mngon par zhen pa de don med do //
analyzed: de yang khyad par can yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan khas blangs pa'i phyir ci don gzhan du brtags nas rtogs pa'i yul der mngon par zhen pa de don med do //
translated: And if you imagine that the object of the cognition is a real entity, then the designation of the cause and effect is meaningless, because you accept the reason for the existence and nonexistence of the qualified thing.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu cig car na yin te /
translated: And if cause and effect are simultaneous,

original: lhan cig tu 'di dag skye ba med do //
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'di dag skye ba med do //
translated: they do not arise together.

original: so sor skye na yang ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin /
analyzed: so sor skye na yang ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin /
translated: If they arise separately, how could they be the entity of cause and effect?

original: gang gi tshe rgyu las skye ba de'i tshe ci rang gi 'bras bu lhan cig skye'am yang na 'ba' zhig yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu las skye ba de'i tshe ci rang gi 'bras bu lhan cig skye'am yang na 'ba' zhig yin /
translated: When it arises from a cause, at that time, does its own effect arise simultaneously or not?

original: 'ba' zhig kyang cig rang gi 'bras bu'i sngar ram yang na phyis yin /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kyang cig rang gi 'bras bu'i sngar ram yang na phyis yin /
translated: If it is not, then is it prior to its own effect or is it subsequent?

original: gal te rang gi 'bras bu dang lhan cig gnyi ga gzhan las yod pas phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i 'brel pa med pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang gi 'bras bu dang lhan cig gnyi ga gzhan las yod pas phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i 'brel pa med pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: If it arises simultaneously with its own effect, since both exist from another, they would be unrelated to each other, and the effect would be devoid of the relation of being an effect.

original: yang na 'ba' zhig rang gi 'bras bu las sngar de skad cig ma rgyu yin pas de nyid skye bar 'gyur ba nyid na zhig pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu byed pa yin /
analyzed: yang na 'ba' zhig rang gi 'bras bu las sngar de skad cig ma rgyu yin pas de nyid skye bar 'gyur ba nyid na zhig pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu byed pa yin /
translated: If it is not, then prior to its own effect, it is a momentary cause. When it itself arises, it has already disintegrated, so how could it be a cause of its effect?

original: de yang yod na ji ltar rgyu 'di la ltos pa yin /
analyzed: de yang yod na ji ltar rgyu 'di la ltos pa yin /
translated: If it exists, how could it rely on this cause?

original: de med pa las yin na ji ltar rgyu ma yin pas 'bras bu rgyu dang 'brel ba las skye ba yin /
analyzed: de med pa las yin na ji ltar rgyu ma yin pas 'bras bu rgyu dang 'brel ba las skye ba yin /
translated: If it does not exist, how could the effect arise from a cause that is not a cause?

original: yang na rang gi 'bras bu byas zin nas phyis @210b skye na ni de yang 'bras bu'i tshe zhig pa'i phyir med pa de dus phyis 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po skyed pa ga la yin de'i dngos po yang 'brel pa brjod na /
analyzed: yang na rang gi 'bras bu byas zin nas phyis @210b skye na ni de yang 'bras bu'i tshe zhig pa'i phyir med pa de dus phyis 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po skyed pa ga la yin de'i dngos po yang 'brel pa brjod na /
translated: Or if it arises later after its result has already been produced, then since it would be nonexistent at the time of the result because it has disintegrated, how could it be the cause that produces the entity of the result that arises later?🔽If you say that the entity of the result is related to the cause,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir gnyis la gnas par gal 'gyur de med na ji ltar 'brel pa yin /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir gnyis la gnas par gal 'gyur de med na ji ltar 'brel pa yin /
translated: since the cause and result do not occur simultaneously, how could it be related to the two? If it does not exist, how could it be related?

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag skyes pa las sngar de rten la yod pa ma gtogs pa dag phyi nas kyang rang bzhin gzhan la 'jug pas de ma yin pa la brten pa nyid dang rten med pas de dngos po'i rkyen
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag skyes pa las sngar de rten la yod pa ma gtogs pa dag phyi nas kyang rang bzhin gzhan la 'jug pas de ma yin pa la brten pa nyid dang rten med pas de dngos po'i rkyen
translated: Also, if it is not momentary, then apart from the cause and result existing prior to arising, they would not engage in a different nature later. Therefore, since it would not be related to that which is not itself and would not be related to a nonexistent basis, it would not be a condition of an entity.

original: nam rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: nam rgyu ma yin no //
translated: It would not be a cause.

original: yang na 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bur brjod pa dang shes pa dag yin de'i tshe 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid kyi 'bras bu ni 'du ba las rgyu nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bur brjod pa dang shes pa dag yin de'i tshe 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid kyi 'bras bu ni 'du ba las rgyu nyid du 'gyur /
translated: In that case, the effect of the cause that inheres in them would be the cause due to inhering in them.

original: rgyu mtshan dang 'du ba med pa'i rgyu dang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang 'du ba med pa'i rgyu dang ma yin te /
translated: But the effect is not the cause that inheres in it, nor is it the cause that does not inhere in it.

original: 'bras bu ni de 'dra ba'i 'bras bu nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de 'dra ba'i 'bras bu nyid de /
translated: And that is the effect of that kind.

original: de yang thams cad la bye brag med pas dngos po thams cad phan tshun rgyu dang 'dras bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang thams cad la bye brag med pas dngos po thams cad phan tshun rgyu dang 'dras bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since it is not differentiated, all entities would be the nature of cause and effect in relation to each other.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma yong pa dang med pa'i bye brag gis de yang 'dir de ni 'brel ba med par mi rigs pas bogs dbyung du med pa la de mi rigs so //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma yong pa dang med pa'i bye brag gis de yang 'dir de ni 'brel ba med par mi rigs pas bogs dbyung du med pa la de mi rigs so //
translated: Since it is not tenable that that which is related to the prior and posterior is not differentiated, it is not tenable that it is not enhanced.

original: de dag nyid dam de'i khyad par dag de'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes dgongs nas de yong na ni yod la de med na ni med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dag nyid dam de'i khyad par dag de'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes dgongs nas de yong na ni yod la de med na ni med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo zhes bshad do //
translated: Thinking that those very things or their distinctions are its characteristics, it is said that when it exists, they exist, and when it does not exist, they do not exist, and therefore it is the nature of cause and effect.

original: de ltar re zhig mi dmigs pa dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod na yod pa'i yul la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mi dmigs pa dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod na yod pa'i yul la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, if cause and effect exist, they exist in a context that is the object of perception and non-apprehension.

original: de yod na ni yod la de med na ni med pa mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa bshad do //
analyzed: de yod na ni yod la de med na ni med pa mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa bshad do //
translated: We have explained the proof of the characteristic of existence, i.e., that if it exists, it exists; if it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: res 'ga' zhig mi dmigs pa 'am mngon sum sngon pas rgyu dang 'bras bu sgrub pa'i phyir de'i yul re zhig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig mi dmigs pa 'am mngon sum sngon pas rgyu dang 'bras bu sgrub pa'i phyir de'i yul re zhig bstan pa ni /
translated: Sometimes, non-apprehension or perception proves cause and effect. Therefore, the object of that is sometimes taught.

original: rgyu gzhan rnams yod kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan rnams yod kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Even though the other causes exist,”

original: du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i skye bo'i tshogs pa can dag ni tshogs pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu me dang bud shing la sogs pa'i skye bo'i tshogs pa can dag ni tshogs pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: because the effect, such as smoke, is a collection of causes, such as fire and fuel, etc. A collection is not different from the collection.

original: tshogs pa rnams rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnams rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not different from the collection, it would follow, absurdly, that the collection would be causeless.

original: 'bras bu de la ltos pa ma yin na dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu de la ltos pa ma yin na dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not depend on the effect, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be a non-thing.

original: gal te de dang 'bras pas de la ltos pa yin no zhe na //
analyzed: gal te de dang 'bras pas de la ltos pa yin no zhe na //
translated: If you say that it depends on the effect because it is related to it,

original: 'dir su zhig skyed par byed pa ma yin na don gzhan dang 'brel pas @211a * //
analyzed: 'dir su zhig skyed par byed pa ma yin na don gzhan dang 'brel pas @211a * //
translated: If it is not produced by anyone, then it is related to something else.

original: yin / skyed par byed na yang tshogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho nas skyed bar byed pa yin te //
analyzed: yin / skyed par byed na yang tshogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho nas skyed bar byed pa yin te //
translated: If it is produced, then it is produced by the intrinsic nature of the assemblage itself.

original: 'bras bu gcig byed pa la 'di dag nus pa med dam gang gis na gzhan zhig bstan par bya /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig byed pa la 'di dag nus pa med dam gang gis na gzhan zhig bstan par bya /
translated: If it is not capable of producing a single effect, then why is another one postulated?

original: de la yang gzhan gyi tshogs pa dang 'brel la ltos pa yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan gyi tshogs pa dang 'brel la ltos pa yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is related to another assemblage, then there is an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa kho nas skyed bar byed pa de dag kyang rgyu re re thabs kyis 'bras bu tha dad pa de dpag par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa kho nas skyed bar byed pa de dag kyang rgyu re re thabs kyis 'bras bu tha dad pa de dpag par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, the producer is only the assemblage. But the individual causes within the assemblage are inferred to be the producers of the distinct effects.

original: rgyu gzhan rnams yod kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan rnams yod kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus he says, “Even though the other causes exist,”

original: tshogs pa can gyi nang du gtogs pa'i rgyu'i skyed par byed pa rnams ni so sor de dag kyang skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'di skyed par byed pa med pa nyid du bzung nas /
analyzed: tshogs pa can gyi nang du gtogs pa'i rgyu'i skyed par byed pa rnams ni so sor de dag kyang skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'di skyed par byed pa med pa nyid du bzung nas /
translated: because the individual causes that are included in the assemblage are the producers of the individual effects, the effect is not grasped as being without a cause.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i med pa las yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis mi dmigs pa'i yul bshad do //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i med pa las yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis mi dmigs pa'i yul bshad do //
translated: The phrase “not from a non-existent” in the statement of the thesis indicates the object of non-apprehension.

original: yang na mngon sum gyi 'jug pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mi dmigs pas spangs nas de yod na yod pa 'dzin pa ni srid pa yin te ;
analyzed: yang na mngon sum gyi 'jug pa ni sngar bshad pa'i mi dmigs pas spangs nas de yod na yod pa 'dzin pa ni srid pa yin te ;
translated: Or, the operation of perception is to apprehend the existence of an object when it exists, having eliminated the object of non-apprehension explained above.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang de yod na yod la de med na ni med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa ci zhig snyam na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang de yod na yod la de med na ni med pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa ci zhig snyam na /
translated: In the same way, here, what is the proof of the relation of cause and effect, which is the existence of the effect when the cause exists and the non-existence of the effect when the cause does not exist?

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase “perception and non-apprehension prove” is stated.

original: mngon sum sngon du song ba'i mi dmigs pa don gzhan gyis dben pa 'dzin par byed pa mngon sum gyi bdag nyid 'di sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes mngon sum dang mi dmigs bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo sgrub par byed ba yin gyi gang mi
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du song ba'i mi dmigs pa don gzhan gyis dben pa 'dzin par byed pa mngon sum gyi bdag nyid 'di sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes mngon sum dang mi dmigs bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo sgrub par byed ba yin gyi gang mi
translated: The proof of the relation of cause and effect is by perception and non-apprehension, because the apprehension of the absence of another object, which is non-apprehension preceded by perception, is the proof of the nature of perception itself. Thus, perception and non-apprehension prove the nature of cause and effect.

original: dmigs ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes sngar bshad do //
analyzed: dmigs ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes sngar bshad do //
translated: It was explained above that it is established by a direct perception that is dependent on an object.

original: de mi dmigs pa sngon du song ba'i mngon sum 'di sgrub par byed pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang mngon sum sgrub par byed par brjod bar bya'o //🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de'i rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa grub par nges pa dag ji skad bshad pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa nges pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa sngon du song ba'i mngon sum 'di sgrub par byed pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang mngon sum sgrub par byed par brjod bar bya'o // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de'i rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa grub par nges pa dag ji skad bshad pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa nges pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since this non-apprehension is the means of establishing that, it is called the means of establishing non-apprehension and direct perception.🔽The ascertainment of the establishment of the forward and reverse pervasions of the relation of cause and effect is the ascertainment of the relation of cause and effect, which is the ascertainment of the relation of cause and effect, which is the ascertainment of the forward and reverse pervasions of the relation of cause and effect.

original: 'o na ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa thams cad du 'bras bu 'byung ba ni rang gi rgyu yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes bya bar sgrub pa'i skabs yin na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por sgrub ba🔽nyid 'dir brjod snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba nges pa thams cad du 'bras bu 'byung ba ni rang gi rgyu yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no zhes bya bar sgrub pa'i skabs yin na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por sgrub ba🔽nyid 'dir brjod snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: If the ascertainment of the forward pervasion of a causal reason is always the establishment of the occurrence of the effect when its cause exists, then how is the relation of cause and effect established in this case?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub ba @211b rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nges pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags nas gzhan ma yin pa'i thabs kyis bsgrub bar bya ba bstan pa ni mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gang dag 'dod
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub ba @211b rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba nges pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags nas gzhan ma yin pa'i thabs kyis bsgrub bar bya ba bstan pa ni mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gang dag 'dod
translated: Because the existence of cause and effect is the reason, the ascertainment of the pervasion is taught by the method of non-difference, by applying the effect to the cause.

original: pa de'i 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir 'di bstan pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: pa de'i 'dod pa bsal ba'i phyir 'di bstan pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: This is explained in order to eliminate the assertion of those who assert that the reason is merely seeing.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba smos te //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba smos te //
translated: He says, The nature of cause and effect exists.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni yod pa'o //
translated: The nature of cause and effect exists.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: Ni means because.

original: don gzhan pa ni bsgrub par bya ba las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan pa ni bsgrub par bya ba las tha dad pa'o //
translated: Different object means different from the probandum.

original: gang tha mi dad pa de ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pas de'i bdag nyid du nges pa kho na'i rjes su 'gro ba sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gang tha mi dad pa de ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma 'jug pas de'i bdag nyid du nges pa kho na'i rjes su 'gro ba sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro//
translated: That which is non-different is ascertained to be of that nature alone, because the valid cognition that contradicts it operates. This is the pervasion explained earlier.

original: don gzhan smos pa ni de ni don gzhan pa nyid la'ang de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan smos pa ni de ni don gzhan pa nyid la'ang de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: The other meaning is that it would be like that for other meanings as well.

original: ji ltar gang na la lar du ba yod pa de la me gdon mi za bar nges pas me de la yod do zhes bya ba 'dis gzugs kyi rjes su 'gro ba yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gang na la lar du ba yod pa de la me gdon mi za bar nges pas me de la yod do zhes bya ba 'dis gzugs kyi rjes su 'gro ba yang yin te /
translated: Just as wherever there is smoke there is fire, and fire exists there, it is certain.

original: gang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma yin yang ro don gzhan pa gzugs las rjes su 'gro ba nges pa de ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas de'i rang gi rgyu'i sgo nas mi 'khrul pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma yin yang ro don gzhan pa gzugs las rjes su 'gro ba nges pa de ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas de'i rang gi rgyu'i sgo nas mi 'khrul pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Although it is not the nature of cause and effect, the certainty of the other meaning following from form is because it is dependent on the same collection. There is no fault because it is unmistaken through its own cause.

original: yang na gal te me'i 'bras bu du ba yin pa de lta na yang gang na 'di yod pa de la gdon mi za bar me yod pa cis na yin /
analyzed: yang na gal te me'i 'bras bu du ba yin pa de lta na yang gang na 'di yod pa de la gdon mi za bar me yod pa cis na yin /
translated: Or, if smoke is the effect of fire, then why is it that wherever this exists, fire definitely exists?

original: gang gi rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba brjod do snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi rgyu dang 'bras bu yod par grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'gro ba brjod do snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that the reason for the existence of cause and effect is stated as the certainty of following,

original: me yod na yod pa kho na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: me yod na yod pa kho na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said that it exists only when fire exists.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: “Ni” means “because.”

original: yod na yod pa 'bras bu nyid du ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na yod pa 'bras bu nyid du ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it exists, it is the effect of the existence of the other.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la yod na yod pa nyid ji skad bshad pa ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la yod na yod pa nyid ji skad bshad pa ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the positive concomitance of the existence of the effect with the existence of the cause, as it has been explained, is the ascertainment of the positive concomitance of the effect with the cause.

original: gal te gang na du ba yod pa de la gdon mi za bar me yod bar ma gyur la de me med kyang yod bas me'i yod pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gang na du ba yod pa de la gdon mi za bar me yod bar ma gyur la de me med kyang yod bas me'i yod pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the existence of smoke in a place does not necessarily entail the existence of fire, and if it exists even where there is no fire, then the effect would not have the characteristic of being the state of existence of the cause.

original: da ni mi dmigs pa'i 'brel pa nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mi dmigs pa'i 'brel pa nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the ascertainment of the relation of nonobservation,

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya smos te /
translated: he says, “Nonobservation,” etc.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig gi rjes su 'gro ba nges ba bshad pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang brjod par bya na 'di'i ngo bo ci zhig yin ce na /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig gi rjes su 'gro ba nges ba bshad pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang brjod par bya na 'di'i ngo bo ci zhig yin ce na /
translated: The ascertainment of the positive concomitance is not explained only in terms of the reasons of nature and effect, but rather, the ascertainment of the positive concomitance of nonobservation should also be mentioned. What is its nature?

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi zhes bya ba smos te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su rung ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /🔽de med pa'i @212a * //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi zhes bya ba smos te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su rung ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir / de med pa'i @212a * //
translated: The expression of nonexistence is what is to be proven.

original: tha snyad du rung bar mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: tha snyad du rung bar mngon par 'dod do //
translated: It is what is explicitly asserted.

original: de ni dmigs ba'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa de ni gzhan mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs ba'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa de ni gzhan mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nonapprehension of that which is the object of apprehension is the nature of the nonapprehension of something else.

original: de tsam ni rgyu mtshan la mi ltos par med pa'i tha snyad la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de tsam ni rgyu mtshan la mi ltos par med pa'i tha snyad la 'jug pa'o //
translated: That alone is the engagement in the expression of nonexistence without relying on a reason.

original: de sgrub par byed pa ni rjes su 'gro ba nges par grub pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa ni rjes su 'gro ba nges par grub pa'o //
translated: The proof of that is the establishment of the ascertainment of the positive concomitance.

original: yang med pa'i tha snyad tsam la 'jug par 'gyur ba ga las she na /
analyzed: yang med pa'i tha snyad tsam la 'jug par 'gyur ba ga las she na /
translated: How does one engage in the expression of mere nonexistence?

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan med par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan med par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase “because one sees that there is no other reason” is stated.

original: gang med pa'i tha snyad kyang ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i blo dang sgra don byed nus pas stong pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bya ba bsgrub pa de'i tshe ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs ba tsam gyi 'jug
analyzed: gang med pa'i tha snyad kyang ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i blo dang sgra don byed nus pas stong pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bya ba bsgrub pa de'i tshe ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs ba tsam gyi 'jug
translated: The expression “does not exist” is not a reason for the cognition or verbal expression of non-apprehension, as explained, or for the emptiness of causal efficiency.

original: pas grub ba ma yin te /
analyzed: pas grub ba ma yin te /
translated: When this is established, it is not established by the mere occurrence of the non-apprehension as explained.

original: de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba grub pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the pervasion is established.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos bar dogs pa yang bden no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos bar dogs pa yang bden no //
translated: Otherwise, it is true that one would doubt the dependence on another reason.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs par gdon mi za bar med pa'i tha snyad mi 'gyur na gang las rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i mi dmigs par gdon mi za bar med pa'i tha snyad mi 'gyur na gang las rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yin snyam na /
translated: If the expression “does not exist” does not necessarily follow from the non-apprehension as explained, from what is the pervasion ascertained?

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa ni rtsod pa'i rigs par rgya cher bshad pas de nyid du nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa ni rtsod pa'i rigs par rgya cher bshad pas de nyid du nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Since the absence of another reason is explained at length in the Nyāyamukha, it should be ascertained from there.

original: yang na yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las yod pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan ni de la mi dmigs pas med pa nye bar bstan pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de nyid🔽kyis bshad do //
analyzed: yang na yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba las yod pa de ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan ni de la mi dmigs pas med pa nye bar bstan pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de nyid kyis bshad do //
translated: That is explained by the valid knowledge that teaches nonexistence.

original: des na yod pa'i dngos po ni mi srid par nges pas mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'i ldog pa dpyad pa'i tshe bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: des na yod pa'i dngos po ni mi srid par nges pas mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'i ldog pa dpyad pa'i tshe bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the existence of a thing is ascertained to be impossible, the pervasion of nonobservation should be explained when the reverse pervasion is analyzed.

original: de nyid ni gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po'i bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po'i bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: That is the explanation of the valid knowledge that is the nature of the three kinds of reasons.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa de'i bdag nyid 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa de'i bdag nyid 'brel pa grub pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason of nature is established by the fact that there is a valid cognition that contradicts the opposite of that, and the reason of effect is established by the fact that direct perception and non-observation establish the reason of the entity of cause and effect.

original: mi dmigs pa la rgyu mtshan gzhan med pas sgrub bar byed ba'i tshad mas de med pas gtan tshigs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la rgyu mtshan gzhan med pas sgrub bar byed ba'i tshad mas de med pas gtan tshigs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no other reason for non-observation, the valid cognition that proves it establishes the reason by the absence of that.

original: re zhig gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum yang rang rang gi tshad mas ldog pa nges pa'i rgyu @212b mtshan bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum yang rang rang gi tshad mas ldog pa nges pa'i rgyu @212b mtshan bstan to //
translated: The reason for ascertaining the reversal of each of the three types of reasons has been explained by valid cognition.

original: ldog pa nges pa yang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa yang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: Reversal is ascertained not only by ascertaining the forward pervasion.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad ma dag gi rgyu mtshan bshad kyang 'bras bu rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa nges pa yang bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan brjod do//
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad ma dag gi rgyu mtshan bshad kyang 'bras bu rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa nges pa yang bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan brjod do//
translated: The reason for the valid knowledge that is just as it is is explained, and the ascertainment of the opposite of the result, the reason of nature, is also stated as the reason for the valid knowledge that is just as it is.

original: yang ci 'dir bsgrub par bya ba med na med par grub pa gang de'i bdag nyid yin nam /
analyzed: yang ci 'dir bsgrub par bya ba med na med par grub pa gang de'i bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: Moreover, is that which is established as not existing if the object of affirmation does not exist the same as the object of affirmation?

original: bsgrub par bya ba med na med bar grub pa de dag tshad ma gang gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med na med bar grub pa de dag tshad ma gang gis yin zhe na /
translated: By what valid knowledge are those established as not existing if the object of affirmation does not exist?

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag las 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni rgyu mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba med na med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag las 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni rgyu mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba med na med par nges pa yin no //
translated: From among the nonobservation of a cause and the nonobservation of a pervader, a reason of effect is ascertained as not existing if the object of affirmation does not exist by the nonobservation of a cause.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni khyab bar byed pa mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni khyab bar byed pa mi dmigs pas so //
translated: A reason of nature is ascertained as not existing if the object of affirmation does not exist by the nonobservation of a pervader.

original: nam zhig na mi dmigs pa de sgrub bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nam zhig na mi dmigs pa de sgrub bar 'gyur /
translated: When is that nonobservation established?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i ngo bor grub na'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i ngo bor grub na'o //
translated: When the nature of the effect, the pervaded, and the pervader is established.

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor grub pa bden na rgyu mi dmigs pas 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub bar bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med pa 'grub po //🔽bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma de yod pa'i rgyu mtshan 'jug pa na grub pas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos por grub pa yod na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor grub pa bden na rgyu mi dmigs pas 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub bar bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med pa 'grub po // bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma de yod pa'i rgyu mtshan 'jug pa na grub pas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos por grub pa yod na /
translated: If the nature of cause and effect were established by direct perception and non-apprehension, then if the probandum of the effect-evidence were absent, because of the non-apprehension of the cause, the absence of the probans would be established.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med pa 'grub po //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med pa 'grub po //
translated: When the reason of the counter-pervasion is engaged, the reason of the pervasion is established. If the pervaded and the pervader were established as real entities, then if the probandum of the natural evidence were absent, because of the non-apprehension of the pervader, the absence of the probans would be established.

original: de ni de skad du brjod pas gang la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa nges pa nyid kyis gnyi ga'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de skad du brjod pas gang la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa nges pa nyid kyis gnyi ga'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: That is what is being said. When the relation of the nature of that and arising from that is ascertained, the pervasion and counter-pervasion of both are explained.

original: de nyid kyis na gzhan du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gzhan du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, it has been explained that they are the nature of cause and effect in other cases.

original: ci 'dra ba dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bltar rung ba'i yul gang dag yin pa de dag la'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bltar rung ba'i yul gang dag yin pa de dag la'o //
translated: They are the objects that are visible, as they have been explained.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa de'i bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa de'i bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When the cause and the pervader are perceptible, but are not perceived, then, at that time, the non-perception of that which is to be established is the non-existence of the proof.

original: nam zhig na de dag snang du rung ba'i yul gyi bye brag la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: nam zhig na de dag snang du rung ba'i yul gyi bye brag la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
translated: When are they suitable to appear?

original: nye bar bstan pa'i yul la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa'i yul la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “in the case of the object that is indicated.”

original: nye bar bstan pa ni brjod @213a * //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa ni brjod @213a * //
translated: “Indicated” means “expressed.”

original: ba'o ; / yul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i gzhi'i mtshan nyid gang bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos med na med pa de nye bar bstan pa ni bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ba'o ; / yul ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i gzhi'i mtshan nyid gang bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos med na med pa de nye bar bstan pa ni bya ba yin no //
translated: The object is the basis of the characteristic of the dissimilar example. The non-existence of the property to be established is the non-existence of that. The indication is the action.

original: gal te de la yang snang du rung ba'i yul la ci'i phyir ltos she na /
analyzed: gal te de la yang snang du rung ba'i yul la ci'i phyir ltos she na /
translated: If you ask why it is necessary to rely on an object that is suitable to appear,

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te gzhan du na ni gal te snang du rung ba'i yul gyi bye brag gi mi dmigs pa la mi ltos pa na'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te gzhan du na ni gal te snang du rung ba'i yul gyi bye brag gi mi dmigs pa la mi ltos pa na'o //
translated: he says, “If it is not non-observation,” and so on. Otherwise, if it does not rely on the non-observation of a specific object that is suitable to appear,

original: gang dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur ba'i yul gyi chos mi mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa de'i tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur ba de ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa yin no zhes mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i rgyu'am khyab par byed pa la
analyzed: gang dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur ba'i yul gyi chos mi mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa de'i tshe dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur ba de ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa yin no zhes mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i rgyu'am khyab par byed pa la
translated: then at that time, that which is not an observed object is the reason or the pervader.

original: lar bskal ba'i yul ri rab la sogs pa med par mi 'grub na ci bsgrub par bya ba med pas sgrub par byed pa med ba dag ji ltar 'grub bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: lar bskal ba'i yul ri rab la sogs pa med par mi 'grub na ci bsgrub par bya ba med pas sgrub par byed pa med ba dag ji ltar 'grub bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that since the object of the reason, such as Meru, is not established as nonexistent, how could the nonexistence of the probandum be established, and thus how could the prover be established,

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid du grub pas 'grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid du grub pas 'grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
translated: he thinks that it is established because the nonobservation of the reason and the pervader is established.

original: 'on te yul nye bar ma bstan kyang med pa nye bar bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa snang ba'i yul gyi bye brag la cis na ltos par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yul nye bar ma bstan kyang med pa nye bar bstan pa'i mi dmigs pa snang ba'i yul gyi bye brag la cis na ltos par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if the object is not specified, why is non-apprehension not dependent on the particular of the apparent object, even though non-existence is specified?

original: yul nye bar ma bstan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul nye bar ma bstan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “The object is not specified.”

original: yul nye bar ma bstan pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yul nye bar ma bstan pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The object is not specified, this is the nature of the dissimilar example.

original: gang la bsgrub bar bya ba med pa la med pa bshad pas de'i 'brel pa tsam grub ste yod na snang ba'i yul gyi bye brag med kyang gang gi phyir 'grub pa de'i phyir de la yul nye bar ma bstan pa ni ldog pa sgrub par byed pa'i
analyzed: gang la bsgrub bar bya ba med pa la med pa bshad pas de'i 'brel pa tsam grub ste yod na snang ba'i yul gyi bye brag med kyang gang gi phyir 'grub pa de'i phyir de la yul nye bar ma bstan pa ni ldog pa sgrub par byed pa'i
translated: Where the probandum is absent, the absence is stated, and the mere connection of that is established. If it existed, even though the particular of the apparent object is absent, because it is established, therefore, there the object is not specified, and the negation is established.

original: mi dmigs pa bltar rung ba'i yul gyi bye brag la ltos pa ma yin pa ni yan lag tu mi byed do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa bltar rung ba'i yul gyi bye brag la ltos pa ma yin pa ni yan lag tu mi byed do //
translated: Non-apprehension is not dependent on the particular of the apparent object, and is not taken as a part.

original: de lta na don mtha' dag yongs su ma bzung ba'i spyir brjod pa yang dang gang la 'brel pa'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba de dag ni de med med na gdon mi za bar med pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na don mtha' dag yongs su ma bzung ba'i spyir brjod pa yang dang gang la 'brel pa'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba de dag ni de med med na gdon mi za bar med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, when the general statement “all objects” is not taken to be inclusive, then those things that are related to the nature of that thing or that arise from that thing, certainly do not exist when that thing does not exist.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyu ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyu ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that they would not be its nature or its cause.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rang bzhin la yang med mi 'byung //
analyzed: rang bzhin la yang med mi 'byung //
translated: Nor does it arise from what does not exist.

original: yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin //
analyzed: yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin //
translated: It is related to mere existence.

original: de med par ni rang yod dag / med 'gyur tha dad med phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par ni rang yod dag / med 'gyur tha dad med phyir ro //
translated: If it existed without that, it would not exist, because it would not be different.

original: de bzhin du /🔽me yi 'bras bu du ba ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du / me yi 'bras bu du ba ste //
translated: Similarly:🔽The effect of fire is smoke.

original: du ba chos kyi rjes 'jug pa //
analyzed: du ba chos kyi rjes 'jug pa //
translated: Smoke is related to the property of fire.

original: de med par ni de yod na //
analyzed: de med par ni de yod na //
translated: If it existed without that,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //🔽ces bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur // ces bshad do //
translated: it would be beyond having a cause.

original: de dang @213b de ni snang ba'i yul la ltos par bya ba la phan 'dogs par mi byed na //
analyzed: de dang @213b de ni snang ba'i yul la ltos par bya ba la phan 'dogs par mi byed na //
translated: If that and this do not assist the dependence on the object of appearance,

original: de dag ni cung zad cig kyang med do //
analyzed: de dag ni cung zad cig kyang med do //
translated: then they do not exist in the least.

original: 'brel pa tsam grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa tsam grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: This statement “the mere relation is established” does not express a reason of non-relation.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba tsam nyid kyis ldog pa brjod pa mi srid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba tsam nyid kyis ldog pa brjod pa mi srid do zhes bstan to //
translated: However, it teaches that it is impossible to state a counterexample by mere perception.

original: de lta na 'brel pa med kyang gang gi tshe bsgrub pa bya ba thams cad spangs pa'i don mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de rnam bar mi dmigs pa'i sgrub bar byed bas med par grub po snyam nas gzhon nu ma len gyis de yang /
analyzed: de lta na 'brel pa med kyang gang gi tshe bsgrub pa bya ba thams cad spangs pa'i don mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de rnam bar mi dmigs pa'i sgrub bar byed bas med par grub po snyam nas gzhon nu ma len gyis de yang /
translated: Thus, although there is no relation, when one sees the object that is the exclusion of all that is to be established, at that time, because of the proof of non-apprehension of that, one thinks “nonexistence is established.”🔽Thus, Kumarila says:

original: yul de dag tu bgrod song na //
analyzed: yul de dag tu bgrod song na //
translated: Having gone to those places,

original: don gzhan nye bar mi dmigs pa //🔽de rgyu gzhan ni med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don gzhan nye bar mi dmigs pa // de rgyu gzhan ni med pa'i phyir //
translated: the non-apprehension of another object

original: med pa yin ces rtogs par bya //
analyzed: med pa yin ces rtogs par bya //
translated: is understood to be nonexistence

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: because there is no other cause.

original: yul la sogs pa bskal pa'i mi snang ba yod kyang de la gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa tsam srid pas the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa bskal pa'i mi snang ba yod kyang de la gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa tsam srid pas the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Although there is the possibility of the non-appearance of objects and so on due to separation, because it is possible that the mere non-apprehension of a reason exists there, there is doubt.

original: 'dir ni bsgrub bar bya ba ma lus pa med na ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsgrub bar bya ba ma lus pa med na ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Here, the definition of the absence of the probandum is the absence of the proof.

original: rnams de lta bu nyid gang dang gang la bsgrub par bya ba med pa de dang de la sgrub par byed pa med do zhes slar yang tshig dag gis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams de lta bu nyid gang dang gang la bsgrub par bya ba med pa de dang de la sgrub par byed pa med do zhes slar yang tshig dag gis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the words “wherever there is no probandum, there is no proof” are stated again.

original: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang sngar 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid brjod do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang sngar 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid brjod do //
translated: The necessity of positive concomitance was stated earlier as the reason for the relation.

original: de'i phyir des kyang gzhan dag mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro ba grub par 'dod pas med par brjod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir des kyang gzhan dag mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro ba grub par 'dod pas med par brjod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only because of that that others assert the establishment of positive concomitance by the mere perception of the reason, and thus state the absence of the probandum.

original: don thams cad kyi gtan tshigs su 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan par rjes su dpog par byed pa rnams kyis mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don thams cad kyi gtan tshigs su 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang ldan par rjes su dpog par byed pa rnams kyis mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who infer the presence of the property of the probandum in all objects cannot perceive the reason.

original: ma lus pa'i yul dang phyogs la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don rjes su 'gro ba ni gang dang gang la gtan tshigs yod pa de dang de la bsgrub par bya ba yod do zhes ma lus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i yul dang phyogs la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don rjes su 'gro ba ni gang dang gang la gtan tshigs yod pa de dang de la bsgrub par bya ba yod do zhes ma lus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pervasion of the object to be established, in all places and directions, is shown by the fact that wherever the reason exists, there the object to be established exists.

original: yul la sogs pa nyung zad cig tu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang sgrub pa byed pa'i chos lhan cig tu yang dang yang khyab pa grub pa mthong yang 'brel pa med pa ni la lar phal cher de bzhin du mthon kyang srid pas mi srid pa la
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nyung zad cig tu bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang sgrub pa byed pa'i chos lhan cig tu yang dang yang khyab pa grub pa mthong yang 'brel pa med pa ni la lar phal cher de bzhin du mthon kyang srid pas mi srid pa la
translated: Even though one sees the property to be established and the establishing property co-occurring many times in a few places, etc., still, because it is possible that in some cases they do not have the relation, the non-occurrence of the relation is not ascertained.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas da ni /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro // mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang du byas nas da ni /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition to contradict the possibility.🔽Now, with regard to the reason of non-apprehension, he says:

original: mi dmigs pa'i ldog pa nges pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ldog pa nges pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The ascertainment of the exclusion of non-apprehension.

original: brjod do zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //🔽'di'i bdag nyid @214a * //
analyzed: brjod do zhes bya ba lhag ma'o // 'di'i bdag nyid @214a * //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te yod pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te yod pa'o //
translated: “The object of the operation” means that it exists.

original: mi dmigs pa ni shes pa gzhan gyis sam bltar rung ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni shes pa gzhan gyis sam bltar rung ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Non-apprehension” means that it is not apprehended by another cognition or by the nature of the object itself.

original: de ni yod ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i ngo bos mi dmigs pa de nye bar dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yod ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i ngo bos mi dmigs pa de nye bar dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi med pa'o //
translated: Since it exists, the non-apprehension of the object to be established is not the nature of non-existence. It is the nature of the non-apprehension of that.

original: de gang 'dzin pa ni mngon sum mo //🔽de yod pa'i mtshan nyid du de bstan pa ni bstan par bya zhing shes par bya ba 'dis bstan pa ni nye bar bstan pa can gyi tshad mas de'i bdag nyid kyi mi dmigs pa'i ldog pa nges pa dang de'i gtan tshigs de ni tshad ma de bzhin
analyzed: de gang 'dzin pa ni mngon sum mo // de yod pa'i mtshan nyid du de bstan pa ni bstan par bya zhing shes par bya ba 'dis bstan pa ni nye bar bstan pa can gyi tshad mas de'i bdag nyid kyi mi dmigs pa'i ldog pa nges pa dang de'i gtan tshigs de ni tshad ma de bzhin
translated: The apprehension of that is perception.

original: du brjod do //
analyzed: du brjod do //
translated: The definition of its existence is taught by that. What is to be taught and known is taught by this. The one who teaches is the one with the teaching. The valid cognition is the ascertainment of the exclusion of non-apprehension of that nature. The reason for that is the valid cognition. It is expressed in that way.

original: gal te yod na ni gzhan nye bar dmigs pa'i shes pa la snang du rung ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni gzhan nye bar dmigs pa'i shes pa la snang du rung ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If it exists, it would be the nature of something that can appear in the cognition of the apprehension of another.

original: 'on kyang nye bar mi dmigs na ji ltar 'di snang du rung ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur gang zhig yod pa gzhan rnams kyang dmigs pa'i rkyen du yod pa ni mngon sum du 'gyur ba de nyid du snang du rung bar bshad do ;
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar mi dmigs na ji ltar 'di snang du rung ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur gang zhig yod pa gzhan rnams kyang dmigs pa'i rkyen du yod pa ni mngon sum du 'gyur ba de nyid du snang du rung bar bshad do ;
translated: And that which is perceived as the condition of perception is said to be the appearance of the object.

original: / des na rnam pa de lta bu nye ba las gdon mi za bar rnam pa de lta bu'i mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / des na rnam pa de lta bu nye ba las gdon mi za bar rnam pa de lta bu'i mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, from the proximity of such an aspect, the perception of such an aspect must occur.

original: gzhan du na res 'ga' zhig kyang mngon sum gyi yul du mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na res 'ga' zhig kyang mngon sum gyi yul du mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would never be the object of perception, because there would be no difference.

original: gang dang gang la rgyu mtshan tsam yod pa de dang de la nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dang gang la rgyu mtshan tsam yod pa de dang de la nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever has a mere reason is ascertained by that.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis myu gu bzhin no //
translated: For example, a sprout is ascertained by the mere reason of the collection of seeds and so on.

original: yod pa'i dngos po yang ji skad bshad pa'i dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po yang ji skad bshad pa'i dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: An existent thing is also of that kind, because it has the reason of being merely the observed object as explained, and so it is a direct perception of that kind. This is a natural inference.

original: tshad ma 'dis ni rang bzhin ma dmigs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldog pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma 'dis ni rang bzhin ma dmigs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldog pa nges pa'o //
translated: This valid cognition ascertains the negation that is the invariable concomitance of the absence of the probandum in the absence of the natural evidence.

original: 'di yang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi tshad ma 'dis kyang mi dmigs pa la rgyu mtshan gzhan med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang rjes su 'gro ba nges pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi tshad ma 'dis kyang mi dmigs pa la rgyu mtshan gzhan med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is also taught by this valid cognition of ascertained positive concomitance, because there is no other reason for non-apprehension.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa rjod par 'dod pa dag 'brel pa nyid grub pa'i thabs kho nas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa rjod par 'dod pa dag 'brel pa nyid grub pa'i thabs kho nas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa grub pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of the cause and the pervader, which are intended to be stated, are the reason for establishing positive and negative concomitance by the method of establishing the relation itself.

original: de yang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nye bar bstan pa nyid kyis tha dad par ma brjod do //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nye bar bstan pa nyid kyis tha dad par ma brjod do //
translated: Moreover, the reason of effect and the reason of nature are not stated separately, because they are shown to be similar.

original: de bzhin du rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag med pas @214b 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dag med par gdon mi za bar rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag med pas @214b 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dag med par gdon mi za bar rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: In the same way, because of the absence of cause and the absence of the pervader, there is the absence of the effect and the absence of the pervaded.

original: 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba med pa las ldog pa'i yod pa de ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid la gdon mi za bar ldog pas khyab par byed pa dang rgyu dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba med pa las ldog pa'i yod pa de ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid la gdon mi za bar ldog pas khyab par byed pa dang rgyu dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The existence that is the contrapositive of the absence of the effect and the absence of the pervaded is necessarily pervaded by the contrapositive of existence, because of the existence of the pervader and the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dag rgyu med pa 'am rang bzhin ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir cung zad cig kyang tha dad par brjod pa med do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dag rgyu med pa 'am rang bzhin ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir cung zad cig kyang tha dad par brjod pa med do //
translated: Otherwise, because of the consequence that the effect and the pervaded would be causeless or not nature, there would be no statement of any difference.

original: gzhung 'di tsam gyis ni phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba de bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhung 'di tsam gyis ni phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba de bshad pa yin no //
translated: By this much of the text, the explanation of the reason called “the property of the subject and pervasion by that part” is finished.

original: da ni rnam gsum nyid ces bya ba de bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rnam gsum nyid ces bya ba de bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the so-called “three modes” will be explained.

original: mtshan nyid 'dis zhes bya ba smos te phyogs la chos yod pa de'i chas khyab pa de ni gtan tshigs yin no zhes de'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dis zhes bya ba smos te phyogs la chos yod pa de'i chas khyab pa de ni gtan tshigs yin no zhes de'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid /
translated: The statement “by this definition” refers to the definition of a reason: “That which is the pervasion by the property of the position is the reason.”

original: gtan tshigs de ni rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni rnam gsum ste //
translated: The reason is of three types.

original: zhes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition.

original: de zhes bshad pa ni gtan tshigs rnams so //
analyzed: de zhes bshad pa ni gtan tshigs rnams so //
translated: The statement “those” refers to reasons.

original: rnam gsum ste zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ni rnam gsum kho na'o //🔽gtan tshigs de rnams kyi rang rang gi ming grags pa ni /
analyzed: rnam gsum ste zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa ni rnam gsum kho na'o // gtan tshigs de rnams kyi rang rang gi ming grags pa ni /
translated: The statement “of three types” is connected to the statement “only.”

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The individual names of those reasons are well known to be nature, effect, and non-observation.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi bsdu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bstan pas nges par bzung ba'i don kho nar gsal lo //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi bsdu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bstan pas nges par bzung ba'i don kho nar gsal lo //
translated: The statement “and” is for the purpose of including reasons. The statement “only” clarifies that the meaning is definitely limited to what is taught.

original: dper na sgra 'ga' zhig la mi rtogs pa bsgrub par bya ba yod pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nye bar bstan pa dang me dang ldan par sa phyogs la bsgrub par bya ba du ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i gtan
analyzed: dper na sgra 'ga' zhig la mi rtogs pa bsgrub par bya ba yod pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nye bar bstan pa dang me dang ldan par sa phyogs la bsgrub par bya ba du ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i gtan
translated: In the case of proving that the place possesses fire, it is like smoke.

original: tshigs bstan pa dang med pa la zhes bya ba ni med pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: tshigs bstan pa dang med pa la zhes bya ba ni med pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: The statement “non-existent” is the convention of non-existence.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nye bar bkod pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nye bar bkod pa'o //
translated: “ Non-observation of the perceptible” is the statement of non-observation.

original: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho na yin zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum kho na yin zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Why are there only three types of reasons?

original: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las tha dad pa'i don rnams kyi gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang gtan tshigs 'gal bas khyab pas gtan tshigs gsum nyid du nges pa yin te gtan tshigs ltar snang ba tshad ma yin pa de las ldog pa ste nye ba bstan pa
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las tha dad pa'i don rnams kyi gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dang gtan tshigs 'gal bas khyab pas gtan tshigs gsum nyid du nges pa yin te gtan tshigs ltar snang ba tshad ma yin pa de las ldog pa ste nye ba bstan pa
translated: Since all objects that are different from the three types of reasons are either fallacious reasons or contradictory reasons, reasons are ascertained as only three.

original: ni / 'di kho na zhes bya ba smos te /🔽rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs par bshad pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum med @215a * //
analyzed: ni / 'di kho na zhes bya ba smos te / rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs par bshad pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum med @215a * //
translated: This is the only way.

original: na mi 'byung bar nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: na mi 'byung bar nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If the three kinds of reasons explained as nature, effect, and non-apprehension do not occur without it, it is called “inseparable from the object.”🔽The reversal of the three kinds of reasons is the meaning of “if they do not exist.”

original: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum gyi ldog pa ni de rnams kyi don la med na mi 'byung bas gang med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum gyi ldog pa ni de rnams kyi don la med na mi 'byung bas gang med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “if they do not exist” is that the three kinds of reasons do not occur without their objects.

original: des kyang med na mi 'byung ba ma tshang ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa las tha dad pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: des kyang med na mi 'byung ba ma tshang ba yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa las tha dad pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ste /
translated: Since that is incomplete, the apparent reason is different from nature, effect, and non-apprehension.

original: gzhal bar bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It would be like the object of evaluation and so on.

original: med na mi 'byung ba med pas gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum ldog pa yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med na khyab pa med do zhes bya ba na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas rtags so //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba med pas gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum ldog pa yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba med na khyab pa med do zhes bya ba na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas rtags so //
translated: Since the reversal of the three kinds of reasons is due to the absence of inseparability, there is no pervasion if the nature and effect are absent. Thus, the non-apprehension of the pervader is the reason.

original: 'on te med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ci zhig su zhig gis yin /
analyzed: 'on te med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ci zhig su zhig gis yin /
translated: But if it does not exist, what is called “not arising without it” belongs to whom?

original: 'di ji ltar rnam pa gsum du nges par brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar rnam pa gsum du nges par brjod ce na /
translated: How is it ascertained as threefold?

original: ji skad bshad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “as previously explained.”

original: khyab par byed pa 'am de'i rgyu de dag yod pa des na gang la de khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu dag nye ba de la yod pa nyid do//
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'am de'i rgyu de dag yod pa des na gang la de khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu dag nye ba de la yod pa nyid do//
translated: Since the pervader or its cause exists, that which is pervaded by it and its effect exists.🔽That which is pervaded by the effect and the nature of its cause is taught to exist, or the pervader is the property of the subject.

original: gang la khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin de'i rgyu yod par bstan pa'am khyab par byed pa nye ba'i chos can de nyid la de med na mi 'byung ba yin no zhes khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi khyab par bshad
analyzed: gang la khyab par bya ba dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin de'i rgyu yod par bstan pa'am khyab par byed pa nye ba'i chos can de nyid la de med na mi 'byung ba yin no zhes khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi khyab par bshad
translated: The pervasion of the property of the pervader is explained as follows: “If that does not exist, it does not arise.”

original: pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the non-arising without it as previously explained.

original: su'i zhe na /
analyzed: su'i zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: phyogs kyi chos bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi chos de nyid kyi ngo bo'i med na mi 'byung ba gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum ji skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi chos de nyid kyi ngo bo'i med na mi 'byung ba gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum ji skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of reasons that have been explained are the non-observation of a thing that is essentially the same as the property to be established in the subject.

original: gtan tshigs las de gzhan la de ldog pa'i don gyis yod pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs las de gzhan la de ldog pa'i don gyis yod pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is the existence of the reason in the similar class by the meaning of the exclusion of that from the dissimilar class.

original: 'dir yang rnam pa gsum yod ba la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i med na mi 'byung ba'i khyab ba dag yod pa'i phyir byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa bzhin du 'dis khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa yod pa de ni khyab
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam pa gsum yod ba la de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i med na mi 'byung ba'i khyab ba dag yod pa'i phyir byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa bzhin du 'dis khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa yod pa de ni khyab
translated: Here, too, there are three kinds. Because there is the pervasion by the non-observation of the essential identity and the non-observation of the effect, the existence of the pervasion by this is like the pervasion by being produced and being impermanent.

original: pa mnyam pas gcig la ci mi 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: pa mnyam pas gcig la ci mi 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: The pervasion is equal, and there is no error in one.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid las de gzhan pa la med pa'i sgo nas nges par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid las de gzhan pa la med pa'i sgo nas nges par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the pervasion is ascertained by the exclusion of that from the other three kinds of reasons.

original: des na gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan zhes bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i nges pa'i 'thad pa dang lhan cig tu de'i don bshad do //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan zhes bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i nges pa'i 'thad pa dang lhan cig tu de'i don bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “other than the fallacious reason” is explained together with the definite proof that it does not occur without that.

original: ji ltar gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan pa ni med na mi 'byung ba med pa de ltar sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las gzhan pa ni med na mi 'byung ba med pa de ltar sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained above how there is no other kind of reason than the three kinds of reasons, and how there is no non-observation that is not non-observation of something possible.

original: yang na gal te rang bzhin las @215b gzhan pa'i don ni don gzhan 'bras bu las kyang gzhan rgyu 'am gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / mi dmigs pa las gzhan ji skad du bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa tsam 'am nye bar dmigs pa 'am dgag pa'am de las gzhan pa yang 'gal ba'am /🔽mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gal te rang bzhin las @215b gzhan pa'i don ni don gzhan 'bras bu las kyang gzhan rgyu 'am gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / mi dmigs pa las gzhan ji skad du bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa tsam 'am nye bar dmigs pa 'am dgag pa'am de las gzhan pa yang 'gal ba'am / mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: Or else, if the object is different from the nature of the reason, it is either a different object, or it is the effect, or it is the cause, or it is neither, or it is non-observation, or it is just the non-observation as explained, or it is the observation, or it is the negation, or it is something other than those, or it is contradictory, or it is non-contradictory.

original: de la don gzhan ni brgya la de ma thag pa'i 'bras bu yin na ni tshu rol mthong bas rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: de la don gzhan ni brgya la de ma thag pa'i 'bras bu yin na ni tshu rol mthong bas rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir rtags ma yin no //
translated: If the different object is the effect that immediately follows it, it is not a reason, because the one with limited vision cannot understand it.

original: 'bras bu mthong nas tha dad par nges par byed pa yang /
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong nas tha dad par nges par byed pa yang /
translated: And if it is ascertained as different after seeing the effect,

original: bsgrub pa grub pa'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa don med do //
analyzed: bsgrub pa grub pa'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa don med do //
translated: It is meaningless to realize that the property of the subject occurs after the time of the establishment of the probandum.

original: 'bras bu dang bar du chod pa'i rgyu rnams las kyang 'bras bu de'i rtags ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bar du chod pa'i rgyu rnams las kyang 'bras bu de'i rtags ma yin te /
translated: Also, from causes that are interrupted from the effect, that effect is not a reason.

original: bar du chod pa la gegs byed pas ma tshang bas srid pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar du chod pa la gegs byed pas ma tshang bas srid pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the possibility of error due to incompleteness by the obstruction of the interruption.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'i nus pa rnams //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'i nus pa rnams //
translated: The potencies of the effect of the collection

original: 'gyur ba dang 'brel 'bras bu yang //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang 'brel 'bras bu yang //
translated: are related to the transformation, and the effect

original: ma nges pa ni nyid yin te //
