analyzed: ma nges pa ni nyid yin te //
translated: is uncertain,

original: gags byed pa dag srid phyir ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gags byed pa dag srid phyir ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: because the obstruction is possible.

original: rung ba rjes su dpag pa ni don gzhan pa'i rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: rung ba rjes su dpag pa ni don gzhan pa'i rtags ma yin no //
translated: The inference of the suitable is not a reason for another object.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa yang 'brel pa med pas gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa yang 'brel pa med pas gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
translated: Also, the non-both is not suitable as a reason because of the lack of relation.

original: ji ltar smin drug shar ba las snar ma yod par rnam par shes pa nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar smin drug shar ba las snar ma yod par rnam par shes pa nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is there the ascertainment of consciousness that the Pleiades exist from the rising of the Capella?

original: 'on te de yang 'brel pa med par mi rigs te khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te de yang 'brel pa med par mi rigs te khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is not related to the object, it is not a reason, because it is not a property of the subject.

original: de'i phyir rgyu skar gyi 'khor lo'i 'phong ba ni gtan tshigs kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu skar gyi 'khor lo'i 'phong ba ni gtan tshigs kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, the motion of the stars is not a reason at all.

original: dus kyis bar du chod par 'ga' zhig gis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyis bar du chod par 'ga' zhig gis brtag par bya'o //
translated: It is only a time that is to be inferred by someone.

original: dper na 'byung ba 'khrug pa las dus phyis char 'byung ba bzhin du gtan tshigs kyis rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog par 'bras bu'i rtags las skyed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba 'khrug pa las dus phyis char 'byung ba bzhin du gtan tshigs kyis rgyu'i chos rjes su dpog par 'bras bu'i rtags las skyed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: Just as rain is inferred from the disturbance of the elements, so the property of the cause is to be inferred from the reason, the sign of the effect.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam yang the tshom za ba'i gtan tshigs te tshad ma ldog pas kyang don med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam yang the tshom za ba'i gtan tshigs te tshad ma ldog pas kyang don med par mi 'grub po //
translated: Non-apprehension alone is a reason that is doubtful, because the cessation of the valid cognition is not established as meaningless.

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i dgag pa yang ji ltar dngos po med par sgrub par byed pa yin /
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i dgag pa yang ji ltar dngos po med par sgrub par byed pa yin /
translated: And how can the negation of apprehension establish the non-existence of something?

original: nye bar dmigs pa ma 'khrul pas med par mi rigs so //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa ma 'khrul pas med par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the non-existence of something is due to the non-apprehension of something else.

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa yang mi mthun pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa yang mi mthun pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The observation of an incompatible object is the establishment of a contradictory object.

original: 'on kyang 'gal ba de yod pa na gzhan nye bar mi dmigs pa kho @216a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gal ba de yod pa na gzhan nye bar mi dmigs pa kho @216a * //
translated: However, when that contradiction exists, the non-observation of the other is established only by that.

original: nas grub pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa nyid sbyor bar rigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nas grub pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa nyid sbyor bar rigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to apply non-observation in that way.

original: de lta ma yin na dmigs su yod pa la dgag pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dmigs su yod pa la dgag pa mi 'grub po //
translated: Otherwise, the negation is not established for what is observable.

original: 'gal ba med pa nye bar dmigs pa yang dgag par ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa nye bar dmigs pa yang dgag par ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The observation of the non-contradictory is also uncertain in negation.

original: 'gal ba med pa rnams ni lhan cig yod pa srid pas so //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa rnams ni lhan cig yod pa srid pas so //
translated: Because it is possible for the non-contradictory to exist together.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang mi srid pas med na mi 'byung ba las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang mi srid pas med na mi 'byung ba las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because there is no existence other than the invariable concomitance.

original: da ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni de la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni de la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Now, the characteristic of existence of the natural reason is stated with in that.

original: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid brjod do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum las re zhig rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid brjod do //
translated: From among the three types of reasons, the characteristic of the natural reason is stated first.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la gang gis de sgrub par byed pa de'i chos de'i ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo de nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang de'i rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa de yod de /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la gang gis de sgrub par byed pa de'i chos de'i ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo de nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa'i chos kyi ngo bo tsam dang de'i rjes su 'gro ba gang yin pa de yod de /
translated: The nature of that which establishes the probandum is the nature of that probandum, and that which is concomitant with it is the mere nature of the property that establishes it.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi cha shas la spyi nye bar btags nas de la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi cha shas la spyi nye bar btags nas de la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Having imputed a universal to a part of the probandum, that is the reason of nature.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de nyid rang bzhin yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni mnyan par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de nyid rang bzhin yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The probandum should be heard, and therefore it should be understood that it is the nature.

original: ji ltar 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin ji snyed pa tha mi dad par rtogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin ji snyed pa tha mi dad par rtogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the nature of the probandum is understood without distinction?

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “mutually.”

original: med pa dang mi rtag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i gtan tshigs su gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos dag tha dad pa de la yod kyang dngos po ni don dam par rtags can gyi rang bzhin kho
analyzed: med pa dang mi rtag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i gtan tshigs su gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos dag tha dad pa de la yod kyang dngos po ni don dam par rtags can gyi rang bzhin kho
translated: Since it is a logical reason that is the opposite of nonexistence, impermanence, and so on, the property to be established and the property that establishes it are different.

original: na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: However, in reality, the property possessor is only the nature of the property to be established.

original: de lta na med pa las ldog pa gang yin pa de nyid skad cig ma la sogs pa de nyid chos can gcig la tha mi dad pas bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par byed pa'i chos kyang don dam par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na med pa las ldog pa gang yin pa de nyid skad cig ma la sogs pa de nyid chos can gcig la tha mi dad pas bsgrub par bya ba dang bsgrub par byed pa'i chos kyang don dam par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, whatever is the opposite of nonexistence is itself momentary and so on. Since they are not different in a single basis, the property to be established and the property that establishes it are also ultimately not different.

original: gal te dngos su na rtags can gyi rang bzhin gyi sgrub par byed pa'i chos ci'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyad par du bya ba yin /
analyzed: gal te dngos su na rtags can gyi rang bzhin gyi sgrub par byed pa'i chos ci'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis khyad par du bya ba yin /
translated: If the property to be established is the nature of the property possessor, why is the property that establishes it, the mere existence of the reason, related to the property to be established, which is qualified by the property to be established?

original: gang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni ji ltar de tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin /🔽rang bzhin ma yin par thal bar 'gyur bas de'i rang bzhin yin no snyam nas gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni ji ltar de tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin / rang bzhin ma yin par thal bar 'gyur bas de'i rang bzhin yin no snyam nas gang gi phyir /
translated: How could the nature of something be concomitant with just that?

original: gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you think that it is the nature of that, then because of the consequence that it would not be its nature, it is said, “The nature of the reason.”

original: gang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos @216b de la gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba las 'khrul pa med pas sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba de la 'khrul pa med pa dang
analyzed: gang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos @216b de la gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rjes su 'gro ba las 'khrul pa med pas sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba de la 'khrul pa med pa dang
translated: Because the nature of the reason is the nature of the predicate of the probandum, it is unmistaken with respect to being concomitant with the predicate of the probandum. Therefore, the mere existence of the reason is concomitant with the predicate of the probandum.

original: 'khrul pa srid na ni khyad par rnams rigs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa srid na ni khyad par rnams rigs so //
translated: If error were possible, then the distinctions would be reasonable.

original: 'dir yang 'khrul pa mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir khyab par mi rigs pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'khrul pa mi srid pa nyid kyi phyir khyab par mi rigs pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Here, because error is impossible, pervasion is unreasonable.

original: de ltar yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid byed pa dang / gang 'di dag bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i khyad par ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pa ni rigs pa can la sogs pa'i 'dod pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid byed pa dang / gang 'di dag bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i khyad par ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa la ltos pa ni rigs pa can la sogs pa'i 'dod pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: Thus, the definition of the natural reason is: that which is the property of the subject and is pervaded by the property to be established. The qualification “merely” is added to exclude the property of the subject that is not pervaded by the property to be established. The qualification “in relation to the opponent’s assertion” is added to exclude the property of the subject that is pervaded by the property to be established in relation to one’s own assertion.

original: de nyid pha rol po'i log par rtog pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid pha rol po'i log par rtog pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to illustrate the opponent’s misconception.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The word “others” refers to the Naiyāyikas and others.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa gang don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gyis skyed par byed pa'i don gyis don gzhan la bsnun pa'i rdzas dang ldan pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan yin no //🔽de nyid 'di ltar bsnun pas rdzas dang ldan pa cha shas rnams la bya ba skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa gang don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gyis skyed par byed pa'i don gyis don gzhan la bsnun pa'i rdzas dang ldan pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu mtshan yin no // de nyid 'di ltar bsnun pas rdzas dang ldan pa cha shas rnams la bya ba skyed pa yin te /
translated: The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.🔽The reason is that which is the cause of another object, in the sense of producing another object. It is the substance that possesses the action of striking another object.

original: de rnams kyi cha shas su bye bas ldan pa zhig go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi cha shas su bye bas ldan pa zhig go //
translated: The reason is that which is the cause of another object

original: de na rtsom pa'i 'bras bu'i rdzas zhig pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de na rtsom pa'i 'bras bu'i rdzas zhig pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: Therefore, the substance of the effect of the action is destroyed.

original: de ltar na don gzhan la ltos pa'i rgyu mtshan ni byas pa nyid la sogs pa yod kyang de med pas so //
analyzed: de ltar na don gzhan la ltos pa'i rgyu mtshan ni byas pa nyid la sogs pa yod kyang de med pas so //
translated: Thus, although the reason, such as being produced, depends on another object, it is not that.

original: de ma yin pa yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba de byis pa nyid la sogs pa yod na yod pa kho na de tsam ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba yod pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid do
analyzed: de ma yin pa yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba de byis pa nyid la sogs pa yod na yod pa kho na de tsam ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba yod pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid do
translated: The mere presence of that which is not that is the pervasion. If childishness, etc. exist, it exists only. That mere presence is the pervasion. Whatever is that is the characteristic of the probandum impermanence.

original: // de las bzlog pa yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod do //
analyzed: // de las bzlog pa yang byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod do //
translated: The opposite of that is also asserted to be the nature of being produced, etc.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par du byas pa de'i phyir des na khyad par gyi rnam pa de lta bu'i don gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi 'jig pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par du byas pa de'i phyir des na khyad par gyi rnam pa de lta bu'i don gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi 'jig pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: Because it is qualified by that, therefore, that kind of qualified aspect is not the nature of destruction, which has another object as its reason.

original: mtshan nyid khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term qualified by the characteristic is stated.

original: rang yod tsam gyis 'byung ba nyid //
analyzed: rang yod tsam gyis 'byung ba nyid //
translated: It is the mere presence of itself.

original: rang bzhin nyid ni gzhan la min //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni gzhan la min //
translated: The nature of the reason is not in the other.

original: zhes bya bas khyab par bstan to //🔽de bzhin du de la don gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan ni //
analyzed: zhes bya bas khyab par bstan to // de bzhin du de la don gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan ni //
translated: This is the pervasion.

original: bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs bya ba la sogs pa 'khrul pas ma nges pa yin te 'dir dpe ni dper na 'jig par bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs bya ba la sogs pa 'khrul pas ma nges pa yin te 'dir dpe ni dper na 'jig par bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: In the same way, the reason is inconclusive because of error in regard to the object to be established, as in the case of the statement,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i byas pa @217a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i byas pa @217a * //
translated: “The impermanent is produced because it is an effect.”

original: lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here the example is like the statement, “The impermanent is to be established as perishable because it is produced and has a cause.”

original: gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The reason is erroneous because it is not the nature of the reason.

original: 'o na ni tha dad par khas blangs pas byas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i mi rtag pa ni gzhan dag mi 'dod pa des ci zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ni tha dad par khas blangs pas byas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i mi rtag pa ni gzhan dag mi 'dod pa des ci zhig brjod ce na /
translated: Well, if you accept that the impermanent is different from the produced, then why do you say that the impermanent, which is by nature the produced, is not accepted by others?

original: des yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa yang yin no snyam du de ltar sems na ni byas pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos kyi rtog pa yang khas blangs pa rnams kyis gdon mi za bar ma byung ba las byung ba dang
analyzed: des yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa yang yin no snyam du de ltar sems na ni byas pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos kyi rtog pa yang khas blangs pa rnams kyis gdon mi za bar ma byung ba las byung ba dang
translated: If you think that the nature of things is related to mere existence, then those who accept the concepts of being produced and impermanent must also accept that they are not arisen from what is non-existent and

original: / byung nas kyang med pa'i mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: / byung nas kyang med pa'i mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: that having arisen, they do not endure due to their nature of non-existence.

original: gzhan du na bdag la sogs pa dang byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid khyab par med pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag la sogs pa dang byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid khyab par med pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the self and so on and being produced and impermanent would exist without being mutually pervasive.

original: de'i phyir gang ma byung ba las byung ba dang byung nas med pas mi gnas pa de dag nyid de ni mthong ba'i stobs las skyes pa'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos tha dad par rtog pa la snang ba'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang ma byung ba las byung ba dang byung nas med pas mi gnas pa de dag nyid de ni mthong ba'i stobs las skyes pa'i byas pa dang mi rtag pa'i chos tha dad par rtog pa la snang ba'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba dang /
translated: Therefore, those that are arisen from what is non-existent and having arisen do not endure due to their nature of non-existence are themselves the phenomena of being produced and impermanent that arise from the power of seeing.

original: sgrub par byed pa dag las cis tha dad pa'i chos gnas pa yin /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dag las cis tha dad pa'i chos gnas pa yin /
translated: How are they different from the phenomena that are established by the means of affirmation and the object of affirmation?

original: brtags su zin kyang dngos po'i bdag nyid don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan de don du gnyer ba rnams kyis bsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags su zin kyang dngos po'i bdag nyid don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan de don du gnyer ba rnams kyis bsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is investigated, it is the nature of things that those who seek the meaning consider the reason for the cause of the performance of an object.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: yod med phyogs ni tha dad pas //
analyzed: yod med phyogs ni tha dad pas //
translated: The position of existence and nonexistence is different.

original: sgra don skur 'debs med rnams kyis //🔽gang la 'brel pas 'bras skyed pa'i //
analyzed: sgra don skur 'debs med rnams kyis // gang la 'brel pas 'bras skyed pa'i //
translated: Those who do not deny the meaning of words🔽should investigate only those things

original: dngos po kho na dpyad par bya //🔽don byed nus pa med pa la //
analyzed: dngos po kho na dpyad par bya // don byed nus pa med pa la //
translated: that are related to the production of results.🔽What is the use of imagining

original: de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya //🔽ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
analyzed: de 'dod brtags pas ci zhig bya // ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
translated: that which is incapable of performing a function?🔽What is the use of the lustful investigating

original: 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtag ci phan //🔽zhes bshad do //🔽de'i phyir mthong du zin kyang dngos po 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid du ma yin pa gzhan las ldog pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig nges so //
analyzed: 'dod ldan rnams kyis brtag ci phan // zhes bshad do // de'i phyir mthong du zin kyang dngos po 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid du ma yin pa gzhan las ldog pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig nges so //
translated: whether a eunuch is beautiful or ugly?🔽Therefore, even though it is seen, it is ascertained in some way as not being the nature of some thing, as being different from another.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan gyis kyang de yin pa'i ngo bo las ldog pa'i bdag nyid la 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa srid pas ma nges pa yin pas ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan gyis kyang de yin pa'i ngo bo las ldog pa'i bdag nyid la 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa srid pas ma nges pa yin pas ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: But because it is possible that there is a cause for error in the nature of that which is not that, as being different from the nature of that, it is not ascertained, and so it is not ascertained.

original: nges pa dag gi ngo bo ni tshad ma gzhan gyi 'brel pa nges pas mdun na gnas pa la rjes su dpag pa yis nges pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i byas pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i rtags su rigs so //
analyzed: nges pa dag gi ngo bo ni tshad ma gzhan gyi 'brel pa nges pas mdun na gnas pa la rjes su dpag pa yis nges pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i byas pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i rtags su rigs so //
translated: The nature of the ascertainment is that, since the relation with another valid cognition is ascertained, it is ascertained by inference in regard to what is present in front. Therefore, it is reasonable that the sign of destruction is the produced that has the nature of impermanence.

original: de bzhin du 'jig pa'i rang bzhin kho na gtan tshigs su ji skad bshad pa'i rigs @217b pas de 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig pa'i rang bzhin kho na gtan tshigs su ji skad bshad pa'i rigs @217b pas de 'dod pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, it is asserted that the nature of destruction itself is the reason, because it is reasonable as explained.

original: de ni de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid la don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gyis bye brag ni rang bzhin ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de ni de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid la don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan gyis bye brag ni rang bzhin ma yin par brjod do //
translated: That is just the relation with that, and the difference due to the reason of another object is not said to be the nature.

original: gal te byas pa nyid kyi dngos su rgyu dang ldan par 'di rjes su dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid kyi dngos su rgyu dang ldan par 'di rjes su dpag par bya ste /
translated: If it is to be inferred that this is actually related to a cause by being produced,

original: des na sngar zhig pa med pa'i bye brag gis yod pa de 'du ba'i 'brel pas mi rtag pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: des na sngar zhig pa med pa'i bye brag gis yod pa de 'du ba'i 'brel pas mi rtag pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: then, by the difference of not previously having been destroyed, that existence is posited as impermanent by the relation of inherence.

original: 'di nyid bdag la sogs pa rtag pa la thal bar 'gyur ba med la 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa med pa 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa na /
analyzed: 'di nyid bdag la sogs pa rtag pa la thal bar 'gyur ba med la 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa med pa 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa na /
translated: This is because it would follow that it is permanent, like a self, etc.

original: byas pa nyid 'du ba'i srid pa'i 'brel pa'i khyad par gyis 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa la cung zad cig kyang mi 'dod pa med do snyam du sems pa na de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid 'du ba'i srid pa'i 'brel pa'i khyad par gyis 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa la cung zad cig kyang mi 'dod pa med do snyam du sems pa na de ni mi rigs te /
translated: When one thinks that there is nothing at all that is not accepted in the teaching of the nature of destruction as the special connection of the cause and effect of becoming, since it is the characteristic of the nonexistence of existence,🔽this is not reasonable, because it is contradictory for such a kind of destruction to have a cause.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'jig pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon rang nyid 'di 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'jig pa ni rgyu dang ldan pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon rang nyid 'di 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained by the master himself.

original: 'di ni rjes su dpag par byed na cung zad cig kyang don byed par nus pa med pa brtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su dpag par byed na cung zad cig kyang don byed par nus pa med pa brtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one infers this, one should investigate whether it is capable of the slightest function.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa shes pa ji ltar rigs pa rtogs par 'dod pa ni cung zad cig yongs su brtag par byed do //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa shes pa ji ltar rigs pa rtogs par 'dod pa ni cung zad cig yongs su brtag par byed do //
translated: One should investigate whether it is the slightest bit capable of producing pleasure and pain, as one wishes.

original: de'i phyir 'dir mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin gyi yod pa nyid rjes su dpag par bya ste de nyid kyi rgyu dang ldan pa brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir mi brtan pa'i rang bzhin gyi yod pa nyid rjes su dpag par bya ste de nyid kyi rgyu dang ldan pa brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here one should infer the existence of an unstable nature and one should investigate whether it has a cause.

original: de lta ma yin na med pas dben pa'i skad cig ma'i dus su med pa thob pa la sogs pas bskyed pa ni dngos po la nye bar mi mkho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med pas dben pa'i skad cig ma'i dus su med pa thob pa la sogs pas bskyed pa ni dngos po la nye bar mi mkho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, since it would not exist at the time of the moment of separation from nonexistence, the production of nonexistence and so on would not be useful for things.

original: de yod pa ni de nyid du gnas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de yod pa ni de nyid du gnas pa kho na yin te /
translated: That existence is only present in that very thing.

original: ji ltar de'i khyad par gyis sam yod pa de 'du bas mi rtag par 'gyur /🔽dngos po mi 'gyur thob pa la sogs pas byas nas zhig nas med pa'i khyad par gyis yod pa ldan pa'i 'brel pas gal te mi rtag pa yin no ci ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i khyad par gyis sam yod pa de 'du bas mi rtag par 'gyur / dngos po mi 'gyur thob pa la sogs pas byas nas zhig nas med pa'i khyad par gyis yod pa ldan pa'i 'brel pas gal te mi rtag pa yin no ci ste /
translated: How could it become impermanent through the connection of that particular existence?

original: bdag la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba gnas pa yin no //
translated: If it is impermanent through the connection of the particular existence of a thing that has changed and been destroyed by the production of nonexistence and so on, then it follows that even the self and so on would be impermanent.🔽That is untenable.

original: rang gi rgyu las ma byung ba las byung ba la yod pa dang 'du ba ni mi 'dod de mi 'grub pas so //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las ma byung ba las byung ba la yod pa dang 'du ba ni mi 'dod de mi 'grub pas so //
translated: One does not assert that existence and connection arise from what did not arise from its own cause, because it is not established.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba gang yod pa de nyid la byas pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba gang yod pa de nyid la byas pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Whatever exists having arisen from what did not exist is called “produced.”

original: yod pa la 'du ba'i 'brel pas mi rtag par khas blang par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yod pa la 'du ba'i 'brel pas mi rtag par khas blang par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not accept that what exists is impermanent by the relation of inherence,

original: bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no enhancement.

original: snga ma zhig nas med pa'i bye brag mi rigs so //
analyzed: snga ma zhig nas med pa'i bye brag mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that the difference of having previously been nonexistent is destroyed.

original: ma byung ba las 'byung bar khas blangs pa de nyid ni byas pa nyid kyi mi brten pa'i rnag bzhin gyi @218a * //
analyzed: ma byung ba las 'byung bar khas blangs pa de nyid ni byas pa nyid kyi mi brten pa'i rnag bzhin gyi @218a * //
translated: The very acceptance of arising from what did not exist is the very production that is the nature of impermanence.

original: 'jig pa yod na 'bras bu byed pa tshad ma med cing tshad mas gnod pa'i don gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'jig pa yod na 'bras bu byed pa tshad ma med cing tshad mas gnod pa'i don gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If destruction exists, what is the use of positing another result that is not established by valid knowledge and is undermined by valid knowledge?

original: de ltar na byas pa 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid du pha rol pos kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de ltar na byas pa 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid du pha rol pos kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: Thus the opponent must undoubtedly accept that what is produced is by nature destroyed.

original: de'i phyir 'jig ba mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid la don gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan khas blangs nas byas pa nyid ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi bye brag tu bstan na de grub pa dang ma grub pa dang tha dad pa'i rgyu can ni de'i rang bzhin du mi
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig ba mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid la don gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan khas blangs nas byas pa nyid ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi bye brag tu bstan na de grub pa dang ma grub pa dang tha dad pa'i rgyu can ni de'i rang bzhin du mi
translated: Therefore, if you accept that destruction has a cause that is a different object from the thing itself, and if you teach that the nature of a thing is not produced, then it would be illogical for that nature to be the cause of something that is either established or not established as different from it.

original: rigs pas de ltar bsgrub par bya ba de la byas pa nyid ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas de ltar bsgrub par bya ba de la byas pa nyid ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in that proof, the nature of a thing is not ascertained as produced.

original: gang dang gang rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa de dang de ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa de dang de ni gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Whatever depends on another cause is not necessarily produced,

original: dper na gos kha bsgyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gos kha bsgyur ba bzhin no //
translated: like a dyed cloth.

original: byas pa nyid rnams kyi 'byung ba zhig nas med pa yang rgyu mtshan gzhan ltos pas zhes bya ba 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid rnams kyi 'byung ba zhig nas med pa yang rgyu mtshan gzhan ltos pas zhes bya ba 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The observation of a pervasion by a contradictory reason is as follows: The production of things that are produced is not dependent on another cause, because it is a thing that is produced, like a cloth that is already produced.

original: 'on te gos la tshon gyis bsgyur ba ni tshad yod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de yang rang gi rgyu la rag las pas nye ba na de'i rten la mi mthun pa'i rkyen dang phrad pas mi brtan pas na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba mi rigs kyi
analyzed: 'on te gos la tshon gyis bsgyur ba ni tshad yod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de yang rang gi rgyu la rag las pas nye ba na de'i rten la mi mthun pa'i rkyen dang phrad pas mi brtan pas na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba mi rigs kyi
translated: But since it is unstable, it is not tenable that it definitely arises due to the condition of the cloth.

original: 'jig pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the same for destruction.🔽Since causes are limitless, it is uncertain that some, such as a vase, will be destroyed due to the proximity of the cause of destruction.

original: rgyu rnams ni mtha' yas pas gdon mi za bar bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la nye ba dang 'jig pa'i rten pa la snga ma'i rgyu de nye bas kha cig nye bar 'jig ste /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni mtha' yas pas gdon mi za bar bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la nye ba dang 'jig pa'i rten pa la snga ma'i rgyu de nye bas kha cig nye bar 'jig ste /
translated: Some are destroyed due to the proximity of the cause of destruction.

original: gang gi phyir de med na 'jig pa mi rtsom mo zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de med na 'jig pa mi rtsom mo zhe na /
translated: But if that cause does not exist, destruction does not commence.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gal te yang gang gi phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po yod pa de lta na yang rang gi rgyu gang yin pa nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yang gang gi phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu mang po yod pa de lta na yang rang gi rgyu gang yin pa nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there are many causes of destruction, it is due to the proximity of its own cause.

original: de bzhin du de'i rgyu rnams dang nye ba na yang de dang 'gal ba mtha' yas pa yod pas de'i nus pa la gegs byed pas gdon mi za bar rgyu ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig zhig pa yang ma nges 'jig pa
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rgyu rnams dang nye ba na yang de dang 'gal ba mtha' yas pa yod pas de'i nus pa la gegs byed pas gdon mi za bar rgyu ni 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig zhig pa yang ma nges 'jig pa
translated: Likewise, when its causes are near, there are also infinite things that are incompatible with it. Therefore, since its power is obstructed, it is not the case that the cause definitely possesses the effect.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not certain that something that has disintegrated does not disintegrate again.

original: 'on te gos la tshon la sogs pa 'di ni ltos pa dang bcas par yang gal te thams cad du nye bar dmigs pa des na gdon mi za bar cis na 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gos la tshon la sogs pa 'di ni ltos pa dang bcas par yang gal te thams cad du nye bar dmigs pa des na gdon mi za bar cis na 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if this color in cloth and so on is observed everywhere in dependence on conditions, why is it not definitely produced?

original: gal te de bzhin du nye bar dmigs kyang de ni gzhan du 'dzin to //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin du nye bar dmigs kyang de ni gzhan du 'dzin to //
translated: Even if it is observed in that way, it is apprehended as different.

original: gal te de lta na de bzhin du thams cad zhig pa nye bar dmigs pa las gzhan du yod par dogs pa la yid skyo bar mi bya'o zhe na //
analyzed: gal te de lta na de bzhin du thams cad zhig pa nye bar dmigs pa las gzhan du yod par dogs pa la yid skyo bar mi bya'o zhe na //
translated: If that is so, then in the same way, since the disintegration of everything is observed, one should not be disheartened about the possibility that it exists elsewhere.

original: ci dngos po ma lus pa'i ngo bo rgya che ba la yang @218b shes pa'i snang bas khyab pa yin par gang gis brjod na ni de ltar yin na yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug par thal ba las 'jug pa mthong bas na don med🔽pa la brten par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci dngos po ma lus pa'i ngo bo rgya che ba la yang @218b shes pa'i snang bas khyab pa yin par gang gis brjod na ni de ltar yin na yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug par thal ba las 'jug pa mthong bas na don med pa la brten par 'gyur te /
translated: If someone says that the light of consciousness pervades the nature of all things, then even if that were so, it would be pointless to rely on inference because it is seen to engage its object when it is not engaged.

original: gang zhig rgyus byas pa'i 'jig pa mthong du zin kyang rgyu gang zhig las gzhan du skye bar yang mthong bas dogs pa skye ste //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyus byas pa'i 'jig pa mthong du zin kyang rgyu gang zhig las gzhan du skye bar yang mthong bas dogs pa skye ste //
translated: Even though one sees that destruction is produced by a cause, one doubts whether it arises from another cause.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhan gyis bskal ba rnams la ji ltar de bzhin du yod par nges pa yin /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhan gyis bskal ba rnams la ji ltar de bzhin du yod par nges pa yin /
translated: How can one ascertain that it exists in that way in terms of place, time, and nature?

original: byas pa nyid la yang 'di yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa ni rtag par khas blangs pas de'i 'jig pa khas blangs pa ni dngos po las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jig pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig nye bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byas pa nyid la yang 'di yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa ni rtag par khas blangs pas de'i 'jig pa khas blangs pa ni dngos po las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba dang / bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jig pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig nye bar mi dmigs so //
translated: Also, with respect to that which is produced, since you assert that the characteristic of disintegration that has the nature of nonexistence is permanent, then it follows that disintegration would arise from a thing, and like a pot and so on, no cause of disintegration is observed.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dper na bum pa la sogs par //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs par //
translated: For example, in the case of a pot and so on,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni mthong ba yin //
translated: the cause of disintegration is seen.

original: de bzhin 'jig de rgyu med las //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig de rgyu med las //
translated: In the same way, if disintegration is causeless,

original: de yi skye ba ci ltar yin //
analyzed: de yi skye ba ci ltar yin //
translated: how could it arise?

original: zhes bya ba smras pa de'i phyir byas pa nyid la ni sgrub pa de nyid kyis ma ngas pa cis ni ma mthong /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras pa de'i phyir byas pa nyid la ni sgrub pa de nyid kyis ma ngas pa cis ni ma mthong /
translated: Therefore, since the proof is the same with respect to that which is produced, why is nonobservation not accepted?

original: gal te dngos po rnams kyi gcig tu nges pa chos nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kyi gcig tu nges pa chos nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of things is ascertained as one,

original: de dag kho na yin par ga las nges /
analyzed: de dag kho na yin par ga las nges /
translated: how could they be ascertained as just that?

original: gal te de dag las gzhan pa yod par nye bar mi dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag las gzhan pa yod par nye bar mi dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is because another that is different from them is not observed,

original: 'o na ni 'di mi dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di mi dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then it follows that this is not observed.

original: bdag la sogs pa la yang ci'i phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ji ltar 'dir gzhan du yod pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa la yang ci'i phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ji ltar 'dir gzhan du yod pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Why would it not also cease in regard to self and so on? How could it cease in regard to something else?

original: des rjes su dpag pas nye bar dmigs so zhes brjod na rjes su dpag pa de dang de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ni mi dmigs par kho nas gtan tshigs ci ltar ldog par 'gyur 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des rjes su dpag pas nye bar dmigs so zhes brjod na rjes su dpag pa de dang de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ni mi dmigs par kho nas gtan tshigs ci ltar ldog par 'gyur 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: If you say that it is perceived by inference, then how could the reason be reversed by the mere non-perception of the opposite in that inference? This is nothing at all.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa'i 'jig pa ni byas ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / 'khrul pas na legs bar bshad pa smras pas chog go //🔽da ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs gang yin pa de dag na yang 'ga' zhig sbyor ba'i yan lag nyid bstan pa'i phyir rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yang srid pas zhar la gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa'i 'jig pa ni byas ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / 'khrul pas na legs bar bshad pa smras pas chog go // da ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs gang yin pa de dag na yang 'ga' zhig sbyor ba'i yan lag nyid bstan pa'i phyir rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yang srid pas zhar la gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba
translated: Therefore, since destruction that possesses a cause is not the nature of being produced, and since it is mistaken, it is enough to say that it is well explained.🔽Now, in those contexts where there is inference for oneself, in order to demonstrate the very parts of the syllogism, the syllogism of inference for others is presented as an aside.

original: bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration of the syllogism of inference for others is as follows.

original: de'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba smos te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba smos te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The word “application” is mentioned because there are two kinds of natural syllogisms.

original: mtshan nyid gsum bstan pa'i tshig gi dpe ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum bstan pa'i tshig gi dpe ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The example of the statement that teaches the three characteristics is an application.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni chos mthun pa @219a * //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni chos mthun pa @219a * //
translated: That itself is taught:

original: mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni de la yod pa des na chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni de la yod pa des na chos mthun pa ste /
translated: That which is similar in the property to be proven is the similar property.

original: sbyor ba gcig dang gzhan chos mi mthun pa mi 'dra ba gang yin pa de la yod pa des na chos mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig dang gzhan chos mi mthun pa mi 'dra ba gang yin pa de la yod pa des na chos mi mthun pa'o //
translated: That which is dissimilar in the application is the dissimilar property.

original: rim pa ji lta ba 'dis de'i dpe brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba 'dis de'i dpe brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the example of that is:

original: dper na gang dang gang yod pa //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na gang dang gang yod pa // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, whatever exists

original: gang gi sgra ni zlos pa gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: gang gi sgra ni zlos pa gtso bo yin no //
translated: The word “whatever” is a repetition of the word “that.”

original: de thams cad ces bya ba ni de'i sgra yang zlos pa gtso bo nyid do //
analyzed: de thams cad ces bya ba ni de'i sgra yang zlos pa gtso bo nyid do //
translated: The word “all” is also a repetition of the word “that.”

original: thams cad smos pa ni ma lus pa yongs su bzung bas phyi rol gyi khyab pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni ma lus pa yongs su bzung bas phyi rol gyi khyab pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: The mention of “all” is to include everything, and thus to exclude external pervasion.

original: dper na bum pa zhes bya ba ni gang yod pa dang skad cig ma 'brel bsgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa de la dran pa kun nas slong ba'i phyir dper brjod kyi dpe tsam las sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: dper na bum pa zhes bya ba ni gang yod pa dang skad cig ma 'brel bsgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa de la dran pa kun nas slong ba'i phyir dper brjod kyi dpe tsam las sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ro
translated: For example, a pot is the example of a pot, because it is the valid cognition that establishes the connection between existence and momentariness, and it is the cause for the production of memory. But it is not a proof, because it is merely an example.

original: // gcig la yod pa de bzhin du thams cad la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // gcig la yod pa de bzhin du thams cad la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: What exists in one does not exist in all.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: sgra la yang yod pas zhes bya ba ni phyogs de la chos bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sgra la yang yod pas zhes bya ba ni phyogs de la chos bsdu ba'o //
translated: And it exists in sound as well. This is the inclusion of the property in the subject.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i dpe ni /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i dpe ni /
translated: The example of a dissimilar instance is

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: in the same way, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba smos pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i dpe bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba smos pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i dpe bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The phrase in the same way refers to the inclusion of the example of a dissimilar instance.

original: 'dir yang thams cad ces bya ba de ni rnam par dbye ba 'gyur bar 'brel pa yin te skad cig ma nyid med pa thams cad la yod pa nyid med pa yin zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang thams cad smos pa 'bras bur bstan🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang thams cad ces bya ba de ni rnam par dbye ba 'gyur bar 'brel pa yin te skad cig ma nyid med pa thams cad la yod pa nyid med pa yin zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang thams cad smos pa 'bras bur bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here also, the term “all” is related to the division, and the statement “all that is not momentary is not existent” is the demonstration of the result of the statement “all” in both syllogisms.

original: thams cad ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can nyid do //
translated: “All” refers to the subject of the probandum and the subject of the example.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nye ba bsdu ba ni nye bar bsdus pa dang bsdoms pa des na khyab par bya ba ni khyab par byed pa de kho na la yod pa la zhes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nye ba bsdu ba ni nye bar bsdus pa dang bsdoms pa des na khyab par bya ba ni khyab par byed pa de kho na la yod pa la zhes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The inclusion of the probandum is the inclusion and the summary. Therefore, the pervasion is the existence of the pervaded only in the pervader.

original: de bstan pa ni rab tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni rab tu bshad pa'o //
translated: The demonstration of that is the explanation.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni gang dang gang de skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni gang dang gang de skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: The definition of that is whatever is explained in that way.

original: de'i phyir gang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su spangs nas phyi rol gyi khyab pa bstan pa ni gal te yang dpe'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis sgrub par byed pa'i chos la khyab pa de tsam gyis thams cad la de bzhin du
analyzed: de'i phyir gang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yongs su spangs nas phyi rol gyi khyab pa bstan pa ni gal te yang dpe'i chos can la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyis sgrub par byed pa'i chos la khyab pa de tsam gyis thams cad la de bzhin du
translated: Therefore, having completely abandoned the subject that is to be proven, if you teach an external pervasion, then even if the property of the subject in the example is pervaded by the predicate, that much does not prove that the subject in the example is pervaded by the predicate in the thesis.

original: yod pa dang med pa las bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par mi rigs pas bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par mi rigs pas bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, having completely abandoned the subject that is to be established, if you teach an external pervasion, then even if the property of the subject in the example is pervaded by the property of the probandum, it is not suitable to establish that the probandum exists in that way in all similar instances.🔽Therefore, the pervasion is refuted.

original: yang na thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba'i @219b chos kyis sgrub par byed par chos la khyab pa yod par 'gyur na ni rnam pa de lta bu cis na ma bstan /
analyzed: yang na thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba'i @219b chos kyis sgrub par byed par chos la khyab pa yod par 'gyur na ni rnam pa de lta bu cis na ma bstan /
translated: Or, if the property of the probandum pervades the property of the probandum in all respects, then why is that not taught?🔽The explanation that external pervasion is not capable of proving the probandum is like the example of seeing the son of a barren woman.

original: gang gis phyi'i khyab pa la nus pa med par bshad pa ni de ni sngo bsangs yin te de'i bu yin pa'i phyir sngo bsangs kyi bu mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de'i bu yin pas sngo ba sangs su bsgrub par bya ba phyi rol du mthong
analyzed: gang gis phyi'i khyab pa la nus pa med par bshad pa ni de ni sngo bsangs yin te de'i bu yin pa'i phyir sngo bsangs kyi bu mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba de'i bu yin pas sngo ba sangs su bsgrub par bya ba phyi rol du mthong
translated: The son of a barren woman is not established as blue, but he is seen externally as blue.

original: ba'i bu la khyab pa bstan kyang bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i bu la khyab pa bstan kyang bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the pervasion is taught to the son of a barren woman, the probandum will not be established.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyi nye bar bsdus pa'i 'brel pa tshad mas grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis shugs la bsgrub par bya ba grub pa gang yin pa de dran pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyi nye bar bsdus pa'i 'brel pa tshad mas grub pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis shugs la bsgrub par bya ba grub pa gang yin pa de dran pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the memory is the establishment of the probandum by implication from the reason that is established by a valid cognition of the relation that subsumes everything.

original: thams cad nye bar bsdus nas khyab pa bstan pa yang chos kyis khyad par byas pa'i chos can de nyid shes pa med pas /
analyzed: thams cad nye bar bsdus nas khyab pa bstan pa yang chos kyis khyad par byas pa'i chos can de nyid shes pa med pas /
translated: And the teaching of the pervasion that subsumes everything is not the cognition of that very subject that is distinguished by the property.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos bstan pa'i de ma thag pa'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa na dran pa nyid du 'gyur na de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can med na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos bstan pa'i de ma thag pa'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa na dran pa nyid du 'gyur na de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can med na /
translated: Because when the pervasion is inferred after the teaching of the property of the subject, it would be just memory. But if the subject of the probandum does not exist,

original: mi 'byung ba chos rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi de bstan pa las sngar ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba chos rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyi de bstan pa las sngar ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is impossible for the teaching of the non-occurrence that is the reason for the cognition of the property to occur before.

original: de ni khyab pa sngon du song ba'i de ma thag tu bye brag gi yul la rjes su dpog pa na ji ltar dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni khyab pa sngon du song ba'i de ma thag tu bye brag gi yul la rjes su dpog pa na ji ltar dran par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be remembered later when the particular object is inferred, since the pervasion was previously established?

original: 'o na chos mthun pa'i sbyor bas khyab pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rigs te /
analyzed: 'o na chos mthun pa'i sbyor bas khyab pa bstan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rigs te /
translated: Well, then, it is correct that the definition of the indication of pervasion by a similar instance is

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gdon mi za bar yod par bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos yod na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gdon mi za bar yod par bstan pas so //
translated: the indication that the property of the thesis necessarily exists when the property of the reason exists.🔽But how can the dissimilar instance be stated in the proof of nonexistence alone, since the reason does not exist when the thesis is nonexistent?

original: chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pas gtan tshigs med pa 'ba' zhig ji ltar de la brjod gtan tshigs yod pas bsgrub par bya ba yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pas gtan tshigs med pa 'ba' zhig ji ltar de la brjod gtan tshigs yod pas bsgrub par bya ba yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The reason is not stated when the thesis is nonexistent, but the existence of the thesis is not due to the existence of the reason.

original: de dag gi skyon ni med de 'dir bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo bstan pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo 'gal ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi skyon ni med de 'dir bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo bstan pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo 'gal ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no fault in those, because here the reason does not exist when the thesis is nonexistent, but that is not the nature of the reason’s pervasion, which is defined as the indication of the nature of the thing.

original: dngos po'i chos kyi yod pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs de'i bdag nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos kyi yod pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs de'i bdag nyid med par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could the reason, the existence of a thing and so on, not be the nature of that?

original: gang las gtan tshigs tshul gsum par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las gtan tshigs tshul gsum par 'gyur /
translated: From what would the trimodal condition of the reason arise?🔽However, the teaching of a property-possessor that is the opposite of the probandum, a property that is the opposite of the property of the probandum, is a dissimilar example.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa las ldog pa'i chos nyid rang gi chos su gtogs pa de lta bu bstan pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor bas rnam pa de lta bu'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos las gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba rtogs
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa las ldog pa'i chos nyid rang gi chos su gtogs pa de lta bu bstan pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor bas rnam pa de lta bu'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos las gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba rtogs
translated: In that way, the property of the proof is ascertained without doubt from the probandum.

original: pa yin gyi gzhan du na ldog pa dang ldan pa gcig pa nyid @220a * //
analyzed: pa yin gyi gzhan du na ldog pa dang ldan pa gcig pa nyid @220a * //
translated: Otherwise, it would be illogical for the property of the probandum and the property of the proof to be the same.

original: du mi rigs pa'i phyir khyab pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa med na chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: du mi rigs pa'i phyir khyab pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa med na chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor bar mi rigs so //
translated: If the definition of pervasion is not taught, it would be illogical to have a dissimilar example.

original: 'o na ni sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis la dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba ma bstan pa'i de ji ltar shugs kyis go bas de'i don rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ni sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis la dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba ma bstan pa'i de ji ltar shugs kyis go bas de'i don rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Well, if the two types of syllogism are not taught, how would the meaning of the thesis be understood through implication?

original: gang yang sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor bar mngon par mi 'dod can /
analyzed: gang yang sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor bar mngon par mi 'dod can /
translated: Nor is it the case that the syllogism is not accepted as a means of establishing that.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba smos te sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba smos te sbyor ba'o //
translated: Here, he says, “in this case,” that is, in the case of the syllogism.

original: phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa brjod pa'i shugs kho nas zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa brjod pa'i shugs kho nas zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The expression “merely by the force of the statement of the property of the subject” will be explained below.

original: dam bcas pa'i don ni chos dang chos can gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid bsgrub byar rtogs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs las dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don ni chos dang chos can gyi spyi'i mtshan nyid bsgrub byar rtogs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs las dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: The point of the thesis is to be understood as the probandum, the general characteristic of the subject and the property. Therefore, the syllogism should not be taught as a means of establishing the thesis from the reason.

original: gal te gzhan shugs kyis brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan shugs kyis brjod pa ni /
translated: If someone thinks that the point of the thesis is not stated,

original: rab tu ma bstan pa zhes bya ba smos te ma brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma bstan pa zhes bya ba smos te ma brjod pa'o //
translated: he says, “if it is not stated,” that is, if it is not expressed.

original: gzhal bar bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The object of evaluation is the probandum.

original: ji ltar ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: How? In some way it is not understood.

original: gal te dam bcas pa'i don de bzhin du rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa'i don de bzhin du rtogs pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the point of the thesis is understood in that way,🔽he says, “if it is understood in that way, then the statement of the reason is pointless.”

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs su de rang nyid la gzhan gyis bstan pa med par rtogs na gzhal bya nya bar ston par byed pa su zhig yod ces bya ba ni su yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i skabs su de rang nyid la gzhan gyis bstan pa med par rtogs na gzhal bya nya bar ston par byed pa su zhig yod ces bya ba ni su yang ma yin no //
translated: When one infers for oneself, if one understands that without being taught by another, then who is the one who teaches the object to be understood? No one at all.

original: rang nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos mthong bas gzhal bya rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos mthong bas gzhal bya rtogs pa yin no //
translated: One understands the object to be understood by seeing the proving property that is not seen when the probandum is absent.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa las yang de nyid kyis de rtogs na dam bca' ba brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa las yang de nyid kyis de rtogs na dam bca' ba brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: In the same way, if one understands that by inference for the sake of another, then what is the use of stating the thesis?

original: gal te rang nyid rtogs pa'i dus na gzhal bar bya ba 'ga' zhig nye bar bstan pa med pa de lta na de ji ltar rtogs she na /🔽phyogs na yod pa zhes bya ba smos te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rang nyid rtogs pa'i dus na gzhal bar bya ba 'ga' zhig nye bar bstan pa med pa de lta na de ji ltar rtogs she na / phyogs na yod pa zhes bya ba smos te bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod pa'o //
translated: If at the time of understanding for oneself there is no indication of any object to be understood, then how is it understood?🔽He says, “when the proving property is seen in the subject,” that is, when it is present in the subject of the probandum.

original: du bsgrub par byed pa'i chos nye bar dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba ldan pa'o //
analyzed: du bsgrub par byed pa'i chos nye bar dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba ldan pa'o //
translated: The perception of the proving property is seeing it by direct perception.

original: du ba de dang de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me dang 'brel pa tshad mas nges pa'i stobs kyis sngar khyab pa rtogs la med na mi 'byung ba dran par 'gyur ba'i mthu kho nas phyogs kyi chos kho na bzung ba dang khyab par dran pa'i mthu
analyzed: du ba de dang de la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos me dang 'brel pa tshad mas nges pa'i stobs kyis sngar khyab pa rtogs la med na mi 'byung ba dran par 'gyur ba'i mthu kho nas phyogs kyi chos kho na bzung ba dang khyab par dran pa'i mthu
translated: The power of ascertaining by valid cognition the relationship between the property of the subject and the probandum in that smoke and that fire causes one to remember the pervasion that if there is no fire, there is no smoke.🔽

original: kho nas dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba spangs pa las 'di na me yod do zhes de lta bu'i ngo bo dam bca' ba'i don shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho nas dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba spangs pa las 'di na me yod do zhes de lta bu'i ngo bo dam bca' ba'i don shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of ascertaining the pervasion that smoke and fire are related, one previously understood the pervasion. By the power of recalling that smoke does not occur without fire, one comes to understand the meaning of the thesis, “Fire exists here,” by the power of recalling only the subject property and the pervasion.

original: de la 'dir yang sha za la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis gzhal bar bya ba rna bar brjod pas de ltar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang sha za la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis gzhal bar bya ba rna bar brjod pas de ltar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If one thinks, “In this case, it would be like an object of comprehension being stated to an ear by some ghost and so on,”

original: @220b de na 'di la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @220b de na 'di la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then one would say, “In this case,”

original: de la rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dus su sha za la sogs pa 'ga' zhig mi snang ba'i me 'di na de ltar yod do zhes gzhal bar bya ba 'di rtogs par byed pa ston cing brjod pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dus su sha za la sogs pa 'ga' zhig mi snang ba'i me 'di na de ltar yod do zhes gzhal bar bya ba 'di rtogs par byed pa ston cing brjod pa ni med do //
translated: and in this case, one would not teach or state that an inference for oneself realizes the object of comprehension, “Fire exists here in this way,” by the power of some ghost and so on not appearing at the time.

original: gal te khyod bden par smra bas yin na de ltar brjod par ni mi rigs la /
analyzed: gal te khyod bden par smra bas yin na de ltar brjod par ni mi rigs la /
translated: If you are speaking the truth, then it is not right to say that.

original: de bzhin du kho bos kyang sa phyogs la yod pa'i du ba mthong nas de mes khyab par dran pa la ltos nas me'i rtogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du kho bos kyang sa phyogs la yod pa'i du ba mthong nas de mes khyab par dran pa la ltos nas me'i rtogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, when I see smoke in a particular place and remember that it is pervaded by fire, I have the cognition of fire.

original: yod par 'ga' zhig brjod par mi byed na yang me 'di na yod do zhes de rtogs par byed pa de bzhin du de ni gzhan la yang rim pa dang bcas pas rtogs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod par 'ga' zhig brjod par mi byed na yang me 'di na yod do zhes de rtogs par byed pa de bzhin du de ni gzhan la yang rim pa dang bcas pas rtogs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though I do not say that fire exists, I do understand that fire exists there. In the same way, the other person also understands it in a similar way.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig ston pa med pa de lta na yang rang nyid kyis gzhal bya rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa na rtogs kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig ston pa med pa de lta na yang rang nyid kyis gzhal bya rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa na rtogs kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that even without being taught, when one understands the presentation of the object of comprehension, one understands it and then wishes to follow it,

original: bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna says, “By oneself.”

original: gal te 'ga' zhig ston par mi byed na rang nyid 'ba' zhig gis kyang rtags kyi byed pa las sngar cung zad cig kyang me la sogs pa rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig ston par mi byed na rang nyid 'ba' zhig gis kyang rtags kyi byed pa las sngar cung zad cig kyang me la sogs pa rtogs pa med do //
translated: If no one teaches it, then even by itself, one would not at all understand fire, etc. prior to the operation of the reason.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na tshad ma ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na tshad ma ni rgyu'o //
translated: Why? The valid cognition is the cause.

original: med pa ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ni stong pa'o //
translated: The non-existent is empty.

original: me 'di na yod do zhes de ltar rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir de lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan tshul gsum ba'i gtan tshigs med na de ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: me 'di na yod do zhes de ltar rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir de lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan tshul gsum ba'i gtan tshigs med na de ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Since there is no reason for understanding in the way “fire exists here,” how could that be the reason for understanding the hidden, if there is no reason with the trimodal logical mark?

original: gal te rtags med kyang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes smra na de'i tshe de ltar rtogs par 'dod pa yin na rtags don med do //
analyzed: gal te rtags med kyang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes smra na de'i tshe de ltar rtogs par 'dod pa yin na rtags don med do //
translated: If one says that one understands in that way even without a reason, then if one desires to understand in that way, the reason is pointless.

original: de ni rje su dpag par bya ba'i rtogs pa'i ched yin pa'i phyir de med kyang de rtogs na de ji ltar 'di dgos pa med par mi 'gyur gzhan dag shin tu rmongs par ston pa ni bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te //
analyzed: de ni rje su dpag par bya ba'i rtogs pa'i ched yin pa'i phyir de med kyang de rtogs na de ji ltar 'di dgos pa med par mi 'gyur gzhan dag shin tu rmongs par ston pa ni bdag nyid ces bya ba smos te //
translated: To show that others are extremely confused, he says one's own...

original: rang dgar 'di la me yod do zhes rnam par 'jog pa ni ji ltar ba bcol du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang dgar 'di la me yod do zhes rnam par 'jog pa ni ji ltar ba bcol du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should not haphazardly posit fire exists here in an arbitrary manner.

original: ci'i phyir tshad ma med kyang rnam par 'jog par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshad ma med kyang rnam par 'jog par 'gyur /
translated: Why would one posit it even without valid cognition?

original: de rtogs pa ni rgyu mtshan ni gzhal bya rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa'i ched du phyi nas rtags de'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i rim pa char phye ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni rgyu mtshan ni gzhal bya rnam par gzhag pa rtogs pa'i ched du phyi nas rtags de'i rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i rim pa char phye ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the purpose of this sequence of understanding, that after understanding the object to be established, one then follows the reason as the basis for that understanding?

original: de lta na dang po rtags kyi rjes su 'brangs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs so zhes bya ba rim pa 'thad pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta na dang po rtags kyi rjes su 'brangs pa de las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs so zhes bya ba rim pa 'thad pa yin na /
translated: In that case, it would be reasonable to say that first one understands the probandum from following the reason.

original: gang sngar rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de ni phyin ci log la brten @221a * //🔽pa'i phyir bzhad gang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang sngar rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de ni phyin ci log la brten @221a * // pa'i phyir bzhad gang du 'gyur te /
translated: What was previously to be inferred is now the basis of laughter, because it is based on error.🔽For example, in the world, when someone shaves his head, he is asked, “What star is your deity?”

original: 'jig rten na skra bregs nas skar ma 'dri'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'i gru de dang rim pa 'di mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na skra bregs nas skar ma 'dri'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'i gru de dang rim pa 'di mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The analogy is that the present case is similar to that in terms of the absurdity.

original: de'i phyir phyogs kyi chos bzung nas khyab par dran pa'i mthu kho nas rang nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs kyi chos bzung nas khyab par dran pa'i mthu kho nas rang nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, having grasped the property of the position, by the power of remembering the pervasion, one understands the property of the position by oneself.🔽And that is stated by the teacher.

original: de yang ston par byed pas brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni cung zad cig kyang gzhal bya bstan pa med do //
analyzed: de yang ston par byed pas brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni cung zad cig kyang gzhal bya bstan pa med do //
translated: There is no indication of an object of comprehension at all.

original: gal te rang gi don rjes su dpag pa'i dus su rang nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa ni rigs te brtag kyang de la bdag nyid kho nas rtogs so zhes de skad du bshad kyi /
analyzed: gal te rang gi don rjes su dpag pa'i dus su rang nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa ni rigs te brtag kyang de la bdag nyid kho nas rtogs so zhes de skad du bshad kyi /
translated: If it is reasonable that at the time of inferring for oneself, one understands the probandum by oneself, then it is reasonable to say, “I understand it by myself alone.”

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni gzhan gyis ji ltar rtags bstan pa de bzhin du gzhal byer bya ba yang gzhan kho nas bstan par bya ba de'i phyir dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba rigs so snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni gzhan gyis ji ltar rtags bstan pa de bzhin du gzhal byer bya ba yang gzhan kho nas bstan par bya ba de'i phyir dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba rigs so snyam na /
translated: As for inference for the sake of others, it is just as the reason is stated by others, and the object of comprehension is also stated by others alone. Therefore, the application of a thesis is reasonable.

original: de gzhan gyis shes brjod na yang //
analyzed: de gzhan gyis shes brjod na yang //
translated: Even if others understand and express it,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: it is still flawed.

original: bdag nyid kho na nyid tshe sngar rnam par 'jog par byed na bslad pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na nyid tshe sngar rnam par 'jog par byed na bslad pa yin te /
translated: If one posits it oneself, it is flawed.

original: gzhan rgol bas de'i gzhal bar bya ba brjod pa yang bslad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan rgol bas de'i gzhal bar bya ba brjod pa yang bslad pa nyid do //
translated: Even if the opponent expresses the object of comprehension, it is still flawed.

original: de brjod pa ni don la the tshom za ba rjod par byed de /
analyzed: de brjod pa ni don la the tshom za ba rjod par byed de /
translated: The expression of that is the expression of doubt about the meaning.

original: de ni nges pa'i yan lag ma yin pas gzhal bar bya ba zab pa rtogs par dka' ba brgyud pas kyang de ma yin pa dang 'brel pa brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis stong par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nges pa'i yan lag ma yin pas gzhal bar bya ba zab pa rtogs par dka' ba brgyud pas kyang de ma yin pa dang 'brel pa brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis stong par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Since that is not a part of certainty, the object of comprehension, which is difficult to realize, is empty of the reason of mere desire to express the connection with that through the lineage.

original: ci'i phyir bslad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bslad pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it flawed?

original: nye bar mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not necessary.

original: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa la nye bar mkho ba cung zad cig kyang med de //
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa la nye bar mkho ba cung zad cig kyang med de //
translated: Here, there is not the slightest necessity for understanding the probandum,

original: de shes pa dang shugs la dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de shes pa dang shugs la dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is known and inseparable from the force. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan dag ni 'ga' zhig tu nye bar mkho ba yod do zhes dgongs pas yul nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'ga' zhig tu nye bar mkho ba yod do zhes dgongs pas yul nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Others think that it is necessary in some cases, so he says, “The statement of the object . . .”

original: gtan tshigs kyi yul ni bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi yul ni bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de bstan pa ste /
translated: The object of the reason is the probandum. The statement of that is the statement of the thesis.

original: dam bca' ba'i tshig nye bar mkho ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i tshig nye bar mkho ba yin zhe na /
translated: The words of the thesis are necessary.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te yul lo //🔽re zhig smos pa ni rim gyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos te yul lo // re zhig smos pa ni rim gyis so //
translated: He says, “By that alone . . .” the object.🔽The statement of the object is the statement of the thesis.

original: yul nye bar bstan pas don dang ldan pa yin de bstan na ni dam bca' ba'i tshig dogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yul nye bar bstan pas don dang ldan pa yin de bstan na ni dam bca' ba'i tshig dogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the object is stated, the words of the thesis are stated.

original: yul bstan pa nyid kyis ci zhig phan te dgos pa ci zhig yod ces bya'o //
analyzed: yul bstan pa nyid kyis ci zhig phan te dgos pa ci zhig yod ces bya'o //
translated: What is the use of stating the object? What is the purpose?
