original: gal te de ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa dang / chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i yul nye bar bstan pa'i don de dang de @221b bstan pa la dam bca' ba'i tshig brjod dgos te de lta na bsgrub par bya ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa dang / chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i yul nye bar bstan pa'i don de dang de @221b bstan pa la dam bca' ba'i tshig brjod dgos te de lta na bsgrub par bya ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: If it is necessary to state the thesis in order to indicate the object that is understood, such as the probandum and the object understood by the application of a similar property, then the probandum must be indicated.

original: byas pa nyid mi rtag go zhes brjod pa 'dir ci zhig chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba yin /
analyzed: byas pa nyid mi rtag go zhes brjod pa 'dir ci zhig chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba yin /
translated: In the statement “That which is produced is impermanent,” what is the application of a similar property?

original: yang na chos mi mthun pa can yang mi shes te /
analyzed: yang na chos mi mthun pa can yang mi shes te /
translated: Or, one would not understand the application of a dissimilar property.

original: 'dir gnyi ga la dogs pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'dir gnyi ga la dogs pa skye ste /
translated: Here, doubt arises regarding both.

original: byas pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba dang chos mthun pa can dang rtag pa ni ma byas pa nyid ni chos mi mthun pa zhes bya ba sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa nyid do zhes dam bca' ba'i tshig gis the tshom med par
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba dang chos mthun pa can dang rtag pa ni ma byas pa nyid ni chos mi mthun pa zhes bya ba sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa nyid do zhes dam bca' ba'i tshig gis the tshom med par
translated: The statement “Sound is impermanent because it is produced” is understood without doubt by the words of the thesis, “That which is produced is impermanent,” which is the application of a similar property that proves impermanence by production, and “That which is not produced is permanent,” which is the application of a dissimilar property.

original: rtogs pa dang / gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang ma nges pa rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang / gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang ma nges pa rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One would not understand the reason to be contradictory or indeterminate.

original: dam bca' pa sngon du song ba'i sbyor ba ni sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs yod par rtogs pa las byas pa'i phyir rtag go zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dang / rtsol ba las byung ba yin te byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa dang /
analyzed: dam bca' pa sngon du song ba'i sbyor ba ni sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs yod par rtogs pa las byas pa'i phyir rtag go zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dang / rtsol ba las byung ba yin te byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa dang /
translated: It is inconclusive, as in “It arises from effort because it is produced.”

original: gtan tshigs tshul gsum pa'i rtags go bar bya bar mi 'gyur te de bsgrub par bya ba ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs tshul gsum pa'i rtags go bar bya bar mi 'gyur te de bsgrub par bya ba ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason, which has the three modes, does not make the proposition understood, because it depends on the probandum.

original: dam bca' ba'i tshig ni cha shas la spyi brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i tshig ni cha shas la spyi brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words of the thesis are a designation of the universal in the parts.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la phyogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la phyogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The subject of the probandum is called the “position.”

original: de la yod pa'i byas pa nyid ni phyogs kyi chos so //
analyzed: de la yod pa'i byas pa nyid ni phyogs kyi chos so //
translated: The production that exists in it is the property of the position.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni spyi'i don ni phyogs so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni spyi'i don ni phyogs so //
translated: The probandum is the universal. The meaning of the position is the universal.

original: de la 'jug pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ste mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos spong ba ni mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ste mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos spong ba ni mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The engagement of that is the existence in the similar class and the non-existence in the dissimilar class. The similar class is the predicate of the probandum. The non-engagement is the abandonment of the similar class.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par rtogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par rtogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa la /
translated: There is the apprehension of non-existence in the dissimilar class.

original: gal te zhes bya ba smos te /🔽bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid nges pa dang / chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nges par bzung ba'i bdag nyid las gzhan du na ni dam bca' ba'i tshig med pa na'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba smos te / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid nges pa dang / chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nges par bzung ba'i bdag nyid las gzhan du na ni dam bca' ba'i tshig med pa na'o //
translated: To that, it is said: If...🔽 If the definition of the predicate of the probandum and the statement of the reason in the similar class, etc. were other than the nature of the ascertainment of the essence, then there would be no statement of the thesis.

original: de ni mi rigs te bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa don du chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa shes pa'i don la yul nye bar bstan par bya ba yin na ni de thams cad legs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa don du chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa shes pa'i don la yul nye bar bstan par bya ba yin na ni de thams cad legs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not correct. If the establishment of the probandum were the purpose, then the statement of the reason in the similar class, etc. would be the indication of the object, but that would not be correct.

original: ji srid du rang gi don rjes su dpag pa'i dus su dam bca' ba'i tshig med kyang phyogs kyi chos bzung nas 'brel ba dran pas bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bshad pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes @222a🔽* // su dpag pa la yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji srid du rang gi don rjes su dpag pa'i dus su dam bca' ba'i tshig med kyang phyogs kyi chos bzung nas 'brel ba dran pas bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bshad pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes @222a * // su dpag pa la yang 'gyur te /
translated: As long as one comprehends the definition of the probandum through recalling the relation after apprehending the property of the subject, even though there are no words of thesis at the time of inferring for oneself, in the same way, it is also for inferring for the sake of others.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bas na dam bca' ba'i sbyor bar smra ba ni gang gi tshe rang nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pas yul rnam par 'jog par byed na gang gis na yul dam bca'
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bas na dam bca' ba'i sbyor bar smra ba ni gang gi tshe rang nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pas yul rnam par 'jog par byed na gang gis na yul dam bca'
translated: Therefore, when one who advocates the employment of a thesis comprehends the probandum by oneself, at that time, one posits the object through comprehending the probandum by oneself.

original: ba'i tshig gi sgo nas skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis de med kyang rtogs pas bsgrub par bya ba nges pa ni rtags kyi mthu kho na las yin no //
analyzed: ba'i tshig gi sgo nas skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis de med kyang rtogs pas bsgrub par bya ba nges pa ni rtags kyi mthu kho na las yin no //
translated: By what means does one ascertain the probandum through the power of the sign alone, even though some person does not have the thesis statement?

original: kho bo cag gis rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag don du gnyer ba mthong ba ni bsal ba'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag don du gnyer ba mthong ba ni bsal ba'o //
translated: Whatever we understand, we see that we are seeking a purpose, and that is the elimination.

original: dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba mtshan nyid ni ci dus ston gyi bram ze bzhin du rnyed pa tshol bar byed dam /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i sbyor ba mtshan nyid ni ci dus ston gyi bram ze bzhin du rnyed pa tshol bar byed dam /
translated: The definition of the application of the thesis is: Are you seeking wealth like a brahmin at a festival?

original: dper na yod med kyang gzhan dag gi khyim du bram ze la gzhan dag dad pa can la sogs pa dus ston don du gnyer ba na dad pa can la smras pa mar gyis bkang zhing so sor yon ster na ni kho bo za'i gzhan du na ma
analyzed: dper na yod med kyang gzhan dag gi khyim du bram ze la gzhan dag dad pa can la sogs pa dus ston don du gnyer ba na dad pa can la smras pa mar gyis bkang zhing so sor yon ster na ni kho bo za'i gzhan du na ma
translated: For example, in the houses of others, when brahmins are sought for a festival by the faithful and so on, they say to the faithful, If you fill this with butter and give it to each, I will eat. Otherwise, I will not.

original: yin no zhes bya ba de dang mtshungs par khyod la yang yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba de dang mtshungs par khyod la yang yin no //
translated: That is similar to you.

original: gzhan yang gal te smras pa gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus su ji ltar rtags gzhan gyis ma brjod na rtogs pa med do zhes bstan pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te smras pa gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus su ji ltar rtags gzhan gyis ma brjod na rtogs pa med do zhes bstan pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes brjod na /
translated: Moreover, if it is said, Just as it is taught that when inferring for the sake of others, if the reason is not stated by another, there is no understanding, so it is for the probandum,

original: nam gyi tshe dgos pa yin /
analyzed: nam gyi tshe dgos pa yin /
translated: when is that necessary?

original: gal te 'di rgol bas brjod pa tsam gyis rtags kyang nges la de'i rjes su 'brangs nas bsgrub bya rtogs par 'gyur ba dang gzhan la rtogs pa don du gnyer ba yin na kho bo yang rtags brjod pa spangs nas dam bca' ba la cis na sbyor ba
analyzed: gal te 'di rgol bas brjod pa tsam gyis rtags kyang nges la de'i rjes su 'brangs nas bsgrub bya rtogs par 'gyur ba dang gzhan la rtogs pa don du gnyer ba yin na kho bo yang rtags brjod pa spangs nas dam bca' ba la cis na sbyor ba
translated: If the opponent were to ascertain the reason merely by the proponent’s statement of it and then understand the probandum by following the reason, and if the opponent were to seek to understand the reason, then why would we not engage in a proof that is just a thesis, abandoning the statement of the reason?

original: mi byed / kho bo cag gi tshig nyed de rtogs pa'i tshad ma yin pa de nyid kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa ni brjod pas grub pa'i phyir na de na yod pa ma yin no //🔽gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi tshig 'ba' zhig gis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi byed / kho bo cag gi tshig nyed de rtogs pa'i tshad ma yin pa de nyid kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa ni brjod pas grub pa'i phyir na de na yod pa ma yin no // gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi tshig 'ba' zhig gis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Because the mere words of us Mādhyamikas are a valid cognition that ascertains the probandum, the understanding of the probandum that follows from those words is established by the statement. Therefore it is not the case that the reason is not stated.🔽It is not the case that the reason is not stated because it is not the case that the probandum is understood only from our words.

original: rang gi don rjes su dpag pa'i dus su kho bo cag gis brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su dpag pa'i dus su kho bo cag gis brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when we are inferring for ourselves, we do not state the reason.

original: kyang gi sgras ni 'on kyang gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi brjod pa 'jug pa de'i tshe yang kho bo cag gi tshig las rtags kyang rtogs pa med na gang kho na las bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni 'on kyang gang gi tshe kho bo cag gi brjod pa 'jug pa de'i tshe yang kho bo cag gi tshig las rtags kyang rtogs pa med na gang kho na las bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur /
translated: The word “also” indicates that even when our statements are used, if the reason is not understood from our words, then what will be understood?🔽However, when the reason is established by some valid cognition, and it is established for the opponent himself, then at that time we are merely reminding the opponent of the reason.

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe de'i rtags tshad ma 'ga' zhig las de 'dir rang nyid grub par gyur pa de la kho bo cag gis dran pa skyed par byed pa tsam yin pa @222b de'i tshe rtags bdag nyid grub pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bsgrub par bya ba
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe de'i rtags tshad ma 'ga' zhig las de 'dir rang nyid grub par gyur pa de la kho bo cag gis dran pa skyed par byed pa tsam yin pa @222b de'i tshe rtags bdag nyid grub pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bsgrub par bya ba
translated: At that time, the probandum is understood by following the established reason,

original: rtogs kyi tshig gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs kyi tshig gis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the words.

original: de'i phyir gang gis na dam bca' ba brjod pa dang ma brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs 'di gnyis la khyad par med de rtags kyi bdag nyid grub pa'i nus pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pas ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis na dam bca' ba brjod pa dang ma brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs 'di gnyis la khyad par med de rtags kyi bdag nyid grub pa'i nus pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pas ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between the two situations, where the thesis is stated and where it is not stated, because the probandum is understood by the mere power of the established reason itself, and nothing else.

original: des na rang dang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa rtags kyi bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs pa des bsgrub bya rtogs te /
analyzed: des na rang dang gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa rtags kyi bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs pa des bsgrub bya rtogs te /
translated: Therefore, one should understand the probandum by following the inference of one’s own and others’ purposes, which is the nature of a reason.

original: bsgrub bya rtogs pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa la dam bca' ba don med pa nyid de rtags kyang re zhig 'dir ma brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: bsgrub bya rtogs pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa la dam bca' ba don med pa nyid de rtags kyang re zhig 'dir ma brjod pa yin na /
translated: Since there is no difference in understanding the probandum, it is pointless to state a thesis in the inference of others. If the reason is not stated here,

original: gang de sngar grub pa'i bdag nyid rjes su dran pas ma yin na ci the tshom za ba'i don brjod par bya ba'i dam bca' ba brjod par khas len pa yin /
analyzed: gang de sngar grub pa'i bdag nyid rjes su dran pas ma yin na ci the tshom za ba'i don brjod par bya ba'i dam bca' ba brjod par khas len pa yin /
translated: then why would one accept the statement of a thesis that expresses a doubtful meaning, not by recalling a previously established self?

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa la dam bca' ba mi brjod pa nye bar mi mkho bas de'i don la 'di sbyor ba ma yin gyi chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa shes pa'i phyir de brjod pa la gnas pa nyid de de bzhin du
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba 'grub pa la dam bca' ba mi brjod pa nye bar mi mkho bas de'i don la 'di sbyor ba ma yin gyi chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa shes pa'i phyir de brjod pa la gnas pa nyid de de bzhin du
translated: If it is not necessary to state a thesis in order to establish the probandum, then this is not applied to that purpose. It is only stated in order to understand syllogisms with similar properties and so on.

original: na rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam na dam bca' ba smos pa med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: na rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam na dam bca' ba smos pa med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you think that it is because there is no understanding, then the response is that there is no statement of a thesis.

original: chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa dam bca' ba brjod pa med par yang rtogs pa mthong ba de'i phyir de'i don la dam bca' ba nye bar dgod pa mdzes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa dam bca' ba brjod pa med par yang rtogs pa mthong ba de'i phyir de'i don la dam bca' ba nye bar dgod pa mdzes pa ma yin no //
translated: Since one sees that there is understanding even without a statement of a thesis in a probative argument that has a similar property, therefore it is not elegant to posit a thesis for that purpose.

original: chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa med na yang bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa rtogs pa ga la yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa med na yang bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa rtogs pa ga la yin zhe na /
translated: If there is no probative argument that has a similar property, how can there be an understanding of the demonstration of the probandum?

original: phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa smos pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa smos pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response is that it is merely by stating the relation of the property of the subject.

original: 'di snyam du dgongs pa yin te 'ga' zhig byas pa yin pa de ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba de tsam brjod pa tsam gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs pa yin te 'ga' zhig byas pa yin pa de ni mi rtag go zhes bya ba de tsam brjod pa tsam gyis ma yin te /
translated: The idea is this: It is not merely by stating that much, “Whatever is produced is impermanent,”

original: btang snyoms su 'dug pa dang / sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba gang yin pa kho nas phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms su 'dug pa dang / sgrub par byed pa ma tshang ba gang yin pa kho nas phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would remain indifferent and the proof would be incomplete.

original: 'on kyang gtan tshigs chos can la nye bar bsdu ba ni gdon mi za bar bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: 'on kyang gtan tshigs chos can la nye bar bsdu ba ni gdon mi za bar bya ba yin no ;
translated: However, it is necessary to apply the reason to the subject.

original: / de la gang gi tshe sgra yang byas pas shes brjod pa de'i tshe chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: / de la gang gi tshe sgra yang byas pas shes brjod pa de'i tshe chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba rtogs pa'am /
translated: When one says that sound is also a product, then at that time one understands the syllogism having a similar predicate.🔽Or, when one says that it is to be examined, then at that time it is a syllogism having a dissimilar predicate.

original: yang na gang gi tshe brtag pa brjod pa de'i tshe chos mi mthun pa can yin no zhes 'brel pa brjod pa sngon du song ba'i phyogs kyi chos brjod pas sbyor ba gnyi ga rtogs pa @223a * //
analyzed: yang na gang gi tshe brtag pa brjod pa de'i tshe chos mi mthun pa can yin no zhes 'brel pa brjod pa sngon du song ba'i phyogs kyi chos brjod pas sbyor ba gnyi ga rtogs pa @223a * //
translated: One understands both syllogisms by stating the property of the subject, preceded by the statement of the relation.

original: yin no // gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang ma nges pa yang phyogs kyi chos smos pa tsam gyis rtogs so //
analyzed: yin no // gtan tshigs 'gal ba dang ma nges pa yang phyogs kyi chos smos pa tsam gyis rtogs so //
translated: One understands the contradictory and uncertain reasons merely by stating the property of the subject.

original: gang gi 'brel pa rjod par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar mi rtogs /
analyzed: gang gi 'brel pa rjod par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar mi rtogs /
translated: When one states the relation, how could one not understand it?

original: de lta na gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos brjod pa na 'brel pa bshad pa la gtan tshigs su khong du chud pa ni bsgrub pa'i rjes su bzlas pas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos brjod pa na 'brel pa bshad pa la gtan tshigs su khong du chud pa ni bsgrub pa'i rjes su bzlas pas khyab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the property of the position is stated, the explanation of the relation is understood as the reason, and the pervasion is the repetition of the probandum.

original: gang byas pa de ni rtag pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'gal ba ste khyab pa phyin ci log pa yin la /
analyzed: gang byas pa de ni rtag pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'gal ba ste khyab pa phyin ci log pa yin la /
translated: When it is stated that what is produced is permanent, that is contradictory, because the pervasion is reversed.

original: gang byas pa de ni rtsol ba las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa ni 'khrul pas ma nges pa yin par nges so //
analyzed: gang byas pa de ni rtsol ba las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa ni 'khrul pas ma nges pa yin par nges so //
translated: When it is stated that what is produced arises from effort, it is certainly inconclusive due to error.

original: tshul gsum pas rtags go bar bya ba yin te gang gi phyir khyab pa ston pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum pas rtags go bar bya ba yin te gang gi phyir khyab pa ston pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The reason is understood through the three modes, because at the time of teaching the pervasion, the pervading property is to be understood as the probandum.

original: gang la khyab par bya ba'i chos can la nye bar sdud pa de khyab par byed pa'i chos khyad par can rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la khyab par bya ba'i chos can la nye bar sdud pa de khyab par byed pa'i chos khyad par can rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Where the pervaded property is subsumed in the subject, that special pervading property is to be understood.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i spyi'i phyogs gcig phyogs yin no zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni khyab par bya ba'i chos phyogs kyi chos nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i spyi'i phyogs gcig phyogs yin no zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni khyab par bya ba'i chos phyogs kyi chos nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The general subject of the probandum is the subject.🔽The subject is to be understood as the property of the subject of the pervasion.🔽Moreover, the subject of the pervasion that is indicated is to be understood as the similar instance that is concordant with the general meaning of the probandum.

original: de yang khyab pa chos can gang nye bar bstan pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang don mthun pa la mthun pa'i phyogs su shes par bya'o zhes mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa yang rtogs pa dang / shugs kyis khyab par byed pa ldog pas khyab par bya ba ldog pa gang la nges pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa yang nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang khyab pa chos can gang nye bar bstan pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi dang don mthun pa la mthun pa'i phyogs su shes par bya'o zhes mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa yang rtogs pa dang / shugs kyis khyab par byed pa ldog pas khyab par bya ba ldog pa gang la nges pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa yang nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the existence of the similar instance is ascertained by implication, and the nonexistence of the dissimilar instance is ascertained by implication through the reversal of the pervader.

original: gal te phyogs la sogs pa rnams kyang shes pa ni cung zad cig dogs pa ni tha snyad du byed pa rnams phyogs la sogs pa'i brda la ltos nas lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te phyogs la sogs pa rnams kyang shes pa ni cung zad cig dogs pa ni tha snyad du byed pa rnams phyogs la sogs pa'i brda la ltos nas lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If one wonders whether the subject and so on are known, the response is that those who engage in conventions do not realize a hidden object in dependence on the conventions of the subject and so on.

original: gang la lar dpe gang la 'brel pa'i rnam pa de dang des rtogs pa de la 'jig rten pa dngos po rtogs par gyur pa ni phyogs la sogs pa brda bzung pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la lar dpe gang la 'brel pa'i rnam pa de dang des rtogs pa de la 'jig rten pa dngos po rtogs par gyur pa ni phyogs la sogs pa brda bzung pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: In some cases, the understanding of a thing by the world is not dependent on the grasping of a convention such as a direction.

original: de la bstan bcos byed pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i lung gi ngo bo rtogs pa rang nyid kyi brda la /
analyzed: de la bstan bcos byed pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i lung gi ngo bo rtogs pa rang nyid kyi brda la /
translated: In that case, the author of a treatise, in his own convention, understands the nature of a scriptural statement as he wishes.

original: gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid bye pa yang tha snyad kyi dus su de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams la 'ba' zhig tu nye bar mkho ba med do //🔽de'i brda bstan pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i @223b lung gi ngo bo la nye bar mkho ba'i tha snyad du byed pa rnams gal te de las rtogs pa de tsam nyid kyi bsgrub bya 'grub pa skyed pa'i phyir phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa'i
analyzed: gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid bye pa yang tha snyad kyi dus su de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams la 'ba' zhig tu nye bar mkho ba med do // de'i brda bstan pa nyid ni ji skad bshad pa'i @223b lung gi ngo bo la nye bar mkho ba'i tha snyad du byed pa rnams gal te de las rtogs pa de tsam nyid kyi bsgrub bya 'grub pa skyed pa'i phyir phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa'i
translated: The definition of another is also not necessary for those who follow him at the time of convention.

original: brda yongs su shes pa la yang cung zad nyams pa med do //
analyzed: brda yongs su shes pa la yang cung zad nyams pa med do //
translated: The teaching of his convention is only necessary for those who make statements about the nature of a scriptural statement as explained. If they understand it from that alone, the thesis is established, because it produces that understanding. Therefore, there is no fault in not understanding the convention of direction, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis med na mi 'byung ba'i don bstan pa de rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes go bar byed pa'i ngo bo tsam gyi phyogs la brda la mi ltos par rtsod pa bsgrub par bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis med na mi 'byung ba'i don bstan pa de rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes go bar byed pa'i ngo bo tsam gyi phyogs la brda la mi ltos par rtsod pa bsgrub par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the Acarya has explained that when one proves a syllogism, one does not depend on linguistic signs in the case of the mere nature of the object that is taught to be the meaning of the invariable relation.

original: rang gi shes rab kyis nyes pas yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi shes rab kyis nyes pas yin gyi /
translated: It is not because of his own faulty wisdom.

original: de la cung zad cig kyang skyon du grags pa med pa'i phyir 'dir ci zhig brjod par bya /
analyzed: de la cung zad cig kyang skyon du grags pa med pa'i phyir 'dir ci zhig brjod par bya /
translated: Since there is not the slightest fault in that, what is there to say here?

original: de'i chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa shes pa'i phyir dam bca' ba brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa shes pa'i phyir dam bca' ba brjod pa yin na /
translated: If the statement of the proposition is for the sake of understanding the application, etc., which are similar to its property,

original: phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa brjod pa tsam kho nas ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa rtogs par mi yod de /🔽ci yang med pa yod de /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa brjod pa tsam kho nas ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa rtogs par mi yod de / ci yang med pa yod de /
translated: then it is not the case that one understands the form as it has been explained merely by the statement of the relation of the property of the subject.🔽Because there is nothing at all.

original: ci yang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is nothing at all.

original: rang nyid kyang 'di brjod pa'i rim pa gnag gis rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa de khyab par du bsal nas gzhan la rtogs pa rim gzhan la brten pa ni gzhan slu ba g-yo can gyi rtogs pa kho na yin gyi bden pa ma yin no
analyzed: rang nyid kyang 'di brjod pa'i rim pa gnag gis rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa de khyab par du bsal nas gzhan la rtogs pa rim gzhan la brten pa ni gzhan slu ba g-yo can gyi rtogs pa kho na yin gyi bden pa ma yin no
translated: And also, having eliminated the pervasion that one understands the object to be inferred by the process of stating this, the process of causing another to understand in dependence on another process is only the understanding of a deceiver, a trickster, and is not true.

original: zhes bstan pa ni rang la nges pa bzhin du zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni rang la nges pa bzhin du zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement of this is “just as one has ascertained oneself . . .”

original: ji ltar rang la pa skyes par byas pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang nges pa skyes par byed pa ni gzhan la yang phan par dga' bas sgrub pa brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar rang la pa skyes par byas pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang nges pa skyes par byed pa ni gzhan la yang phan par dga' bas sgrub pa brjod do //
translated: Just as one generates ascertainment for oneself, so one generates ascertainment for another. This is stated to be practice because of delighting in benefiting others.

original: de la ni de'i rigs par gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: de la ni de'i rigs par gyur pa la'o //
translated: In that, “in that way” is with respect to that reasoning.

original: bdag nyid ni rgol ba 'di'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni rgol ba 'di'o //
translated: “One’s own” is this challenger.

original: gzhan bya nye bar bstan pa ni nye bar bstan pa su zhig gis brjod pa med kyang rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus su gzhal par bya ba la rtogs la gzhan la the tshom za ba la sogs pa la ston pa ni bdag nyid kyis
analyzed: gzhan bya nye bar bstan pa ni nye bar bstan pa su zhig gis brjod pa med kyang rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i dus su gzhal par bya ba la rtogs la gzhan la the tshom za ba la sogs pa la ston pa ni bdag nyid kyis
translated: “Teaching others” means that even though no one teaches it, when one is inferring for oneself, one understands the object of comprehension and teaches it to others who have doubts, etc.🔽This is the comprehension of the object of comprehension that one has understood.

original: rtogs pa'i gzhal bya khong du chud pa sngar rang nyid kyis rtogs pa'i dus su gang snga ma'i gzhal bya rtogs pa'i thabs kyi rim pa nyams su myong ba de las gzhan la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rim pa gzhan la brten pa'i rgyu
analyzed: rtogs pa'i gzhal bya khong du chud pa sngar rang nyid kyis rtogs pa'i dus su gang snga ma'i gzhal bya rtogs pa'i thabs kyi rim pa nyams su myong ba de las gzhan la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rim pa gzhan la brten pa'i rgyu
translated: When one previously understood it for oneself, one experienced the process of the method for understanding the object of comprehension.🔽What is the reason for relying on another process?

original: ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ci zhig yod /
translated: There is no reason at all.

original: ci yang med pa nyid de gzhan dag rmongs par 'gyur bas spang bar bya'o //🔽'di ltar gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rim pas @224a * //
analyzed: ci yang med pa nyid de gzhan dag rmongs par 'gyur bas spang bar bya'o // 'di ltar gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rim pas @224a * //
translated: This is to be rejected because it would confuse others.

original: rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na cis na des yongs su spangs nas rim pa gzhan la brten pa yin /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na cis na des yongs su spangs nas rim pa gzhan la brten pa yin /
translated: In this way, if the process of understanding for oneself is the reason for understanding, why would one abandon it and rely on another process?

original: yang na rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i rim pa gzhan la brten pa yin na ni ji ltar des rang nyid kyis rtogs pa dang ldan pa khyed kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i rim pa gzhan la brten pa yin na ni ji ltar des rang nyid kyis rtogs pa dang ldan pa khyed kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, if it is based on another stage that is not the reason for understanding, then how could it be yours, which has understanding by itself?

original: de lta bas na gang gi phyir de ltar na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi phyir de ltar na'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is like that,

original: gzhal bar bya ba bsgrub par bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba bsgrub par bya ba smos te /
translated: the object of comprehension is the probandum.

original: dam bca' ba brjod pa ni cung zad cig kyang dgos pa med do //
analyzed: dam bca' ba brjod pa ni cung zad cig kyang dgos pa med do //
translated: The statement of the thesis has no purpose at all.

original: gang las gzhan du yang ni med kyang des rtogs pa ste bsgrub par bya ba'i rtogs pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gang las gzhan du yang ni med kyang des rtogs pa ste bsgrub par bya ba'i rtogs pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Even though it does not exist elsewhere, by that, i.e., the reason, there is the arising of the understanding of the probandum. This is the conclusion.

original: de ltar dam bca' ba'i ngag sgrub par byed pa yin pa bsal bas gzhan dag gi nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba la sogs pa gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i dag bsal ba ni rigs pa lhag par bshad pa ni 'dis
analyzed: de ltar dam bca' ba'i ngag sgrub par byed pa yin pa bsal bas gzhan dag gi nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba la sogs pa gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i dag bsal ba ni rigs pa lhag par bshad pa ni 'dis
translated: Thus, by eliminating the thesis statement as the proof, the other applications of others, such as the conclusion, and the other imagined proofs are eliminated. The additional logic is explained by this.

original: ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “thus.”

original: gzhan las kyang rtogs pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa ni nye bar gtod pa dang mjug bsdu ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang rtogs pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa ni nye bar gtod pa dang mjug bsdu ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reason called arising from another is the statement of the example, the statement of the application, the statement of the pervasion, the statement of the conclusion, and so on.🔽The phrase and so on includes the statement of the doubt, the statement of the desire to know, and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni the tshom za bas shes par 'dod pa la sogs pa spangs shing bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni the tshom za bas shes par 'dod pa la sogs pa spangs shing bsal ba yin no //
translated: The statement of the example is the statement of the example, such as Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot.

original: de la dpe la ltos pa de bzhin du nye bar sbyar ba 'am /
analyzed: de la dpe la ltos pa de bzhin du nye bar sbyar ba 'am /
translated: The statement of the application is the statement of the application, such as Sound is like that.🔽 The statement of the pervasion is the statement of the pervasion, such as Whatever is produced is necessarily impermanent, like a pot.

original: de bzhin du ma yin pa las bsgrub par bya ba ni nye bar gtod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma yin pa las bsgrub par bya ba ni nye bar gtod pa'o //
translated: The statement of the conclusion is the statement of the conclusion, such as Sound is impermanent because it is produced.🔽 The statement of the doubt is the statement of the doubt, such as Is sound permanent or impermanent?🔽 The statement of the desire to know is the statement of the desire to know, such as I desire to know whether sound is permanent or impermanent.🔽 The statement of the counter-argument is the statement of the counter-argument, such as Sound is permanent because it is cognizable.🔽 The statement of the refutation of the counter-argument is the statement of the refutation of the counter-argument, such as Sound is impermanent because it is produced.

original: dam bca' ba slar brjod pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni dam bca' ba yin pas dam bca' ba'o /'dis ni zhes bya bas de nyid bstan pa yin te 'di tsam nyid kyis phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel
analyzed: dam bca' ba slar brjod pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni dam bca' ba yin pas dam bca' ba'o /'dis ni zhes bya bas de nyid bstan pa yin te 'di tsam nyid kyis phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel
translated: The statement of the summary is the statement of the summary, such as Therefore, sound is impermanent.🔽 The statement of the doubt is the statement of the doubt, such as Is sound permanent or impermanent?🔽 The statement of the desire to know is the statement of the desire to know, such as I desire to know whether sound is permanent or impermanent.🔽 The statement of the counter-argument is the statement of the counter-argument, such as Sound is permanent because it is cognizable.🔽 The statement of the refutation of the counter-argument is the statement of the refutation of the counter-argument, such as Sound is impermanent because it is produced.

original: pa brjod pa tsam gyis nye bar gtod pa la sogs pa spangs nas bsgrub bya rtogs pa btub pa'i phyir ni skye'o //
analyzed: pa brjod pa tsam gyis nye bar gtod pa la sogs pa spangs nas bsgrub bya rtogs pa btub pa'i phyir ni skye'o //
translated: The statement of the summary is the statement of the summary, such as

original: 'dir 'od kyi smras pa re zhig dam bca' ba ni yul nye bar bstan pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'od kyi smras pa re zhig dam bca' ba ni yul nye bar bstan pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, Āryadeva says, “First, the thesis must be stated without doubt in order to show the object.

original: 'jig rten sngar gcad par bya ba la sogs pa'i las nges par dpyad pa de'i phyir sta re la sogs pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten sngar gcad par bya ba la sogs pa'i las nges par dpyad pa de'i phyir sta re la sogs pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: Because the world has already investigated the object, such as that to be cut, therefore it produces an axe, etc.

original: nye bar gtod pa yang ji srid du dpe mthong ba nus pas gtan tshigs chos can la nye bar ma bsdus pa de srid du gang las bsgrub bya rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: nye bar gtod pa yang ji srid du dpe mthong ba nus pas gtan tshigs chos can la nye bar ma bsdus pa de srid du gang las bsgrub bya rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: And until the example is seen, the reason is not included in the subject. How then could the probandum be understood?

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dang mthong ba ni nges pa'i shes pa @224b 'dis don ston to //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa dang mthong ba ni nges pa'i shes pa @224b 'dis don ston to //
translated: The inference for oneself and perception show the object by means of this definite cognition.

original: de ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni thog mar sa phyogs la du ba mthong na de ni gang dang gang la du ba bdag gis mthong ba de dang de la me yod do zhes mes khyab pa dran pa dang / des na 'di na yang du ba yod do zhes slar nges so //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni thog mar sa phyogs la du ba mthong na de ni gang dang gang la du ba bdag gis mthong ba de dang de la me yod do zhes mes khyab pa dran pa dang / des na 'di na yang du ba yod do zhes slar nges so //
translated: Thus, when an inference for oneself first sees smoke on a piece of ground, it remembers the pervasion by fire, thinking, “Wherever I have seen smoke, there is fire.” Then it ascertains, “Here there is also fire.”

original: de so sor nges pa'i don gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa la nye bar gtod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de so sor nges pa'i don gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa la nye bar gtod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called “the conclusion that is directed toward the inference of another, which is the definitive meaning.”

original: mjug bsdu ba yang gdon mi za bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba yang gdon mi za bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: The summary should also be stated without fail.

original: gang gi phyir gang yang sngar sgra mi rtag go zhes brjod pa de tsam gyis nges pa skye ba ma yin gyi da ltar tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i don de shes pa'i don 'dis mjug bsdu ba yin no//
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang yang sngar sgra mi rtag go zhes brjod pa de tsam gyis nges pa skye ba ma yin gyi da ltar tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa'i don de shes pa'i don 'dis mjug bsdu ba yin no//
translated: Because the mere statement “Sound is impermanent” does not generate certainty, the summary is for the purpose of understanding the meaning that is now being conveyed by the power of the valid means of knowledge.

original: ma lus pa'i tshad ma'i bya ba 'dis nye bar sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i tshad ma'i bya ba 'dis nye bar sdud pa yin te /
translated: This is the summary of the entire activity of the valid means of knowledge.

original: 'di ltar dam bca' ba ni lung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dam bca' ba ni lung ngo //
translated: Thus, the thesis is scripture.

original: gtan tshigs ni rjes su dpag pa'o //🔽dpe ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni rjes su dpag pa'o // dpe ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The reason is inference.🔽The example is direct perception.

original: nye bar gtod pa ni nye bar 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar gtod pa ni nye bar 'jal ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is analogy.

original: des na tshad ma rnam pa bzhi po'i de dag gi bya ba yang mjug bsdu bas nye bar sdud pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin snyam pa de dag bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des na tshad ma rnam pa bzhi po'i de dag gi bya ba yang mjug bsdu bas nye bar sdud pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin snyam pa de dag bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since the activity of those four valid means of knowledge is summarized by the summary, how could they not have a result?

original: re zhig kha bya'i chags pa yongs su dor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: re zhig kha bya'i chags pa yongs su dor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement for the time being, give up the attachment to the kite, and so on.

original: kha bya ni gcer bu slob dpon no //🔽de ni 'bras bu med pa'i ming rtseg ma 'bri ba la chags pa des na de lta bu gzhan gyis bshad pa'i de'i steng du gdon mi za bar mi rigs pa 'bras bu med par yang brjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnas med pa la mngon par
analyzed: kha bya ni gcer bu slob dpon no // de ni 'bras bu med pa'i ming rtseg ma 'bri ba la chags pa des na de lta bu gzhan gyis bshad pa'i de'i steng du gdon mi za bar mi rigs pa 'bras bu med par yang brjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gnas med pa la mngon par
translated: The kite is the naked teacher.

original: zhen pa ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhen pa ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: Since he is attached to writing the meaningless repetition of names, he will certainly say something meaningless on top of that, which is explained by others. Therefore, one should abandon attachment to a baseless position.

original: mig tshugs la zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba nye bar bsdus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig tshugs la zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba nye bar bsdus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement fix your gaze, and so on, is a summary of distraction.

original: re zhig 'di tsam gyi phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa smos pa tsam gyi dag gis bsgrub bya rtogs par gyur pa cis nam yin ji srid du ji snyed pa'i gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i don brjod pa na kho bo cag rnams kyis rjes su
analyzed: re zhig 'di tsam gyi phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa smos pa tsam gyi dag gis bsgrub bya rtogs par gyur pa cis nam yin ji srid du ji snyed pa'i gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i don brjod pa na kho bo cag rnams kyis rjes su
translated: Since the mere statement of the connection of the property of the position is understood as the probandum, why is it not so? As long as the meaning of the inference for the sake of others is stated, we should follow the statement of the master Dignāga.

original: rang don ji lta ba bzhin shes la de srid du nyung ba dang lhag par chags pa med pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs pa la yang gtan tshigs dang / dpe de'i nus pa la nyams pa ci zhig yod /🔽'di gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang gang gis rtogs pa mi skye /
analyzed: rang don ji lta ba bzhin shes la de srid du nyung ba dang lhag par chags pa med pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs pa la yang gtan tshigs dang / dpe de'i nus pa la nyams pa ci zhig yod / 'di gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la yang gang gis rtogs pa mi skye /
translated: And what is the deficiency in the power of the reason and example in the inference for oneself, which is the knowledge of one’s own purpose, as long as it is not excessive and is not done with excessive attachment?🔽And what is the deficiency in the power of the reason and example in the inference for others, which is the knowledge of others’ purpose, that prevents the arising of knowledge in others?

original: de tsam gyis rtogs pas dam bca' ba dang nye bar gtod pa dang mjug bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid smos pa'i phreng bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de tsam gyis rtogs pas dam bca' ba dang nye bar gtod pa dang mjug bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid smos pa'i phreng bas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of a string of definitions of thesis, proof, and conclusion, which are merely a repetition of what is already known?

original: yang na byis pa @225a * //
analyzed: yang na byis pa @225a * //
translated: Or, if it is for the sake of engaging the childish,

original: 'jug par byed pa de la nye bar mkho ba nye bar brjod pa ni mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa de la nye bar mkho ba nye bar brjod pa ni mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: the definition is the statement of what is necessary for that engagement.

original: de lta na dam bca' ba nye bar gtod pa dang mjug bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid spros pa'i phreng bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de lta na dam bca' ba nye bar gtod pa dang mjug bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid spros pa'i phreng bas ci zhig bya /
translated: In that case, what is the use of a string of definitions of thesis, proof, and conclusion, which are merely a repetition of what is already known?🔽Or, if it is for the sake of engaging the childish,

original: yang byis pa 'jug par byed pa de la nye bar mkho ba nye bar brjod pa ni mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang byis pa 'jug par byed pa de la nye bar mkho ba nye bar brjod pa ni mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: the definition is the statement of what is necessary for that engagement.

original: de lta na dam bca' ba ni nye bar gtod pa dang mjug bsdu ba'i sbyor ba yang gal te tshad mas des na rang gi bsgrub byas khyab pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos su mi 'gyur ba'am /🔽bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod pa yin pa de 'dir gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na dam bca' ba ni nye bar gtod pa dang mjug bsdu ba'i sbyor ba yang gal te tshad mas des na rang gi bsgrub byas khyab pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos su mi 'gyur ba'am / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la yod pa yin pa de 'dir gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the thesis is the application of the conclusion and the summary. If the valid cognition does not pervade the probandum, then the property to be established is not established.🔽Or, if the property to be established exists in the subject, then that is not the reason here.

original: de'i gtan tshigs yod pa yin na dam bca' ba med kyang rang gi don rjes su dpag pa lta bu'i go bar byed pa'i ngo bo ma tshang ba med pas /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs yod pa yin na dam bca' ba med kyang rang gi don rjes su dpag pa lta bu'i go bar byed pa'i ngo bo ma tshang ba med pas /
translated: If the reason exists, then even without the thesis, the meaning of the inference is not incomplete, so

original: de'i bsal bar mi bya ba'i phyir gnas med pa la cis na zhen par byed /
analyzed: de'i bsal bar mi bya ba'i phyir gnas med pa la cis na zhen par byed /
translated: why be attached to a position that is groundless?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos 'phen pa'i nus pas stong ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brjod pa tsam gyis rgol ba bsgrub par bya ba nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos 'phen pa'i nus pas stong ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brjod pa tsam gyis rgol ba bsgrub par bya ba nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable for the opponent to ascertain the probandum merely by stating the probandum, which is devoid of the capacity to project the property to be established.

original: gtan tshigs nye bar bkod pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nye bar bkod pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the statement of the reason would be pointless.

original: de des 'phangs pa'i nus pa nyid kyis dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de des 'phangs pa'i nus pa nyid kyis dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: The power of that is what impels the statement of the thesis.

original: gang gis dam bca' ba'i yul nye bar bstan pa ni gzhan du bstan bcos byed pa nyid kyis bshad pas smras pa'i lan btab zin to //
analyzed: gang gis dam bca' ba'i yul nye bar bstan pa ni gzhan du bstan bcos byed pa nyid kyis bshad pas smras pa'i lan btab zin to //
translated: As for the object of the thesis, it is taught elsewhere in the treatise itself, so the response to that has already been given.

original: gang yang sgrub par byed pa la rab tu sbyar ba des na kho bo sgrub par byed pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba che ge mo zhig rtogs par bsgrub par bya'o snyam pas /
analyzed: gang yang sgrub par byed pa la rab tu sbyar ba des na kho bo sgrub par byed pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba che ge mo zhig rtogs par bsgrub par bya'o snyam pas /
translated: When one applies a proof, one thinks, “By this proof, I will prove that such and such a thesis is understood.”

original: las la nges par dpyad pa nyid de la rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i rigs las 'das pa ma yin no //🔽de ltar ma yin na gal te sgrub par byed pa las gang gi bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa skye ba des na las la nges par dpyod pa de med par gyur pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni sgrub par byed
analyzed: las la nges par dpyad pa nyid de la rab tu sbyar ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i rigs las 'das pa ma yin no // de ltar ma yin na gal te sgrub par byed pa las gang gi bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa skye ba des na las la nges par dpyod pa de med par gyur pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni sgrub par byed
translated: Therefore, because one is applying oneself to the analysis of the object of the proof, it is not the case that one is transgressing worldly norms.🔽If that were not so, then if the object of the thesis were understood from the proof, then the analysis of the object of the proof would be pointless.

original: pa'i rgyu mtshan las ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu mtshan las ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: So how could the thesis of the inference for one’s own sake be established without it?

original: nang yang me dang du ba'i 'brel pa sems la rnam par gnas kyang gang na me yod ces me tshol ba na du ba dang pa skye ba des na las la nges par dpyod pa de med par gyur ji ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa
analyzed: nang yang me dang du ba'i 'brel pa sems la rnam par gnas kyang gang na me yod ces me tshol ba na du ba dang pa skye ba des na las la nges par dpyod pa de med par gyur ji ltar rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa
translated: Also, although the connection between fire and smoke is present in the mind, when one searches for fire by asking, “Where is the fire?” and the other person replies, “Where there is smoke,” then the ascertainment of the connection between the action and the object is lost.

original: la nges pa'i shes pa'i shes pas shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: la nges pa'i shes pa'i shes pas shes par 'gyur /
translated: How then could one come to know the object of inference through a cognition that is not ascertained?

original: yang na res 'ga' de la @225b mthong ngo zhes gzhan gyi don la bstan pa yin na ni de'i tshe zho la sogs pa zho la sogs pa zos nas res 'ga' du ba las me rtogs pa yang yin no zhes /🔽zho la sogs pa zos pa yang res 'ga' zhig cis na su zhig gis brten pa bya ba ma yin gang phyir brjod pa lung yin no zhes bya ba de la gal te rgol ba'i tshig nyid lung yin pa de'i tshe de nyid las bsgrub par bya ba
analyzed: yang na res 'ga' de la @225b mthong ngo zhes gzhan gyi don la bstan pa yin na ni de'i tshe zho la sogs pa zho la sogs pa zos nas res 'ga' du ba las me rtogs pa yang yin no zhes / zho la sogs pa zos pa yang res 'ga' zhig cis na su zhig gis brten pa bya ba ma yin gang phyir brjod pa lung yin no zhes bya ba de la gal te rgol ba'i tshig nyid lung yin pa de'i tshe de nyid las bsgrub par bya ba
translated: If, on the other hand, the other person points to the object of inference by saying, “I see it,” then at that time, when the other person has eaten curd and so on, he might say, “I have sometimes inferred fire from smoke.”🔽Why then would anyone not rely on the words of the other person?

original: 'grub par gtan tshigs bstan pa don med do //
analyzed: 'grub par gtan tshigs bstan pa don med do //
translated: If the opponent’s words themselves are scripture, then it is pointless to state a reason to prove the thesis.

original: yang na dam bca' lung du smra na lung dam bca' ba yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang na dam bca' lung du smra na lung dam bca' ba yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Or, if you say that scripture is a thesis,

original: phyogs 'di na me yod do zhes lung 'ga' zhig las bshad pa med na ji ltar lung dam bca' ba yin /
analyzed: phyogs 'di na me yod do zhes lung 'ga' zhig las bshad pa med na ji ltar lung dam bca' ba yin /
translated: then since there is no explanation in any scripture that “there is fire on the side of the hill,” how can scripture be a thesis?

original: gtan tshigs rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te phyogs kyi chos tsam gtan tshigs ma yin gyi de ni tshul gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mi rigs te phyogs kyi chos tsam gtan tshigs ma yin gyi de ni tshul gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also illogical to say that it is an inference because the mere property of the subject is not a reason, but rather it is the trimodal property.

original: dpe thams cad kyang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dpe mngon sum du 'gyur /
analyzed: dpe thams cad kyang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dpe mngon sum du 'gyur /
translated: And since all examples are not direct perception, how can an example be direct perception?

original: nye bar gtod pa yang tshad ma ma yin na ji ltar de'i byed pa nye bar bsdu ba yin /
analyzed: nye bar gtod pa yang tshad ma ma yin na ji ltar de'i byed pa nye bar bsdu ba yin /
translated: And if the presentation is not a valid cognition, how can it be the collection of its activity?

original: nye bar gtod pa ni gal te nges par dpe mthong ba'i nus pas gtan tshigs chos can la nye bar gtod pa de ni nye bar gtod par bla'i //
analyzed: nye bar gtod pa ni gal te nges par dpe mthong ba'i nus pas gtan tshigs chos can la nye bar gtod pa de ni nye bar gtod par bla'i //
translated: If the presentation is the ability to see the example, then it is the presentation of the reason to the subject.

original: ci byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la phyogs kyi chos bstan pa yin de nyid mthong ba'i nus pas gtan tshigs nye bar bsdu bar 'gyur bas phyogs kyi chos bstan par mi bya bas ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ci byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la phyogs kyi chos bstan pa yin de nyid mthong ba'i nus pas gtan tshigs nye bar bsdu bar 'gyur bas phyogs kyi chos bstan par mi bya bas ci yang ma yin no //
translated: The phrase because of what is done indicates the property of the position. Since the power of seeing that very [property] is subsumed in the reason, the property of the position is not stated. Therefore, it is nothing.

original: des na gang la dam bca' ba thog ma kho nar sbyor ba mi 'dod de /
analyzed: des na gang la dam bca' ba thog ma kho nar sbyor ba mi 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, one should not desire to connect the thesis at the very beginning.

original: de la de yang brjod pa gang las mjug bsdu bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de la de yang brjod pa gang las mjug bsdu bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, How is that also stated? From what is it concluded?

original: phyir zhes bya ba smos te de'i phyir na 'di nyid phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa tsam gyis sgrub par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyang gang gi sbyor bas sbyor ba na tshig yan lag lnga pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba smos te de'i phyir na 'di nyid phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa tsam gyis sgrub par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyang gang gi sbyor bas sbyor ba na tshig yan lag lnga pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: The phrase because of that is stated. Therefore, this very mere connection with the property of the position is the nature of the proof. When it is connected by that connection, it is not the nature of a five-membered statement. This is the point.

original: 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i ngag gis dam bca' ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig sbyor ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i ngag gis dam bca' ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig sbyor ba mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to connect only the thesis and so on with the statement to be proven.

original: sngar gzhan gyis khas blangs pa gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba'i dpe yin no zhes bya ba'i rim pa nges pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: sngar gzhan gyis khas blangs pa gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba'i dpe yin no zhes bya ba'i rim pa nges pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no certainty whatsoever in the order of the example of the syllogism, which is the assertion of others.

original: ga las she na thams cad du gang gi tshe sngar gtan tshigs yin la phyi nas khyab pa'am /
analyzed: ga las she na thams cad du gang gi tshe sngar gtan tshigs yin la phyi nas khyab pa'am /
translated: Why? Because in all cases, when the reason is stated first and the pervasion is stated later,

original: yang na sngar khyab pa yin la phyis phyogs kyi chos la rab tu sbyar ba de lta na yang go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽'o na ni de'i sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs par bshad pa yin te gang gi phyir rigs pa can gyi gtan @226a * //
analyzed: yang na sngar khyab pa yin la phyis phyogs kyi chos la rab tu sbyar ba de lta na yang go bar byed pa'i phyir ro // 'o na ni de'i sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs par bshad pa yin te gang gi phyir rigs pa can gyi gtan @226a * //
translated: or when the pervasion is stated first and the property of the subject is stated later, it is still understood.

original: tshigs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshigs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Well then, it is illogical to say that there are two types of syllogism, because the logicians state that there are three types of reason:

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the positive, the negative, and the positive and negative.

original: des na de'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: des na de'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therefore, there are three types of syllogism:

original: chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa dang chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa can dag go zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa dang chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa can dag go zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are similar, dissimilar, and both similar and dissimilar,

original: 'brel ba smos pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'brel ba smos pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then the response is that even those who assert a relation

original: rim pa nges pa 'ba' zhig ni rigs pa ma yin te /🔽'on kyang gnyi ga la yang don tha dad pa ni 'ga' yang med de gang la yang tshul gsum yod par gyur pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba can nam /
analyzed: rim pa nges pa 'ba' zhig ni rigs pa ma yin te / 'on kyang gnyi ga la yang don tha dad pa ni 'ga' yang med de gang la yang tshul gsum yod par gyur pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba can nam /
translated: must say that the reason is not just the ascertainment of the order.🔽However, in both cases, there is no difference in meaning at all, because the three modes exist for anyone. Therefore, all reasons are pervasions, and there are no reasons that are pervasions or reasons that are nonpervasions.

original: ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig med pa des na gang las sbyor ba rnam pa gsum du 'gyur bar sems pa yin //
analyzed: ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig med pa des na gang las sbyor ba rnam pa gsum du 'gyur bar sems pa yin //
translated: Therefore, we think that the three modes are not different.

original: gal te gang las don tha dad pa med pa yang yin na gnyis ka smos so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang las don tha dad pa med pa yang yin na gnyis ka smos so zhe na /
translated: If you say that even though there is no difference in meaning, both are stated,

original: gnyis ka zhes bya ba smos te chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa sbyor ba la sogs pa la yang dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i ngo bos chos tha dad par rtogs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka zhes bya ba smos te chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa sbyor ba la sogs pa la yang dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i ngo bos chos tha dad par rtogs so //
translated: “Both” refers to the application of similar and dissimilar reasons, where one understands the different properties of negation and affirmation.

original: de lta na sgrub par byed pa'i chos de yod pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na sgrub par byed pa'i chos de yod pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, the property of the reason is the existence of the probandum.

original: rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na chos mthun pa dang / chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba dag gis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gyur pa kho na chos mthun pa dang / chos mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba dag gis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the reason that is explained by the application of similar and dissimilar reasons.

original: 'o na ni chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba ni gtan tshigs yod na bsgrub bya yod pa dang / chos mi mthun pa bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par sgra las rtogs kyi de'i bdag nyid ma yin na de cis na brjod /
analyzed: 'o na ni chos mthun pa'i sbyor ba ni gtan tshigs yod na bsgrub bya yod pa dang / chos mi mthun pa bsgrub par bya ba med na gtan tshigs med par sgra las rtogs kyi de'i bdag nyid ma yin na de cis na brjod /
translated: If so, then the application of similar reasons is understood from the statement “where the reason exists, the probandum exists,” and the application of dissimilar reasons is understood from the statement “where the probandum does not exist, the reason does not exist.” But if they are not of the same nature, why are they stated?

original: gal te de'i rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir zhe na de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te gang gi tshe chos mthun pa'i sbyor bas de'i rang bzhin du ma 'phangs pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa de'i rang bzhin du ma gyur pa ci
analyzed: gal te de'i rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir zhe na de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te gang gi tshe chos mthun pa'i sbyor bas de'i rang bzhin du ma 'phangs pa de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa de'i rang bzhin du ma gyur pa ci
translated: When a syllogism with a similar example does not imply that nature, then the proof is not that nature.

original: de ltar gcig tu nges par gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gcig tu nges par gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it is definitely one, and it is definitely established.

original: res 'ga' ba zhig tu 'gyur srid do //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba zhig tu 'gyur srid do //
translated: Sometimes it is possible that it is not.

original: gang byas pa de mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar gcig tu nges par gyur ba'i gtan tshigs la bsgrub byas khyab pa ni chos mthun pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bar brjod do //
analyzed: gang byas pa de mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar gcig tu nges par gyur ba'i gtan tshigs la bsgrub byas khyab pa ni chos mthun pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bar brjod do //
translated: When it is definitely one, that which is produced is impermanent. The pervasion of the probandum by the proof is stated in the syllogism with a similar example.

original: de yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni don gzhan la shugs kyis de 'phen pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni don gzhan la shugs kyis de 'phen pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, if that is not its nature, then it is impossible for the power of another object to imply it.

original: ji ltar de'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i gcig tu nges pa las gzhan la @226b yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i gcig tu nges pa las gzhan la @226b yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it is definitely one, and it is not in another that has become its nature?

original: byas pa nyid yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: byas pa nyid yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “If it were produced” and so on.🔽If, even though production from effort does not exist, production does exist, then it is not the nature of that, and impermanence would not follow from that.

original: gal te rtsol ba las byung ba nyid med du zin kyang byas pa nyid yod pas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas mi rtag pa yang 'di nyid kyi lugs kyis de yang de'i bdag nyid spangs pa'i phyir na rtsol ba las byung ba nyid mi rtag pa'i rjes
analyzed: gal te rtsol ba las byung ba nyid med du zin kyang byas pa nyid yod pas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas mi rtag pa yang 'di nyid kyi lugs kyis de yang de'i bdag nyid spangs pa'i phyir na rtsol ba las byung ba nyid mi rtag pa'i rjes
translated: In this system, that also is the nature of that, and therefore production from effort is impermanent.

original: su 'gro bas mi 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: su 'gro bas mi 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: If it does not follow, then it would not be possible to infer that from it.🔽If it does follow, then it would not be possible to reverse it.

original: ldog na ldog par mi 'gyur bas ji ltar de las de rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ldog na ldog par mi 'gyur bas ji ltar de las de rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could one understand that from it?

original: nyes pa 'di dag med de /🔽rtsol ba las byung ba'i don gyi rang bzhin gyis mi rtags pa nyid des sgrub par byed pa de la yang de'i bdag nyid yod pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang bsal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di dag med de / rtsol ba las byung ba'i don gyi rang bzhin gyis mi rtags pa nyid des sgrub par byed pa de la yang de'i bdag nyid yod pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang bsal bar mi nus so //
translated: These errors do not exist.🔽The nature of the object of production from effort is impermanent. That which establishes it also has the nature of that, and therefore it is not possible to reverse the fact that it follows from that.

original: byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid tsam la ltos pa de'i bdag nyid ni 'dis spong bar byed bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid tsam la ltos pa de'i bdag nyid ni 'dis spong bar byed bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is maintained that production from effort is impermanent, and that the nature of that is rejected by this.

original: 'o na ni me ldog pas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i du ba ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba yang mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni me ldog pas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i du ba ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba yang mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: But we see that smoke, which is not the nature of fire, is seen to occur when fire is absent and to not occur when fire is absent.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /🔽rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan des de la khyab pa na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan des de la khyab pa na /
translated: He says, “It is not the case that the effect is absent,”🔽because the reason for the relation of invariable concomitance and the reason for the relation of the absence of one when the other is absent is that the pervasion is by the reason of the relation.

original: de med na de med pa'i phyir dang / de la don gzhan pa'i du ba me de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan du yod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de med na de med pa'i phyir dang / de la don gzhan pa'i du ba me de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan du yod par gyur pa'o //
translated: The relation of the effect, which has a different meaning from that, is the reason for the relation of invariable concomitance and the reason for the relation of the absence of one when the other is absent.

original: de dag gang la don gzhan ma yin par brjod pa de ni gdon mi za ba'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag gang la don gzhan ma yin par brjod pa de ni gdon mi za ba'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: He intends that that which is said to not have a different meaning is necessarily the nature of that.

original: 'dir dpe ni dper na byas pa nyid dang rtsol ba las byung ba de dag nyid las byung ba zlog pa ste gcig ldog pas gzhan ldog pa ni ma yin te gang rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa de ni byas pa yang yin no zhes bya
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni dper na byas pa nyid dang rtsol ba las byung ba de dag nyid las byung ba zlog pa ste gcig ldog pas gzhan ldog pa ni ma yin te gang rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa de ni byas pa yang yin no zhes bya
translated: The example here is like the following: the reversal of the arising from that which is created and the arising from effort is not the reversal of one by the reversal of the other. That which is not arisen from effort is also created.

original: ba de lta bu'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: ba de lta bu'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the example.🔽Since that is the case, therefore, when there is a reason that has the nature of the forward and reverse pervasions, the predicate is necessarily existent and when the predicate is not existent, the reason is necessarily not existent.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las mtshan nyid ji lta ba'i gtan tshigs yod na bsgrub par bya ba gdon mi za bar yod pa dang / bsgrub bya med na gtan tshigs gdon mi za bar med pa'i phyir chos mthun pa'i sgo nas sam chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas sbyor ba gcig gis gnyis pa 'phen pas bdag nyid la khyab par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'phangs pas de yang cig shos ni khyab
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las mtshan nyid ji lta ba'i gtan tshigs yod na bsgrub par bya ba gdon mi za bar yod pa dang / bsgrub bya med na gtan tshigs gdon mi za bar med pa'i phyir chos mthun pa'i sgo nas sam chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas sbyor ba gcig gis gnyis pa 'phen pas bdag nyid la khyab par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'phangs pas de yang cig shos ni khyab
translated: Since one application either by the method of agreement or by the method of difference projects the other, it is projected by the reason that is the pervader of itself.

original: par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir gang la yang tshul gsum pa rtogs pas gcig ni tshig gis yin la gzhan ni don gyis yin no zhes 'brel pa brjod ba'i sbyor ba @227a * //
analyzed: par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir gang la yang tshul gsum pa rtogs pas gcig ni tshig gis yin la gzhan ni don gyis yin no zhes 'brel pa brjod ba'i sbyor ba @227a * //
translated: Therefore, since the trimodal condition is understood in any case, the one is by the word and the other is by the meaning.

original: kho nas dgag pa'i sgo nas sam sgrub pa'i sgo nas tha dad kyi don ni ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: kho nas dgag pa'i sgo nas sam sgrub pa'i sgo nas tha dad kyi don ni ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The meaning of the difference is not by way of negation or by way of affirmation.

original: de'i phyir de'i sbyor ba gnyis te chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sbyor ba gnyis te chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there are two kinds of application of that, similar and dissimilar.

original: chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa dag gnyis bsam yin la /
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa dag gnyis bsam yin la /
translated: The similar and dissimilar are the two kinds of application of that.

original: de'i don gyis yin te gang yang rung ba kho nas ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don gyis yin te gang yang rung ba kho nas ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of that is by the meaning, because it is taught by either one.🔽All reasons have the nature of positive and negative concomitance. It is not the case that they have positive concomitance or negative concomitance.

original: gtan tshigs thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog ba'i dngos bo can de rjes su 'gro ba can nam ldog pa can gyis ma yin no zhes bya 'di dag kyang nye bar bsdu ba ni gnyis pa 'phen pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog ba'i dngos bo can de rjes su 'gro ba can nam ldog pa can gyis ma yin no zhes bya 'di dag kyang nye bar bsdu ba ni gnyis pa 'phen pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The second is the implication of the two.

original: gcig pu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig pu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not just one.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas sam ldog pa'i sgo nas sgrub par byed pa'i ngag gnyis kyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi sbyor ba dngos su sgra yis bstan par 'dod pa ni don med pas rtogs pa'i shes pa la dgos ba med pa'i phyir
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas sam ldog pa'i sgo nas sgrub par byed pa'i ngag gnyis kyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi sbyor ba dngos su sgra yis bstan par 'dod pa ni don med pas rtogs pa'i shes pa la dgos ba med pa'i phyir
translated: The assertion that the two statements that prove by the forward and reverse modes of entailment explicitly teach the forward and reverse entailments by means of the words is pointless, because there is no need for a cognition that understands them.

original: ro // don de nyid gzhan gyi bsal ba rtogs par bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ro // don de nyid gzhan gyi bsal ba rtogs par bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of that is stated in the passage beginning with “because it is just its nature.”

original: gang gi tshe de'i rang bzhin gyis bsgrub bya dang gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba grub bo //🔽de'i rang bzhin yin pa de nyid kyi phyir de med na med par yang grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i rang bzhin gyis bsgrub bya dang gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba grub bo // de'i rang bzhin yin pa de nyid kyi phyir de med na med par yang grub pa nyid do //
translated: When its nature establishes the forward pervasion of the probandum and the logical reason,🔽it is also established that it is absent when that is absent, because it is just its nature.

original: de'i rang bzhin med pa ni gang gi bdag nyid med pas med par rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin med pa ni gang gi bdag nyid med pas med par rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is reasonable that it is absent when its nature is absent, since it would not exist in its own nature.

original: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin gyis bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med par grub pa bden pa de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs grub pa dang rjes su 'gro ba yang grub pa yin no //🔽kha cig chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba bshad pa na de med pa nyid ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par gsungs pa ji ltar gzhan pa dang 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang 'gal
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin gyis bsgrub par bya ba med na sgrub par byed pa med par grub pa bden pa de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs grub pa dang rjes su 'gro ba yang grub pa yin no // kha cig chos mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba bshad pa na de med pa nyid ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par gsungs pa ji ltar gzhan pa dang 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang 'gal
translated: So too, if the property to be established does not exist by its intrinsic reality, the property that establishes it does not exist. Because of that truth, the establishment of the reason and the establishment of the forward pervasion are also established.🔽When the syllogism with a similar example is explained, the absence of that is said to be the absence of the reason in the dissimilar class. How is the dissimilar class the opposite of that? It follows that the reason would be absent.🔽If it is said that the dissimilar class is the opposite of that, then the dissimilar class would be the opposite of the reason.🔽If it is said that the dissimilar class is the opposite of the reason, then the dissimilar class would be the opposite of the reason.

original: ba kho nas rnam par bcad pa thal bar 'gyur pas na bsnan pa bstan pa'i phyir ldog pa'i sbyor ba yin no zhe na /🔽de dang de'i don du yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: ba kho nas rnam par bcad pa thal bar 'gyur pas na bsnan pa bstan pa'i phyir ldog pa'i sbyor ba yin no zhe na / de dang de'i don du yang mi rigs te /
translated: If it is said that the dissimilar class is the opposite of the reason, then the dissimilar class would be the opposite of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan pa dang 'gal ba dag kyang yin te /
