translated: If it is said that the dissimilar class is the opposite of the reason, then the dissimilar class would be the opposite of the reason.🔽If it is said that the dissimilar class is the opposite of the reason, then the dissimilar class would be the opposite of the reason.

original: de med pa 'ba' zhig gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na chos gzhan dang ldan pas gzhan yin na /
analyzed: de med pa 'ba' zhig gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na chos gzhan dang ldan pas gzhan yin na /
translated: If it were the counter-correlate of the absence of that, then it would be different from the property-possessor, because it would possess another property.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it is not the basis of the property that is intended to be expressed.

original: 'gal ba nyid kho na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin te @227b lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid kho na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin te @227b lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: Opposition is not the only counter-correlate, because there is also the counter-correlate that is incompatible, which has the characteristic of not coexisting, and the counter-correlate that is mutually exclusive, which has the characteristic of excluding each other.

original: de'i mi rtag pa las gzhan pa dag med pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i don la byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'jug pa ni gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mi rtag pa las gzhan pa dag med pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i don la byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'jug pa ni gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the meaning that possesses the properties of being other than impermanent and so on, the application of the properties of being produced and so on would be without a reason.

original: dro ba bsgrub par bya ba'i me'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba ni grang ba ste grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa gzhan yang rnam par bcad par thal bar 'gyur bas dro ba gcig tu nges pa mes go ba byed par
analyzed: dro ba bsgrub par bya ba'i me'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs dang 'gal ba ni grang ba ste grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa gzhan yang rnam par bcad par thal bar 'gyur bas dro ba gcig tu nges pa mes go ba byed par
translated: The counter-correlate of the reason that has the characteristic of fire, which is established as heat, is cold, but it would follow that another, which is neither cold nor heat, would be excluded. Therefore, heat, which is ascertained as being only fire, is the reason that causes understanding of fire.

original: mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de 'di'i skyon du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de 'di'i skyon du 'gyur gyi /
translated: The master [Dignāga] said, “It would be a fault if it were not so.”

original: slob dpon gyis bshad pa gang gi tshe gcig tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dod pa de'i tshe de med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin gyi 'gal ba dang gzhan ni ma yin na de ni gzhan la yang brjod par 'dod pa'i chos mi rten pa dang 'gal
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bshad pa gang gi tshe gcig tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dod pa de'i tshe de med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin gyi 'gal ba dang gzhan ni ma yin na de ni gzhan la yang brjod par 'dod pa'i chos mi rten pa dang 'gal
translated: When the master [Dignāga] said that the property of the thesis and the reason are discordant, at that time the nonexistence of the discordant class is the discordant class, but it is not contradictory or different.

original: ba yang yod pas de med pa las gzhan pa dag ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba yang yod pas de med pa las gzhan pa dag ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: However, there are other [properties] that are discordant with the property to be proven, and the nonexistence of those other [properties] is not reasonable.

original: kho bo cag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang rnam pa gsum 'dod pa dang / brjod par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa gzhan yin no zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang rnam pa gsum 'dod pa dang / brjod par 'dod pa'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa gzhan yin no zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not assert that the discordant class is threefold, nor that there are other [properties] that are discordant with the property to be proven.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro bas sam /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ni sgrub par byed pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis rjes su 'gro bas sam /
translated: If the pervasion and counter-pervasion of an essential reason are established by the reason of the property to be proven being of the same nature, then it follows that

original: ldog pas chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba dag brjod pas de'i bdag nyid kyi sgo nas don gyis cig shos 'phangs par brjod do //
analyzed: ldog pas chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa can gyi sbyor ba dag brjod pas de'i bdag nyid kyi sgo nas don gyis cig shos 'phangs par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, by stating the syllogism that has a similar property and a dissimilar property, the other is implied by the meaning in terms of its nature.

original: de'i tshe tshad ma grub pa nyid de de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin gyi sgra tsam shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so snyam nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma grub pa nyid de de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin gyi sgra tsam shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so snyam nas /
translated: At that time, the valid cognition is established just by that nature, by the reason of that, but not by the mere understanding of the word.

original: gzhan gyis gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thinking this, the opponent says, “By what?” and so on.

original: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni yod pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid kyis yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs skad cig ma nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni yod pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid kyis yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs skad cig ma nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “By what” means by the nature of existence, by the reason of the characteristic of existence, it is the nature of momentariness. This is the meaning.

original: 'di 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni yod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni yod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The thought of this question is that existence is twofold:

original: byas pa bum pa la sogs pa dang ma byas pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa bum pa la sogs pa dang ma byas pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
translated: the produced, such as a pot, and the unproduced, such as space.

original: de la gang re zhig ma byas par yod pa rgyu med pa ni rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni mi rtag pa kho nar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gang re zhig ma byas par yod pa rgyu med pa ni rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni mi rtag pa kho nar mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which exists without being made is not impermanent, since it possesses the characteristics of permanence.

original: gang kho @228a * //
analyzed: gang kho @228a * //
translated: That which exists without having been made, which possesses the characteristic of permanence, does not become impermanent.

original: na las skad cig ma yin zhes bya /
analyzed: na las skad cig ma yin zhes bya /
translated: How can it be momentary?

original: yod pa ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Existence is not of the nature of momentariness.

original: gang yang yod pa dang byas pa nyid de dag kyang tho ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir de'i rgyu nye bar 'jig go //🔽byas pa'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang yod pa ma lus pa nyid skad cig ma'i rang bzhin ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag mi srid pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'jig pa ni dbyug pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang
analyzed: gang yang yod pa dang byas pa nyid de dag kyang tho ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir de'i rgyu nye bar 'jig go // byas pa'i bdag nyid yin du zin kyang yod pa ma lus pa nyid skad cig ma'i rang bzhin ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag mi srid pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'jig pa ni dbyug pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang
translated: And that which exists and is produced, since it follows after and ceases with the hammer, etc., its destruction is with cause, and so its cause is proximate.🔽Even though it is of the nature of the produced, not all that exists is of the nature of momentariness, because following after and ceasing are impossible.

original: ldog pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Undoubtedly, destruction is seen by the mode of following after and ceasing with the stick, etc.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: bsnun dang me dang 'brel pa ni ;
analyzed: bsnun dang me dang 'brel pa ni ;
translated: The conditions for the destruction of a pot,

original: /'jig pa'i rkyen du nye ba yin //
analyzed: /'jig pa'i rkyen du nye ba yin //
translated: such as a blow or fire, are present.

original: gang gi tshogs pa med pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi tshogs pa med pa ni //
translated: When the assemblage is absent,

original: bum pa la sogs 'jig pa med //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs 'jig pa med //
translated: the pot, etc., are not destroyed.

original: ce'o // bde bar gshegs pa pas gzhan la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid rgyu dang ldan pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan du khas blangs pas de 'dir yang yod pa yin no zhes de'i tha snyad cis ni 'jug par mi🔽'gyur zhe na /🔽'o na ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang bstan te gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin yin pa sngar bstan zin la /
analyzed: ce'o // bde bar gshegs pa pas gzhan la yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid rgyu dang ldan pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i rgyu mtshan du khas blangs pas de 'dir yang yod pa yin no zhes de'i tha snyad cis ni 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na / 'o na ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang bstan te gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa'i dbang gis rang bzhin yin pa sngar bstan zin la /
translated: The Sugata has accepted that the mere presence of the reason is the reason for the use of the expressions “possessing the property of being a subsequent modifier” and “possessing the property of being an invariable concomitant” in the case of the reason “being a product.” So why would the expression “possessing the property of being a subsequent modifier” not apply in this case?🔽But you have already taught the ascertainment of the invariable concomitant, and you have already taught that the presence of a reason is the reason for the use of the expression “possessing the property of being a subsequent modifier” in the case of a reason that is a nature.

original: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la sogs pa la brjod pas de gang gis phyogs snga ma'i go skabs su 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la sogs pa la brjod pas de gang gis phyogs snga ma'i go skabs su 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: And you have also taught the ascertainment of the invariable concomitant in the case of a reason that is a nature. So why would the expression “possessing the property of being a subsequent modifier” not apply in this case?

original: bden te 'on kyang sngon gyi slob dpon gyis byas pa nyid skad cig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la mthar gzhan gyis byas pa ste /🔽gdon mi za bar 'jig pa'i rgyu dang 'brel par khas len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang sngon gyi slob dpon gyis byas pa nyid skad cig pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la mthar gzhan gyis byas pa ste / gdon mi za bar 'jig pa'i rgyu dang 'brel par khas len pa'i phyir /
translated: Indeed, that is true, but the former masters, in order to prove momentariness, accepted that which is produced by another is necessarily related to a cause of destruction.

original: de'i rgyu dang mi ldan par bstan pas ltos pa med par 'jig pa las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma rnams kyis de'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed par bshad pa de'i zhar la byung bas byas pa dang yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni de'i bdag
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang mi ldan par bstan pas ltos pa med par 'jig pa las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma rnams kyis de'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed par bshad pa de'i zhar la byung bas byas pa dang yod pa'i mtshan nyid ni de'i bdag
translated: Therefore, they explained that the refutation of destruction without reliance on a cause is established by the valid knowledge that refutes that which is not endowed with that cause, and that which is not endowed with that cause is taught to be the nature of that.🔽The characteristics of that which is produced and that which exists are understood to be the nature of that, but they should not be taught as something else, because they are contradictory to the characteristic of that which performs a function.

original: nyid go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan du bstan par mi bya ste don byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'gal bas na yod pa thams cad ni dngos po tsam kho na zhes sngar bshad du zin kyang /
analyzed: nyid go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan du bstan par mi bya ste don byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang 'gal bas na yod pa thams cad ni dngos po tsam kho na zhes sngar bshad du zin kyang /
translated: Although it was previously explained that all that exists is mere thing,

original: spros par 'dod nas phyogs snga ma nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: spros par 'dod nas phyogs snga ma nye bar bkod do //
translated: the opponent’s position is set forth here because it is desired to elaborate on that.

original: ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yod pa ni mi srid pa kho nar nges te rgyu med na yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges par mi rigs pa'i phyir @228b ro ;
analyzed: ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yod pa ni mi srid pa kho nar nges te rgyu med na yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges par mi rigs pa'i phyir @228b ro ;
translated: It is certain that existence characterized by non-performance is impossible, because if there is no cause, it is illogical to determine a place, time, or nature.

original: / des na sngon gyi slob dpon gyis yod pa rgyu med pa can gyi rtag pa ni yan lag ma tshang ba nyid kyi rtag pa mi srid pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du de la 'bad pa ma mdzad do //
analyzed: / des na sngon gyi slob dpon gyis yod pa rgyu med pa can gyi rtag pa ni yan lag ma tshang ba nyid kyi rtag pa mi srid pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid du de la 'bad pa ma mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the former masters did not exert themselves in that regard, because permanence that is causeless existence is impossible due to the incompleteness of its parts.

original: bstan bcos byed pa ni yod pa'i spyi dang byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang skad cig ma'i rang bzhin du yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal du zin kyang de'i bdag nyid du dngos po la gnas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa ni yod pa'i spyi dang byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang skad cig ma'i rang bzhin du yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal du zin kyang de'i bdag nyid du dngos po la gnas pa kho na ste /
translated: The author of the treatise, although the universal of existence and the characteristic of the produced are distant in terms of place, time, and nature, still they are established as entities that are of the nature of momentariness.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i don byed par 'gal ba dang phyis gdon mi za bar 'jig pa rgyu med pa ni khyad par med pas skye ba tsam med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i don byed par 'gal ba dang phyis gdon mi za bar 'jig pa rgyu med pa ni khyad par med pas skye ba tsam med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: It should be demonstrated that the contradiction of performing a function accepted by others and the subsequent inevitable destruction without cause are the same, so the consequence of mere arising being impossible would follow.

original: de la sngon gyi slob dpon gyis yod pa dang byas pa thams cad la mthar rgyus byas pa'i 'jig par gdon mi za ba yin no zhes gang pha rol po 'dod pa ni de ni ltos pa med pa'i rim pas 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rigs pa'i phyir ro🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi slob dpon gyis yod pa dang byas pa thams cad la mthar rgyus byas pa'i 'jig par gdon mi za ba yin no zhes gang pha rol po 'dod pa ni de ni ltos pa med pa'i rim pas 'jig pa'i rgyu mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: This is because it is illogical that destruction would occur by a cause of destruction that is not related to it.

original: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa de lta na de dag gi byas pa 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa de lta na de dag gi byas pa 'jig pa ste /
translated: If there is no cause of destruction, then the destruction of that which is produced🔽would occur without doubt, and it would be destroyed.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni 'jig go zhes bya ba gang las yin de glo bur ba 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin mi rigs she na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni 'jig go zhes bya ba gang las yin de glo bur ba 'ba' zhig gi rang bzhin mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it illogical that it would be a mere adventitious nature?

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “It is by its own nature alone,”

original: kho bo cag de las 'byung ba 'bras bu yin pas dngos po'i rgyu'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag de las 'byung ba 'bras bu yin pas dngos po'i rgyu'i sgras brjod do //
translated: because we say that it is a thing’s cause because it is the source of that effect.

original: rang gi rgyu kho nas 'jig pa ni 'jig pa'i ngang can ni khab kyi rtse mor yungs kar gyi gnas med pa bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid dngos po las skye ba de dag byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa'i dngos po rnams rang gi rgyu las grub
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho nas 'jig pa ni 'jig pa'i ngang can ni khab kyi rtse mor yungs kar gyi gnas med pa bzhin du rang gi bdag nyid dngos po las skye ba de dag byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa'i dngos po rnams rang gi rgyu las grub
translated: Things that are produced from their own causes, which are characterized by being produced, are established from their own causes.

original: pa ni gzhan gyis bcol ba la sogs pas 'jig pa skyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ni gzhan gyis bcol ba la sogs pas 'jig pa skyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not produced by destruction, which is dependent on other things, such as fire.

original: gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bcom pa me dang 'brel pa la sogs pa la rgyur khas blangs pa de ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bcom pa me dang 'brel pa la sogs pa la rgyur khas blangs pa de ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that the cause of destruction by fire and so on is not capable of destroying things.

original: me dang 'brel pa la sogs pa cha rnam pa gsum du dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: me dang 'brel pa la sogs pa cha rnam pa gsum du dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Fire and so on should be analyzed in three parts:

original: de nyid shing la sogs pa 'jig pa'am sol ba la sogs pa gnas skabs gzhan pa 'am shing la sogs pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dngos po med pa can ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhig yin /
analyzed: de nyid shing la sogs pa 'jig pa'am sol ba la sogs pa gnas skabs gzhan pa 'am shing la sogs pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dngos po med pa can ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhig yin /
translated: It is not the case that fire and so on is the cause of the destruction of things such as wood, or the cause of the production of other states such as charcoal, or the cause of the nonexistence of things characterized by the cessation of wood and so on.

original: gang la me la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i byed pa las gzhan ni bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la me la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i byed pa las gzhan ni bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not imagine that there is any other cause of destruction than the activity that is related to fire, etc.

original: re zhig dngos por gyur pa la la zhig la 'dir 'jig pa rgyu'i nus pas ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: re zhig dngos por gyur pa la la zhig la 'dir 'jig pa rgyu'i nus pas ni mi rigs so //
translated: First, it is not logical that the cause of destruction has the power to destroy something that is already an existent thing.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig @229a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig @229a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: pa'i rgyu yod pa yis bud shing la sogs pa rang gi rgyu las bstan pa'i ngo bor skyes pa'i rang bzhin kho na mi brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can du mi byed do //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu yod pa yis bud shing la sogs pa rang gi rgyu las bstan pa'i ngo bor skyes pa'i rang bzhin kho na mi brten pa'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can du mi byed do //
translated: The cause of destruction does not cause fuel, etc., which has arisen from its own cause with the nature that has been described, to have the nature of nonendurance, which is characterized by the absence of its own nature.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: bud shing la sogs pa rang gi rgyu kho na ldog pas so //
analyzed: bud shing la sogs pa rang gi rgyu kho na ldog pas so //
translated: By the mere cessation of fuel, etc., from its own cause.

original: gnas pa'i bdag nyid ldog pa med pa gzhan du dngos po med pa de'i bdag nyid du byed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i bdag nyid ldog pa med pa gzhan du dngos po med pa de'i bdag nyid du byed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for something that has the nature of endurance, which does not cease, to have the nature of nonexistence.

original: de'i rgyu gzhan gyis phyis 'byung ba ni don gzhan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur na de ni gzhan du rigs pa ma yin te de la rgyu'i byed pa brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu gzhan gyis phyis 'byung ba ni don gzhan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur na de ni gzhan du rigs pa ma yin te de la rgyu'i byed pa brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If its cause arises later from another, it follows that it would be a different object, but that is not logical, because its causal function cannot be conceived.

original: yang na ji srid du rnam gsum brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ji srid du rnam gsum brtag par bya ste /
translated: Or, as long as the three modes are conceived,

original: 'jig pa ni shing la sogs pa'i rang bzhin me dang 'brel pa la sogs pas 'jig pa rgyus byed par 'gyur na de'i rang gi rgyu kho nas ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni shing la sogs pa'i rang bzhin me dang 'brel pa la sogs pas 'jig pa rgyus byed par 'gyur na de'i rang gi rgyu kho nas ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: destruction would be caused by a cause, such as the nature of wood and so on being destroyed by contact with fire and so on, but that is not logical, because it is just its own cause that ceases.

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis bsam pa me dang 'brel pa la sogs pas med pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis bsam pa me dang 'brel pa la sogs pas med pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Kumarila thinks that contact with fire and so on does not cause the nature of wood and so on to be nonexistent.

original: 'on kyang bud shing la sogs pas zhig nas med pa de yang bud shing la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma tshang ba na sol ba la sogs pa phyis byung ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bud shing la sogs pas zhig nas med pa de yang bud shing la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma tshang ba na sol ba la sogs pa phyis byung ba kho na ste /
translated: However, after it is destroyed by firewood and so on, that nonexistence is the mere noncompletion of the nature of firewood and so on, and it is only the subsequent arising of ashes and so on.

original: de ni zho la 'o ma med pa la zhig nas med par bshad pa'i rnam pa de bzhin du med pa rgyu dang ldan par khas blang par bya ba la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ni zho la 'o ma med pa la zhig nas med par bshad pa'i rnam pa de bzhin du med pa rgyu dang ldan par khas blang par bya ba la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Just as it is explained that milk is not present in curd, but is not absent through having been destroyed, in the same way, there is no contradiction in maintaining that absence is caused.

original: de bzhin du gzhan zhig kyang /🔽dngos po gzhan gyis dben pa yi //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan zhig kyang / dngos po gzhan gyis dben pa yi //
translated: In the same way, another says:🔽From the non-observation of a thing

original: mi dmigs pa las srid pa na //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las srid pa na //
translated: that is separate from another, existence is ascertained.
